Text

﻿Kim by [Rudyard Kipling]342-rudyard kipling Chapter [I]0-i O [ye]716-ye who tread [the Narrow Way By Tophet]717-the narrow way by tophet - flare to judgment Day , Be gentle when ' [the heathen]4446-the heathen '[342-rudyard kipling] pray To Buddha at [Kamakura]1-kamakura ! Buddha at [Kamakura]1-kamakura . [He]718-he sat , in defiance of municipal orders , astride the gun [Zam Zammah]343-zam - zammah on [her]719-her brick platform opposite [the old Ajaib - Gher]720-the old ajaib - gher - [the Wonder House]721-the wonder house , as [the natives]722-the natives call [the Lahore Museum]723-the lahore museum . Who hold [Zam - Zammah]343-zam - zammah , that ' fire - breathing dragon '[343-zam - zammah] , hold [the Punjab]2-the punjab , for the great green - bronze piece is always first of [the conqueror]724-the conqueror 's loot . There was some justification for [Kim]344-kim - [he]344-kim had kicked [[Lala Dinanath]345-lala dinanath 's boy]725-lala dinanath 's boy off the trunnions - since [the English]346-the english held [the Punjab]2-the punjab and [Kim]344-kim was English . Though [he]344-kim was burned black as [any native]726-any native ; though [he]344-kim spoke the vernacular by preference , and [[his]344-kim mother]727-his mother - tongue in a clipped uncertain sing - song ; though [he]344-kim consorted on terms of perfect equality with [the small boys of [the bazar]729-the bazar]728-the small boys of the bazar ; [Kim]344-kim was white - [a poor white of the very poorest]730-a poor white of the very poorest . [The half - caste woman who looked after [him]344-kim]731-the half - caste woman who looked after him [she]731-the half - caste woman who looked after him smoked opium , and pretended to keep [a second - hand furniture shop by [the square]733-the square where [the cheap cabs wait]734-the cheap cabs wait told [the missionaries]735-the missionaries that [she]731-the half - caste woman who looked after him was [[Kim]344-kim 's mother 's sister]736-kim 's mother 's sister]732-a second - hand furniture shop by the square where the cheap cabs wait told the missionaries that she was kim 's mother 's sister ; but [[his]344-kim mother]727-his mother had been nursemaid in [[a Colonel]738-a colonel 's family]739-a colonel 's family and had married [Kimball O'Hara]347-o'hara , [a young colour- sergeant of [the Mavericks]474-the mavericks , [an Irish regiment]741-an irish regiment]740-a young colour- sergeant of the mavericks , an irish regiment . [He]347-o'hara afterwards took a post on [the Sind]4-the sind , [Punjab]2-the punjab , and [Delhi Railway]6-delhi railway , and [[his]347-o'hara Regiment]742-his regiment went [home]743-home without [him]347-o'hara . [The wife]744-the wife died of cholera in [Ferozepore]7-ferozepore , and [O'Hara]347-o'hara fell to drink and loafing up and down the line with [the keen - eyed three - year - old baby]745-the keen - eyed three - year - old baby . [Societies]348-societies and [chaplains]746-chaplains , anxious for [the child]747-the child , tried to catch [him]347-o'hara , but [O'Hara]347-o'hara drifted away , till [he]347-o'hara came across [the woman who took opium and learned the taste from [her]748-the woman who took opium and learned the taste from her , and died as poor whites die in india , and died as [poor whites]749-poor whites die in [India]8-india]748-the woman who took opium and learned the taste from her , and died as poor whites die in india . [His]347-o'hara estate at death consisted of three papers - one [he]347-o'hara called [his]347-o'hara ' ne varietur '[347-o'hara] because those words were written below [his]347-o'hara signature thereon , and another [his]347-o'hara ' clearance - certificate '[347-o'hara] . The third was [Kim]344-kim 's birth - certificate . Those things , [he]347-o'hara was used to say , in [his]347-o'hara glorious opium - hours , would yet make little [Kimball]347-o'hara [a man]750-a man . On no account was [Kim]344-kim to part with [them]751-them , for [they]751-them belonged to a great piece of magic - such magic as [men]752-men practised over yonder behind [the Museum]753-the museum , in the big blue - and - white [Jadoo - Gher]9-jadoo - gher - [the Magic House]754-the magic house , as [we]755-we name [the Masonic Lodge]756-the masonic lodge . It would , [he]347-o'hara said , all come right some day , and [Kim]344-kim 's horn would be exalted between pillars - monstrous pillars - of beauty and strength . [The Colonel]757-the colonel [himself]757-the colonel , riding on a horse , at the head of [the finest Regiment in [the world]759-the world]758-the finest regiment in the world , would attend to [Kim]344-kim - [little Kim that should have been better off than [[his]344-kim father]761-his father]760-little kim that should have been better off than his father . [Nine hundred first - class devils , whose God was a Red Bull on [a green field]763-a green field]762-nine hundred first - class devils , whose god was a red bull on a green field , would attend to [Kim]344-kim , if [they]762-nine hundred first - class devils , whose god was a red bull on a green field had not forgotten [O'Hara]347-o'hara - poor O'Hara that was [gang- foreman on the Ferozepore line]764-gang- foreman on the ferozepore line . Then [he]344-kim would weep bitterly in the broken rush chair on [the veranda]765-the veranda . So it came about after [his]344-kim death that [the woman]766-the woman sewed parchment , paper , and birth- certificate into a leather amulet - case which [she]766-the woman strung round [Kim]344-kim 's neck . ' And some day , '[766-the woman] [she]766-the woman said , confusedly remembering [O'Hara]347-o'hara 's prophecies , ' there will come for [you]344-kim a great Red Bull on [a green field]763-a green field , and [the Colonel]757-the colonel riding on [his]757-the colonel tall horse , yes , and '[766-the woman] dropping into English - ' [nine hundred devils]4449-nine hundred devils . '[766-the woman] ' Ah , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , ' [I]344-kim shall remember . A Red Bull and [a Colonel on a horse]4450-a colonel on a horse will come , but first , [[my]344-kim father]4451-my father said , will come [the two men]4452-the two men making ready the ground for these matters . That is how [[my]344-kim father]4451-my father said [they]4452-the two men always did ; and it is always so when [men]752-men work magic . '[344-kim] If [the woman]766-the woman had sent [Kim]344-kim up to the local Jadoo - Gher with those papers , [he]344-kim would , of course , have been taken over by [the Provincial Lodge]768-the provincial lodge , and sent to [the Masonic Orphanage in [the Hills]10-the hills]769-the masonic orphanage in the hills ; but what [she]766-the woman had heard of magic [she]766-the woman distrusted . [Kim]344-kim , too , held views of [his]344-kim own . As [he]344-kim reached the years of indiscretion , [he]344-kim learned to avoid [missionaries]770-missionaries and [white men of serious aspect who asked who [he]344-kim was]771-white men of serious aspect who asked who he was , and what [he]344-kim did . For [Kim]344-kim did nothing with an immense success . True , [he]344-kim knew [the wonderful walled city of [Lahore]11-lahore]772-the wonderful walled city of lahore from [the [Delhi]12-delhi Gate to [the outer Fort Ditch]774-the outer fort ditch]773-the delhi gate to the outer fort ditch ; was hand in glove with men who led lives stranger than anything [Haroun al Raschid]349-haroun al raschid dreamed of ; and [he]344-kim lived in a life wild as that of [the Arabian Nights]13-the arabian nights , but [missionaries]770-missionaries and [secretaries of [charitable societies]777-charitable societies]776-secretaries of charitable societies could not see the beauty of it . [His]344-kim nickname through the wards was ' [Little Friend of all [the World]14-the world]4455-little friend of all the world '[344-kim] ; and very often , being lithe and inconspicuous , [he]344-kim executed commissions by night on [the crowded housetops for [sleek and shiny young men of fashion]779-sleek and shiny young men of fashion]778-the crowded housetops for sleek and shiny young men of fashion . It was intrigue , - of course [he]344-kim knew that much , as [he]344-kim had known all evil since [he]344-kim could speak , - but what [he]344-kim loved was the game for its own sake - the stealthy prowl through the dark gullies and [lanes]780-lanes , the crawl up a waterpipe , the sights and sounds of [the women]781-the women 's world on the flat roofs , and the headlong flight from [housetop]782-housetop to [housetop]782-housetop under cover of the hot dark . Then there were [holy men]784-holy men , ash - smeared fakirs by [[their]784-holy men brick shrines under the trees at the riverside]785-their brick shrines under the trees at the riverside , with whom [he]344-kim was quite familiar - greeting [them]784-holy men as [they]784-holy men returned from begging - tours , and , when [no one]786-no one was by , eating from the same dish . [The woman who looked after [him]344-kim]787-the woman who looked after him insisted with tears that [he]344-kim should wear European clothes - trousers , a shirt and a battered hat . [Kim]344-kim found it easier to slip into Hindu or Mohammedan garb when engaged on [certain businesses]788-certain businesses . [One of [the young men of fashion]790-the young men of fashion]789-one of the young men of fashion - [he]789-one of the young men of fashion who was [found dead at the bottom of a well on the night of the earthquake]791-found dead at the bottom of a well on the night of the earthquake - had once given [him]344-kim a complete suit of Hindu kit , the costume of [a lowcaste street boy]792-a lowcaste street boy , and [Kim]344-kim stored it in [a secret place under some baulks in [Nila Ram]15-nila ram 's timber - yard]793-a secret place under some baulks in nila ram 's timber - yard , beyond [the Punjab High Court]794-the punjab high court , where the fragrant deodar logs lie seasoning after [they]784-holy men have driven down [the Ravi]16-the ravi . When there was business or frolic afoot , [Kim]344-kim would use [[his]344-kim properties]795-his properties , returning at dawn to [the veranda]765-the veranda , all tired out from shouting at the heels of a marriage procession , or yelling at a Hindu festival . Sometimes there was food in [the house]797-the house , more often there was not , and then [Kim]344-kim went out again to eat with [[his]344-kim native friends]798-his native friends . As [he]344-kim drummed [his]344-kim heels against [Zam - Zammah]343-zam - zammah [he]344-kim turned now and again from [his]344-kim king - of - the - castle game with [little Chota Lal]350-little chota lal and [[Abdullah]351-abdullah [the sweetmeat - seller]800-the sweetmeat - seller 's son]799-abdullah the sweetmeat - seller 's son , to make a rude remark to [the native policeman on guard over rows of shoes at the Museum]801-the native policeman on guard over rows of shoes at the museum door . [The big Punjabi]352-punjabi grinned tolerantly : [he]352-punjabi knew [Kim]344-kim of old . So did the water - carrier , sluicing water on [the dry road]802-the dry road from [his]352-punjabi goat- skin bag . So did [Jawahir Singh]353-jawahir singh , [the Museum carpenter]803-the museum carpenter , bent over new packing - cases . So did [everybody]804-everybody in sight except [the peasants from [the country]806-the country]805-the peasants from the country , hurrying up to [the Wonder House]721-the wonder house to view the things that [men]752-men made in [[their]752-men [own province]810-own province]809-their own province and elsewhere . [The Museum]753-the museum was given up to Indian arts and manufactures , and [anybody who sought wisdom]812-anybody who sought wisdom could ask [the Curator]813-the curator to explain . ' Off ! Off ! Let [me]351-abdullah up ! '[351-abdullah] cried [Abdullah]351-abdullah , climbing up [Zam - Zammah]343-zam - zammah 's wheel . ' [[Thy]351-abdullah father]4456-thy father was [a pastry - cook]4457-a pastry - cook , [[Thy]351-abdullah mother]4458-thy mother stole the ghi " sang [Kim]344-kim . '[351-abdullah] [All Mussalmans]354-all mussalmans fell off [Zam - Zammah]343-zam - zammah long ago ! ' '[343-zam - zammah] Let [me]0-i up ! ' shrilled [little Chota Lal]350-little chota lal in [his]0-i gilt - embroidered cap . [[His]351-abdullah father]761-his father was worth perhaps half a million sterling , but [India]8-india is [the only democratic land in [the world]759-the world]4460-the only democratic land in the world . '[814-the hindus] [The Hindus]814-the hindus fell off [Zam - Zammah]343-zam - zammah too . [The Mussalmans]354-all mussalmans pushed [them]814-the hindus off . [[Thy]815-thy father]4456-thy father was [a pastry - cook]4457-a pastry - cook - ' [He]344-kim stopped ; for there shuffled round the corner , from [the roaring Motee Bazar]4462-the roaring motee bazar , [such a man as [Kim]344-kim , who thought [he]344-kim knew [all castes]4464-all castes , had never seen]4463-such a man as kim , who thought he knew all castes , had never seen . [He]4463-such a man as kim , who thought he knew all castes , had never seen was nearly six feet high , dressed in fold upon fold of dingy stuff like horse - blanketing , and not one fold of it could [Kim]344-kim refer to any known trade or profession . At [his]4463-such a man as kim , who thought he knew all castes , had never seen belt hung a long open - work iron pencase and a wooden rosary such as [holy men]784-holy men wear . On [his]4463-such a man as kim , who thought he knew all castes , had never seen head was a gigantic sort of tam - o'-shanter . [His]4463-such a man as kim , who thought he knew all castes , had never seen face was yellow and wrinkled , like that of [Fook Shing]355-fook shing , [the Chinese bootmaker in [the bazar]729-the bazar]4466-the chinese bootmaker in the bazar . [His]4463-such a man as kim , who thought he knew all castes , had never seen eyes turned up at the corners and looked like little slits of onyx . '[4457-a pastry - cook] Who is that ? ' said [Kim]344-kim to [[his]344-kim companions]4468-his companions . '[750-a man] Perhaps it is [a man]750-a man , ' said [Abdullah]351-abdullah , finger in mouth , staring . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim clicked round the self - registering turnstile ; [the old man]861-the old man followed and halted amazed . In [the entrance - hall]862-the entrance - hall stood the larger figures of the Greco - Buddhist sculptures done , [savants]863-savants know how long since , by [forgotten workmen whose hands were feeling , and not unskilfully , for the mysteriously transmitted Grecian touch]864-forgotten workmen whose hands were feeling , and not unskilfully , for the mysteriously transmitted grecian touch . [The Master]869-the master was represented seated on a lotus the petals of which were so deeply undercut as to show almost detached . Round [Him]869-the master was an adoring hierarchy of [kings]870-kings , [elders]871-elders , and old - time Buddhas . Below were lotus - covered waters with fishes and water- birds . ' Out shuffled [the lama]868-the lama to [the main hall]4497-the main hall , and , [the Curator]813-the curator beside [him]868-the lama , went through the collection with the reverence of [a devotee]4499-a devotee and the appreciative instinct of [a craftsman]4500-a craftsman . Incident by incident in the beautiful story [he]868-the lama identified on the blurred stone , puzzled here and there by the unfamiliar Greek convention , but delighted as [a child]4501-a child at each new trove . Where the sequence failed , as in the Annunciation , [the Curator]813-the curator supplied it from [his]813-the curator mound of books - French and German , with photographs and reproductions . Here was [the devout Asita]4503-the devout asita , the pendant of [Simeon]366-simeon in the Christian story , holding [the Holy Child]4504-the holy child on [his]4482-the lord knee while [mother]4505-mother and [father]4506-father listened ; and here were incidents in the legend of [the cousin Devadatta]4507-the cousin devadatta . In a few minutes [the Curator]813-the curator saw that [[his]813-the curator guest]4516-his guest was [no mere bead- telling mendicant]4517-no mere bead- telling mendicant , but [a scholar of parts]4518-a scholar of parts . And [they]4519-they went at it all over again , [the lama]868-the lama taking snuff , wiping [his]868-the lama spectacles , and talking at railway speed in a bewildering mixture of Urdu and Tibetan . [He]895-he had heard of the travels of [the Chinese pilgrims]4521-the chinese pilgrims , [Fu- Hiouen]367-fu- hiouen and [Hwen - Tsiang]368-hwen - tsiang , and was anxious to know if there was any translation of [their]4521-the chinese pilgrims record . '[895-he] Then [he]895-he composed [himself]895-he reverently to listen to fragments hastily rendered into Urdu . ' And thus it was , O Fountain of Wisdom , that [I]868-the lama decided to go to [the Holy Places which [His]861-the old man foot had trod]4522-the holy places which his foot had trod - to [the Birthplace]28-the birthplace , even to [Kapila]29-kapila ; then to [Mahabodhi]371-mahabodhi , which is [Buddh Gaya]36-buddh gaya - to [the Monastery]4523-the monastery - to [the Deer - park]4510-the deer - park -to [the place of [His]861-the old man death]4525-the place of his death . '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama lowered [his]868-the lama voice . ' And [I]868-the lama come here alone . [Thou]4542-thou knowest ? '[813-the curator] ' It is written . [I]813-the curator have read . '[813-the curator] ' And , overshooting all other marks , the arrow passed far and far beyond sight . Even as [He]869-the master went so go [I]813-the curator , forsaking the ease of [[my]813-the curator monastery]4571-my monastery . There was with [me]813-the curator when [I]813-the curator left [the hills]833-the hills [a chela disciple who begged for [me]813-the curator as the Rule demands , but halting in [Kulu]19-kulu]4573-a chela disciple who begged for me as the rule demands , but halting in kulu awhile a fever took [him]4573-a chela disciple who begged for me as the rule demands , but halting in kulu and [he]4573-a chela disciple who begged for me as the rule demands , but halting in kulu died . [I]813-the curator have now no chela , but [I]813-the curator will take the alms- bowl and thus enable [the charitable]4574-the charitable to acquire merit . '[813-the curator] [He]813-the curator nodded [his]813-the curator head valiantly . [Learned doctors of [a lamassery]920-a lamassery]919-learned doctors of a lamassery do not beg , but [the lama]868-the lama was [an enthusiast in this quest]922-an enthusiast in this quest . ' Be it so , '[813-the curator] said [the Curator]813-the curator , smiling . ' Suffer [me]813-the curator now to acquire merit . [We]4575-we be craftsmen together , [thou]4576-thou and [I.]813-the curator Here is a new book of white English paper : here be sharpened pencils two and three - thick and thin , all good for [a scribe]4577-a scribe . Now lend [me]813-the curator [thy]868-the lama spectacles . '[813-the curator] [The Curator]813-the curator looked through them . They were heavily scratched , but the power was almost exactly that of [his]813-the curator own pair , which [he]813-the curator slid into [the lama]868-the lama 's hand , saying : ' Try these . '[813-the curator] ' A feather ! A very feather upon the face . '[861-the old man] [The old man]861-the old man turned [his]861-the old man head delightedly and wrinkled up [his]861-the old man nose . ' How scarcely do [I]861-the old man feel [them]4578-them ! How clearly do [I]861-the old man see ! '[861-the old man] ' They be bilaur - crystal - and will never scratch . May [they]4578-them help [thee]868-the lama to [[thy]868-the lama River]4579-thy river , for they are thine . '[861-the old man] ' [I]868-the lama will take them and the pencils and the white note - book , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama , ' as a sign of friendship between [priest]4580-priest and [priest]4580-priest - and now - '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama fumbled at [his]868-the lama belt , detached the open - work iron pincers , and laid it on [the Curator]813-the curator 's table . ' That is for a memory between [thee]868-the lama and [me]868-the lama - [my]868-the lama pencase . It is something old - even as [I]868-the lama am . '[868-the lama] It was a piece of ancient design , Chinese , of an iron that is not smelted these days ; and [the collector]929-the collector 's heart in [the Curator]813-the curator 's bosom had gone out to it from the first . For no persuasion would [the lama]868-the lama resume [his]868-the lama gift . ' When [I]868-the lama return , having found [the River]33-the river , [I]868-the lama will bring [thee]868-the lama a written picture of the Padma Samthora such as [I]868-the lama used to make on silk at [the lamassery]4582-the lamassery . But [the lama]868-the lama strode out , head high in air , and pausing an instant before the great statue of [a Bodhisat in meditation]936-a bodhisat in meditation , brushed through the turnstiles . [Kim]344-kim followed like a shadow . What [he]344-kim had overheard excited [him]344-kim wildly . [This man]937-this man was entirely new to all [his]937-this man experience , and [he]937-this man meant to investigate further , precisely as [he]937-this man would have investigated [a new building]938-a new building or a strange festival in [Lahore city]939-lahore city . [The lama]868-the lama was [his]937-this man trove , and [he]937-this man purposed to take possession . [[Kim]344-kim 's mother]941-kim 's mother had been [Irish]374-irish , too . [The old man]861-the old man halted by [Zam - Zammah]343-zam - zammah and looked round till [his]861-the old man eye fell on [Kim]344-kim . The inspiration of [his]861-the old man pilgrimage had left [him]861-the old man for awhile , and [he]861-the old man felt old , forlorn , and very empty . ' Do not sit under that gun , '[4469-the policeman] said [the policeman]4469-the policeman loftily . ' Huh ! [Owl]375-owl ! '[344-kim] was [Kim]344-kim 's retort on [the lama]868-the lama 's behalf . ' Sit under that gun if it please [thee]861-the old man . When didst [thou]861-the old man steal [the milkwoman]4585-the milkwoman 's slippers , [Dunnoo]376-dunnoo ? '[344-kim] That was an utterly unfounded charge sprung on the spur of the moment , but it silenced [Dunnoo]376-dunnoo , who knew that [Kim]344-kim 's clear yell could call up legions of [bad bazaar boys]945-bad bazaar boys if need arose . ' And whom didst [thou]861-the old man worship within ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim affably , squatting in the shade beside [the lama]868-the lama . ' [I]344-kim worshipped [none]4586-none , [child]835-child . [I]344-kim bowed before [the Excellent Law]377-the excellent law . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim accepted [this new God]947-this new god without emotion . [He]344-kim knew already a few score . ' And what dost [thou]861-the old man do ? '[344-kim] ' [I]344-kim beg . [I]344-kim remember now it is long since [I]344-kim have eaten or drunk . What is the custom of charity in [this town]4588-this town ? '[344-kim] ' [Those who beg in silence]4590-those who beg in silence starve in silence , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , quoting a native proverb . '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim proudly . ' There is [a new priest in [the city]4596-the city]4595-a new priest in the city - [a man such as [I]344-kim have never seen]4597-a man such as i have never seen . '[958-the huge , mouse - coloured brahmini bull of the ward] [The huge , mouse - coloured Brahmini bull of the ward]958-the huge , mouse - coloured brahmini bull of the ward was shouldering [his]958-the huge , mouse - coloured brahmini bull of the ward way through [the many - coloured crowd]959-the many - coloured crowd , a stolen plantain hanging out of [his]958-the huge , mouse - coloured brahmini bull of the ward mouth . '[958-the huge , mouse - coloured brahmini bull of the ward] A growl came out of the back of [the shop]960-the shop , where [a man]750-a man lay . ' [He]750-a man drove away the bull , '[766-the woman] said [the woman]766-the woman in an undertone . ' It is good to give to [the poor]4614-the poor . ' A little curry is good , and a fried cake , and a morsel of conserve would please [him]750-a man , [I]344-kim think . '[344-kim] ' It is a hole as big as [thy]344-kim head , '[766-the woman] said [the woman]766-the woman fretfully . ' That is good . When [I]344-kim am in [the bazar]729-the bazar [the bull]4617-the bull shall not come to [this house]4618-this house . ' [Pardesi]379-pardesi [a foreigner]823-a foreigner , '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim explained , as [the old man]861-the old man delivered in an unknown tongue what was evidently a blessing . Then [the lama]868-the lama took snuff from a portentous wooden snuff - gourd , fingered [his]868-the lama rosary awhile , and so dropped into the easy sleep of age , as the shadow of [Zam - Zammah]343-zam - zammah grew long . [Kim]344-kim loafed over to [the nearest tobacco - seller]976-the nearest tobacco - seller , [a rather lively young Mohammedan woman]977-a rather lively young mohammedan woman , and begged a rank cigar of the brand that [they]978-they sell to students of the Punjab University who copy English customs . Then [he]868-the lama smoked and thought , knees to chin , under the belly of the gun , and the outcome of [his]868-the lama thoughts was a sudden and stealthy departure in the direction of [[Nila Ram]15-nila ram 's timber- yard]979-nila ram 's timber- yard . [The lama]868-the lama did not wake till the evening life of [the city]4596-the city had begun with lamp - lighting and the return of [white - robed clerks]982-white - robed clerks and [subordinates]983-subordinates from [the Government offices]984-the government offices . [He]868-the lama stared dizzily in all directions , but none looked at [him]868-the lama save [a Hindu urchin in a dirty turban and Isabella - coloured clothes]985-a hindu urchin in a dirty turban and isabella - coloured clothes . ' Hast [thou]4634-thou been robbed ? '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama pointed towards [the Museum]753-the museum . ' [He]868-the lama came upon [me]868-the lama to show [me]868-the lama [a road which [I]868-the lama had lost]4640-a road which i had lost . And when [I]868-the lama was faint with hunger [he]868-the lama begged for [me]868-the lama , as would a chela for [[his]868-the lama teacher]4643-his teacher . Suddenly was [he]868-the lama sent . Suddenly has [he]868-the lama gone away . It was in [my]868-the lama mind to have taught [him]868-the lama the Law upon [the road]4566-the road to [Benares]37-benares . '[868-the lama] [Kim]344-kim stood amazed at this , because [he]344-kim had overheard the talk in [the Museum]753-the museum , and knew that [the old man]861-the old man was speaking the truth , which is a thing [a native on the road]990-a native on the road seldom presents to [a stranger]857-a stranger . ' But [I]861-the old man see now that [he]868-the lama was but sent for a purpose . By this [I]861-the old man know that [I]861-the old man shall find [a certain River for which [I]861-the old man seek]4645-a certain river for which i seek . '[861-the old man] ' [The River of the Arrow]39-the river of the arrow ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , with a superior smile . ' Is this yet another Sending ? Who art [thou]4648-thou ? '[868-the lama] ' [Thy]868-the lama chela , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim simply , sitting on [his]344-kim heels . ' [I]344-kim have never seen anyone like to [thee]868-the lama in all this [my]344-kim life . [I]344-kim go with [thee]868-the lama to [Benares]37-benares . '[344-kim] ' But [the River]33-the river - [the River of [the Arrow]34-the arrow]4652-the river of the arrow ? '[868-the lama] ' Oh , that [I]868-the lama heard when [thou]4648-thou wast speaking to [the Englishman]4653-the englishman . [I]868-the lama lay against the door . '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama sighed . ' [I]868-the lama thought [thou]4648-thou hadst been [a guide permitted]4654-a guide permitted . '[868-the lama] ' Not [I]868-the lama , " [Kim]344-kim laughed uneasily . '[868-the lama] [I]0-i go to look for - for a bull - a Red . ' [Boylike]380-boylike , if [an acquaintance]4655-an acquaintance had a scheme , [Kim]344-kim was quite ready with one of [his]344-kim own ; and , boylike , [he]344-kim had really thought for as much as twenty minutes at a time of [[his]344-kim father]761-his father 's prophecy . '[868-the lama] To what , [child]835-child ? ' said [the lama]868-the lama . '[360-god] [God]360-god knows , but so [[my]0-i father]4451-my father told [me]0-i ' . [I]4451-my father heard [thy]4658-thy talk in [the Wonder House]721-the wonder house of [all those new strange places in [the Hills]10-the hills]4660-all those new strange places in the hills , and if one so old and so little - so used to truth - telling - may go out for the small matter of [a river]4546-a river , it seemed to [me]4451-my father that [I]4451-my father too must go a - travelling . If it is [our]4662-our fate to find those things [we]4662-our shall find them - [thou]4658-thy , [thy]4658-thy River ; and [I]4451-my father , [my]4451-my father Bull , and the Strong Pillars and some other matters that [I]4451-my father forget . '[4451-my father] ' It is not pillars but a Wheel from which [I]868-the lama would be free , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' That is all one . Perhaps [they]4663-they will make [me]344-kim [a king]4664-a king , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , serenely prepared for anything . ' [I]868-the lama will teach [thee]344-kim other and better desires upon [the road]4566-the road , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama replied in the voice of authority . ' Let [us]4666-us go to [Benares]37-benares . '[868-the lama] ' Not by night . [Thieves]4667-thieves are abroad . Wait till the day . '[868-the lama] ' But there is no place to sleep . '[861-the old man] [The old man]861-the old man was used to the order of [[his]861-the old man monastery]1000-his monastery , and though [he]861-the old man slept on [the ground]1001-the ground , as [the Rule]1002-the rule decrees , preferred a decency in these things . ' [We]4666-us shall get good lodging at [the Kashmir Serai]43-the kashmir serai , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , laughing at [his]861-the old man perplexity . ' [I]344-kim have [a friend]4668-a friend there . Come ! '[344-kim] [The hot and crowded bazars]1003-the hot and crowded bazars blazed with light as [they]1004-they made [their]1004-they way through the press of all the races in [Upper India]44-upper india , and [the lama]868-the lama mooned through [it]1006-it like [a man in a dream]1007-a man in a dream . It was [his]868-the lama first experience of [a large manufacturing city]1008-a large manufacturing city , and [the crowded tram- car with its continually squealing brakes]1009-the crowded tram- car with its continually squealing brakes frightened [him]868-the lama . Half pushed , half towed , [he]868-the lama arrived at [the high gate of [the Kashmir Serai]43-the kashmir serai]1010-the high gate of the kashmir serai : [that huge open square over against [the railway station]1012-the railway station , surrounded with arched cloisters , where the camel and [horse caravans]1013-horse caravans put up on [their]1013-horse caravans return from [Central Asia]45-central asia]1011-that huge open square over against the railway station , surrounded with arched cloisters , where the camel and horse caravans put up on their return from central asia . Here were all manner of Northern folk , tending tethered ponies and kneeling camels ; loading and unloading bales and bundles ; drawing water for the evening meal at the creaking well - windlasses ; piling grass before [the shrieking , wild - eyed stallions]1014-the shrieking , wild - eyed stallions ; cuffing the surly caravan dogs ; paying off [camel - drivers]1015-camel - drivers ; taking on [new grooms]1016-new grooms ; swearing , shouting , arguing , and chaffering in [the packed square]1017-the packed square . [The cloisters]1018-the cloisters , reached by three or four masonry steps , made a haven of refuge around [this turbulent sea]1019-this turbulent sea . [Most of [them]1018-the cloisters]1020-most of them were rented to [traders]1021-traders , as [we]1022-we rent the arches of [a viaduct]1023-a viaduct ; the space between pillar and pillar being bricked or boarded off into [rooms]1024-rooms , which were guarded by heavy wooden doors and cumbrous native padlocks . Locked doors showed that [the owner]1025-the owner was away , and a few rude - sometimes very rude - chalk or paint scratches told where [he]1025-the owner had gone . Thus : ' [Lutuf Ullah]381-lutuf ullah is gone to [Kurdistan]46-kurdistan . '[868-the lama] Below , in coarse verse : ' O [Allah]382-allah , who sufferest lice to live on the coat of [a Kabuli]47-a kabuli , why hast [thou]382-allah allowed [this louse Lutuf]4669-this louse lutuf to live so long ? '[868-the lama] [Kim]344-kim , fending [the lama]868-the lama between [excited men]1027-excited men and excited beasts , sidled along [the cloisters]1018-the cloisters to the far end , nearest [therailway station]1029-therailway station , where [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , [the horse - trader]1030-the horse - trader , lived when [he]383-mahbub came in from that mysterious land beyond [the Passes of [the North]48-the north]1031-the passes of the north . [Kim]344-kim had had many dealings with [Mahbub]383-mahbub in [his]344-kim little life , especially between [his]344-kim tenth and [his]344-kim thirteenth year - and [the big burly Afghan]1032-the big burly afghan , [his]1032-the big burly afghan beard dyed scarlet with lime for [he]1032-the big burly afghan was elderly and did not wish [his]1032-the big burly afghan grey hairs to show , knew [the boy]986-the boy 's value as [a gossip]1034-a gossip . Sometimes [he]383-mahbub would tell [Kim]344-kim to watch [a man who had nothing whatever to do with horses : to follow [him]383-mahbub for one whole day and report every soul with whom [he]383-mahbub talked]1035-a man who had nothing whatever to do with horses : to follow him for one whole day and report every soul with whom he talked . [Kim]344-kim would deliver [himself]344-kim of [his]344-kim tale at evening , and [Mahbub]383-mahbub would listen without a word or gesture . It was intrigue of some kind , [Kim]344-kim knew ; but its worth lay in saying nothing whatever to [anyone]1036-anyone except [Mahbub]383-mahbub , who gave [him]344-kim beautiful meals all hot from [the cookshop at the head of [the serai]1038-the serai]1037-the cookshop at the head of the serai , and once as much as eight annas in money . ' [He]383-mahbub is here , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , hitting a bad - tempered camel on the nose . ' Ohe . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub ! '[344-kim] [He]344-kim halted at a dark arch and slipped behind [the bewildered lama]1039-the bewildered lama . [The horse - trader]1030-the horse - trader , [his]1030-the horse - trader deep , embroidered Bokhariot belt unloosed , was lying on a pair of silk carpet saddle - bags , pulling lazily at an immense silver hookah . [He]1030-the horse - trader turned [his]1030-the horse - trader head very slightly at the cry ; and seeing only [the tall silent figure]1041-the tall silent figure , chuckled in [his]1030-the horse - trader deep chest . ' [Allah]382-allah ! [A lama]839-a lama ! [A Red Lama]4671-a red lama ! It is far from [Lahore]11-lahore to [the Passes]49-the passes . What dost [thou]868-the lama do here ? '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama held out the begging - bowl mechanically . ' [God]360-god 's curse on [all unbelievers]4672-all unbelievers ! '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub . ' [I]383-mahbub do not give to [a lousy Tibetan]4673-a lousy tibetan ; but ask [[my]383-mahbub Baltis]4674-my baltis over yonder behind the camels . See if [he]4676-a countryman of yours be hungry . '[383-mahbub] A shaven , crouching [Balti]384-balti , who had come down with the horses , and who was nominally some sort of [degraded Buddhist]1043-degraded buddhist , fawned upon [the priest]1044-the priest , and in thick gutturals besought [the Holy One]385-holy one to sit at the horseboys ' fire . '[360-god] Go ! ' said [Kim]344-kim , pushing [him]4676-a countryman of yours lightly , and [the lama]868-the lama strode away , leaving [Kim]344-kim at the edge of the cloister . '[360-god] Go ! ' said [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , returning to [[his]383-mahbub hookah]4678-his hookah . '[386-little hindu] [Little Hindu]386-little hindu , run away . ' '[387-maharaj] [Maharaj]387-maharaj , ' whined [Kim]344-kim , using the Hindu form of address , and thoroughly enjoying the situation ; '[387-maharaj] [[my]0-i father]4451-my father is dead - [[my]0-i mother]4610-my mother is dead - [my]0-i stomach is empty . ' '[4610-my mother] Beg from [[my]0-i men]1048-my men among the horses , [I]0-i say . There must be some [Hindus]359-hindus in [my]0-i tail . ' '[0-i] Oh , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , but am [I]0-i [a Hindu]1049-a hindu ? ' said [Kim]344-kim in English . ' '[4455-little friend of all the world] Nothing . [I]0-i am now [[that holy man]1051-that holy man 's disciple]1052-that holy man 's disciple ; and [we]1053-we go a pilgrimage together - to [Benares]37-benares , [he]1051-that holy man says . [He]1051-that holy man is quite mad , and [I]0-i am tired of [Lahore city]939-lahore city . [I]0-i wish new air and water . ' '[0-i] But for whom dost [thou]1055-thou work ? Why come to [me]0-i ? ' The voice was harsh with suspicion . '[1055-thou] To whom else should [I]0-i come ? [I]0-i have no money . It is not good to go about without money . [Thou]1055-thou wilt sell many horses to [the officers]1056-the officers . [They]1057-they are very fine horses , these new ones : [I]0-i have seen [them]1057-they . ' said [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , thinking swiftly . '[1055-thou] [Thou]1055-thou hast never before lied to [me]0-i . Call [that lama]1059-that lama - stand back in the dark . ' '[1059-that lama] Oh , [our]1060-our tales will agree , ' said [Kim]344-kim , laughing . '[1060-our] [We]1060-our go to [Benares]37-benares , ' said [the lama]868-the lama , as soon as [he]868-the lama understood the drift of [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's questions . '[986-the boy] [The boy]986-the boy and [I]0-i , [I]0-i go to seek for [a certain River]1062-a certain river . ' '[986-the boy] Maybe - but [the boy]986-the boy ? ' said [Kim]344-kim , coming forward to the light again . '[986-the boy] Why should [I]0-i lie to [thee]1073-thee , [Hajji]388-hajji ? ' [Mahbub]383-mahbub puffed [his]383-mahbub hookah in silence . Then [he]383-mahbub began , almost whispering : '[0-i] [Umballa]52-umballa is on [the road to [Benares]37-benares]1076-the road to benares - if indeed [ye]1073-thee two go there . ' '[0-i] Tck ! ' '[0-i] And if [thou]1077-thou wilt carry a message for [me]0-i as far as [Umballa]52-umballa , [I]0-i will give [thee]1073-thee money . It concerns a horse - a white stallion which [I]0-i have sold to [an officer]1078-an officer upon the last time [I]0-i returned from [the Passes]49-the passes . But then - stand nearer and hold up hands as begging -the pedigree of the white stallion was not fully established , and [that officer]1079-that officer , who is now at [Umballa]52-umballa , bade [me]0-i make it clear . ' [Mahbub]383-mahbub here described the horse and the appearance of [the officer]4682-the officer . " ' '[383-mahbub] And all for the sake of a white stallion , ' said [Kim]344-kim , with a giggle , [his]344-kim eyes aflame . '[383-mahbub] That pedigree [I]0-i will give [thee]1077-thou now - in [my]0-i own fashion and some hard words as well . ' A shadow passed behind [Kim]344-kim , and a feeding camel . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub raised [his]383-mahbub voice . '[382-allah] [Allah]382-allah ! Art [thou]1077-thou [the only beggar in [the city]4596-the city]1082-the only beggar in the city ? [[Thy]1077-thou mother]4458-thy mother is dead . [[Thy]1077-thou father]4456-thy father is dead . So is it with all of [them]1086-them . Well , well - ' [He]0-i turned as feeling on the floor beside [him]0-i and tossed a flap of soft , greasy Mussalman bread to [the boy]986-the boy . '[1077-thou] Go and lie down among [[my]0-i horseboys]1087-my horseboys for tonight - [thou]1077-thou and [the lama]868-the lama . Tomorrow [I]0-i may give [thee]1077-thou service . ' [Kim]344-kim slunk away , [his]344-kim teeth in the bread , and , as [he]344-kim expected , [he]344-kim found a small wad of folded tissue - paper wrapped in oilskin , with three silver rupees - enormous largesse . [He]344-kim smiled and thrust money and paper into [his]344-kim leather amulet - case . [The lama]868-the lama , sumptuously fed by [[Mahbub]383-mahbub 's Baltis]4685-mahbub 's baltis , was already asleep in a corner of one of [the stalls]4686-the stalls . [Kim]344-kim lay down beside [him]868-the lama and laughed . [He]344-kim knew [he]344-kim had rendered a service to [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , and not for one little minute did [he]344-kim believe the tale of [the stallion]4687-the stallion 's pedigree . But [Kim]344-kim did not suspect that [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , known as one of [the best horse - dealers in [the Punjab]4689-the punjab]4688-the best horse - dealers in the punjab , [a wealthy and enterprising trader , whose caravans penetrated far and far into [the Back of Beyond]53-the back of beyond]4690-a wealthy and enterprising trader , whose caravans penetrated far and far into the back of beyond , was registered in one of the locked books of [the Indian Survey Department]4691-the indian survey department as C25 IB . Twice or thrice yearly C25 would send in a little story , baldly told but most interesting , and generally - it was checked by the statements of [R17]390-r17 and [M4]391-m4 - quite true . It concerned all manner of [out - of - the - way mountain principalities]4692-out - of - the - way mountain principalities , [explorers of nationalities other than English]4693-explorers of nationalities other than english , and the guntrade - was , in brief , a small portion of that vast mass of '[0-i] information received ' on which [the Indian Government]4694-the indian government acts . But , recently , [five confederated Kings , who had no business to confederate]4695-five confederated kings , who had no business to confederate , had been informed by a kindly Northern Power that there was a leakage of news from [[their]4695-five confederated kings , who had no business to confederate territories]4696-their territories into [British India]8-india . So [[those Kings]4697-those kings '[868-the lama] Prime Ministers]4698-those kings ' prime ministers were seriously annoyed and took steps , after the Oriental fashion . [They]1089-they suspected , among many others , [the bullying , red - bearded horsedealer whose caravans ploughed through [their]1091-their fastnesses belly - deep in snow]1090-the bullying , red - bearded horsedealer whose caravans ploughed through their fastnesses belly - deep in snow . At least , [[his]1090-the bullying , red - bearded horsedealer whose caravans ploughed through their fastnesses belly - deep in snow caravan]1092-his caravan that season had been ambushed and shot at twice on the way down , when [[Mahbub]383-mahbub 's men]1093-mahbub 's men accounted for [three strange ruffians who might , or might not , have been hired for the job]1094-three strange ruffians who might , or might not , have been hired for the job . Therefore [Mahbub]383-mahbub had avoided halting at [the insalubrious city of Peshawur]1095-the insalubrious city of peshawur , and had come through without stop to [Lahore]11-lahore , where , knowing [[his]383-mahbub country - people]1096-his country - people , [he]383-mahbub anticipated curious developments . And there was that on [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub which [he]383-mahbub did not wish to keep an hour longer than was necessary - a wad of closely folded tissue- paper , wrapped in oilskin - an impersonal , unaddressed statement , with five microscopic pin - holes in one corner , that most scandalously betrayed [the five confederated Kings]1097-the five confederated kings , the sympathetic Northern Power , [a Hindu banker in [Peshawur]55-peshawur]1098-a hindu banker in peshawur , [a firm of gun - makers in [Belgium]56-belgium]1099-a firm of gun - makers in belgium , and [an important , semi - independent Mohammedan ruler to the south]1100-an important , semi - independent mohammedan ruler to the south . This last was [R17]390-r17 's work , which [Mahbub]383-mahbub had picked up beyond the [Dora Pass]57-dora pass and was carrying in for [R17]390-r17 , who , owing to circumstances over which [he]383-mahbub had no control , could not leave [his]383-mahbub post of observation . [Dynamite]392-dynamite was milky and innocuous beside that report of [C25]58-c25 ; and even [an Oriental , with an Oriental]1101-an oriental , with an oriental 's views of the value of time , could see that the sooner it was in the proper hands the better . [Mahbub]383-mahbub had no particular desire to die by violence , because two or three family blood - feuds across [the Border]59-the border hung unfinished on [his]383-mahbub hands , and when these scores were cleared [he]383-mahbub intended to settle down as [a more or less virtuous citizen]1102-a more or less virtuous citizen . [He]383-mahbub had never passed the serai gate since [his]383-mahbub arrival two days ago , but had been ostentatious in sending telegrams to [Bombay]60-bombay , where [he]383-mahbub banked some of [his]383-mahbub money ; to [Delhi]12-delhi , where [a sub - partner of [[his]383-mahbub own clan]1104-his own clan was selling horses to [the agent of [a Rajputana state]1106-a rajputana state]1105-the agent of a rajputana state]1103-a sub - partner of his own clan was selling horses to the agent of a rajputana state ; and to [Umballa]52-umballa , where [an Englishman]1107-an englishman was excitedly demanding the pedigree of a white stallion . [The public]1108-the public letter - writer , who knew English , composed excellent telegrams , such as : ' [Creighton]393-colonel creighton , [Laurel Bank]61-laurel bank , [Umballa]52-umballa . Horse is Arabian as already advised . Sorrowful delayed pedigree which am translating . '[1108-the public] And later to the same address : ' Much sorrowful delay . Will forward pedigree . '[1108-the public] To [[his]383-mahbub sub - partner at [Delhi]12-delhi]1109-his sub - partner at delhi [he]383-mahbub wired : ' [Lutuf Ullah]381-lutuf ullah . Have wired two thousand rupees [your]381-lutuf ullah credit [Luchman Narain]394-luchman narain 's bank- '[383-mahbub] This was entirely in the way of trade , but every one of those telegrams was discussed and re- discussed , by parties who conceived [themselves]1110-themselves to be interested , before [they]1110-themselves went over to [the railway station]1012-the railway station in charge of [a foolish Balti]1112-a foolish balti , who allowed all sorts of people to read [them]1110-themselves on [the road]4566-the road . When , in [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's own picturesque language , [he]383-mahbub had muddied the wells of inquiry with the stick of precaution , [Kim]344-kim had dropped on [him]383-mahbub , sent from [Heaven]62-heaven ; and , being as prompt as [he]383-mahbub was unscrupulous , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub used to taking all sorts of gusty chances , pressed [him]383-mahbub into service on the spot . [A wandering lama]1114-a wandering lama with [a low - caste boy - servant]1115-a low - caste boy - servant might attract a moment 's interest as [they]1116-they wandered about [India]8-india , [the land of [pilgrims]1118-pilgrims]1117-the land of pilgrims ; but [no one]786-no one would suspect [them]1116-they or , what was more to the point , rob . [He]383-mahbub called for a new light - ball to [[his]383-mahbub hookah]4678-his hookah , and considered the case . If the worst came to the worst , and [the boy]986-the boy came to harm , the paper would incriminate [nobody]1122-nobody . And [he]383-mahbub would go up to [Umballa]52-umballa leisurely and - at a certain risk of exciting fresh suspicion - repeat [his]383-mahbub tale by word of mouth to [the people concerned]1123-the people concerned . But [R17]390-r17 's report was the kernel of the whole affair , and it would be distinctly inconvenient if that failed to come to hand . However , [God]360-god was great , and [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub felt [he]383-mahbub had done all [he]383-mahbub could for the time being . [Kim]344-kim was [the one soul in [the world]759-the world who had never told [him]383-mahbub a lie]1124-the one soul in the world who had never told him a lie . That would have been a fatal blot on [Kim]344-kim 's character if [Mahbub]383-mahbub had not known that to [others]1126-others , for [his]383-mahbub own ends or [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's business , [Kim]344-kim could lie like [an Oriental]1127-an oriental . Then [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub rolled across [the serai]1038-the serai to the Gate of [the Harpies who paint [their]1129-the harpies who paint their eyes and trap the stranger eyes and trap [the stranger]1130-the stranger]1129-the harpies who paint their eyes and trap the stranger , and was at some pains to call on [the one girl who , [he]383-mahbub had reason to believe , was a particular friend of [a smooth - faced Kashmiri pundit who had waylaid [his]1132-a smooth - faced kashmiri pundit who had waylaid his simple balti simple [Balti]384-balti]1132-a smooth - faced kashmiri pundit who had waylaid his simple balti in the matter of the telegrams]1131-the one girl who , he had reason to believe , was a particular friend of a smooth - faced kashmiri pundit who had waylaid his simple balti in the matter of the telegrams . It was an utterly foolish thing to do ; because [they]1133-they fell to drinking perfumed brandy against the Law of [the Prophet]1134-the prophet , and [Mahbub]383-mahbub grew wonderfully drunk , and the gates of [his]383-mahbub mouth were loosened , and [he]383-mahbub pursued the Flower of Delight with the feet of intoxication till [he]383-mahbub fell flat among the cushions , where the Flower of Delight , aided by [a smooth - faced Kashmiri pundit]1135-a smooth - faced kashmiri pundit , searched [him]383-mahbub from head to foot most thoroughly . About the same hour [Kim]344-kim heard soft feet in [[Mahbub]383-mahbub 's deserted stall]1136-mahbub 's deserted stall . [The horse - trader]1030-the horse - trader , curiously enough , had left [his]1030-the horse - trader door unlocked , and [[his]1030-the horse - trader men]1138-his men were busy celebrating [their]1138-his men return to [India]8-india with a whole sheep of [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's bounty . [A sleek young gentleman from [Delhi]12-delhi , armed with a bunch of keys which [the Flower]395-the flower had unshackled from [the senseless one]1140-the senseless one 's belt]1139-a sleek young gentleman from delhi , armed with a bunch of keys which the flower had unshackled from the senseless one 's belt , went through every single box , bundle , mat , and saddle - bag in [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's possession even more systematically than [the Flower]395-the flower and [the pundit]1141-the pundit were searching [the owner]1025-the owner . ' And [I]395-the flower think . '[395-the flower] said [the Flower]395-the flower scornfully an hour later , one rounded elbow on the snoring carcass , ' that [he]1025-the owner is no more than a pig of [an Afghan horse - dealer]4699-an afghan horse - dealer , with no thought except [women]4700-women and horses . Moreover , [he]1025-the owner may have sent it away by now - if ever there were such a thing . '[395-the flower] ' Nay - in a matter touching Five Kings it would be next [his]1025-the owner black heart , '[1141-the pundit] said [the pundit]1141-the pundit . ' Was there nothing ? '[1141-the pundit] [The Delhi man]1144-the delhi man laughed and resettled [his]1144-the delhi man turban as [he]1144-the delhi man entered . ' [I]1144-the delhi man searched between the soles of [his]1025-the owner slippers as [the Flower]4701-the flower searched [his]1025-the owner clothes . '[1144-the delhi man] ' [They]4703-they did not say [he]1025-the owner was [the very man]4704-the very man , '[1141-the pundit] said [the pundit]1141-the pundit thoughtfully . " '[1141-the pundit] ' That [North country]4706-north country is full of [horse - dealers]4707-horse - dealers as an old coat of lice . ' [They]4703-they have not yet come in , '[1141-the pundit] said [the pundit]1141-the pundit . ' [Thou]4709-thou must ensnare [them]4703-they later . '[1141-the pundit] Phew ! ' said [the Flower]395-the flower with deep disgust , rolling [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's head from [her]395-the flower lap . '[0-i] [I]0-i earn [my]0-i money . [Farrukh Shah]398-farrukh shah is a bear , [Ali Beg]397-nur ali beg [a swashbuckler]1147-a swashbuckler , and [old Sikandar Khan - yaie]396-sikandar khan ! Go ! [I]0-i sleep now . [This swine]1148-this swine will not stir till dawn . ' When [Mahbub]383-mahbub woke , [the Flower]4701-the flower talked to [him]383-mahbub severely on the sin of drunkenness . [Asiatics]4711-asiatics do not wink when [they]4711-asiatics have outmanoeuvred [an enemy]4712-an enemy , but as [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub cleared [his]383-mahbub throat , tightened [his]383-mahbub belt , and staggered forth under the early morning stars , [he]383-mahbub came very near to it . '[1148-this swine] What [a colt]1149-a colt 's trick ! ' said [he]383-mahbub to [himself]383-mahbub . '[1149-a colt] As if [every girl in [Peshawur]55-peshawur]1150-every girl in peshawur did not use it ! But ' twas prettily done . Now [God]360-god [He]360-god knows how many more there be upon [the Road]4566-the road who have orders to test [me]1151-he - perhaps with the knife . So it stands that [the boy]986-the boy must go to [Umballa]52-umballa - and by rail - for the writing is something urgent . [I]1151-he abide here , following the Flower and drinking wine as [an Afghan coper]4715-an afghan coper should . '[1151-he] [He]1151-he halted at [the stall next but one to [his]1151-he own]1152-the stall next but one to his own . [[His]1151-he men]1138-his men lay there heavy with sleep . There was no sign of [Kim]344-kim or [the lama]868-the lama . ' Up ! '[1151-he] [He]1151-he stirred a sleeper . ' Whither went [those who lay here last even]4716-those who lay here last even - [the lama]868-the lama and [the boy]986-the boy ? Is aught missing ? '[1151-he] ' Nay , '[4471-the man] grunted [the man]4471-the man , ' [the old madman]4719-the old madman rose at second cockcrow saying [he]4719-the old madman would go to [Benares]37-benares , and [the young one]4720-the young one led [him]4719-the old madman away . '[4471-the man] ' The curse of Allah on [all unbelievers]4672-all unbelievers ! '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub heartily , and climbed into [[his]383-mahbub own stall]1156-his own stall , growling in [his]383-mahbub beard . But it was [Kim]344-kim who had wakened [the lama]868-the lama - [Kim]344-kim with one eye laid against a knot - hole in the planking , who had seen [the Delhi man]1144-the delhi man 's search through the boxes . This was [no common thief that turned over letters , bills , and saddles]1159-no common thief that turned over letters , bills , and saddles - [no mere burglar]1160-no mere burglar who ran a little knife sideways into the soles of [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's slippers , or picked the seams of the saddle - bags so deftly . At first [Kim]344-kim had been minded to give the alarm - the long - drawn choor - choor ! [thief]1161-thief ! [thief]1161-thief ! that sets the serai ablaze of nights ; but [he]344-kim looked more carefully , and , hand on amulet , drew [his]344-kim own conclusions . ' It must be the pedigree of that made - up horse - lie , '[344-kim] said [he]344-kim , ' the thing that [I]344-kim carry to [Umballa]52-umballa . Better that [we]4722-they go now . [Those who search bags with knives]4723-those who search bags with knives may presently search bellies with knives . Surely there is [a woman behind this . Hai]4724-a woman behind this . hai ! Hai ! in a whisper to [the light - sleeping old man]4725-the light - sleeping old man . '[344-kim] Come . It is time - time to go to [Benares]37-benares . ' [The lama]868-the lama rose obediently , and [they]4722-they passed out of [the serai like shadows]4727-the serai like shadows . Chapter 2 And whoso will , from [Pride released]63-pride released ; Contemning neither creed nor [priest]4580-priest , May feel the Soul of all [the East]64-the east . '[344-kim] This is the work of devils ! '[1164-one] It is [the train]913-the train - only the te - rain . It will not come here . Wait ! '[1164-one] Nay , ' said [Kim]344-kim , scanning it with a grin . '[1164-one] This may serve for [farmers]1169-farmers , but [I]0-i live in [the city of [Lahore]11-lahore]1170-the city of lahore . '[401-amritzar] The price is so much . The small money in return is just so much . [I]0-i know the ways of the te - rain ... Day comes ! ' Golden , rose , saffron , and pink , the morning mists smoked away across the flat green levels . [All the rich Punjab]4821-all the rich punjab lay out in the splendour of the keen sun . [The lama]868-the lama flinched a little as the telegraph - posts swung by . '[385-holy one] Great is the speed of the te - rain , ' said [the banker]1207-the banker , with a patronizing grin . '[385-holy one] [We]1241-their have gone farther since [Lahore]11-lahore than [thou]1242-thou couldst walk in two days : at even , [we]1241-their shall enter [Umballa]52-umballa . ' '[1243-ye] And that is still far from [Benares]37-benares , ' said [the lama]868-the lama wearily , mumbling over the cakes that [Kim]344-kim offered . Then [the banker]1207-the banker , [the cultivator]4769-the cultivator , and [the soldier]1204-the soldier prepared [their]1241-their pipes and wrapped the compartment in choking , acrid smoke , spitting and coughing and enjoying [themselves]1241-their . [The Sikh]409-the sikh and [[the cultivator]4769-the cultivator 's wife]1210-the cultivator 's wife chewed pan ; [the lama]868-the lama took snuff and told [his]868-the lama beads , while [Kim]344-kim , cross - legged , smiled over the comfort of a full stomach . '[1243-ye] What rivers have [ye]1243-ye by [Benares]37-benares ? ' said [the lama]868-the lama of a sudden to [the carriage]4804-the carriage at large . ' '[410-gunga] What other than [Gunga]410-gunga ? ' '[410-gunga] Nay , but in [my]0-i mind was the thought of a certain River of healing . ' '[410-gunga] That is [Gunga]410-gunga . Who bathes in [her]410-gunga is made clean and goes to [the Gods]1244-the gods . Thrice have [I]0-i made pilgrimage to [Gunga]410-gunga . ' [He]868-the lama looked round proudly . '[0-i] There was need , ' said [the young sepoy]4774-the young sepoy drily , and [the travellers]4835-the travellers '[0-i] laugh turned against [the banker]1207-the banker . ' Clean - to return again to [the Gods]402-the gods , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama muttered . ' And to go forth on the round of lives anew - still tied to the Wheel . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama shook [his]868-the lama head testily . ' But maybe there is a mistake . Who , then , made [Gunga]410-gunga in the beginning ? '[868-the lama] ' [The Gods]402-the gods . Of what known faith art [thou]4836-thou ? '[1207-the banker] [the banker]1207-the banker said , appalled . ' [I]1207-the banker follow the Law - the Most Excellent Law . So it was [the Gods that made Gunga]4837-the gods that made gunga . What like of Gods were [they]4837-the gods that made gunga ? '[1207-the banker] [The carriage]4804-the carriage looked at [him]868-the lama in amazement . It was inconceivable that [anyone]1036-anyone should be ignorant of [Gunga]410-gunga . ' What - what is [[thy]4836-thou God]4838-thy god ? '[4771-the money - lender] said [the money - lender]4771-the money - lender at last . ' Hear ! [Swiftly Kim]344-kim took up the money ; but for all [his]4471-the man training , [he]4471-the man was Irish enough by birth to reckon silver the least part of any game . '[1325-sir] As [the trooper]1331-the trooper cantered off , [Kim]344-kim crawled round to the back of [the house]797-the house , where , going on [his]344-kim Lahore experiences , [he]344-kim judged there would be food - and information . '[1335-one of whom kicked him] ' It is a very big dinner , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , looking at the plates . ' Small wonder . ' And all that trouble , '[344-kim] said [he]344-kim to [himself]344-kim , thinking as usual in [Hindustani]77-hindustani , ' for a horse 's pedigree ! [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub should have come to [me]344-kim to learn a little lying . Every time before that [I]344-kim have borne a message it concerned [a woman]1192-a woman . Now it is [men]752-men . Better . [The tall man]1327-the tall man said that [they]752-men will loose a great army to punish [someone]4966-someone - somewhere - the news goes to [Pindi]424-pindi and [Peshawur]55-peshawur . There are also guns . Would [I]344-kim had crept nearer . It is big news ! '[344-kim] [He]344-kim returned to find [[the cultivator]4769-the cultivator 's cousin 's younger brother]1338-the cultivator 's cousin 's younger brother discussing the family law - suit in all its bearings with [the cultivator]4769-the cultivator and [[his]4769-the cultivator wife]1340-his wife and [a few friends]1341-a few friends , while [the lama]868-the lama dozed . After the evening meal [some one]1343-some one passed [him]344-kim a water - pipe ; and [Kim]344-kim felt very much of [a man]750-a man as [he]344-kim pulled at the smooth coconut - shell , [his]344-kim legs spread abroad in the moonlight , [his]344-kim tongue clicking in remarks from time to time . [[His]344-kim hosts]1345-his hosts were most polite ; for [[the cultivator]4769-the cultivator 's wife]1210-the cultivator 's wife had told [them]1345-his hosts of [his]344-kim vision of [the Red Bull]426-the red bull , and of [his]344-kim probable descent from [another world]1348-another world . Moreover , [the lama]868-the lama was a great and venerable curiosity . [The family priest]1350-the family priest , [an old , tolerant Sarsut Brahmin]1351-an old , tolerant sarsut brahmin , dropped in later , and naturally started a theological argument to impress [the family]1352-the family . By creed , of course , [they]1345-his hosts were all on [[their]1345-his hosts [priest]4580-priest]1353-their priest 's side , but [the lama]868-the lama was [the guest]1356-the guest and the novelty . [His]868-the lama gentle kindliness , and [his]868-the lama impressive Chinese quotations , that sounded like spells , delighted [them]1345-his hosts hugely ; and in this sympathetic , simple air , [he]868-the lama expanded like [the Bodhisat]364-the bodhisat 's own lotus , speaking of [his]868-the lama life in [the great hills of Such - zen]1357-the great hills of such - zen , before , as [he]868-the lama said , ' [I]868-the lama rose up to seek enlightenment . '[868-the lama] Then it came out that in those worldly days [he]868-the lama had been [a master- hand at casting horoscopes and nativities]1358-a master- hand at casting horoscopes and nativities ; and [the family priest]1350-the family priest led [him]868-the lama on to describe [his]868-the lama methods ; each giving the planets names that [the other]1360-the other could not understand , and pointing upwards as the big stars sailed across the dark . [The children of [the house]797-the house]1361-the children of the house tugged unrebuked at [his]868-the lama rosary ; and [he]868-the lama clean forgot the Rule which forbids looking at [women]4700-women as [he]868-the lama talked of enduring snows , landslips , blocked passes , [the remote cliffs]1364-the remote cliffs where [men]752-men find sapphires and turquoise , and [that wonderful upland road that leads at last into [Great China itself]78-great china itself]1366-that wonderful upland road that leads at last into great china itself . ' How thinkest [thou]4967-thou of this one ? '[4769-the cultivator] said [the cultivator]4769-the cultivator aside to [the priest]1044-the priest . ' [A holy man]4605-a holy man - [a holy man]4605-a holy man indeed . [[His]4605-a holy man Gods]4970-his gods are not [the Gods]1244-the gods , but [his]4605-a holy man feet are upon the Way , '[4769-the cultivator] was the answer . ' And [his]4605-a holy man methods of nativities , though that is beyond [thee]4967-thou , are wise and sure . '[4769-the cultivator] ' Tell [me]344-kim , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim lazily , ' whether [I]344-kim find [my]344-kim Red Bull on a green field , as was promised [me]344-kim . '[344-kim] ' What knowledge hast [thou]4967-thou of [thy]4967-thou birth - hour ? '[1044-the priest] [the priest]1044-the priest asked , swelling with importance . ' Between first and second cockcrow of the first night in May. '[1044-the priest] ' Of what year ? '[344-kim] ' [I]1044-the priest do not know ; but upon the hour that [I]1044-the priest cried first fell the great earthquake in [Srinagar]79-srinagar which is in [Kashmir]80-kashmir . '[1044-the priest] This [Kim]344-kim had from [the woman who took care of [him]344-kim]1370-the woman who took care of him , and [she]1370-the woman who took care of him again from [Kimball O'Hara]347-o'hara . The earthquake had been felt in [India]8-india , and for long stood a leading date in [the Punjab]2-the punjab . ' Ai ! '[1192-a woman] said [a woman]1192-a woman excitedly . This seemed to make [Kim]344-kim 's supernatural origin more certain . " Was not [such [an one]1373-an one 's daughter]1372-such an one 's daughter born then - ' '[1372-such an one 's daughter] And [[her]1372-such an one 's daughter mother]1374-her mother bore [[her]1374-her mother husband]1264-her husband four sons in four years [all likely boys]1376-all likely boys , ' cried [[the cultivator]4769-the cultivator 's wife]1210-the cultivator 's wife , sitting outside the circle in the shadow . ' [He]1350-the family priest began to draw in the dust of [the courtyard]1298-the courtyard . '[1377-their] At least [thou]1379-thou hast good claim to [a half of [the House of the Bull]1381-the house of the bull]1380-a half of the house of the bull . How runs [thy]1379-thou prophecy ? ' '[1379-thou] Upon a day , ' said [Kim]344-kim , delighted at the sensation [he]0-i was creating , '[1379-thou] [I]0-i shall be made great by means of a Red Bull on [a green field]763-a green field , but first there will enter [two men making all things ready]1383-two men making all things ready . ' '[1383-two men making all things ready] Yes : thus ever at the opening of a vision . A thick darkness that clears slowly ; anon one enters with a broom making ready [the place]4561-the place . Then begins the Sight . [Two men]1385-two men - [thou]1379-thou sayest ? Ay , ay . The Sun , leaving [the House of the Bull]1381-the house of the bull , enters that of [the Twins]427-the twins . Hence [the two men of the prophecy]1387-the two men of the prophecy . Let [us]1388-us now consider . Fetch [me]0-i a twig , [little one]1389-little one . ' [He]0-i knitted [his]0-i brows , scratched , smoothed out , and scratched again in the dust mysterious signs - to the wonder of all save [the lama]868-the lama , who , with fine instinct , forbore to interfere . At the end of half an hour , [he]0-i tossed the twig from [him]0-i with a grunt . '[1389-little one] Hm ! Thus say the stars . Within three days come [the two men]4452-the two men to make all things ready . After [them]4452-the two men follows [the Bull]426-the red bull ; but the sign over against [him]426-the red bull is the sign of War and [armed men]1391-armed men . ' '[4977-a man of the ludhiana sikhs in the carriage from lahore , ' said the cultivator 's wife] There was indeed [a man of the Ludhiana Sikhs in [the carriage]4804-the carriage from [Lahore]11-lahore , ' said [[the cultivator]4769-the cultivator 's wife]1210-the cultivator 's wife]4977-a man of the ludhiana sikhs in the carriage from lahore , ' said the cultivator 's wife hopefully . '[428-tck] [Tck]428-tck ! [Armed men]1391-armed men - many hundreds . What concern hast [thou]1394-thou with war ? ' said [the priest]1044-the priest to [Kim]344-kim . ' [Kim]344-kim smiled , remembering what [he]344-kim had overheard in [the dressing- room]4982-the dressing- room . ' Next morning , though [they]1395-us were pressed to stay , [the lama]868-the lama insisted on departure . [They]1395-us gave [Kim]344-kim a large bundle of good food and nearly three annas in copper money for the needs of [the road]4566-the road , and with many blessings watched [the two]4989-the two go southward in the dawn . '[4548-my brother] Pity it is that these and such as these could not be freed from - ' '[4548-my brother] Nay , then would only [evil people]1401-evil people be left on [the earth]1402-the earth , and who would give [us]1395-us meat and shelter ? Chapter 3 Yea , voice of [every Soul that clung To life that strove from rung to rung When [Devadatta]429-devadatta 's rule was young]1404-every soul that clung to life that strove from rung to rung when devadatta 's rule was young , The warm wind brings [Kamakura]1-kamakura . [Buddha]360-god at [Kamakura]1-kamakura . Behind [them]1395-us [an angry farmer]1405-an angry farmer brandished a bamboo pole . [He]1405-an angry farmer was [a market - gardener]1406-a market - gardener , [Arain]430-arain by caste , growing vegetables and flowers for [Umballa city]1407-umballa city , and well [Kim]344-kim knew the breed . ' [Such an one]4993-such an one , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama , disregarding the dogs , ' is impolite to [strangers]4994-strangers , intemperate of speech and uncharitable . '[1409-the farmer] ' [We]868-the lama go , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama returned , with quiet dignity . ' [We]868-the lama go from [these unblessed fields]4997-these unblessed fields . '[868-the lama] ' Ah , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , sucking in [his]344-kim breath . ' If the next crops fail , [thou]868-the lama canst only blame [thine]868-the lama own tongue . '[344-kim] [The man]4471-the man shuffled uneasily in [his]4471-the man slippers . ' [The land]4998-the land is full of [beggars]4999-beggars , '[4471-the man] [he]4471-the man began , half apologetically . '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim tartly , using the name that [a market - gardener]1406-a market - gardener least likes . ' All [we]868-the lama sought was to look at [that river beyond [the field there]5001-the field there]5000-that river beyond the field there . '[344-kim] ' [River]33-the river , forsooth ! '[4471-the man] [the man]4471-the man snorted . ' What city do [ye]868-the lama hail from not to know [a canal - cut]5002-a canal - cut ? '[4471-the man] [the man]4471-the man stammered , as [he]4471-the man looked at [the strange tall figure]1416-the strange tall figure . '[4471-the man] ' Take notice . '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama turned to [Kim]344-kim . ' [He]4471-the man was led to speak harshly by the Red Mist of anger . '[868-the lama] ' [I]344-kim have met [holy ones who would have cursed [thee]1418-the abashed man from hearthstone to byre]5010-holy ones who would have cursed thee from hearthstone to byre , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim to [the abashed man]1418-the abashed man . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim sprang to [his]1418-the abashed man side and dragged [him]1418-the abashed man back . A yellow - and - brown streak glided from the purple rustling stems to [the bank]1423-the bank , stretched its neck to the water , drank , and lay still - a big cobra with fixed , lidless eyes . ' [I]344-kim have no stick - [I]344-kim have no stick , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . ' 1 will get [me]344-kim one and break [his]433-the serpent back . '[344-kim] ' Why ? ' Where [the hard - worked soil]5027-the hard - worked soil gives three and even four crops a year through patches of sugar - cane , tobacco , long white radishes , and nol - kol , all that day [they]1429-they strolled on , turning aside to every glimpse of water ; rousing village dogs and [sleeping villages]5028-sleeping villages at noonday ; [the lama]868-the lama replying to the volleyed questions with an unswerving simplicity . [They]1429-they sought [a River]4546-a river : [a River of miraculous healing]5031-a river of miraculous healing . Had any one knowledge of [such a stream]5032-such a stream ? Sometimes [men]752-men laughed , but more often heard the story out to the end and offered [them]752-men a place in the shade , a drink of milk , and a meal . [The women]781-the women were always kind , and [the little children]5035-the little children as [children]848-children are the world over , alternately shy and venturesome . '[0-i] [I]0-i see - and hear . ' [The priest]1044-the priest smiled . '[0-i] Ho , there , Friend of all [the World]759-the world , ' [he]1044-the priest cried across the sharp - smelling smoke , '[0-i] what art [thou]1454-thou ? ' said [Kim]344-kim , with a twinkle . '[0-i] For [I]0-i am hungry . ' '[0-i] It is no jest , ' cried [the lama]868-the lama . '[1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten] [A certain astrologer of [that city]4559-that city whose name [I]0-i have forgotten]1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten - ' '[1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten] That is no more than [the city of Umballa]1460-the city of umballa where [we]1461-we slept last night , ' [Kim]344-kim whispered to [the priest]1044-the priest . '[1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten] Ay , [Umballa]52-umballa was it ? [He]1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten cast a horoscope and declared that [[my]0-i chela]4863-my chela should find [his]1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten desire within two days . ' [Kim]344-kim cleared [his]344-kim throat and looked around at [the village greybeards]5068-the village greybeards . '[1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten] The meaning of [my]0-i Star is War , ' [he]344-kim replied pompously . [Somebody]5069-somebody laughed at the little tattered figure strutting on the brickwork plinth under the great tree . Where [a native]5070-a native would have lain down , [Kim]344-kim 's white blood set [him]5070-a native upon [his]5070-a native feet . '[1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten] Ay , War , ' [he]344-kim answered . '[1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten] That is a sure prophecy , ' rumbled a deep voice . '[1458-a certain astrologer of that city whose name i have forgotten] For there is always war along [the Border]1463-the border - as [I]0-i know . ' [It]5071-it was [an old , withered man]5072-an old , withered man , who had served [the Government]852-the government in the days of the Mutiny as [a native officer in [a newly raised cavalry regiment]5075-a newly raised cavalry regiment]5074-a native officer in a newly raised cavalry regiment . [The Government]85-the government had given [him]5072-an old , withered man a good holding in [the village]5076-the village , and though the demands of [[his]5072-an old , withered man sons]5077-his sons , now [grey - bearded officers]5078-grey - bearded officers on [their]5077-his sons own account , had impoverished [him]5072-an old , withered man , [he]5072-an old , withered man was still [a person of consequence]5079-a person of consequence . [English officials]5080-english officials - [Deputy Commissioners]5081-deputy commissioners even - turned aside from [the main road]5082-the main road to visit [him]5072-an old , withered man , and on those occasions [he]5072-an old , withered man dressed [himself]5072-an old , withered man in the uniform of ancient days , and stood up like a ramrod . '[0-i] But this shall be a great war - a war of eight thousand . ' [Kim]344-kim 's voice shrilled across [the quick - gathering crowd]5083-the quick - gathering crowd , astonishing [himself]344-kim . '[1464-redcoats] [Redcoats]1464-redcoats or [[our]1465-our own regiments]1466-our own regiments ? ' [the old man]861-the old man snapped , as though [he]861-the old man were asking [an equal]5085-an equal . [His]861-the old man tone made [men]752-men respect [Kim]344-kim . ' '[986-the boy] [The boy]986-the boy has heard bazar - talk , ' said [the priest]1044-the priest . '[986-the boy] But [he]986-the boy was always by [my]0-i side , ' said [the lama]868-the lama . '[986-the boy] What new trick is this ? ' '[986-the boy] A sign . Give [me]0-i a sign , ' thundered [the old soldier]5092-the old soldier suddenly . '[0-i] If there were war [[my]0-i sons]1474-my sons would have told [me]0-i . ' '[1474-my sons] When all is ready , [[thy]0-i sons]1475-thy sons , doubt not , will be told . But it is a long road from [[thy]0-i sons]1475-thy sons to [the man in whose hands these things lie]1477-the man in whose hands these things lie . ' [Kim]344-kim warmed to the game , for it reminded [him]344-kim of experiences in the letter - carrying line , when , for the sake of a few pice , [he]344-kim pretended to know more than [he]344-kim knew . But now [he]344-kim was playing for larger things - the sheer excitement and the sense of power . [He]344-kim drew a new breath and went on . '[1240-old man] [Old man]1240-old man , give [me]0-i a sign . Do [underlings]1479-underlings order the goings of eight thousand redcoats - with guns ? ' '[1479-underlings] No . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i have seen [Him]1477-the man in whose hands these things lie . ' '[0-i] To know again ? ' '[1482-a tall man] [A tall man]1482-a tall man . [A tall man with black hair , walking thus]1483-a tall man with black hair , walking thus ? ' [Kim]344-kim took a few paces in a stiff , wooden style . '[1483-a tall man with black hair , walking thus] Ay . But that [anyone]1036-anyone may have seen . ' [The crowd]4816-the crowd were breathless - still through all this talk . '[1483-a tall man with black hair , walking thus] That is true , ' said [Kim]344-kim . '[1483-a tall man with black hair , walking thus] But [I]0-i will say more . Look now . First [the great man]1485-the great man walks thus . Then [He]1485-the great man thinks thus . ' [Kim]344-kim drew a forefinger over [his]344-kim forehead and downwards till it came to rest by the angle of the jaw . '[1485-the great man] [Anon]1486-anon [He]1485-the great man twitches [his]1485-the great man fingers thus . [Anon]436-anon [He]1485-the great man thrusts [his]1485-the great man hat under [his]1485-the great man left armpit . ' [Kim]344-kim illustrated the motion and stood like a stork .
