'[868-the lama] ' That is no part of the Way , '[868-the lama] sighed [the lama]868-the lama . ' But at least [she]5394-that woman in the bullock - cart is from [the Hills]10-the hills . Ah , [the Hills]10-the hills , and the snow of [the Hills]10-the hills ! '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama rose and stalked to [the cart]1856-the cart . [Kim]344-kim would have given [his]344-kim ears to come too , but [the lama]868-the lama did not invite [him]344-kim ; and the few words [he]344-kim caught were in an unknown tongue , for they spoke some common speech of [the mountains]1898-the mountains . [The woman]766-the woman seemed to ask questions which [the lama]868-the lama turned over in [his]868-the lama mind before answering . Now and again [he]868-the lama heard the singsong cadence of a Chinese quotation . It was a strange picture that [Kim]344-kim watched between drooped eyelids . [The lama]868-the lama , very straight and erect , the deep folds of [his]868-the lama yellow clothing slashed with black in the light of the parao fires precisely as a knotted tree - trunk is slashed with the shadows of the low sun , addressed a tinsel and lacquered ruth which burned like a many - coloured jewel in the same uncertain light . The patterns on the gold - worked curtains ran up and down , melting and reforming as the folds shook and quivered to the night wind ; and when the talk grew more earnest the jewelled forefinger snapped out little sparks of light between the embroideries . Behind [the cart]1856-the cart was a wall of uncertain darkness speckled with little flames and alive with half - caught forms and faces and shadows . The voices of early evening had settled down to one soothing hum whose deepest note was the steady chumping of the bullocks above [their]1903-their chopped straw , and [whose highest was the tinkle of a Bengali dancing - girl]1904-whose highest was the tinkle of a bengali dancing - girl 's sitar . [Most men]1905-most men had eaten and pulled deep at [their]1905-most men gurgling , grunting hookahs , which in full blast sound like bull - frogs . At last [the lama]868-the lama returned . [A hillman]834-a hillman walked behind [him]868-the lama with a wadded cotton - quilt and spread it carefully by the fire . ' [She]766-the woman deserves [ten thousand grandchildren]5398-ten thousand grandchildren , '[344-kim] thought [Kim]344-kim . ' None the less , but for [me]344-kim , those gifts would not have come . '[344-kim] ' [A virtuous woman]5399-a virtuous woman - and [a wise one]5400-a wise one . '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama slackened off , joint by joint , like a slow camel . ' [The world]759-the world is full of charity to [those who follow the Way]5402-those who follow the way . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama flung a fair half of the quilt over [Kim]344-kim . ' And what said [she]766-the woman ? '[868-the lama] [Kim]344-kim rolled up in [his]344-kim share of it . ' [She]766-the woman asked [me]868-the lama many questions and propounded many problems - the most of which were idle tales which [she]766-the woman had heard from [devil- serving priests who pretend to follow the Way]5403-devil- serving priests who pretend to follow the way . Some [I]868-the lama answered , and some [I]868-the lama said were foolish . [Many]1563-many wear the Robe , but [few keep the Way]5405-few keep the way . '[868-the lama] ' True . That is true . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim used the thoughtful , conciliatory tone of [those who wish to draw confidences]1909-those who wish to draw confidences . ' But by [her]766-the woman lights [she]766-the woman is most right - minded . [She]766-the woman desires greatly that [we]5406-we should go with [her]766-the woman to [Buddh Gaya]36-buddh gaya ; [[her]766-the woman road]5407-her road being [ours]5406-we , as [I]344-kim understand , for many days '[344-kim] journey to the southward . ' '[344-kim] And ? ' '[344-kim] Patience a little . To this [I]0-i said that [my]0-i Search came before all things . [She]1910-she had heard many foolish legends , but this great truth of [[my]0-i River]1074-my river [she]1910-she had never heard . Such are [the priests of [the lower hills]1913-the lower hills]1912-the priests of the lower hills ! [She]1910-she knew [the Abbot of [Lung - Cho]365-lung - cho]1914-the abbot of lung - cho , but [she]1910-she did not know of [my]0-i River - nor the tale of the Arrow . ' '[1910-she] And ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i spoke therefore of the Search , and of the Way , and of matters that were profitable ; [she]1910-she desiring only that [I]0-i should accompany [her]1910-she and make prayer for [a second son]5378-a second son . ' '[1910-she] Aha ! " [[We]1916-we women]1917-we women " do not think of anything save [children]848-children , ' said [Kim]344-kim sleepily . '[1917-we women] Now , since [[our]1916-we roads]1919-our roads run together for a while , [I]0-i do not see that [we]1916-we in any way depart from [our]1916-we Search if so be [we]1916-we accompany [her]1910-she - at least as far as - [I]0-i have forgotten the name of [the city]4596-the city . ' '[0-i] Ohe ! ' said [Kim]344-kim , turning and speaking in a sharp whisper to one of the Ooryas a few yards away . '[0-i] Where is [[[your]0-i master]1921-your master 's house]1922-your master 's house ? ' '[1910-she] A little behind [Saharunpore]100-saharunpore , among [the fruit gardens]1923-the fruit gardens . ' [He]1921-your master named [the village]5076-the village . '[1910-she] That was [the place]4561-the place , ' said [the lama]868-the lama . '[1910-she] So far , at least , [we]1916-we can go with [her]1910-she . ' '[1910-she] Flies go to carrion , ' said [the Oorya]467-the oorya , in an abstracted voice . '[1910-she] For [the sick cow]1925-the sick cow a crow ; for [the sick man]1926-the sick man [a Brahmin]1927-a brahmin . ' [Kim]344-kim breathed the proverb impersonally to the shadow - tops of the trees overhead . [The Oorya]467-the oorya grunted and held [his]868-the lama peace . '[1927-a brahmin] So then [we]1916-we go with [her]1910-she , [Holy One]385-holy one ? ' '[385-holy one] Is there any reason against ? [I]0-i can still step aside and try [all the rivers that [the road]4566-the road overpasses]1928-all the rivers that the road overpasses . [She]1910-she desires that [I]0-i should come . [She]1910-she very greatly desires it . ' [Kim]344-kim stifled a laugh in the quilt . When once [that imperious old lady]5410-that imperious old lady had recovered from [her]5410-that imperious old lady natural awe of [a lama]839-a lama [he]344-kim thought it probable that [she]5410-that imperious old lady would be worth listening to . [He]344-kim was nearly asleep when [the lama]868-the lama suddenly quoted a proverb : '[1910-she] [The husbands of [the talkative]1931-the talkative]1930-the husbands of the talkative have a great reward hereafter . ' Then [Kim]344-kim heard [him]868-the lama snuff thrice , and dozed off , still laughing . The diamond - bright dawn woke [men]752-men and crows and bullocks together . [Kim]344-kim sat up and yawned , shook [himself]344-kim , and thrilled with delight . This was seeing [the world]759-the world in real truth ; this was life as [he]344-kim would have it - bustling and shouting , the buckling of belts , and beating of bullocks and creaking of wheels , lighting of fires and cooking of food , and new sights at every turn of the approving eye . The morning mist swept off in a whorl of silver , the parrots shot away to [some distant river in shrieking green hosts]5415-some distant river in shrieking green hosts : all the well - wheels within ear - shot went to work . [India]8-india was awake , and [Kim]344-kim was in the middle of it , more awake and more excited than [anyone]1036-anyone , chewing on a twig that [he]344-kim would presently use as a toothbrush ; for [he]344-kim borrowed right- and left - handedly from all the customs of [the country]806-the country [he]344-kim knew and loved . There was no need to worry about food - no need to spend a cowrie at [the crowded stalls]5418-the crowded stalls . [He]344-kim was [the disciple of [a holy man annexed by [a strong - willed old lady]5421-a strong - willed old lady]5420-a holy man annexed by a strong - willed old lady]5419-the disciple of a holy man annexed by a strong - willed old lady . All things would be prepared for [them]5422-they , and when [they]5422-they were respectfully invited so to do [they]5422-they would sit and eat . For the rest - [Kim]344-kim giggled here as [he]344-kim cleaned [his]344-kim teeth - [[his]344-kim hostess]5423-his hostess would rather heighten the enjoyment of [the road]4566-the road . [He]344-kim inspected [her]5421-a strong - willed old lady bullocks critically , as [they]5425-they came up grunting and blowing under the yokes . If [they]5425-they went too fast -it was not likely - there would be a pleasant seat for [himself]344-kim along the pole ; [the lama]868-the lama would sit beside [the driver]5427-the driver . [The escort , of course]5428-the escort , of course , would walk . [The old lady , equally of course]5429-the old lady , equally of course , would talk a great deal , and by what [he]344-kim had heard that conversation would not lack salt . [She]1932-her was already ordering , haranguing , rebuking , and , it must be said , cursing [[her]1932-her servants]5430-her servants for delays . '[1910-she] Get [her]1932-her [her]1932-her pipe . In the name of [the Gods]1244-the gods , get [her]1932-her [her]1932-her pipe and stop [her]1932-her ill - omened mouth , ' cried [an Oorya]5431-an oorya , tying up [his]5431-an oorya shapeless bundles of bedding . '[1932-her] [She]1932-her and [the parrots]1934-the parrots are alike . [They]1935-they screech in the dawn . ' '[1935-they] [The lead - bullocks]1936-the lead - bullocks ! [Hai]444-hai ! Look to the lead - bullocks ! ' [They]1936-the lead - bullocks were backing and wheeling as [a grain - cart]5432-a grain - cart 's axle caught [them]1936-the lead - bullocks by the horns . " [Son of an owl]5433-son of an owl , where dost [thou]1936-the lead - bullocks go ? '[1935-they] This to [the grinning carter]1937-the grinning carter . ' Ai ! Yai ! Yai ! That within there is [the Queen of [Delhi]12-delhi]5434-the queen of delhi going to pray for [a son]5435-a son , '[4471-the man] [the man]4471-the man called back over [his]4471-the man high load . ' Room for [the Queen of [Delhi]12-delhi]5434-the queen of delhi and [[her]5434-the queen of delhi Prime Minister]5437-her prime minister the grey monkey climbing up [his]5437-her prime minister own sword ! '[4471-the man] [Another cart loaded with bark]1939-another cart loaded with bark for [a down - country tannery]1940-a down - country tannery followed close behind , and [its driver]1941-its driver added a few compliments as the ruth - bullocks backed and backed again . From behind the shaking curtains came one volley of invective . It did not last long , but in kind and quality , in blistering , biting appropriateness , it was beyond anything that even [Kim]344-kim had heard . [He]344-kim could see [the carter]1684-the carter 's bare chest collapse with amazement , as [the man]4471-the man salaamed reverently to the voice , leaped from the pole , and helped [the escort]1857-the escort haul [their]1857-the escort volcano on to [the main road]5082-the main road . Here the voice told [him]344-kim truthfully what sort of wife [he]344-kim had wedded , and what [she]1946-she was doing in [his]344-kim absence . ' Oh , [shabash]5438-shabash ! '[344-kim] murmured [Kim]344-kim , unable to contain [himself]344-kim , as [the man]4471-the man slunk away . ' Well done , indeed ? It is a shame and a scandal that [a poor woman]5439-a poor woman may not go to make prayer to [[her]5439-a poor woman Gods]5440-her gods except [she]5439-a poor woman be jostled and insulted by all the refuse of [Hindustan]92-hindustan - that [she]5439-a poor woman must eat gali abuse as [men]752-men eat ghi . But [I]344-kim have yet a wag left to [my]344-kim tongue - a word or two well spoken that serves the occasion . And still am [I]344-kim without [my]344-kim tobacco ! Who is [the one - eyed and luckless son of shame]5442-the one - eyed and luckless son of shame that has not yet prepared [my]344-kim pipe ? '[344-kim] It was hastily thrust in by [a hillman]834-a hillman , and a trickle of thick smoke from each corner of the curtains showed that peace was restored . If [Kim]344-kim had walked proudly the day before , [disciple of [a holy man]4605-a holy man]1949-disciple of a holy man , today [he]344-kim paced with tenfold pride in the train of a semi - royal procession , with [a recognized place under the patronage of [an old lady of charming manners and infinite resource]1952-an old lady of charming manners and infinite resource]1951-a recognized place under the patronage of an old lady of charming manners and infinite resource . [The escort]1857-the escort , [their]1857-the escort heads tied up native - fashion , fell in on either side [the cart]1856-the cart , shuffling enormous clouds of dust . [The lama]868-the lama and [Kim]344-kim walked a little to one side ; [Kim]344-kim chewing [his]344-kim stick of sugarcane , and making way for [no one]786-no one under the status of [a priest]820-a priest . [They]1857-the escort could hear [the old lady]1825-the old lady 's tongue clack as steadily as a rice - husker . [She]1825-the old lady bade [the escort]1857-the escort tell [her]1825-the old lady what was going on on [the road]4566-the road ; and so soon as [they]1857-the escort were clear of [the parao]1792-the parao [she]1825-the old lady flung back the curtains and peered out , [her]1825-the old lady veil a third across [her]1825-the old lady face . [[Her]1825-the old lady men]1962-her men did not eye [her]1825-the old lady directly when [she]1825-the old lady addressed [them]1962-her men , and thus the proprieties were more or less observed . [A dark , sallowish District Superintendent of Police]1963-a dark , sallowish district superintendent of police , faultlessly uniformed , [an Englishman]1107-an englishman , trotted by on a tired horse , and , seeing from [her]1825-the old lady retinue what manner of [person]1965-person [she]1825-the old lady was , chaffed [her]1825-the old lady . ' O [mother]4505-mother , '[1107-an englishman] [he]1107-an englishman cried , ' do [they]1962-her men do this in [the zenanas]5444-the zenanas ? Suppose [an Englishman]1107-an englishman came by and saw that [thou]5446-thou hast no nose ? '[1107-an englishman] ' What ? '[1825-the old lady] [she]1825-the old lady shrilled back . ' [[Thine]5446-thou own mother]5447-thine own mother has no nose ? Why say so , then , on [the open road]1811-the open road ? '[1825-the old lady] It was a fair counter . [The Englishman]4653-the englishman threw up [his]4653-the englishman hand with the gesture of [a man hit at sword - play]1967-a man hit at sword - play . [She]1825-the old lady laughed and nodded . ' Is this a face to tempt virtue aside ? '[1825-the old lady] [She]1825-the old lady withdrew all [her]1825-the old lady veil and stared at [him]1107-an englishman . It was by no means lovely , but as [the man]4471-the man gathered up [his]4471-the man reins [he]4471-the man called it a Moon of [Paradise]101-paradise , [a Disturber of Integrity , and a few other fantastic epithets]1969-a disturber of integrity , and a few other fantastic epithets which doubled [her]1825-the old lady up with mirth . ' That is [a nut - cut rogue]5449-a nut - cut rogue , '[1825-the old lady] [she]1825-the old lady said . ' [All police - constables]5450-all police - constables are nut - cuts ; but [the police - wallahs]5451-the police - wallahs are the worst . [Hai]444-hai , [[my]1825-the old lady son]4602-my son , [thou]5453-thou hast never learned all that since [thou]5453-thou camest from [Belait Europe]102-belait europe . Who suckled [thee]5453-thou ? '[1825-the old lady] ' [A pahareen]5454-a pahareen - [a hillwoman of [Dalhousie]103-dalhousie]5455-a hillwoman of dalhousie , [[my]1970-my mother]4610-my mother . Keep [thy]5453-thou beauty under a shade - O Dispenser of Delights , '[1970-my] and [he]1970-my was gone . ' These be the sort '[1825-the old lady] - [she]1825-the old lady took a fine judicial tone , and stuffed [her]1825-the old lady mouth with pan - ' These be the sort to oversee justice . [They]5451-the police - wallahs know [the land]4998-the land and the customs of [the land]4998-the land . [The others]5143-the others , all new from [Europe]104-europe , suckled by [white women]5460-white women and learning [our]5461-our tongues from books , are worse than the pestilence . [They]5451-the police - wallahs do harm to [Kings]870-kings . '[1825-the old lady] Then [she]1825-the old lady told a long , long tale to [the world]759-the world at large , of [an ignorant young policeman who had disturbed [some small [Hill Rajah]469-rajah]1973-some small hill rajah , [a ninth cousin of [her]1825-the old lady own]1974-a ninth cousin of her own , in the matter of a trivial land - case , winding up with a quotation from a work by no means devotional]1972-an ignorant young policeman who had disturbed some small hill rajah , a ninth cousin of her own , in the matter of a trivial land - case , winding up with a quotation from a work by no means devotional . Then [her]1825-the old lady mood changed , and [she]1825-the old lady bade [one of [the escort]1857-the escort]1975-one of the escort ask whether [the lama]868-the lama would walk alongside and discuss matters of religion . So [Kim]344-kim dropped back into the dust and returned to [his]344-kim sugar - cane . For an hour or more [the lama]868-the lama 's tam - o'shanter showed like a moon through the haze ; and , from all [he]344-kim heard , [Kim]344-kim gathered that [the old woman]1866-the old woman wept . [One of [the Ooryas]459-the ooryas]1865-one of the ooryas half apologized for [his]1865-one of the ooryas rudeness overnight , saying that [he]1865-one of the ooryas had never known [[his]1865-one of the ooryas mistress]1981-his mistress of so bland a temper , and [he]1865-one of the ooryas ascribed it to the presence of [the strange priest]1982-the strange priest . Personally , [he]1865-one of the ooryas believed in [Brahmins]5204-brahmins , though , like [all natives]1984-all natives , [he]1865-one of the ooryas was acutely aware of [their]5204-brahmins cunning and [their]5204-brahmins greed . Still , when [Brahmins]5204-brahmins but irritated with begging demands [the mother of [[his]5204-brahmins master 's wife]1987-his master 's wife]1986-the mother of his master 's wife , and when [she]1987-his master 's wife sent [them]5204-brahmins away so angry that [they]5204-brahmins cursed [the whole retinue]1988-the whole retinue which was the real reason of the second off - side bullock going lame , and of the pole breaking the night before , [he]1865-one of the ooryas was prepared to accept [any priest of any other denomination in or out of [India]8-india]1989-any priest of any other denomination in or out of india . To this [Kim]344-kim assented with wise nods , and bade [the Oorya]467-the oorya observe that [the lama]868-the lama took no money , and that the cost of [his]868-the lama and [Kim]344-kim 's food would be repaid a hundred times in the good luck that would attend [the caravan]1991-the caravan henceforward . [He]344-kim also told stories of [Lahore city]939-lahore city , and sang a song or two which made [the escort]1857-the escort laugh . As [a town]1994-a town - mouse well acquainted with the latest songs by [the most fashionable composers]1995-the most fashionable composers - [they]1995-the most fashionable composers are [women]4700-women for the most part - [Kim]344-kim had a distinct advantage over [men from [a little fruit - village behind [Saharunpore]100-saharunpore]1998-a little fruit - village behind saharunpore]1997-men from a little fruit - village behind saharunpore , but [he]344-kim let that advantage be inferred . At noon [they]1995-the most fashionable composers turned aside to eat , and the meal was good , plentiful , and well - served on plates of clean leaves , in decency , out of drift of the dust . [They]1995-the most fashionable composers gave the scraps to [certain beggars]1999-certain beggars , that all requirements might be fulfilled , and sat down to a long , luxurious smoke . [The old lady]1825-the old lady had retreated behind [her]1825-the old lady curtains , but mixed most freely in the talk , [[her]1825-the old lady servants]5430-her servants arguing with and contradicting [her]1825-the old lady as [servants]4922-servants do throughout [the East]4797-the east . [She]1825-the old lady compared the cool and [the pines of [the Kangra]105-the kangra and [Kulu hills]2005-kulu hills]2004-the pines of the kangra and kulu hills with the dust and the mangoes of [the South]1783-the south ; [she]1825-the old lady told a tale of some old local Gods at the edge of [[[her]1825-the old lady husband]1264-her husband 's territory]2008-her husband 's territory ; [she]1825-the old lady roundly abused the tobacco which [she]1825-the old lady was then smoking , reviled [all Brahmins]2009-all brahmins , and speculated without reserve on the coming of [many grandsons]2010-many grandsons . Chapter 5 Here come [I]0-i to [my]0-i own again Fed , forgiven , and known again Claimed by bone of [my]0-i bone again , And sib to flesh of [my]0-i flesh ! The fatted calf is dressed for [me]0-i , But the husks have greater zest for [me]0-i ... [I]0-i think [my]0-i pigs will be best for [me]0-i , So [I]0-i 'm off to [the styes]5463-the styes afresh . [The Prodigal Son]5464-the prodigal son . [Once more the lazy , string - tied , shuffling procession]5465-once more the lazy , string - tied , shuffling procession got under way , and [she]5464-the prodigal son slept till [they]5466-they reached the next halting - stage . It was a very short march , and time lacked an hour to sundown , so [Kim]344-kim cast about for means of amusement . '[0-i] But why not sit and rest ? ' said [one of [the escort]1857-the escort]1975-one of the escort . '[2011-the devils] Only [the devils]2011-the devils and [the English]1571-the english walk to and fro without reason . ' '[1571-the english] Never make [friends]2013-friends with [the Devil]2014-the devil , [a Monkey]2015-a monkey , or [a Boy]4870-a boy . [No man]5156-no man knows what [they]2018-they will do next , ' said [[his]344-kim fellow]5469-his fellow . [Kim]344-kim turned a scornful back - [he]344-kim did not want to hear the old story how [the Devil]2014-the devil played with [the boys]4472-the boys and repented of it and walked idly across [country]5472-country . [The lama]868-the lama strode after [him]344-kim . All that day , whenever [they]2018-they passed [a stream]5474-a stream , [he]868-the lama had turned aside to look at it , but in no case had [he]868-the lama received any warning that [he]868-the lama had found [[his]868-the lama River]5475-his river . Insensibly , too , the comfort of speaking to [someone]4966-someone in a reasonable tongue , and of being properly considered and respected as [[her]4966-someone spiritual adviser]5477-her spiritual adviser by [a well - born woman]5478-a well - born woman , had weaned [his]868-the lama thoughts a little from the Search . And further , [he]868-the lama was prepared to spend serene years in [his]868-the lama quest ; having nothing of [the white man]1425-the white man 's impatience , but a great faith . '[5156-no man] Where goest [thou]2019-thou ? ' [he]868-the lama called after [Kim]344-kim . '[2019-thou] Nowhither - it was a small march , and all this ' - [Kim]344-kim waved [his]344-kim hands abroad - '[5156-no man] is new to [me]0-i . ' '[5156-no man] [She]2020-she is beyond question [a wise and a discerning woman]2021-a wise and a discerning woman . But it is hard to meditate when - ' '[2022-all women] [All women]2022-all women are thus . ' [Kim]344-kim spoke as might have [Solomon]470-solomon . '[2022-all women] Before [the lamassery]4582-the lamassery was [a broad platform]2024-a broad platform , ' [the lama]868-the lama muttered , looping up the well - worn rosary , '[2022-all women] of stone . On that [I]0-i have left the marks of [my]0-i feet - pacing to and fro with these . ' [He]0-i clicked the beads , and began the '[0-i] Om mane pudme hum 's of [his]0-i devotion ; grateful for the cool , the quiet , and the absence of dust . One thing after another drew [Kim]344-kim 's idle eye across [the plain]2025-the plain . There was no purpose in [his]344-kim wanderings , except that the build of [the huts near by]2026-the huts near by seemed new , and [he]344-kim wished to investigate . [They]2027-they came out on [a broad tract of grazing - ground]2028-a broad tract of grazing - ground , brown and purple in the afternoon light , with a heavy clump of mangoes in the centre . It struck [Kim]344-kim as curious that [no shrine]2029-no shrine stood in so eligible a spot : [the boy]986-the boy was observing as [any priest for these things]2031-any priest for these things . Far across [the plain]2025-the plain walked side by side [four men]2033-four men , made small by the distance . [He]344-kim looked intently under [his]344-kim curved palms and caught the sheen of brass . ' [Soldiers]5481-soldiers . [White soldiers]5482-white soldiers ! '[344-kim] said [he]344-kim . ' Let [us]2033-four men see . '[344-kim] ' It is always [soldiers]5481-soldiers when [thou]5484-thou and [I]2033-four men go out alone together . But [I]2033-four men have never seen [the white soldiers]5485-the white soldiers . '[2033-four men] ' [They]5485-the white soldiers do no harm except when [they]5485-the white soldiers are drunk . Keep behind this tree . '[2033-four men] [They]2033-four men stepped behind the thick trunks in the cool dark of the mango- tope . [Two little figures]2034-two little figures halted ; [the other two]2035-the other two came forward uncertainly . [They]2033-four men were [the advance - party of a regiment on the march]2036-the advance - party of a regiment on the march , sent out , as usual , to mark [the camp]2037-the camp . [They]2033-four men bore five - foot sticks with fluttering flags , and called to [each other]2038-each other as [they]2033-four men spread over the flat earth . At last [they]2033-four men entered [the mango - grove]2039-the mango - grove , walking heavily . ' It 's [here]4484-here or hereabouts - [[officers]5487-officers '[0-i] tents under the trees]5488-officers ' tents under the trees , [I]0-i take it , an ' [the rest of [us]2033-four men]5489-the rest of us can stay outside . Have [they]2033-four men marked out for the baggage - wagons behind ? '[2033-four men] [They]2033-four men cried again to [[their]2033-four men comrades]2040-their comrades in the distance , and the rough answer came back faint and mellowed . ' Shove the flag in here , then , '[1164-one] said [one]1164-one . ' What do [they]2033-four men prepare ? '[2042-the lama , wonderstruck] said [the lama , wonderstruck]2042-the lama , wonderstruck . ' This is [a great and terrible world]1315-a great and terrible world . What is the device on the flag ? '[2042-the lama , wonderstruck] [A soldier]1629-a soldier thrust a stave within a few feet of [them]2033-four men , grunted discontentedly , pulled it up again , conferred with [[his]1629-a soldier companion]2044-his companion , who looked up and down [the shaded cave of greenery]2045-the shaded cave of greenery , and returned it . [Kim]344-kim stared with all [his]344-kim eyes , [his]344-kim breath coming short and sharp between [his]344-kim teeth . [The soldiers]2046-the soldiers stamped off into the sunshine . ' O Holy One ! '[344-kim] [he]344-kim gasped . ' [My]344-kim horoscope ! The drawing in the dust by [the priest at [Umballa]52-umballa]5491-the priest at umballa ! Remember what [he]5491-the priest at umballa said . First come two - ferashes - to make all things ready - in [a dark place]5492-a dark place , as it is always at the beginning of a vision . '[344-kim] ' But this is not vision , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' It is [the world]759-the world 's Illusion , and no more . '[868-the lama] ' And after [them]2046-the soldiers comes the Bull - the Red Bull on [the green field]5494-the green field . Look ! It is [he]5491-the priest at umballa ! '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama pointed to the flag that was snap snapping in the evening breeze not ten feet away . It was no more than [an ordinary camp marking- flag]2048-an ordinary camp marking- flag ; but [the regiment , always punctilious in matters of millinery]2049-the regiment , always punctilious in matters of millinery , had charged it with the regimental device , the Red Bull , which is the crest of the Mavericks - the great Red Bull on a background of Irish green . ' [I]868-the lama see , and now [I]868-the lama remember . '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' Certainly it is [thy]2049-the regiment , always punctilious in matters of millinery [Bull]426-the red bull . Certainly , also , [the two men]4452-the two men came to make all ready . '[868-the lama] ' [They]4452-the two men are [soldiers]5481-soldiers - [white soldiers]5482-white soldiers . What said [the priest]1044-the priest ? " The sign over against the Bull is the sign of War and [armed men]1391-armed men . " Holy One , this thing touches [my]868-the lama Search . '[868-the lama] ' True . It is true . '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama stared fixedly at the device that flamed like a ruby in the dusk . ' [The priest]1044-the priest at [Umballa]52-umballa said that thine was the sign of War . '[868-the lama] ' What is to do now ? '[868-the lama] ' Wait . Let [us]5501-us wait . '[868-the lama] ' Even now the darkness clears , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . It was only natural that the descending sun should at last strike through the tree - trunks , across [the grove]2052-the grove , filling it with mealy gold light for a few minutes ; but to [Kim]344-kim it was the crown of [the Umballa Brahmin]2053-the umballa brahmin 's prophecy . ' Hark ! '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' One beats a drum - far off ! '[868-the lama] At first the sound , carrying diluted through the still air , resembled the beating of an artery in the head . Soon a sharpness was added . ' Ah ! The music , '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim explained . [He]344-kim knew the sound of [a regimental band]2055-a regimental band , but it amazed [the lama]868-the lama . At the far end of [the plain]2025-the plain a heavy , dusty column crawled in sight . Then the wind brought the tune : [We]2058-we crave [your]2059-your condescension To tell [you]2059-your what [we]2058-we know Of marching in [the Mulligan Guards]2060-the mulligan guards To [Sligo Port]106-sligo port below ! Here broke in the shrill - tongued fifes : [We]2058-we shouldered arms , [We]2058-we marched - [we]2058-we marched away . From [Phoenix Park]107-phoenix park [We]2058-we marched to [Dublin Bay]108-dublin bay . The drums and the fifes , Oh , sweetly [they]2061-they did play , As [we]2058-we marched - marched - marched - with [the Mulligan Guards]109-the mulligan guards ! ' But this is sorcery ! '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' Let [us]5502-us go , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama , sinking back afraid , as the fires twinkled and [white officers with jingling swords]2077-white officers with jingling swords stalked into [the Mess - tent]2078-the mess - tent . ' Stand back in the shadow . [No one]786-no one can see beyond the light of a fire , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , [his]344-kim eyes still on the flag . [He]344-kim had never before watched the routine of [a seasoned regiment pitching camp]2079-a seasoned regiment pitching camp in thirty minutes . ' Look ! look ! look ! '[868-the lama] clucked [the lama]868-the lama . ' Yonder comes [a priest]820-a priest . '[868-the lama] It was [Bennett]471-bennett , [the Church of England Chaplain of the regiment]2081-the church of england chaplain of the regiment , limping in dusty black . [One of [[his]471-bennett flock]2083-his flock]2082-one of his flock had made some rude remarks about [the Chaplain]2084-the chaplain 's mettle ; and to abash [him]471-bennett [Bennett]471-bennett had marched step by step with [the men]5050-the men that day . The black dress , gold cross on the watch - chain , the hairless face , and the soft , black wideawake hat would have marked [him]471-bennett as [a holy man anywhere in all [India]8-india]2086-a holy man anywhere in all india . [He]471-bennett dropped into [a camp]2087-a camp - chair by the door of [the Mess - tent]2078-the mess - tent and slid off [his]471-bennett boots . ' The talk of [white men]5505-white men is wholly lacking in dignity , '[2090-the lama , who judged only by tone] said [the lama , who judged only by tone]2090-the lama , who judged only by tone . ' But [I]2090-the lama , who judged only by tone considered the countenance of [that priest]5506-that priest and [I]2090-the lama , who judged only by tone think [he]5506-that priest is learned . [I]2090-the lama , who judged only by tone would talk to [him]5506-that priest of [my]2090-the lama , who judged only by tone Search . '[2090-the lama , who judged only by tone] ' Never speak to [a white man]5508-a white man till [he]5508-a white man is fed , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , quoting a well - known proverb . ' [They]5505-white men will eat now , and - and [I]344-kim do not think [they]5505-white men are good to beg from . Let [us]5507-we go back to [the resting - place]5509-the resting - place . After [we]5507-we have eaten [we]5507-we will come again . It certainly was a [Red Bull]426-the red bull - [[my]344-kim Red Bull]5510-my red bull . '[344-kim] [They]2091-their were both noticeably absent - minded when [the old lady]1825-the old lady 's retinue set [their]2091-their meal before [them]2091-their ; so [none]4586-none broke [their]2091-their reserve , for it is not lucky to annoy [guests]2094-guests . ' Now , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , picking [his]344-kim teeth , ' [we]5507-we will return to [that place]5511-that place ; but [thou]868-the lama , [O Holy One]5512-o holy one , must wait a little way off , because [thy]868-the lama feet are heavier than [mine]344-kim and [I]344-kim am anxious to see more of that Red Bull . '[344-kim] ' But how canst [thou]868-the lama understand the talk ? Walk slowly . [The road]4566-the road is dark , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama replied uneasily . [Kim]344-kim put the question aside . ' [I]344-kim marked a place near to the trees , '[344-kim] said [he]344-kim , ' where [thou]868-the lama canst sit till [I]344-kim call . '[344-kim] ' What dost [thou]868-the lama not know of [this world]1066-this world ? '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama squatted obediently in a little hollow of the ground not a hundred yards from the hump of the mango - trees dark against the star - powdered sky . ' Stay till [I]344-kim call . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim flitted into the dusk . Now [the Reverend Arthur Bennett]473-the reverend arthur bennett always left [Mess]113-mess after that toast , and being rather tired by [his]473-the reverend arthur bennett march [his]473-the reverend arthur bennett movements were more abrupt than usual . [Kim]344-kim , with slightly raised head , was still staring at [his]344-kim totem on the table , when [the Chaplain]2084-the chaplain stepped on [his]344-kim right shoulder - blade . [Kim]344-kim flinched under the leather , and , rolling sideways , brought down [the Chaplain]2084-the chaplain , who , ever [a man of action]2124-a man of action , caught [him]344-kim by the throat and nearly choked the life out of [him]344-kim . [Kim]344-kim then kicked [him]344-kim desperately in the stomach . [Mr Bennett]471-bennett gasped and doubled up , but without relaxing [his]471-bennett grip , rolled over again , and silently hauled [Kim]344-kim to [[his]344-kim own tent]2125-his own tent . ' Why , it 's [a boy]4870-a boy ! Now , [Kimball]347-o'hara , [I]344-kim wish [you]347-o'hara to tell [this man]937-this man what [I]344-kim say word for word . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim gathered the import of the next few sentences and began thus : ' [Holy One]385-holy one , [the thin fool who looks like a camel]5594-the thin fool who looks like a camel says that [I]344-kim am [the son of a Sahib]5595-the son of a sahib . '[344-kim] ' But how ? '[452-father victor] ' Oh , it is true . [I]452-father victor knew it since [my]452-father victor birth , but [he]861-the old man could only find it out by rending the amulet from [my]452-father victor neck and reading all the papers . [He]861-the old man thinks that once [a Sahib]5596-a sahib is always [a Sahib]5596-a sahib , and between the two of [them]5596-a sahib [they]5596-a sahib purpose to keep [me]452-father victor in [this Regiment]5598-this regiment or to send [me]452-father victor to [a madrissah a school]5599-a madrissah a school . It has happened before . [I]452-father victor have always avoided it . [The fat fool]5600-the fat fool is of one mind and the camel - like one of another . But that is no odds . [I]452-father victor may spend one night here and perhaps the next . It has happened before . Then [I]452-father victor will run away and return to [thee]5601-thee . '[452-father victor] ' But tell [them]5596-a sahib that [thou]5601-thee art [[my]344-kim chela]4863-my chela . [They]5596-a sahib laugh , and [they]5596-a sahib talk of [the police]1665-the police . '[452-father victor] ' What are [you]452-father victor saying ? '[471-bennett] asked [Mr Bennett]471-bennett . ' [Oah]485-oah . ' And if [you]452-father victor did know what [his]2150-a eurasian clerk in the canal department business was [you]452-father victor would not be in such a beastly hurry to interfere . '[452-father victor] ' What is it then ? '[452-father victor] said [Father Victor]452-father victor , not without feeling , as [he]452-father victor watched [the lama]868-the lama 's face . ' [I]452-father victor 'd give a good deal to be able to talk the vernacular . [A river]4546-a river that washes away sin ! And how long have [you]5608-we two been looking for it ? '[471-bennett] And [I]0-i am [a Follower of the Way]2172-a follower of the way , ' [he]868-the lama said bitterly . '[0-i] The sin is mine and the punishment is [mine]2173-mine . ' [He]0-i quoted an old , old Chinese text , backed it with another , and reinforced these with a third . '[0-i] [I]0-i stepped aside from the Way , [[my]0-i chela]4863-my chela . It was no fault of thine . [I]0-i delighted in the sight of life , [the new people]2177-the new people upon [the roads]2178-the roads , and in [thy]2174-thee joy at seeing these things . ' said [Father Victor]452-father victor , who , wise in the confessional , heard the pain in every sentence . '[0-i] [I]0-i see now that the sign of the Red Bull was a sign for [me]0-i as well as for [thee]2174-thee . All Desire is red - and evil . ' '[2181-the kulu woman] At least go back to [the Kulu woman]2181-the kulu woman , ' said [Kim]344-kim , '[2181-the kulu woman] otherwise [thou]2174-thee wilt be lost upon [the roads]2178-the roads . At least [I]0-i may , acquiring merit , wipe out past ill . ' '[0-i] Make [me]0-i [a Sahib]5596-a sahib - so [they]2183-they think . The day after tomorrow [I]0-i return . Do not grieve . ' [Kim]344-kim put two or three questions in English to [Father Victor]452-father victor , translating the replies to [the lama]868-the lama . Later on , [we]2196-we shall see . [Kimball]347-o'hara , [I]0-i suppose [you]347-o'hara 'd like to be [a soldier]1629-a soldier ? ' '[347-o'hara] [Gorah - log white - folk]2198-gorah - log white - folk . No - ah ! No - ah ! ' [Kim]344-kim shook [his]344-kim head violently . There was nothing in [his]344-kim composition to which drill and routine appealed . '[0-i] [I]0-i will not be [a soldier]1629-a soldier . ' '[0-i] [You]2192-you will be what [you]2192-you 're told to be , '[471-bennett] said [Bennett]471-bennett ; ' and [you]2192-you should be grateful that [we]2196-we 're[471-bennett] going to help [you]2192-you . ' [Kim]344-kim smiled compassionately . If [these men]2188-these men lay under the delusion that [he]344-kim would do anything that [he]344-kim did not fancy , so much the better . Another long silence followed . [Bennett]471-bennett fidgeted with impatience , and suggested calling [a sentry]5669-a sentry to evict [the fakir]5670-the fakir . '[2200-they] Do [they]2200-they give or sell learning among [the Sahibs]552-the sahibs ? Ask [them]2200-they , ' said [the lama]868-the lama , and [Kim]344-kim interpreted . '[2200-they] [They]2200-they say that money is paid to [the teacher]2201-the teacher - but that money [the Regiment]2063-the regiment will give ... What need ? It is only for a night . ' '[2200-they] And - the more money is paid the better learning is given ? ' [The lama]868-the lama disregarded [Kim]344-kim 's plans for an early flight . '[2200-they] It is no wrong to pay for learning . To help [the ignorant]2203-the ignorant to wisdom is always a merit . ' The rosary clicked furiously as an abacus . Then [he]868-the lama faced [[his]868-the lama oppressors]5673-his oppressors . '[2200-they] Ask [them]2200-they for how much money do [they]2200-they give a wise and suitable teaching ? And in [what city]2204-what city is that teaching given ? ' '[2063-the regiment] Well , ' said [Father Victor]452-father victor in English , when [Kim]344-kim had translated , '[2063-the regiment] that depends . [The Regiment]2063-the regiment would pay for [you]2206-you all the time [you]2206-you are at [the Military Orphanage]2207-the military orphanage ; or [you]2206-you might go on [the Punjab Masonic Orphanage]2208-the punjab masonic orphanage 's list not that [he]2209-he or [you]2206-you ' ud understand what that means ; but the best schooling [a boy]4870-a boy can get in [India]8-india is , of course , at [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's in Partibus at [Lucknow]121-lucknow . '[2206-you] This took some time to interpret , for [Bennett]471-bennett wished to cut it short . ' [He]471-bennett wants to know how much ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim placidly . ' Two or three hundred rupees a year . '[344-kim] [Father Victor]452-father victor was long past any sense of amazement . [Bennett]471-bennett , impatient , did not understand . ' [He]471-bennett says : " Write that name and the money upon a paper and give it [him]471-bennett . " And [he]471-bennett says [you]2206-you must write [your]2206-you name below , because [he]471-bennett is going to write a letter in some days to [you]2206-you . [He]471-bennett says [you]2206-you are [a good man]5663-a good man . [He]471-bennett says [the other man]5676-the other man is [a fool]5333-a fool . [He]471-bennett is going away . '[471-bennett] [The lama]868-the lama rose suddenly . ' [I]868-the lama follow [my]868-the lama Search , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama cried , and was gone . ' [He]868-the lama 'll run slap into [the sentries]5678-the sentries , '[452-father victor] cried [Father Victor]452-father victor , jumping up as [the lama]868-the lama stalked out ; ' but [I]868-the lama ca n't leave [the boy]986-the boy . '[868-the lama] [Kim]344-kim made swift motion to follow , but checked [himself]344-kim . There was no sound of challenge outside . [The lama]868-the lama had disappeared . [Kim]344-kim settled [himself]344-kim composedly on [[the Chaplain]2084-the chaplain 's cot]2214-the chaplain 's cot . At least [the lama]868-the lama had promised that [he]868-the lama would stay with [the Raiput woman from [Kulu]19-kulu]2216-the raiput woman from kulu , and the rest was of the smallest importance . It pleased [him]344-kim that [the two padres]2217-the two padres were so evidently excited . [They]2217-the two padres talked long in undertones , [Father Victor]452-father victor urging some scheme on [Mr Bennett]471-bennett , who seemed incredulous . All this was very new and fascinating , but [Kim]344-kim felt sleepy . [They]2217-the two padres called [men]752-men into [the tent]2146-the tent - one of [them]752-men certainly was [the Colonel]757-the colonel , as [[his]757-the colonel father]761-his father had prophesied - and [they]2217-the two padres asked [him]344-kim an infinity of questions , chiefly about [the woman who looked after [him]344-kim]787-the woman who looked after him , all of which [Kim]344-kim answered truthfully . [They]2217-the two padres did not seem to think [the woman]766-the woman [a good guardian]2224-a good guardian . After all , this was the newest of [his]344-kim experiences . Sooner or later , if [he]344-kim chose , [he]344-kim could escape into great , grey , formless [India]8-india , beyond [tents]2225-tents and [padres]2226-padres and [colonels]2227-colonels . Meantime , if [the Sahibs]5165-the sahibs were to be impressed , [he]344-kim would do [his]344-kim best to impress [them]5165-the sahibs . [He]344-kim too was [a white man]5508-a white man . After much talk that [he]344-kim could not comprehend , [they]2217-the two padres handed [him]344-kim over to [a sergeant]2230-a sergeant , who had strict instructions not to let [him]344-kim escape . [The Regiment]118-the regiment would go on to [Umballa]52-umballa , and [Kim]344-kim would be sent up , partly at the expense of [the Lodge]2231-the lodge and in part by subscription , to [a place called [Sanawar]122-sanawar]2232-a place called sanawar . ' It 's miraculous past all whooping , [Colonel]5680-colonel , '[452-father victor] said [Father Victor]452-father victor , when [he]452-father victor had talked without a break for ten minutes . ' [[His]344-kim Buddhist friend]5681-his buddhist friend has levanted after taking [my]452-father victor name and address . [I]452-father victor ca n't quite make out whether [he]5681-his buddhist friend 'll pay for [the boy]986-the boy 's education or whether [he]5681-his buddhist friend is preparing some sort of witchcraft on [his]5681-his buddhist friend own account . '[452-father victor] Then to [Kim]344-kim : ' [You]344-kim 'll live to be grateful to [[your]344-kim friend]5683-your friend [the Red Bull]426-the red bull yet . ' '[2233-a protestant] Certainly - most certainly , ' said [Bennett]471-bennett . '[2233-a protestant] But [you]344-kim will not go to [Sanawar]122-sanawar , ' said [Kim]344-kim . ' There was a shout of laughter from [the full tent]5685-the full tent . '[344-kim] When [you]344-kim know [[your]344-kim own Regiment]2239-your own regiment a trifle better [you]344-kim wo n't confuse the line of march with line of battle , [Kim]344-kim . It is a war of [eight thousand men]2240-eight thousand men , besides the guns . ' '[2240-eight thousand men] That 's explicit . D'you add prophecy to [your]344-kim other gifts ? Who says the age of miracles is gone by ? [I]2243-the drums think [I]2243-the drums 'll go to bed . [My]2243-the drums poor mind 's weakening . '[2243-the drums] At [the far end of [the camp]2037-the camp]2244-the far end of the camp , silent as a wild animal , an hour later sat [Kim]344-kim , newly washed all over , in a horrible stiff suit that rasped [his]344-kim arms and legs . ' [A most amazin '[344-kim] young bird]5687-a most amazin ' young bird , ' said [the sergeant]5688-the sergeant . '[0-i] Chapter 6 Now [I]0-i remember [comrades]2251-comrades - [Old playmates]2252-old playmates on [new seas]2253-new seas - Whenas [we]2254-we traded orpiment Among [the savages]2255-the savages . Song of [Diego Valdez]123-diego valdez . Very early in the morning the white tents came down and disappeared as [the Mavericks]474-the mavericks took [a side - road]2256-a side - road to [Umballa]52-umballa . [It]2256-a side - road did not skirt [the resting - place]5509-the resting - place , and [Kim]344-kim , trudging beside a baggage - cart under fire of comments from [[soldiers]5481-soldiers ' wives]5695-soldiers ' wives , was not so confident as overnight . [He]344-kim discovered that [he]344-kim was closely watched - [Father Victor]452-father victor on the one side , and [Mr Bennett]471-bennett on the other . In the forenoon the column checked . [A camel - orderly]5696-a camel - orderly handed [the Colonel]757-the colonel a letter . [He]757-the colonel read it , and spoke to [a Major]5698-a major . Half a mile in the rear , [Kim]344-kim heard a hoarse and joyful clamour rolling down on [him]344-kim through the thick dust . Then [someone]4966-someone beat [him]344-kim on the back , crying : '[344-kim] Tell [us]2259-us how [ye]344-kim knew , [[ye]344-kim little limb of [Satan]490-satan]2260-ye little limb of satan ? [[Father]452-father victor dear]2261-father dear , see if [ye]344-kim can make [him]2262-him tell . ' A pony ranged alongside , and [he]344-kim was hauled on to [the priest]1044-the priest 's saddlebow . ' '[2259-us] What is thatt ? ' said [Kim]344-kim , for '[2259-us] front ' and '[2259-us] entrain ' were newish words to [him]344-kim . ' '[0-i] [Ye]4602-my son did ; but , Powers o ' [Darkness]482-darkness , how did [ye]4602-my son know ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim 's eyes sparkled . ' For the rest of the day [Kim]344-kim found [himself]344-kim an object of distinguished consideration among [a few hundred white men]5702-a few hundred white men . The story of [his]344-kim appearance in [camp]2064-camp , the discovery of [his]344-kim parentage , and [his]344-kim prophecy , had lost nothing in the telling . [A big , shapeless white woman on a pile of bedding]5704-a big , shapeless white woman on a pile of bedding asked [him]344-kim mysteriously whether [he]344-kim thought [[her]5704-a big , shapeless white woman on a pile of bedding husband]1264-her husband would come back from the war . [Kim]344-kim reflected gravely , and said that [he]344-kim would , and [the woman]766-the woman gave [him]344-kim food . In many respects , this big procession that played music at intervals - [this crowd that talked and laughed so easily]5707-this crowd that talked and laughed so easily - resembled a festival in [Lahore city]11-lahore . So far , there was no sign of hard work , and [he]344-kim resolved to lend [the spectacle]5708-the spectacle [his]344-kim patronage . At evening there came out to meet [them]5702-a few hundred white men [bands of music]5709-bands of music , and played [the Mavericks]5710-the mavericks into [[camp]2064-camp near [Umballa railway station]5713-umballa railway station]5712-camp near umballa railway station . That was an interesting night . [Men of [other regiments]5715-other regiments]5714-men of other regiments came to visit [the Mavericks]474-the mavericks . [The Mavericks]474-the mavericks went visiting on [their]474-the mavericks own account . [[Their]474-the mavericks pickets]5716-their pickets hurried forth to bring [them]474-the mavericks back , met [pickets of [strange regiments on the same duty]5718-strange regiments on the same duty]5717-pickets of strange regiments on the same duty ; and , after a while , the bugles blew madly for more pickets with [officers]5487-officers to control the tumult . [The Mavericks]474-the mavericks had a reputation for liveliness to live up to . But [they]474-the mavericks fell in on [the platform]4808-the platform next morning in perfect shape and condition ; and [Kim]344-kim , left behind with [the sick]5721-the sick , [women]4700-women , and [boys]856-boys , found [himself]344-kim shouting farewells excitedly as [the trains]4565-the trains drew away . Life as [a Sahib]5596-a sahib was amusing so far ; but [he]344-kim touched it with a cautious hand . Then [they]474-the mavericks marched [him]344-kim back in charge of [a drummer - boy]5726-a drummer - boy to [empty , lime - washed barracks]5727-empty , lime - washed barracks , whose floors were covered with rubbish and string and paper , and whose ceilings gave back [his]344-kim lonely footfall . Native - fashion , [he]344-kim curled [himself]344-kim up on a stripped cot and went to sleep . [An angry man]5728-an angry man stumped down [the veranda]765-the veranda , woke [him]344-kim up , and said [he]5728-an angry man was [a schoolmaster]5730-a schoolmaster . This was enough for [Kim]344-kim , and [he]344-kim retired into [[his]344-kim shell]5731-his shell . [He]344-kim could just puzzle out the various English Police notices in [Lahore city]939-lahore city , because they affected [his]344-kim comfort ; and among [the many guests of [the woman]766-the woman who looked after [him]344-kim]5733-the many guests of the woman who looked after him had been [a queer German who painted scenery for [the Parsee travelling theatre]5736-the parsee travelling theatre]5735-a queer german who painted scenery for the parsee travelling theatre . [He]344-kim told [Kim]344-kim that [he]344-kim had been '[344-kim] on the barricades in ' Forty - eight , '[344-kim] and therefore - at least that was how it struck [Kim]344-kim - [he]344-kim would teach [the boy]986-the boy to write in return for food . [Kim]344-kim had been kicked as far as single letters , but did not think well of them . ' [I]344-kim do not know anything . Go away ! '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , scenting evil . Hereupon [the man]4471-the man caught [him]344-kim by the ear , dragged [him]344-kim to [a room in a far - off wing where [a dozen drummer - boys]2282-a dozen drummer - boys were sitting on forms]2281-a room in a far - off wing where a dozen drummer - boys were sitting on forms , and told [him]344-kim to be still if [he]344-kim could do nothing else . This [he]344-kim managed very successfully . [The man]4471-the man explained something or other with white lines on a black board for at least half an hour , and [Kim]344-kim continued [his]344-kim interrupted nap . [He]344-kim much disapproved of the present aspect of affairs , for this was the very school and discipline [he]344-kim had spent two - thirds of [his]344-kim young life in avoiding . Suddenly a beautiful idea occurred to [him]344-kim , and [he]344-kim wondered that [he]344-kim had not thought of it before . [The man]4471-the man dismissed [them]2285-them , and first to spring through [the veranda]765-the veranda into the open sunshine was [Kim]344-kim . ' '[344-kim] Ere , [you]344-kim ! ' [Alt]491-alt ! Stop ! '[4471-the man] said a high voice at [his]344-kim heels . ' [I]4471-the man 've got to look after [you]344-kim . [My]4471-the man orders are not to let [you]344-kim out of [my]4471-the man sight . Where are [you]344-kim goin' ? ' To [the bazar]729-the bazar - to get sweets - for [you]344-kim , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , after thought . ' Well , [the bazar]729-the bazar 's out o '[344-kim] bounds . ' This did not impress [Kim]344-kim as much as the knowledge that [his]344-kim raiment would tire [him]344-kim out if [he]344-kim tried to run . '[5756-the writer] [Kim]344-kim waited for this shaft to sink into [the letter - writer]5755-the letter - writer 's heart , cleared [his]344-kim throat , and continued : ' [A priest]820-a priest clothed [me]344-kim and gave [me]344-kim a new name ... [One priest]5777-one priest , however , was [a fool]5333-a fool . The clothes are very heavy , but [I]344-kim am [a Sahib]5596-a sahib and [my]344-kim heart is heavy too . [They]820-a priest send [me]344-kim to [a school]2195-a school and beat [me]344-kim . [I]344-kim do not like the air and water here . Come then and help [me]344-kim , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , or send [me]344-kim some money , for [I]344-kim have not sufficient to pay [the writer who writes this]5781-the writer who writes this . '[344-kim] ' " Who writes this . " It is [my]344-kim own fault that [I]344-kim was tricked . [Thou]5782-thou art as clever as [Husain Bux]493-husain bux that forged the Treasury stamps at [Nucklao]127-nucklao . But what a tale ! What a tale ! Is it true by any chance ? '[344-kim] ' [It]5783-it does not profit to tell lies to [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . It is better to help [[his]383-mahbub friends]5784-his friends by lending [them]5784-his friends a stamp . When the money comes [I]5756-the writer will repay . '[5756-the writer] [The writer]5756-the writer grunted doubtfully , but took a stamp out of [his]5756-the writer desk , sealed the letter , handed it over to [Kim]344-kim , and departed . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's was a name of power in [Umballa]52-umballa . ' That is the way to win a good account with [the Gods]1244-the gods , '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim shouted after [him]5756-the writer . ' Pay [me]4471-the man twice over when the money comes , '[4471-the man] [the man]4471-the man cried over [his]4471-the man shoulder . ' What was [you]344-kim bukkin '[4471-the man] to [that nigger]2323-that nigger about ? ' said [the drummer - boy]5786-the drummer - boy when [Kim]344-kim returned to [the veranda]765-the veranda . '[2323-that nigger] [I]0-i was watch - in ' [you]344-kim . '[2323-that nigger] ' [I]2323-that nigger was only talkin '[2323-that nigger] to [him]2323-that nigger . ' '[2323-that nigger] [You]0-i talk the same as [a nigger]2324-a nigger , do n't [you]0-i ? ' '[0-i] No - ah ! No - ah ! [I]0-i onlee speak a little . What shall [we]2325-we do now ? ' '[2324-a nigger] The bugles'll go for dinner in arf a minute . [[My]0-i Gawd]2326-my gawd ! [I]0-i wish [I]0-i 'd gone up to [the Front]2327-the front with [the Regiment]2063-the regiment . It 's awful doin' nothin' but school down ' ere . Do n't [you]0-i '[2324-a nigger] ate it ? ' '[2324-a nigger] Oah yess ! ' [I]2324-a nigger 'd run away if [I]2324-a nigger knew where to go to , but , as [the men]5050-the men say , in this bloomin '[2324-a nigger] Injia [you]0-i 're only [a prisoner at large]5789-a prisoner at large . [You]0-i ca n't desert without bein '[0-i] took back at once . [I]0-i 'm fair sick of it . '[2324-a nigger] ' [You]0-i have been in [Be - England]128-be - england ? '[2324-a nigger] ' W'y , [I]4610-my mother only come out last troopin '[4610-my mother] season with [[my]0-i mother]4610-my mother . [I]0-i should think [I]0-i ' ave been in [England]114-england . What [a ignorant little beggar]5790-a ignorant little beggar [you]0-i are ! [You]0-i was brought up in the gutter , was n't [you]0-i ? '[2324-a nigger] ' Oah yess . Tell [me]0-i something about [England]114-england . [[My]0-i father]4451-my father [he]4451-my father came from [there]4784-there . '[0-i] Though [he]0-i would not say so , [Kim]344-kim of course disbelieved every word [the drummer - boy]5786-the drummer - boy spoke about [the [Liverpool]129-liverpool suburb which was [[his]0-i England]2332-his england]2331-the liverpool suburb which was his england . It passed the heavy time till dinner - a most unappetizing meal served to [the boys]4472-the boys and [a few invalids]2334-a few invalids in [a corner of [a barrack - room]2336-a barrack - room]2335-a corner of a barrack - room . But that [he]344-kim had written to [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , [Kim]344-kim would have been almost depressed . The indifference of [native crowds]2337-native crowds [he]344-kim was used to ; but this strong loneliness among [white men]5505-white men preyed on [him]344-kim . [He]344-kim was grateful when , in the course of the afternoon , [a big soldier]2339-a big soldier took [him]344-kim over to [Father Victor]452-father victor , who lived in another wing across [another dusty parade - ground]2340-another dusty parade - ground . [The priest]1044-the priest was reading an English letter written in purple ink . [He]1044-the priest looked at [Kim]344-kim more curiously than ever . ' An '[1044-the priest] how do [you]344-kim like it , [[my]0-i son]4602-my son , as far as [you]344-kim 've gone ? Not much , eh ? It must be hard - very hard on a wild animal . Listen now . " Now what in [the world]759-the world does that mean ? " Now , is that ravin '[496-sobrao satai] lunacy or a business proposition ? [I]0-i ask [you]344-kim , because [I]0-i 'm fairly at [my]0-i wits '[0-i] end . ' '[344-kim] Of course . If [he]2352-he says so ! ' [The priest]1044-the priest whistled ; then [he]1044-the priest addressed [Kim]344-kim as [an equal]5085-an equal . '[0-i] [I]0-i do n't believe it ; but [we]2353-we 'll see . [You]344-kim were goin' off today to [the Military Orphanage at [Sanawar]122-sanawar]2354-the military orphanage at sanawar , where [the Regiment]2063-the regiment would keep [you]344-kim till [you]344-kim were old enough to enlist . On the other hand , if [ye]344-kim go to [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's ye'll get a better education an - an can have the religion . [D'ye]500-d'ye see [my]0-i dilemma ? [Kim]344-kim saw nothing save a vision of [the lama]868-the lama going south in [a train]1185-a train with none to beg for [him]868-the lama . ' Like [most people]5802-most people , [I]868-the lama 'm[868-the lama] going to temporize . If [[your]344-kim friend]5683-your friend sends the money from [Benares]37-benares - Powers of [Darkness]482-darkness below , where 's [a street- beggar]2359-a street- beggar to raise three hundred rupees ? - [ye'll]344-kim go down to [Lucknow]121-lucknow and [I]0-i 'll pay [your]344-kim fare , because [I]0-i ca n't touch the subscription- money if [I]0-i intend , as [I]0-i do , to make [ye]344-kim [a Catholic]2360-a catholic . An '[2363-me] [they]2363-me sent [Bennett]471-bennett to [the Front]2327-the front an ' left [me]2363-me behind . [Bennett]471-bennett ca n't expect everything . '[2363-me] ' Oah yess , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim vaguely . [The priest]1044-the priest leaned forward . ' [I]1044-the priest 'd give a month 's pay to find what 's goin' on inside that little round head of yours . '[1044-the priest] ' There is nothing , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , and scratched it . [He]344-kim was wondering whether [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub would send [him]868-the lama as much as a whole rupee . Then [he]868-the lama could pay [the letter - writer]5755-the letter - writer and write letters to [the lama at [Benares]37-benares]2367-the lama at benares . Perhaps [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub would visit [him]868-the lama next time [he]868-the lama came south with horses . Surely [he]868-the lama must know that [Kim]344-kim 's delivery of the letter to [the officer at [Umballa]52-umballa]2368-the officer at umballa had caused the great war which [the men]5050-the men and [boys]856-boys had discussed so loudly over the barrack dinner - tables . But if [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub did not know this , it would be very unsafe to tell [him]868-the lama so . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub was hard upon [boys]856-boys who knew , or thought [they]856-boys knew , too much . ' Well , till [I]452-father victor get further news '[452-father victor] - [Father Victor]452-father victor 's voice interrupted the reverie . ' [Ye]868-the lama can run along now and play with [the other boys]5805-the other boys . [They]5805-the other boys 'll teach [ye]868-the lama something - but [I]452-father victor do n't think ye'll like it . '[452-father victor] The day dragged to its weary end . When [he]868-the lama wished to sleep [he]868-the lama was instructed how to fold up [his]868-the lama clothes and set out [his]868-the lama boots ; [the other boys]5805-the other boys deriding . [Bugles]501-bugles waked [him]868-the lama in the dawn ; [the schoolmaster]2373-the schoolmaster caught [him]868-the lama after breakfast , thrust a page of meaningless characters under [his]868-the lama nose , gave [them]856-boys senseless names and whacked [him]868-the lama without reason . [Kim]344-kim meditated poisoning [him]868-the lama with opium borrowed from [a barrack - sweeper]2374-a barrack - sweeper , but reflected that , as [they]2375-they all ate at one table in public this was peculiarly revolting to [Kim]344-kim , who preferred to turn [his]344-kim back on [the world]759-the world at meals , the stroke might be dangerous . Then [he]344-kim attempted running off to [the village]5076-the village where [the priest]1044-the priest had tried to drug [the lama]868-the lama - [[the village]5076-the village where [the old soldier]5092-the old soldier lived]2381-the village where the old soldier lived . [But far - seeing sentries at every exit]2383-but far - seeing sentries at every exit headed back [the little scarlet figure]2384-the little scarlet figure . Trousers and jacket crippled body and mind alike so [he]344-kim abandoned the project and fell back , Oriental - fashion , on time and chance . Three days of torment passed in [the big , echoing white rooms]2385-the big , echoing white rooms . [He]344-kim walked out of afternoons under escort of [the drummer - boy]5786-the drummer - boy , and all [he]344-kim heard from [[his]344-kim companions]4468-his companions were the few useless words which seemed to make two - thirds of [the white man]1425-the white man 's abuse . [Kim]344-kim knew and despised [them]4468-his companions all long ago . [The boy]986-the boy resented [his]344-kim silence and lack of interest by beating [him]344-kim , as was only natural . [He]344-kim did not care for any of the bazars which were in bounds . [He]344-kim styled [all natives]1984-all natives ' [niggers]5806-niggers '[344-kim] ; yet [servants]4922-servants and [sweepers]2392-sweepers called [him]344-kim abominable names to [his]344-kim face , and , misled by [their]4468-his companions deferential attitude , [he]344-kim never understood . This somewhat consoled [Kim]344-kim for the beatings . On the morning of the fourth day a judgement overtook [that drummer]2393-that drummer . [They]2394-they had gone out together towards [Umballa racecourse]52-umballa . [He]344-kim returned alone , weeping , with news that [young O'Hara]347-o'hara , to whom [he]344-kim had been doing nothing in particular , had hailed [a scarlet - bearded nigger on horseback]2395-a scarlet - bearded nigger on horseback ; that [the nigger]2396-the nigger had then and there laid into [him]344-kim with a peculiarly adhesive quirt , picked up [young O'Hara]347-o'hara , and borne [him]347-o'hara off at full gallop . These tidings came to [Father Victor]452-father victor , and [he]452-father victor drew down [his]452-father victor long upper lip . [He]452-father victor was already sufficiently startled by a letter from [the Temple of [the Tirthankars]498-the tirthankars at [Benares]37-benares]2397-the temple of the tirthankars at benares , enclosing [a native banker]2398-a native banker 's note of hand for three hundred rupees , and an amazing prayer to ' [Almighty God]499-god '[868-the lama] . [The lama]868-the lama would have been more annoyed than [the priest]1044-the priest had [he]452-father victor known how [the bazar letter- writer]2401-the bazar letter- writer had translated [his]868-the lama phrase ' to acquire merit . '[452-father victor] ' Powers of Darkness below ! '[452-father victor] [Father Victor]452-father victor fumbled with the note . ' An '[452-father victor] now [he]347-o'hara 's off with another of [[his]347-o'hara peep - o'-day friends]2402-his peep - o'-day friends . [I]0-i do n't know whether it will be a greater relief to [me]0-i to get [him]347-o'hara back or to have [him]347-o'hara lost . [He]347-o'hara 's beyond [my]0-i comprehension . How [the Divil]2403-the divil - yes , [he]347-o'hara 's [the man [I]0-i mean]2404-the man i mean -can [a street - beggar]2405-a street - beggar raise money to educate [white boys]2406-white boys ? ' Three miles off , on [Umballa racecourse]5807-umballa racecourse , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , reining a grey Kabuli stallion with [Kim]344-kim in front of [him]0-i , was saying : '[347-o'hara] But , [Little Friend of all [the World]759-the world]4455-little friend of all the world , there is [my]0-i honour and reputation to be considered . [All the officer - Sahibs]2409-all the officer - sahibs in [all the regiments]2410-all the regiments , and all [Umballa]52-umballa , know [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . [Men]752-men saw [me]0-i pick [thee]2412-thee up and chastise [that boy]2413-that boy . [We]2414-we are seen now from far across [this plain]2415-this plain . How can [I]0-i take [thee]2412-thee away , or account for [thy]2412-thee disappearing if [I]0-i set [thee]2412-thee down and let [thee]2412-thee run off into the crops ? [They]752-men would put [me]0-i in [jail]2416-jail . Be patient . Once [a Sahib]5596-a sahib , always [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . When [thou]2412-thee art [a man]750-a man - who knows ? - [thou]2412-thee wilt be grateful to [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . ' '[383-mahbub] Take [me]0-i beyond [[their]752-men sentries]2420-their sentries where [I]0-i can change this red . Give [me]0-i money and [I]0-i will go to [Benares]37-benares and be with [[my]0-i lama]2421-my lama again . [I]0-i do not want to be [a Sahib]5596-a sahib , and remember [I]0-i did deliver that message . ' [The stallion]4687-the stallion bounded wildly . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub had incautiously driven home the sharp - edged stirrup . [He]383-mahbub was not [the new sort of fluent horse - dealer who wears English boots and spurs]5809-the new sort of fluent horse - dealer who wears english boots and spurs . [Kim]344-kim drew [his]344-kim own conclusions from that betrayal . '[0-i] That was a small matter . It lay on [the straight road to [Benares]37-benares]2423-the straight road to benares . [I]0-i and [the Sahib]4485-the sahib have by this time forgotten it . [I]0-i send so many letters and messages to [men who ask questions about horses]2425-men who ask questions about horses , [I]0-i can not well remember one from the other . Was it some matter of a bay mare that [Peters Sahib]502-peters sahib wished the pedigree of ? ' [Kim]344-kim saw the trap at once . If [he]0-i had said '[502-peters sahib] bay mare ' [Mahbub]383-mahbub would have known by [his]0-i very readiness to fall in with the amendment that [the boy]986-the boy suspected something . [Kim]344-kim replied therefore : '[2426-bay mare] [Bay mare]2426-bay mare . No . [I]0-i do not forget [my]0-i messages thus . It was a white stallion . ' '[2428-thou] Ay , so it was . [A white Arab stallion]2427-a white arab stallion . But [thou]2428-thou didst write " bay mare " to [me]0-i . ' '[2428-thou] Who cares to tell truth to [a letter - writer]2429-a letter - writer ? ' [Kim]344-kim answered , feeling [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's palm on [his]344-kim heart . '[2428-thou] Hi ! [Mahbub]383-mahbub , [[you]383-mahbub old villain]2430-you old villain , pull up ! ' cried a voice , and [an Englishman]1107-an englishman raced alongside on a little polo - pony . '[0-i] [I]0-i 've been chasing [you]383-mahbub half over [the country]806-the country . [That Kabuli of yours]2432-that kabuli of yours can go . For sale , [I]0-i suppose ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i have some young stuff coming on made by [Heaven]62-heaven for the delicate and difficult polo - game . [He]0-i has no equal . [He]0-i - ' '[0-i] Plays polo and waits at table . Yes . [We]2433-we know all that . What the deuce have [you]0-i got [there]4784-there ? ' '[2435-a. boy] [A. boy]2435-a. boy , ' said [Mahbub]383-mahbub gravely . '[2435-a. boy] [He]2435-a. boy was being beaten by [another boy]2436-another boy . [[His]2435-a. boy father]761-his father was once [a white soldier]2438-a white soldier in the big war . [The boy]986-the boy was [a child in [Lahore city]939-lahore city]2440-a child in lahore city . [He]986-the boy played with [my]0-i horses when [he]986-the boy was [a babe]1651-a babe . Now [I]0-i think [they]2443-they will make [him]986-the boy [a soldier]1629-a soldier . [He]986-the boy has been newly caught by [[his]986-the boy father]761-his father 's Regiment that went up to the war last week . But [I]0-i do not think [he]986-the boy wants to be [a soldier]1629-a soldier . [I]0-i take [him]986-the boy for a ride . Tell [me]0-i where [[thy]2447-thy barracks]2448-thy barracks are and [I]0-i will set [thee]986-the boy there . ' '[0-i] Let [me]0-i go . [I]0-i can find [the barracks]2301-the barracks alone . ' '[0-i] And if [thou]986-the boy runnest away who will say it is not [my]0-i fault ? ' '[986-the boy] [He]986-the boy 'll run back to [his]986-the boy dinner . Where has [he]986-the boy to run to ? ' [the Englishman]4653-the englishman asked . '[986-the boy] [He]986-the boy was born in [the land]4998-the land . [He]986-the boy has [friends]2013-friends . [He]986-the boy goes where [he]986-the boy chooses . [He]986-the boy is [a chabuk sawai a sharp chap]2452-a chabuk sawai a sharp chap . It needs only to change [his]986-the boy clothing , and in a twinkling [he]986-the boy would be [a low - caste Hindu boy]2453-a low - caste hindu boy . ' '[2454-the deuce] [The deuce]2454-the deuce [he]986-the boy would ! ' [The Englishman]4653-the englishman looked critically at [the boy]986-the boy as [Mahbub]383-mahbub headed towards [the barracks]2301-the barracks . [Kim]344-kim ground [his]344-kim teeth . [Mahbub]383-mahbub was mocking [him]344-kim , as [faithless Afghans]504-faithless afghans will ; for [he]383-mahbub went on : '[2454-the deuce] [They]2455-they will send [him]986-the boy to [a school]2195-a school and put heavy boots on [his]986-the boy feet and swaddle [him]986-the boy in these clothes . Then [he]986-the boy will forget all [he]986-the boy knows . Now , which of [the barracks]2301-the barracks is thine ? ' [Kim]344-kim pointed - [he]344-kim could not speak - to [Father Victor]452-father victor 's wing , all staring white near by . '[2459-a good orderly] Perhaps [he]986-the boy will make [a good soldier]2458-a good soldier , ' said [Mahbub]383-mahbub reflectively . '[986-the boy] [He]986-the boy will make [a good orderly]2459-a good orderly at least . [I]0-i sent [him]986-the boy to deliver a message once from [Lahore]11-lahore . A message concerning the pedigree of a white stallion . ' Here was deadly insult on deadlier injury - and [the Sahib to whom [he]0-i had so craftily given that war - waking letter]502-peters sahib heard it all . [Kim]344-kim beheld [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub frying in flame for [his]383-mahbub treachery , but for [himself]344-kim [he]344-kim saw one long grey vista of [barracks]5816-barracks , [schools]5817-schools , and [barracks]5816-barracks again . [He]344-kim gazed imploringly at the clear - cut face in which there was no glimmer of recognition ; but even at this extremity it never occurred to [him]344-kim to throw [himself]344-kim on [the white man]1425-the white man 's mercy or to denounce [the Afghan]506-the afghan . And [Mahbub]383-mahbub stared deliberately at [the Englishman]4653-the englishman , who stared as deliberately at [Kim]344-kim , quivering and tongue - tied . '[0-i] [My]0-i horse is well trained , ' said [the dealer]5821-the dealer . '[0-i] [Others]1126-others would have kicked , [Sahib]502-peters sahib . ' '[502-peters sahib] Ah , ' said [the Englishman]4653-the englishman at last , rubbing [his]4653-the englishman pony 's damp withers with [his]4653-the englishman whip - butt . '[502-peters sahib] Who makes [the boy]986-the boy [a soldier]1629-a soldier ? ' '[986-the boy] [He]986-the boy says [the Regiment that found [him]986-the boy]2463-the regiment that found him , and especially [the Padre- sahib of [that regiment]4782-that regiment]2464-the padre- sahib of that regiment . ' There is [the Padre]5823-the padre ! '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim choked as bare - headed [Father Victor]452-father victor sailed down upon [them]2466-them from [the veranda]765-the veranda . ' Powers O '[452-father victor] Darkness below , [O'Hara]347-o'hara ! How many more [mixed friends]2468-mixed friends do [you]347-o'hara keep in [Asia]66-asia ? ' [he]452-father victor cried , as [Kim]344-kim slid down and stood helplessly before [him]452-father victor .
