'[2547-some sahib who knows the fat priest in the barracks] Oh , that is [some Sahib who knows [the fat priest in [the barracks]2301-the barracks]2548-the fat priest in the barracks]2547-some sahib who knows the fat priest in the barracks . [He]2547-some sahib who knows the fat priest in the barracks is beckoning [me]0-i . ' '[2547-some sahib who knows the fat priest in the barracks] What dost [thou]2550-thou ? ' said [the Colonel]757-the colonel , when [Kim]344-kim trotted up . '[0-i] [I]0-i - [I]0-i am not running away . [I]0-i send a letter to [my]0-i Holy One at [Benares]37-benares . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i had not thought of that . Hast [thou]2550-thou said that [I]0-i take [thee]2550-thou to [Lucknow]121-lucknow ? ' '[2550-thou] Nay , [I]0-i have not . Read the letter , if there be a doubt . ' '[2550-thou] Then why hast [thou]2550-thou left out [my]0-i name in writing to [that Holy One]2551-that holy one ? ' [The Colonel]757-the colonel smiled a queer smile . [Kim]344-kim took [his]344-kim courage in both hands . '[2550-thou] It was said once to [me]0-i that it is inexpedient to write the names of [strangers concerned]2552-strangers concerned in any matter , because by the naming of names many good plans are brought to confusion . ' '[2550-thou] [Thou]2550-thou hast been well taught , ' [the Colonel]757-the colonel replied , and [Kim]344-kim flushed . '[2550-thou] [I]0-i have left [my]0-i cheroot - case in [the Padre 's veranda]2553-the padre 's veranda . Bring it to [[my]0-i house]2554-my house this even . ' '[2550-thou] Where is [the house]797-the house ? ' said [Kim]344-kim . [His]344-kim quick wit told [him]344-kim that [he]344-kim was being tested in some fashion or another , and [he]344-kim stood on guard . '[1036-anyone] Ask [anyone]1036-anyone in [the big bazar]2557-the big bazar . ' [The Colonel]757-the colonel walked on . '[2558-he] [He]2558-he has forgotten [his]2558-he cheroot - case , ' said [Kim]344-kim , returning . '[2558-he] [I]0-i must bring it to [him]2558-he this evening . That is all [my]0-i letter except , thrice over , Come to [me]0-i ! Come to [me]0-i ! Come to [me]0-i ! Now [I]0-i will pay for a stamp and put it in the post . [He]2558-he rose to go , and as an afterthought asked : ' Who is [that angry - faced Sahib who lost the cheroot - case]5901-that angry - faced sahib who lost the cheroot - case ? '[2558-he] ' Oh , [he]2558-he is only [Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton - [a very foolish Sahib]5902-a very foolish sahib , who is [a Colonel Sahib without [a regiment]5904-a regiment]5903-a colonel sahib without a regiment . '[2558-he] ' What is [his]2558-he business ? '[2558-he] ' [God]499-god knows . [He]2558-he is always buying horses which [he]2558-he can not ride , and asking riddles about the works of [God]499-god - such as plants and stones and the customs of [people]4650-people . [The dealers]5906-the dealers call [him]2558-he [the father of fools]5907-the father of fools , because [he]2558-he is so easily cheated about a horse . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub says [he]2558-he is madder than [most other Sahibs]5908-most other sahibs . '[2558-he] ' Oh ! '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , and departed . [His]344-kim training had given [him]344-kim some small knowledge of character , and [he]344-kim argued that [fools]2559-fools are not given information which leads to calling out [eight thousand men besides guns]2560-eight thousand men besides guns . [The Commander - in - Chief of [all India]1253-all india]2561-the commander - in - chief of all india does not talk , as [Kim]344-kim had heard [him]2561-the commander - in - chief of all india talk , to [fools]2559-fools . Nor would [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's tone have changed , as it did every time [he]383-mahbub mentioned [the Colonel]757-the colonel 's name , if [the Colonel]757-the colonel had been [a fool]5333-a fool . Consequently - and this set [Kim]344-kim to skipping - there was a mystery somewhere , and [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub probably spied for [the Colonel]757-the colonel much as [Kim]344-kim had spied for [Mahbub]383-mahbub . And , like [the horse - dealer]2470-the horse - dealer , [the Colonel]757-the colonel evidently respected people who did not show [themselves]2570-themselves to be too clever . [He]757-the colonel rejoiced that [he]757-the colonel had not betrayed [his]757-the colonel knowledge of [[the Colonel]757-the colonel 's house]2572-the colonel 's house ; and when , on [his]757-the colonel return to [barracks]5816-barracks , [he]757-the colonel discovered that no cheroot - case had been left behind , [he]757-the colonel beamed with delight . Here was [a man after [his]2574-a man after his own heart own heart]2574-a man after his own heart - [a tortuous and indirect person playing a hidden game]2575-a tortuous and indirect person playing a hidden game . Well , if [he]2574-a man after his own heart could be [a fool]5333-a fool , so could [Kim]344-kim . [He]2574-a man after his own heart showed nothing of [his]2574-a man after his own heart mind when [Father Victor]452-father victor , for three long mornings , discoursed to [him]2574-a man after his own heart of an entirely new set of Gods and Godlings - notably of [a Goddess called [Mary]516-mary , who , [he]452-father victor gathered , was one with [Bibi Miriam of Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's theology]2577-a goddess called mary , who , he gathered , was one with bibi miriam of mahbub ali 's theology . [He]2574-a man after his own heart betrayed no emotion when , after the lecture , [Father Victor]452-father victor dragged [him]2574-a man after his own heart from [shop]2578-shop to shop buying articles of outfit , nor when envious [drummer- boys]2579-drummer- boys kicked [him]2574-a man after his own heart because [he]2574-a man after his own heart was going to [a superior school]2580-a superior school did [he]2574-a man after his own heart complain , but awaited the play of circumstances with [an interested soul]2581-an interested soul . [Father Victor]452-father victor , [good man]2582-good man , took [him]2574-a man after his own heart to [the station]4741-the station , put [him]2574-a man after his own heart into [an empty second - class next to [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton 's first]2584-an empty second - class next to colonel creighton 's first , and bade [him]2574-a man after his own heart farewell with genuine feeling . ' [They]5909-they 'll make [a man o '[2574-a man after his own heart] [you]2574-a man after his own heart]5910-a man o ' you , [O'Hara]347-o'hara , at [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier - [a white man]5508-a white man , an ' , [I]5508-a white man hope , [a good man]5663-a good man . [They]5909-they know all about [your]2574-a man after his own heart comin '[5508-a white man] , an ' [the Colonel]757-the colonel will see that ye're not lost or mislaid anywhere on [the road]4566-the road . [I]2586-a cath'lic 've given [you]2574-a man after his own heart a notion of religious matters , - at least [I]2586-a cath'lic hope so , - and [you]2574-a man after his own heart 'll remember , when [they]5909-they ask [you]2574-a man after his own heart [your]2574-a man after his own heart religion , that [you]2574-a man after his own heart 're[2586-a cath'lic] [a Cath'lic]2586-a cath'lic . Better say Roman Cath'lic , tho ' [I]5508-a white man 'm[5508-a white man] not fond of the word . ' [Kim]344-kim lit a rank cigarette - [he]344-kim had been careful to buy a stock in [the bazar]729-the bazar - and lay down to think . [This solitary passage]5915-this solitary passage was very different from that joyful down - journey in the third - class with [the lama]868-the lama . '[5508-a white man] [Sahibs]552-the sahibs get little pleasure of travel , ' [he]344-kim reflected . '[444-hai] [Hai mai]444-hai ! [I]0-i go from [one place]2587-one place to another as it might be a kickball . It is [[my]0-i Kismet]2588-my kismet . [No man]5156-no man can escape [his]5156-no man Kismet . But [I]0-i am to pray to [Bibi Miriam]383-mahbub , and [I]0-i am [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . ' [He]344-kim looked at [his]344-kim boots ruefully . '[5596-a sahib] No ; [I]0-i am [Kim]344-kim . This is [the great world]2591-the great world , and [I]0-i am only [Kim]344-kim . Who is [Kim]344-kim ? ' [He]344-kim considered [his]344-kim own identity , a thing [he]344-kim had never done before , till [his]344-kim head swam . [He]344-kim was [one insignificant person in all this roaring whirl of [India]8-india]5917-one insignificant person in all this roaring whirl of india , going southward to [he]344-kim knew not what fate . Presently [the Colonel]757-the colonel sent for [him]344-kim , and talked for a long time . So far as [Kim]344-kim could gather , [he]344-kim was to be diligent and enter the Survey of [India]8-india as [a chain - man]5919-a chain - man . If [he]344-kim were very good , and passed the proper examinations , [he]344-kim would be earning thirty rupees a month at seventeen years old , and [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton would see that [he]344-kim found suitable employment . [Kim]344-kim pretended at first to understand perhaps one word in three of this talk . Then [the Colonel]757-the colonel , seeing [his]344-kim mistake , turned to fluent and picturesque Urdu and [Kim]344-kim was contented . [No man]5156-no man could be [a fool who knew the language so intimately , who moved so gently and silently , and whose eyes were so different from the dull fat eyes of other Sahibs]5922-a fool who knew the language so intimately , who moved so gently and silently , and whose eyes were so different from the dull fat eyes of other sahibs . '[344-kim] Yes , and [thou]2592-thou must learn how to make pictures of [roads]2593-roads and mountains and [rivers]2594-rivers , to carry these pictures in thine eye till a suitable time comes to set them upon paper . Perhaps some day , when [thou]2592-thou art [a chain - man]5919-a chain - man , [I]0-i may say to [thee]2592-thou when [we]2596-we are working together : " Go across [those hills]2597-those hills and see what lies beyond . " Then [one]1164-one will say : " There are [bad people living in [those hills]2597-those hills who will slay [the chain - man]2601-the chain - man if [he]2601-the chain - man be seen to look like [a Sahib]5596-a sahib]2599-bad people living in those hills who will slay the chain - man if he be seen to look like a sahib . " What then ? ' [Kim]344-kim thought . Would it be safe to return [the Colonel]393-colonel creighton 's lead ? '[0-i] [I]0-i would tell what [that other man]2603-that other man had said . ' '[2603-that other man] But if [I]0-i answered : " [I]0-i will give [thee]2592-thou a hundred rupees for knowledge of what is behind [those hills]2597-those hills - for a picture of [a river]4546-a river and a little news of what [the people]4594-the people say in [the villages]2607-the villages there " ? ' '[4594-the people] How can [I]0-i tell ? [I]0-i am only [a boy]4870-a boy . Wait till [I]0-i am [a man]750-a man . ' Then , seeing [the Colonel]757-the colonel 's brow clouded , [he]0-i went on : '[0-i] But [I]0-i think [I]0-i should in a few days earn the hundred rupees . ' '[0-i] By [what road]2610-what road ? ' [Kim]344-kim shook [his]344-kim head resolutely . '[0-i] If [I]0-i said how [I]0-i would earn [them]2611-them , [another man]2612-another man might hear and forestall [me]0-i . It is not good to sell knowledge for nothing . ' '[0-i] Tell now . ' [The Colonel]757-the colonel held up a rupee . [Kim]344-kim 's hand half reached towards it , and dropped . '[0-i] Nay , [Sahib]393-colonel creighton ; nay . [I]0-i know the price that will be paid for the answer , but [I]0-i do not know why the question is asked . ' '[0-i] Take it for a gift , then , ' said [Creighton]393-colonel creighton , tossing it over . '[0-i] There is a good spirit in [thee]2613-thee . Do not let it be blunted at [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's . There are [many boys there who despise [the black men]2615-the black men]2614-many boys there who despise the black men . ' '[2614-many boys there who despise the black men] [[Their]2614-many boys there who despise the black men mothers]2616-their mothers were [bazar - women]2617-bazar - women , ' said [Kim]344-kim . [He]344-kim knew well there is no hatred like that of [the half - caste for [[his]344-kim brother - in - law]5926-his brother - in - law]5925-the half - caste for his brother - in - law . '[2617-bazar - women] True ; but [thou]2618-thou art [a Sahib]5596-a sahib and [the son of a Sahib]5595-the son of a sahib . Therefore , do not at any time be led to contemn [the black men]2615-the black men . [I]0-i have known [boys newly entered into the service of [the Government]852-the government who feigned not to understand the talk or the customs of [black men]2624-black men]2622-boys newly entered into the service of the government who feigned not to understand the talk or the customs of black men . [Their]2622-boys newly entered into the service of the government who feigned not to understand the talk or the customs of black men pay was cut for ignorance . There is no sin so great as ignorance . Remember this . ' Several times in the course of the long twenty - four hours '[757-the colonel] run south did [the Colonel]757-the colonel send for [Kim]344-kim , always developing this latter text . ' [We]5927-we be all on one lead - rope , then , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim at last , ' [the Colonel]757-the colonel , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , and [I]344-kim - when [I]344-kim become [a chain - man]5919-a chain - man . [He]868-the lama will use [me]344-kim as [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub employed [me]344-kim , [I]344-kim think . That is good , if it allows [me]344-kim to return to [the Road]4566-the road again . This clothing grows no easier by wear . '[344-kim] When [they]2626-they came to [the crowded Lucknow station]2627-the crowded lucknow station there was no sign of [the lama]868-the lama . [He]868-the lama swallowed [his]868-the lama disappointment , while [the Colonel]757-the colonel bundled [him]868-the lama into [a ticca - gharri]2630-a ticca - gharri with [his]868-the lama neat belongings and despatched [him]868-the lama alone to [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier . ' [I]868-the lama do not say farewell , because [we]2626-they shall meet again , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama cried . ' Again , and many times , if [thou]5931-thou art [one of good spirit]5932-one of good spirit . But [thou]5931-thou art not yet tried . '[868-the lama] ' Not when [I]344-kim brought [thee]344-kim '[344-kim] - [Kim]344-kim actually dared to use the turn of equals - ' a white stallion 's pedigree that night ? '[344-kim] ' Much is gained by forgetting , [little brother]5933-little brother , '[757-the colonel] said [the Colonel]757-the colonel , with a look that pierced through [Kim]344-kim 's shoulder - blades as [he]868-the lama scuttled into [the carriage]4804-the carriage . It took [him]868-the lama nearly five minutes to recover . Then [he]757-the colonel sniffed the new air appreciatively . ' [A rich city]5934-a rich city , '[757-the colonel] [he]757-the colonel said . ' Richer than [Lahore]11-lahore . How good [the bazars]5338-the bazars must be ! [Coachman]5936-coachman , drive [me]757-the colonel a little through [the bazars]5338-the bazars here . '[757-the colonel] ' [My]5427-the driver order is to take [thee]344-kim to [the school]2541-the school . '[5427-the driver] [The driver]5427-the driver used the ' thou '[757-the colonel] , which is rudeness when applied to [a white man]5508-a white man . In the clearest and most fluent vernacular [Kim]344-kim pointed out [his]344-kim error , climbed on to the box - seat , and , perfect understanding established , drove for a couple of hours up and down , estimating , comparing , and enjoying . There is [no city]2635-no city - except [Bombay]60-bombay , [the queen of all]2636-the queen of all - more beautiful in [her]60-bombay garish style than [Lucknow]121-lucknow , whether [you]2637-you see [her]60-bombay from [the bridge over [the river]5005-the river]2638-the bridge over the river , or from [the top of [the Imambara]142-the imambara]2640-the top of the imambara looking down on the gilt umbrellas of [the Chutter Munzil]143-the chutter munzil , and the trees in which [the town]2641-the town is bedded . [Kings]870-kings have adorned [her]60-bombay with [fantastic buildings]2643-fantastic buildings , endowed [her]60-bombay with charities , crammed [her]60-bombay with [pensioners]2644-pensioners , and drenched [her]60-bombay with blood . [She]121-lucknow is the centre of all idleness , intrigue , and luxury , and shares with [Delhi]12-delhi the claim to talk the only pure Urdu . ' [A fair city]5939-a fair city - [a beautiful city]5940-a beautiful city . '[5427-the driver] [The driver]5427-the driver , as [a Lucknow man]2646-a lucknow man , was pleased with the compliment , and told [Kim]344-kim many astounding things where [an English guide]2647-an english guide would have talked of [the Mutiny]518-the mutiny . ' Now [we]5941-we will go to [the school]2541-the school , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim at last . [The great old school of [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier in [Partibus]144-partibus]2648-the great old school of st xavier 's in partibus , [block on block of [low white buildings]2650-low white buildings]2649-block on block of low white buildings , stands in [vast grounds]2651-vast grounds over against [the Gumti River]145-the gumti river , at some distance from [the city]4596-the city . ' What like of [folk]5943-folk are [they]2648-the great old school of st xavier 's in partibus within ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . ' [Young Sahibs]552-the sahibs - all devils . But to speak truth , and [I]344-kim drive many of [them]552-the sahibs to and fro from [the railway station]1012-the railway station , [I]344-kim have never seen one that had in [him]344-kim the making of [a more perfect devil]5945-a more perfect devil than [thou]5946-thou - [this young Sahib whom [I]344-kim am now driving]5947-this young sahib whom i am now driving . '[344-kim] Naturally , for [he]344-kim was never trained to consider [them]2653-them in any way improper , [Kim]344-kim had passed the time of day with [one or two frivolous ladies at upper windows in [a certain street]2655-a certain street]2654-one or two frivolous ladies at upper windows in a certain street , and naturally , in the exchange of compliments , had acquitted [himself]344-kim well . [He]344-kim was about to acknowledge [the driver]5427-the driver 's last insolence , when [his]344-kim eye - it was growing dusk - caught a figure sitting by one of the white plaster gate - pillars in the long sweep of wall . ' Stop ! '[344-kim] [he]344-kim cried . ' Stay here . [I]344-kim do not go to [the school]2541-the school at once . '[344-kim] ' But what is to pay [me]5427-the driver for this coming and re - coming ? '[5427-the driver] said [the driver]5427-the driver petulantly . ' Is [the boy]986-the boy mad ? Last time it was [a dancing- girl]5950-a dancing- girl . This time it is [a priest]820-a priest . '[5427-the driver] [Kim]344-kim was in [the road]4566-the road headlong , patting the dusty feet beneath the dirty yellow robe . ' [I]868-the lama have waited [here]4484-here a day and a half , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama 's level voice began . ' Nay , [I]868-the lama had [a disciple]4651-a disciple with [me]868-the lama . [He]4651-a disciple that was [[my]868-the lama friend at [the Temple of [the Tirthankars]498-the tirthankars]5955-the temple of the tirthankars]5954-my friend at the temple of the tirthankars gave [me]868-the lama a guide for this journey . [I]868-the lama came from [Benares]37-benares in [the te - rain]146-the te - rain , when [thy]868-the lama letter was given [me]868-the lama . Yes , [I]868-the lama am well fed . [I]868-the lama need nothing . '[868-the lama] ' But why didst [thou]868-the lama not stay with [the Kulu woman]2181-the kulu woman , O Holy One ? In what way didst [thou]868-the lama get to [Benares]37-benares ? [My]868-the lama heart has been heavy since [we]5957-we parted . '[868-the lama] ' [The woman]766-the woman wearied [me]868-the lama by constant flux of talk and requiring charms for [children]848-children . [I]868-the lama separated [myself]868-the lama from [that company]5960-that company , permitting [her]766-the woman to acquire merit by gifts . [She]766-the woman is at least [a woman of open hands]5961-a woman of open hands , and [I]868-the lama made a promise to return to [[her]766-the woman house]5962-her house if need arose . Then , perceiving [myself]868-the lama alone in this great and terrible world , [I]868-the lama bethought [me]868-the lama of the te - rain to [Benares]37-benares , where [I]868-the lama knew one abode in [[the Tirthankars]498-the tirthankars '[868-the lama] Temple]147-the tirthankars ' temple who was [a Seeker]1436-a seeker , even as [I.]2661-i. ' '[2661-i.] Ah ! [Thy River]148-thy river , ' said [Kim]344-kim . '[0-i] [I]0-i had forgotten [the River]33-the river . ' '[0-i] So soon , [[my]0-i chela]4863-my chela ? [I]0-i have never forgotten it . But when [I]0-i had left [thee]4863-my chela it seemed better that [I]0-i should go to [the Temple]149-the temple and take counsel , for , look [you]4863-my chela , [India]8-india is very large , and it may be that [wise men]2663-wise men before [us]2664-us , [some two or three]2665-some two or three , have left a record of the place of [[our]2664-us River]1396-our river . There is debate in [the Temple of [the Tirthankars]498-the tirthankars]5955-the temple of the tirthankars on this matter ; some saying one thing , and some another . [They]2668-they are [courteous folk]2669-courteous folk . ' '[2668-they] So be it ; but what dost [thou]2670-thou do now ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i acquire merit in that [I]0-i help [thee]4863-my chela , [[my]0-i chela]4863-my chela , to wisdom . [The priest of that body of men who serve [the Red Bull]426-the red bull]2672-the priest of that body of men who serve the red bull wrote [me]0-i that all should be as [I]0-i desired for [thee]4863-my chela . [I]0-i sent the money to suffice for one year , and then [I]0-i came , as [thou]2670-thou seest [me]0-i , to watch for [thee]4863-my chela going up into [the Gates of Learning]2673-the gates of learning . A day and a half have [I]0-i waited , not because [I]0-i was led by any affection towards [thee]4863-my chela - that is no part of the Way - but , as [they]2674-i said at [the Tirthankars ' Temple]147-the tirthankars ' temple , because , money having been paid for learning , it was right that [I]2674-i should oversee the end of the matter . [They]2674-i resolved [my]2674-i doubts most clearly . [I]2674-i had a fear that , perhaps , [I]2674-i came because [I]2674-i wished to see [thee]4863-my chela - misguided by the Red Mist of affection . It is not so ... Moreover , [I]2674-i am troubled by a dream . '[2674-i] ' But surely , [Holy One]385-holy one , [thou]4863-my chela hast not forgotten [the Road]150-the road and all that befell on it . Surely it was a little to see [me]5427-the driver that [thou]4863-my chela didst come ? '[5427-the driver] ' The horses are cold , and it is past [their]2674-i feeding - time , '[5427-the driver] whined [the driver]5427-the driver . ' Go to [Jehannum]407-jehannum and abide there with [[thy]5427-the driver reputationless aunt]5963-thy reputationless aunt ! '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim snarled over [his]344-kim shoulder . ' [I]344-kim am all alone in [this land]5964-this land ; [I]344-kim know not where [I]344-kim go nor what shall befall [me]344-kim . [My]344-kim heart was in that letter [I]344-kim sent [thee]868-the lama . Except for [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , and [he]383-mahbub is [a Pathan]5844-a pathan , [I]344-kim have [no friend]5966-no friend save [thee]868-the lama , [Holy One]385-holy one . Do not altogether go away . '[344-kim] ' [I]868-the lama have considered that also , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama replied , in a shaking voice . ' It is manifest that from time to time [I]868-the lama shall acquire merit if before that [I]868-the lama have not found [[my]868-the lama River]1074-my river - by assuring [myself]868-the lama that [thy]868-the lama feet are set on wisdom . What [they]5968-they will teach [thee]868-the lama [I]868-the lama do not know , but [the priest]1044-the priest wrote [me]868-the lama that [no son of a Sahib]5970-no son of a sahib in [all India]8-india will be better taught than [thou]868-the lama . So from time to time , therefore , [I]868-the lama will come again . Maybe [thou]868-the lama wilt be such [a Sahib]5596-a sahib as [he]5596-a sahib who gave [me]868-the lama these spectacles '[868-the lama] - [the lama]868-the lama wiped them elaborately - ' in [the Wonder House]721-the wonder house at [Lahore]11-lahore . That is [my]868-the lama hope , for [he]5596-a sahib was a Fountain of Wisdom - wiser than [many abbots]5973-many abbots .... Again , maybe [thou]868-the lama wilt forget [me]868-the lama and [our]5974-our meetings . '[868-the lama] ' If [I]344-kim eat [thy]868-the lama bread , '[344-kim] cried [Kim]344-kim passionately , ' how shall [I]344-kim ever forget [thee]868-the lama ? '[344-kim] ' No - no . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama put [the boy]986-the boy aside . ' [I]868-the lama must go back to [Benares]37-benares . From time to time , now that [I]868-the lama know the customs of [letter- writers in [this land]5964-this land]5975-letter- writers in this land , [I]868-the lama will send [thee]868-the lama a letter , and from time to time [I]868-the lama will come and see [thee]868-the lama . '[868-the lama] ' But whither shall [I]344-kim send [my]344-kim letters ? '[344-kim] wailed [Kim]344-kim , clutching at the robe , all forgetful that [he]344-kim was [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . ' To [the Temple of [the Tirthankars]498-the tirthankars at [Benares]37-benares]2397-the temple of the tirthankars at benares . That is [the place [I]344-kim have chosen]5978-the place i have chosen till [I]344-kim find [[my]344-kim [River]33-the river]1074-my river . Do not weep ; for , look [you]868-the lama , all Desire is Illusion and a new binding upon the Wheel . Go up to [the Gates of Learning]2673-the gates of learning . Let [me]344-kim see [thee]868-the lama go ... Dost [thou]868-the lama love [me]344-kim ? Then go , or [my]344-kim heart cracks ... [I]344-kim will come again . Surely [I]344-kim will come again . [The lama]868-the lama watched the ticca - gharri rumble into [the compound]5982-the compound , and strode off , snuffing between each long stride . '[344-kim] [The Gates of Learning]2673-the gates of learning ' shut with a clang . [The country born and bred boy]5983-the country born and bred boy has [his]5983-the country born and bred boy own manners and customs , which do not resemble those of [any other land]5984-any other land ; and [[his]5983-the country born and bred boy teachers]5985-his teachers approach [him]5983-the country born and bred boy by roads which [an English master]5986-an english master would not understand . Therefore , [you]868-the lama would scarcely be interested in [Kim]344-kim 's experiences as [a [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's boy]5987-a st xavier 's boy among [two or three hundred precocious youths]5988-two or three hundred precocious youths , [most of whom had never seen [the sea]1554-the sea]5989-most of whom had never seen the sea . [He]344-kim suffered the usual penalties for breaking out of bounds when there was cholera in [the city]4596-the city . This was before [he]344-kim had learned to write fair English , and so was obliged to find [a bazar letter - writer]2299-a bazar letter - writer . [He]344-kim was , of course , indicted for smoking and for the use of abuse more full - flavoured than even [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's had ever heard . [He]344-kim learned to wash [himself]344-kim with the Levitical scrupulosity of [the native - born , who in [his]344-kim heart]5993-the native - born , who in his heart considers [the Englishman]4653-the englishman rather dirty . [He]344-kim played the usual tricks on the patient coolies pulling [the punkahs]5995-the punkahs in [the sleeping- rooms where [the boys threshed through the hot nights telling tales till the dawn]5997-the boys threshed through the hot nights telling tales till the dawn]5996-the sleeping- rooms where the boys threshed through the hot nights telling tales till the dawn ; and quietly [he]344-kim measured [himself]344-kim against [[his]344-kim self- reliant mates]5998-his self- reliant mates . [They]5998-his self- reliant mates were [sons of subordinate officials in [the Railway]6000-the railway , Telegraph , and [Canal Services]6001-canal services ; of [warrant - officers]6002-warrant - officers , sometimes retired and sometimes acting as [commanders - in - chief to [a feudatory Rajah]6004-a feudatory rajah 's army]6003-commanders - in - chief to a feudatory rajah 's army]5999-sons of subordinate officials in the railway , telegraph , and canal services ; of warrant - officers , sometimes retired and sometimes acting as commanders - in - chief to a feudatory rajah 's army ; of [captains of the Indian Marine Government pensioners]6005-captains of the indian marine government pensioners , [planters]6006-planters , [Presidency shopkeepers]6007-presidency shopkeepers , and [missionaries]770-missionaries . [A few]6009-a few were [cadets of [the old Eurasian houses that have taken strong root in [Dhurrumtollah - Pereiras]153-dhurrumtollah - pereiras , [De Souzas]519-de souzas , and [D'Silvas]520-d'silvas]6011-the old eurasian houses that have taken strong root in dhurrumtollah - pereiras , de souzas , and d'silvas]6010-cadets of the old eurasian houses that have taken strong root in dhurrumtollah - pereiras , de souzas , and d'silvas . [[Their]5998-his self- reliant mates parents]6012-their parents could well have educated [them]5998-his self- reliant mates in [England]114-england , but [they]5998-his self- reliant mates loved [the school that had served [their]5998-his self- reliant mates own youth]6013-the school that had served their own youth , and [generation]6014-generation followed sallow- hued generation at [[St Xavier]495-st xavier 's]6015-st xavier 's . [[Their]5998-his self- reliant mates homes]6016-their homes ranged from Howrah of [the railway people]6017-the railway people to [abandoned cantonments like [Monghyr]154-monghyr and [Chunar]155-chunar]6018-abandoned cantonments like monghyr and chunar ; [lost tea - gardens Shillong - way]6019-lost tea - gardens shillong - way ; [villages where [[their]5998-his self- reliant mates fathers]6021-their fathers were [large landholders in [Oudh]97-oudh or [the Deccan]156-the deccan]6022-large landholders in oudh or the deccan]6020-villages where their fathers were large landholders in oudh or the deccan ; [Mission - stations]6023-mission - stations a week from [the nearest railway line]6024-the nearest railway line ; [seaports a thousand miles south]6025-seaports a thousand miles south , facing [the brazen Indian surf]6026-the brazen indian surf ; and [cinchona - plantations south of all]6027-cinchona - plantations south of all . The mere story of [their]5998-his self- reliant mates adventures , which to [them]5998-his self- reliant mates were no adventures , on [their]5998-his self- reliant mates road to and from [school]5886-school would have crisped [a Western boy]6029-a western boy 's hair . [They]5998-his self- reliant mates were used to jogging off alone through [a hundred miles of jungle]6030-a hundred miles of jungle , where there was always the delightful chance of being delayed by tigers ; but [they]5998-his self- reliant mates would no more have bathed in [the English Channel]157-the english channel in an English August than [[their]5998-his self- reliant mates brothers]6031-their brothers across [the world]759-the world would have lain still while a leopard snuffed at [[their]5998-his self- reliant mates palanquin]6033-their palanquin . There were [boys of fifteen]6034-boys of fifteen who had spent a day and a half on [an islet]6035-an islet in [the middle of [a flooded river]6037-a flooded river]6036-the middle of a flooded river , taking charge , as by right , of [a camp of [frantic pilgrims]6039-frantic pilgrims returning from [a shrine]6040-a shrine]6038-a camp of frantic pilgrims returning from a shrine . There were seniors who had requisitioned a chance - met [Rajah]469-rajah 's elephant , in the name of [St Francis Xavier]158-st francis xavier , when [the Rains]521-the rains once blotted out the cart - track that led to [[[their]5998-his self- reliant mates father]6041-their father 's estate]6042-their father 's estate , and had all but lost the huge beast in a quicksand . There was [a boy who , [he]6041-their father said , and [none]4586-none doubted , had helped [[his]6043-a boy who , he said , and none doubted , had helped his father to beat off with rifles from the veranda a rush of akas in the days when those head - hunters were bold against lonely plantations father]761-his father to beat off with rifles from [the veranda]765-the veranda a rush of [Akas]522-akas in the days when [those head - hunters]6047-those head - hunters were bold against [lonely plantations]6048-lonely plantations]6043-a boy who , he said , and none doubted , had helped his father to beat off with rifles from the veranda a rush of akas in the days when those head - hunters were bold against lonely plantations . And every tale was told in the even , passionless voice of [the native - born]6049-the native - born , mixed with quaint reflections , borrowed unconsciously from [native foster - mothers]6050-native foster - mothers , and turns of speech that showed [they]6049-the native - born had been that instant translated from the vernacular . [Kim]344-kim watched , listened , and approved . This was not insipid , single - word talk of [drummer - boys]6051-drummer - boys . It dealt with a life [he]6041-their father knew and in part understood . The atmosphere suited [him]6041-their father , and [he]6041-their father throve by inches . [They]5998-his self- reliant mates gave [him]6041-their father a white drill suit as the weather warmed , and [he]6041-their father rejoiced in the new- found bodily comforts as [he]6041-their father rejoiced to use [his]6041-their father sharpened mind over the tasks [they]5998-his self- reliant mates set [him]6041-their father . [His]6041-their father quickness would have delighted [an English master]5986-an english master ; but at [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's [they]5998-his self- reliant mates know the first rush of minds developed by sun and surroundings , as [they]5998-his self- reliant mates know the half- collapse that sets in at twenty - two or twenty - three . None the less [he]6041-their father remembered to hold [himself]6041-their father lowly . When tales were told of hot nights , [Kim]344-kim did not sweep the board with [his]344-kim reminiscences ; for [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's looks down on [boys who '[868-the lama] go native all - together]6053-boys who ' go native all - together . ' [One]1164-one must never forget that [one]1164-one is [a Sahib]5596-a sahib , and that some day , when examinations are passed , [one]1164-one will command [natives]2505-natives . [Kim]344-kim made a note of this , for [he]344-kim began to understand where examinations led . Then came the holidays from August to October - the long holidays imposed by the heat and the Rains . [Kim]344-kim was informed that [he]344-kim would go north to some station in [the hills behind [Umballa]52-umballa]6059-the hills behind umballa , where [Father Victor]452-father victor would arrange for [him]344-kim . '[868-the lama] [A barrack - school]2681-a barrack - school ? ' said [Kim]344-kim , who had asked many questions and thought more . '[868-the lama] Yes , [I]0-i suppose so , ' said [the master]869-the master . '[0-i] It will not do [you]2682-you any harm to keep [you]2682-you out of mischief . [You]2682-you can go up with [young De Castro]523-young de castro as far as [Delhi]12-delhi . ' [Kim]344-kim considered it in every possible light . [He]344-kim had been diligent , even as [the Colonel]757-the colonel advised . [A boy]4870-a boy 's holiday was [[his]344-kim own property]6063-his own property - of so much the talk of [[his]344-kim companions]4468-his companions had advised [him]344-kim , - and [a barrack - school]2681-a barrack - school would be torment after [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's . Moreover - this was magic worth anything else - [he]344-kim could write . In three months [he]344-kim had discovered how [men]752-men can speak to [each other]2038-each other without [a third party]6068-a third party , at the cost of half an anna and a little knowledge . No word had come from [the lama]868-the lama , but there remained [the Road]4566-the road . [Kim]344-kim yearned for the caress of soft mud squishing up between the toes , as [his]344-kim mouth watered for mutton stewed with butter and cabbages , for rice speckled with strong scented cardamoms , for the saffron - tinted rice , garlic and onions , and the forbidden greasy sweetmeats of [the bazars]5338-the bazars . [They]6072-they would feed [him]344-kim raw beef on a platter at [the barrack- school]6073-the barrack- school , and [he]344-kim must smoke by stealth . But again , [he]344-kim was [a Sahib]5596-a sahib and was at [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier , and that pig [Mahbub Ali ...]383-mahbub No , [he]344-kim would not test [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's hospitality - and yet ... [He]344-kim thought it out alone in [the dormitory]6075-the dormitory , and came to the conclusion [he]344-kim had been unjust to [Mahbub]383-mahbub . [The school]2541-the school was empty ; nearly all [the masters]6077-the masters had gone away ; [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton 's railway pass lay in [his]344-kim hand , and [Kim]344-kim puffed [himself]344-kim that [he]344-kim had not spent [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton 's or [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's money in riotous living . [He]344-kim was still lord of two rupees seven annas . [His]344-kim new bullock - trunk , marked '[523-young de castro] K. O'H. ' , and bedding - roll lay in [the empty sleeping - room]6078-the empty sleeping - room . Dost [thou]6080-thou know what manner of [women]4700-women [we]6082-we be in [this quarter]6083-this quarter ? Oh , shame ! '[2684-i] ' Was [I]344-kim born yesterday ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim squatted native - fashion on the cushions of [that upper room]2686-that upper room . ' A little dyestuff and three yards of cloth to help out a jest . Is it much to ask ? [Old men]6089-old men are very jealous . '[2684-i] ' That is true . Hold [thy]4700-women face still while [I]344-kim dab on the juice . '[344-kim] ' Not too black , [Naikan]524-naikan . '[2684-i] ' Twelve years , [I]344-kim think , '[344-kim] said [the shameless Kim]344-kim . ' Spread it also on the breast . [The girl]4813-the girl worked busily , dabbing a twist of cloth into a little saucer of brown dye that holds longer than any walnut - juice . ' Now send out and get [me]4813-the girl a cloth for the turban . Woe is [me]4813-the girl , [my]4813-the girl head is all unshaved ! And [he]6091-her father will surely knock off [my]4813-the girl turban . '[4813-the girl] ' [I]4813-the girl am not [a barber]6092-a barber , but [I]4813-the girl will make shift . '[4813-the girl] [She]4813-the girl shook with laughter till [her]4813-the girl bracelets and anklets jingled . ' But who is to pay [me]4813-the girl for this ? '[4813-the girl] ' Trust in [the Gods]1244-the gods , [[my]344-kim sister]6095-my sister , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim gravely , screwing [his]344-kim face round as the stain dried . ' Besides , hast [thou]4813-the girl ever helped to paint a Sahib thus before ? '[344-kim] ' Never indeed . But a jest is not money . '[4813-the girl] ' It is worth much more .
