" [Thou]4813-the girl wilt go very far in [this world]1066-this world . '[4813-the girl] [She]4813-the girl gave [the dancing - girls]2688-the dancing - girls ' salutation in mockery . '[2689-all one] [All one]2689-all one . Make haste and rough - cut [my]0-i head . ' [Kim]344-kim shifted from foot to foot , [his]344-kim eyes ablaze with mirth as [he]344-kim thought of the fat days before [him]344-kim . [He]344-kim gave [the girl]4813-the girl four annas , and ran down [the stairs]6101-the stairs in the likeness of [a low - caste Hindu boy]2453-a low - caste hindu boy - perfect in every detail . [A cookshop]6103-a cookshop was [his]344-kim next point of call , where [he]344-kim feasted in extravagance and greasy luxury . On [Lucknow station platform]6104-lucknow station platform [he]344-kim watched [young De Castro]523-young de castro , all covered with prickly - heat , get into [a second - class compartment]6105-a second - class compartment . [Kim]344-kim patronized a third , and was the life and soul of it . [He]344-kim explained to [the company]4899-the company that [he]344-kim was assistant to [a juggler who had left [him]344-kim [behind sick with fever]6108-behind sick with fever , and that [he]344-kim would pick up [[his]344-kim master]6109-his master at [Umballa]52-umballa]6107-a juggler who had left him behind sick with fever , and that he would pick up his master at umballa . As [the occupants of]6110-the occupants of [the carriage]4804-the carriage changed , [he]344-kim varied this tale , or adorned it with all the shoots of a budding fancy , the more rampant for being held off native speech so long . In all [India]8-india that night was [no human being so joyful]6112-no human being so joyful as [Kim]344-kim . At [Umballa]52-umballa [he]344-kim got out and headed eastward , plashing over [the sodden fields]6113-the sodden fields to [[the village]5076-the village where [the old soldier]5092-the old soldier lived]2381-the village where the old soldier lived . About this time [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton at [Simla]159-simla was advised from [Lucknow]121-lucknow by wire that [young O'Hara]347-o'hara had disappeared . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub was in [town]6117-town selling horses , and to [him]383-mahbub [the Colonel]757-the colonel confided the affair one morning cantering round [Annandale racecourse]160-annandale racecourse . '[4813-the girl] Oh , that is nothing , ' said [the horse - dealer]2470-the horse - dealer . '[4813-the girl] [Men]752-men are like horses . At certain times [they]752-men need salt , and if that salt is not in [the mangers]2691-the mangers [they]752-men will lick it up from the earth . [He]2692-he has gone back to [the Road]4566-the road again for a while . [The madrissak]2694-the madrissak wearied [him]2692-he . [I]0-i knew it would . Another time , [I]0-i will take [him]2692-he upon [the Road]4566-the road [myself]0-i . Do not be troubled , [Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton . It is as though a polo - pony , breaking loose , ran out to learn the game alone . ' '[0-i] Then [he]2692-he is not dead , think [you]0-i ? ' '[2692-he] Fever might kill [him]2692-he . [I]0-i do not fear for [the boy]986-the boy otherwise . A monkey does not fall among trees . ' Next morning , on the same course , [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's stallion ranged alongside [the Colonel]757-the colonel . '[2692-he] It is as [I]0-i had thought , ' said [the horse - dealer]2470-the horse - dealer . '[2692-he] [He]2692-he has come through [Umballa]52-umballa at least , and there [he]2692-he has written a letter to [me]0-i , having learned in [the bazar]729-the bazar that [I]0-i was [here]4484-here . ' '[2692-he] Read , ' said [the Colonel]757-the colonel , with a sigh of relief . It was absurd that [a man of [his]6123-a man of his position position]6123-a man of his position should take an interest in [a little country- bred vagabond]6124-a little country- bred vagabond ; but [the Colonel]757-the colonel remembered the conversation in [the train]913-the train , and often in the past few months had caught [himself]757-the colonel thinking of [the queer , silent , self - possessed boy]6127-the queer , silent , self - possessed boy . [His]2699-the friend of the stars , who is the friend of all the world evasion , of course , was the height of insolence , but it argued some resource and nerve . [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's eyes twinkled as [he]383-mahbub reined out into [the centre of [the cramped little plain]6129-the cramped little plain , where none could come near unseen]6128-the centre of the cramped little plain , where none could come near unseen . '[2692-he] " [The Friend of [the Stars]438-the stars , who is [the Friend of all [the World]14-the world]2491-the friend of all the world]2699-the friend of the stars , who is the friend of all the world - " ' '[2491-the friend of all the world] What is this ? ' '[2491-the friend of all the world] A name [we]2701-we give [him]2699-the friend of the stars , who is the friend of all the world in [Lahore city]939-lahore city . " [The Friend of all [the World]14-the world]2491-the friend of all the world takes leave to go to [[his]2491-the friend of all the world own places]2704-his own places . [He]2491-the friend of all the world will come back upon the appointed day . Let the box and the bedding - roll be sent for ; and if there has been a fault , let [the Hand of Friendship]2705-the hand of friendship turn aside the Whip of Calamity . " There is yet a little more , but - ' '[2705-the hand of friendship] No matter , read . ' '[2705-the hand of friendship] " Certain things are not known to [those who eat with forks]2706-those who eat with forks . It is better to eat with both hands for a while . Speak soft words to those who do not understand this that the return may be propitious . " Now the manner in which that was cast is , of course , the work of [the letter - writer]5755-the letter - writer , but see how wisely [the boy]986-the boy has devised the matter of it so that no hint is given except to [those who know]2709-those who know ! ' '[986-the boy] Is this the Hand of Friendship to avert the Whip of Calamity ? ' laughed [the Colonel]757-the colonel . '[986-the boy] See how wise is [the boy]986-the boy . [He]986-the boy would go back to [the Road]4566-the road again , as [I]0-i said . Not knowing yet [thy]986-the boy trade - ' '[0-i] [I]0-i am not at all sure of that , ' [the Colonel]757-the colonel muttered . '[0-i] [He]986-the boy turns to [me]0-i to make a peace between [you]2712-you . Is [he]986-the boy not wise ? [He]986-the boy says [he]986-the boy will return . [He]986-the boy is but perfecting [his]986-the boy knowledge . Think , [Sahib]393-colonel creighton ! [He]986-the boy has been three months at [the school]2541-the school . And [he]986-the boy is not mouthed to that bit . For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i rejoice . [The pony]2714-the pony learns the game . ' '[2714-the pony] Ay , but another time [he]986-the boy must not go alone . ' '[2714-the pony] Why ? [He]986-the boy went alone before [he]986-the boy came under [the Colonel Sahib]393-colonel creighton 's protection . When [he]986-the boy comes to [the Great Game]2715-the great game [he]986-the boy must go alone - alone , and at peril of [his]986-the boy head . Then , if [he]986-the boy spits , or sneezes , or sits down other than as [the people]4594-the people do whom [he]986-the boy watches , [he]986-the boy may be slain . Why hinder [him]986-the boy now ? Remember how [the Persians]2717-the persians say : [The jackal that lives in [the wilds of [Mazanderan]161-mazanderan]2719-the wilds of mazanderan]2718-the jackal that lives in the wilds of mazanderan can only be caught by the hounds of [Mazanderan]161-mazanderan . ' '[2717-the persians] True . It is true , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . And if [he]986-the boy comes to no harm , [I]0-i do not desire anything better . But it is great insolence on [his]986-the boy part . ' '[986-the boy] [He]986-the boy does not tell [me]0-i , even , whither [he]986-the boy goes , ' said [Mahbub]383-mahbub . '[986-the boy] [He]986-the boy is [no fool]2720-no fool . When [his]986-the boy time is accomplished [he]986-the boy will come to [me]0-i . It is time [the healer of pearls]2721-the healer of pearls took [him]986-the boy in hand . [He]986-the boy ripens too quickly - as [Sahibs]552-the sahibs reckon . ' This prophecy was fulfilled to the letter a month later . [Mahbub]383-mahbub had gone down to [Umballa]52-umballa to bring up a fresh consignment of horses , and [Kim]344-kim met [him]383-mahbub on [the Kalka road]6132-the kalka road at dusk riding alone , begged an alms of [him]383-mahbub , was sworn at , and replied in English . There was [nobody within earshot]6133-nobody within earshot to hear [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's gasp of amazement . '[552-the sahibs] Oho ! And where hast [thou]2722-thou been ? ' '[2722-thou] Up and down - down and up . ' '[2722-thou] Come under a tree , out of the wet , and tell . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i stayed for a while with [an old man near [Umballa]52-umballa]2723-an old man near umballa ; [anon with [a household of [my]0-i acquaintance in [Umballa]52-umballa]2725-a household of my acquaintance in umballa]2724-anon with a household of my acquaintance in umballa . With one of these [I]0-i went as far as [Delhi]12-delhi to the southward . That is [a wondrous city]2726-a wondrous city . Then [I]0-i drove [a bullock]2727-a bullock for [a teli an oilman]2728-a teli an oilman coming north ; but [I]0-i heard of a great feast forward in [Patiala]162-patiala , and thither went [I]0-i in the company of [a firework - maker]2729-a firework - maker . It was a great feast ' [Kim]344-kim rubbed [his]344-kim stomach . '[0-i] [I]0-i saw [Rajahs]408-rajahs , and elephants with gold and silver trappings ; and [they]2730-they lit all the fireworks at once , whereby [eleven men]2731-eleven men were killed , [[my]0-i fire - work - maker]2732-my fire - work - maker among [them]2731-eleven men , and [I]0-i was blown across [a tent]2733-a tent but took no harm . Then [I]0-i came back to [the rel]2734-the rel with [a Sikh horseman]2735-a sikh horseman , to whom [I]0-i was groom for [my]0-i bread ; and so here . ' '[2735-a sikh horseman] Shabash ! ' said [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . '[2735-a sikh horseman] But what does [the Colonel Sahib]2496-the colonel sahib say ? [I]0-i do not wish to be beaten . ' '[2496-the colonel sahib] [The Hand of Friendship]2705-the hand of friendship has averted the Whip of Calamity ; but another time , when [thou]2738-thou takest [the Road]4566-the road it will be with [me]0-i . This is too early . ' '[5596-a sahib] Late enough for [me]0-i . [I]0-i have learned to read and to write English a little at [the madrissah]2740-the madrissah . [I]0-i shall soon be altogether [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . ' '[5596-a sahib] Hear [him]5596-a sahib ! ' laughed [Mahbub]383-mahbub , looking at [the little drenched figure dancing in the wet]6134-the little drenched figure dancing in the wet . '[5596-a sahib] [Salaam - Sahib]527-salaam - sahib , ' and [he]383-mahbub saluted ironically . '[5596-a sahib] Well , art tired of [the Road]150-the road , or wilt [thou]2738-thou come on to [Umballa]52-umballa with [me]0-i and work back with the horses ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i come with [thee]0-i , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . ' Chapter 8 Something [I]383-mahbub owe to the soil that grew - More to the life that fed - But most to [Allah]382-allah Who gave [me]383-mahbub two Separate sides to [my]383-mahbub head . [I]383-mahbub would go without shirts or shoes , [Friends]2013-friends , tobacco or bread Sooner than for an instant lose Either side of [my]383-mahbub head . '[383-mahbub] [The Two - Sided Man]2742-the two - sided man . ' Then in [God]499-god 's name take blue for red , '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub , alluding to the Hindu colour of [Kim]344-kim 's disreputable turban . [Kim]344-kim countered with the old proverb , ' [I]344-kim will change [my]344-kim faith and [my]344-kim bedding , but [thou]6136-thou must pay for it . '[344-kim] [The dealer]5821-the dealer laughed till [he]5821-the dealer nearly fell from [his]5821-the dealer horse . At [a shop on [the outskirts of [the city]4596-the city]2745-the outskirts of the city]2744-a shop on the outskirts of the city the change was made , and [Kim]344-kim stood up , externally at least , [a Mohammedan]2747-a mohammedan . [Mahbub]383-mahbub hired [a room over against [the railway station]1012-the railway station]2748-a room over against the railway station , sent for a cooked meal of the finest with the almond - curd sweet - meats balushai [we]2750-we call it and fine - chopped Lucknow tobacco . ' This is better than some other meat that [I]344-kim ate with [the Sikh]4777-the sikh , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , grinning as [he]344-kim squatted , ' and assuredly [they]6138-they give no such victuals at [my]344-kim madrissah . '[344-kim] ' [I]383-mahbub have a desire to hear of that same madrissah . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub stuffed [himself]383-mahbub with great boluses of spiced mutton fried in fat with cabbage and golden - brown onions . ' But tell [me]383-mahbub first , altogether and truthfully , the manner of [thy]383-mahbub escape . For , [O Friend of all [the World]14-the world]822-o friend of all the world , '[383-mahbub] - [he]383-mahbub loosed [his]383-mahbub cracking belt - ' [I]383-mahbub do not think it is often that [a Sahib]5596-a sahib and [the son of [a Sahib]5596-a sahib]5595-the son of a sahib runs away from there . '[383-mahbub] ' How should [they]6143-they ? [They]6143-they do not know [the land]4998-the land . It was nothing , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , and began [his]344-kim tale . When [he]383-mahbub came to the disguisement and the interview with [the girl in [the bazar]729-the bazar]2751-the girl in the bazar , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's gravity went from [him]383-mahbub . [He]383-mahbub laughed aloud and beat [his]383-mahbub hand on [his]383-mahbub thigh . ' [Shabash]528-shabash ! [Shabash]528-shabash ! Oh , well done , [little one]1389-little one ! What will [the healer of turquoises]6146-the healer of turquoises say to this ? Now , slowly , let [us]6147-us hear what befell afterwards - step by step , omitting nothing . '[383-mahbub] Step by step then , [Kim]344-kim told [his]344-kim adventures between coughs as the full - flavoured tobacco caught [his]344-kim lungs . ' [I]383-mahbub said , '[383-mahbub] growled [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub to [himself]383-mahbub , ' [I]383-mahbub said it was the pony breaking out to play polo . The fruit is ripe already -except that [he]383-mahbub must learn [his]383-mahbub distances and [his]383-mahbub pacings , and [his]383-mahbub rods and [his]383-mahbub compasses . Listen now . [I]383-mahbub have turned aside [the Colonel]757-the colonel 's whip from [thy]383-mahbub skin , and that is no small service . '[383-mahbub] ' True . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim pulled serenely . ' That is true . '[344-kim] ' But it is not to be thought that this running out and in is any way good . '[383-mahbub] ' It was [my]383-mahbub holiday , [Hajji]388-hajji . [I]383-mahbub was [a slave]6149-a slave for many weeks . Why should [I]383-mahbub not run away when [the school]2541-the school was shut ? Look , too , how [I]383-mahbub , living upon [[my]383-mahbub friends]1569-my friends or working for [my]383-mahbub bread , as [I]383-mahbub did with [the Sikh]4777-the sikh , have saved [the Colonel Sahib]393-colonel creighton a great expense . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's lips twitched under [his]383-mahbub well - pruned Mohammedan moustache . ' What are a few rupees '[2753-the pathan] - [the Pathan]2753-the pathan threw out [his]2753-the pathan open hand carelessly - ' to [the Colonel Sahib]393-colonel creighton ? [He]393-colonel creighton spends them for a purpose , not in any way for love of [thee]6153-thee . '[2753-the pathan] ' That , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim slowly , ' [I]344-kim knew a very long time ago . '[344-kim] ' Who told ? '[383-mahbub] ' [The Colonel Sahib]393-colonel creighton [himself]393-colonel creighton . Not in those many words , but plainly enough for one who is not altogether a mud - head . [Yea]6154-yea , [he]393-colonel creighton told [me]2753-the pathan in the te - rain when [we]6155-we went down to [Lucknow]121-lucknow . '[2753-the pathan] ' Be it so . Then [I]344-kim will tell [thee]6153-thee more , Friend of all [the World]14-the world , though in the telling [I]344-kim lend [thee]6153-thee [my]344-kim head . '[344-kim] ' It was forfeit to [me]344-kim , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , with deep relish , ' in [Umballa]52-umballa , when [thou]6153-thee didst pick [me]344-kim up on the horse after [the drummer - boy]5786-the drummer - boy beat [me]344-kim . '[344-kim] ' Speak a little plainer . All [the world]759-the world may tell lies save [thou]6153-thee and [I.]344-kim For equally is [thy]6153-thee life forfeit to [me]344-kim if [I]344-kim chose to raise [my]344-kim finger here . '[344-kim] ' And this is known to [me]344-kim also , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , readjusting the live charcoal - ball on the weed . ' It is a very sure tie between [us]6158-us . Indeed , [thy]6153-thee hold is surer even than [mine]344-kim ; for who would miss [a boy beaten to death]6159-a boy beaten to death , or , it may be , thrown into a well by the roadside ? [Most people here and in [Simla]159-simla and across]6160-most people here and in simla and across [the passes behind [the Hills]10-the hills]6161-the passes behind the hills would , on the other hand , say : " What has come to [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub ? " if [he]383-mahbub were found dead among [his]383-mahbub horses . Surely , too , [the Colonel Sahib]393-colonel creighton would make inquiries . But again,'- [Kim]344-kim 's face puckered with cunning , - '[344-kim] [he]344-kim would not make overlong inquiry , lest [people]4650-people should ask : " What has [this Colonel Sahib]2755-this colonel sahib to do with [that horse - dealer]2756-that horse - dealer ? " But [I]0-i - if [I]0-i lived - ' '[0-i] As [thou]2757-thou wouldst surely die - ' '[0-i] Maybe ; but [I]0-i say , if [I]0-i lived , [I]0-i , and [I]0-i alone , would know that [one]1164-one had come by night , as [a common thief]2759-a common thief perhaps , to [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's bulkhead in the serai , and there had slain [him]383-mahbub , either before or after [that thief]2760-that thief had made a full search into [his]383-mahbub saddlebags and between the soles of [his]383-mahbub slippers . Is that news to tell to [the Colonel]757-the colonel , or would [he]757-the colonel say to [me]0-i - [I]0-i have not forgotten when [he]757-the colonel sent [me]0-i back for a cigar - case that [he]383-mahbub had not left behind [him]383-mahbub - " What is [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub to [me]0-i ? " ? ' Up went a gout of heavy smoke . There was a long pause : then [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub spoke in admiration : '[383-mahbub] And with these things on [thy]383-mahbub mind , dost [thou]383-mahbub lie down and rise again among all [[the Sahibs]552-the sahibs ' little sons at [the madrissah]2740-the madrissah]6162-the sahibs ' little sons at the madrissah and meekly take instruction from [[thy]383-mahbub teachers]6164-thy teachers ? '[383-mahbub] ' It is an order , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim blandly . ' Who am [I]344-kim to dispute an order ? '[344-kim] ' [A most finished Son of [Eblis]529-eblis]6165-a most finished son of eblis , '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . ' But what is this tale of [the thief]6166-the thief and the search ? '[383-mahbub] ' That which [I]344-kim saw , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , ' the night that [[my]344-kim lama]2421-my lama and [I]344-kim lay next [thy]383-mahbub place in [the Kashmir Seral]6168-the kashmir seral . The door was left unlocked , which [I]344-kim think is not [thy]383-mahbub custom , [Mahbub]383-mahbub . [He]383-mahbub came in as one assured that [thou]383-mahbub wouldst not soon return . [My]344-kim eye was against a knot - hole in the plank . [He]383-mahbub searched as it were for something - not a rug , not stirrups , nor a bridle , nor brass pots - something little and most carefully hid . Else why did [he]383-mahbub prick with an iron between the soles of [thy]383-mahbub slippers ? '[344-kim] ' Ha ! '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub smiled gently . ' And seeing these things , what tale didst [thou]383-mahbub fashion to [thyself]6169-thyself , Well of the Truth ? '[383-mahbub] ' None . [I]344-kim put [my]344-kim hand upon [my]344-kim amulet , which lies always next to [my]344-kim skin , and , remembering the pedigree of a white stallion that [I]344-kim had bitten out of a piece of Mussalmani bread , [I]344-kim went away to [Umballa]52-umballa perceiving that a heavy trust was laid upon [me]344-kim . At that hour , had [I]344-kim chosen , [thy]383-mahbub head was forfeit . It needed only to say to [that man]4846-that man , " [I]344-kim have here a paper concerning a horse which [I]344-kim can not read . " And then ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim peered at [Mahbub]383-mahbub under [his]383-mahbub eyebrows . ' Then [thou]383-mahbub wouldst have drunk water twice - perhaps thrice , afterwards . [I]383-mahbub do not think more than thrice , '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub simply . ' It is true . [I]383-mahbub thought of that a little , but most [I]383-mahbub thought that [I]383-mahbub loved [thee]383-mahbub , [Mahbub]383-mahbub . Therefore [I]383-mahbub went to [Umballa]52-umballa , as [thou]383-mahbub knowest , but and this [thou]383-mahbub dost not know [I]383-mahbub lay hid in the garden - grass to see what [Colonel Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton might do upon reading the white stallion 's pedigree . '[383-mahbub] ' And what did [he]393-colonel creighton ? '[344-kim] for [Kim]344-kim had bitten off the conversation . ' Dost [thou]383-mahbub give news for love , or dost [thou]383-mahbub sell it ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim asked . ' [I]344-kim sell and - [I]344-kim buy . '[344-kim] [Mahbub]383-mahbub took a four - anna piece out of [his]383-mahbub belt and held it up . ' Eight ! '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , mechanically following the huckster instinct of [the East]64-the east . [Mahbub]383-mahbub laughed , and put away the coin . ' It is too easy to deal in that market , [Friend of [all the World]2492-all the world]1716-friend of all the world . Tell [me]383-mahbub for love . [Our]6173-our lives lie in [each other]2038-each other 's hand . '[383-mahbub] ' Very good . [I]383-mahbub saw [the Jang - i - Lat Sahib]6175-the jang - i - lat sahib [the Commander - in - Chief]4962-the commander - in - chief come to a big dinner . [I]383-mahbub saw [him]6175-the jang - i - lat sahib in [[Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton 's office]6177-creighton sahib 's office . [I]383-mahbub saw [the two read the white stallion]6178-the two read the white stallion 's pedigree . [I]383-mahbub heard the very orders given for the opening of a great war . '[383-mahbub] ' Hah ! '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub nodded with deepest eyes afire . ' The game is well played . That war is done now , and the evil , [we]6173-our hope , nipped before the flower - thanks to [me]383-mahbub - and [thee]6179-thee . What didst [thou]6179-thee later ? '[383-mahbub] ' [I]383-mahbub made the news as it were a hook to catch [me]383-mahbub victual and honour among [the villagers in [a village]1733-a village whose [priest]4580-priest drugged [my]383-mahbub lama]6180-the villagers in a village whose priest drugged my lama . But [I]383-mahbub bore away [the old man]861-the old man 's purse , and [the Brahmin]6184-the brahmin found nothing . So next morning [he]861-the old man was angry . Ho ! Ho ! And [I]383-mahbub also used the news when [I]383-mahbub fell into the hands of [that white Regiment]6185-that white regiment with [[their]6185-that white regiment Bull]6186-their bull ! '[383-mahbub] ' That was foolishness . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub scowled . ' News is not meant to be thrown about like dung - cakes , but used sparingly - like bhang . '[383-mahbub] ' So [I]383-mahbub think now , and moreover , it did [me]383-mahbub no sort of good . But that was very long ago , '[383-mahbub] [he]383-mahbub made as to brush it all away with a thin brown hand - ' and since then , and especially in the nights under the punkah at [the madrissah]2740-the madrissah , [I]383-mahbub have thought very greatly . '[383-mahbub] ' Is it permitted to ask whither [the Heaven - born]6188-the heaven - born 's thought might have led ? '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub , with an elaborate sarcasm , smoothing [his]383-mahbub scarlet beard . ' It is permitted , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , and threw back the very tone . ' [They]6189-they say at [Nucklao]127-nucklao that [no Sahib]6190-no sahib must tell [a black man]6191-a black man that [he]6191-a black man has made a fault . '[344-kim] [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's hand shot into [his]383-mahbub bosom , for to call [a Pathan a ' black man]6192-a pathan a ' black man '[6192-a pathan a ' black man] kala admi is a blood - insult . Then [he]383-mahbub remembered and laughed . ' Speak , [Sahib]393-colonel creighton . [[Thy]393-colonel creighton [black man]6194-black man]6193-thy black man hears . '[383-mahbub] ' But , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , ' [I]344-kim am not [a Sahib]5596-a sahib , and [I]344-kim say [I]344-kim made a fault to curse [thee]393-colonel creighton , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , on that day at [Umballa]52-umballa when [I]344-kim thought [I]344-kim was betrayed by [a Pathan]5844-a pathan . [I]344-kim was senseless ; for [I]344-kim was but newly caught , and [I]344-kim wished to kill [that low - caste drummer - boy]6197-that low - caste drummer - boy . [I]344-kim say now , [Hajji]388-hajji , that it was well done ; and [I]344-kim see [[my]344-kim road]6198-my road all clear before [me]344-kim to a good service . [I]344-kim will stay in [the madrissah]2740-the madrissah till [I]344-kim am ripe . '[344-kim] ' Well said . Especially are distances and numbers and the manner of using compasses to be learned in that game . One waits in [the Hills above]10-the hills to show [thee]6200-thee . '[757-the colonel] ' [I]344-kim will learn [their]757-the colonel teaching upon a condition - that [my]344-kim time is given to [me]344-kim without question when the madrissah is shut . Ask that for [me]344-kim of [the Colonel]757-the colonel . '[344-kim] ' But why not ask [the Colonel]757-the colonel in [the Sahibs]552-the sahibs '[344-kim] tongue ? ' '[344-kim] [The Colonel]757-the colonel is [the servant of [the Government]852-the government]2763-the servant of the government . [He]757-the colonel is sent hither and yon at a word , and must consider [his]757-the colonel own advancement . See how much [I]0-i have already learned at [Nucklao]127-nucklao ! Moreover , [the Colonel]757-the colonel [I]0-i know since three months only . [I]0-i have known [one Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub for six years . So ! To the madrissah [I]0-i will go . At [the madrissah]2740-the madrissah [I]0-i will learn . In [the madrissah]164-the madrissah [I]0-i will be [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . But when the madrissah is shut , then must [I]0-i be free and go among [[my]0-i people]1568-my people . Otherwise [I]0-i die ! ' '[0-i] And who are [[thy]2769-thy people]2770-thy people , Friend of all [the World]14-the world ? ' '[0-i] [This great and beautiful land]2771-this great and beautiful land , ' said [Kim]344-kim , waving [his]344-kim paw round [the little clay - walled room where the oil - lamp in [its]6203-the little clay - walled room where the oil - lamp in its niche niche]6203-the little clay - walled room where the oil - lamp in its niche burned heavily through the tobacco - smoke . '[0-i] And , further , [I]0-i would see [[my]0-i lama]2421-my lama again . And , further , [I]0-i need money . ' '[0-i] That is the need of [everyone]2773-everyone , ' said [Mahbub]383-mahbub ruefully . '[0-i] [I]0-i will give [thee]2774-thou eight annas , for much money is not picked out of horses ' hooves , and it must suffice for many days . As to all the rest , [I]0-i am well pleased , and no further talk is needed . Make haste to learn , and in three years , or it may be less , [thou]2774-thou wilt be an aid - even to [me]0-i . '[0-i] ' Have [I]344-kim been such a hindrance till now ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , with [a boy]4870-a boy 's giggle . ' Do not give answers , '[344-kim] [Mahbub]383-mahbub grunted . ' [Thou]2774-thou art [[my]383-mahbub new horse - boy]6204-my new horse - boy . Go and bed among [[my]383-mahbub men]1048-my men . [They]1048-my men are near [the north end of [the station]4741-the station]6206-the north end of the station , with the horses . '[383-mahbub] ' [They]1048-my men will beat [me]383-mahbub to the south end of [the station]4741-the station if [I]383-mahbub come without authority . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub felt in [his]383-mahbub belt , wetted [his]383-mahbub thumb on a cake of Chinese ink , and dabbed the impression on a piece of soft native paper . From [Balkh]165-balkh to [[Bombay]60-bombay [men]752-men]2776-bombay men know that rough - ridged print with the old scar running diagonally across it . ' That is enough to show [[my]383-mahbub headman]6209-my headman . [I]383-mahbub come in the morning . '[383-mahbub] ' By [which road]6210-which road ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . ' By [the road]4566-the road from [the city]4596-the city . There is but one , and then [we]6213-we return to [Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton . [I]344-kim have saved [thee]752-men a beating . '[344-kim] ' [Allah]382-allah ! What is a beating when the very head is loose on the shoulders ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim slid out quietly into the night , walked half round [the house]797-the house , keeping close to the walls , and headed away from [the station]4741-the station for a mile or so . Then , fetching a wide compass , [he]344-kim worked back at leisure , for [he]344-kim needed time to invent a story if [any of [[Mahbub]383-mahbub 's retainers]2781-mahbub 's retainers]2780-any of mahbub 's retainers asked questions . [They]2782-they were camped on [a piece of waste ground beside [the railway]6000-the railway]2783-a piece of waste ground beside the railway , and , being [natives]2505-natives , had not , of course , unloaded the two trucks in which [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's animals stood among [a consignment of country - breds bought by [the [Bombay]60-bombay tram - company]2787-the bombay tram - company]2786-a consignment of country - breds bought by the bombay tram - company . [The headman]5039-the headman , [a broken - down , consumptive - looking Mohammedan]2789-a broken - down , consumptive - looking mohammedan , promptly challenged [Kim]344-kim , but was pacified at sight of [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's sign - manual . ' [The Hajji]388-hajji has of [his]388-hajji favour given [me]344-kim service , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim testily . ' If this be doubted , wait till [he]388-hajji comes in the morning . Meantime , a place by the fire . '[344-kim] Followed the usual aimless babble that [every low - caste native]2790-every low - caste native must raise on every occasion . It died down , and [Kim]344-kim lay out behind the little knot of [[Mahbub]383-mahbub 's followers]2791-mahbub 's followers , almost under the wheels of [a horse - truck]2792-a horse - truck , a borrowed blanket for covering . Now a bed among brickbats and ballast - refuse on a damp night , between overcrowded horses and [unwashed Baltis]2793-unwashed baltis , would not appeal to [many white boys]2794-many white boys ; but [Kim]344-kim was utterly happy . Change of scene , service , and surroundings were the breath of [his]344-kim little nostrils , and thinking of the neat white cots of [[St Xavier]495-st xavier 's all arow under [the punkah]2796-the punkah]2795-st xavier 's all arow under the punkah gave [him]344-kim joy as keen as the repetition of the multiplication - table in English . ' [I]344-kim am very old , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim thought sleepily . ' Every month [I]344-kim become a year more old . [I]344-kim was very young , and [a fool to boot]6214-a fool to boot , when [I]344-kim took [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's message to [Umballa]52-umballa . Even when [I]344-kim was with that white Regiment [I]344-kim was very young and small and had no wisdom . But now [I]344-kim learn every day , and in three years [the Colonel]757-the colonel will take [me]344-kim out of [the madrissah]164-the madrissah and let [me]344-kim go upon the Road with [Mahbub]383-mahbub hunting for horses '[344-kim] pedigrees , or maybe [I]0-i shall go by [myself]0-i ; or maybe [I]0-i shall find [the lama]868-the lama and go with [him]868-the lama . Yes ; that is best . To walk again as a chela with [[my]0-i lama]2421-my lama when [he]868-the lama comes back to [Benares]37-benares . ' The thoughts came more slowly and disconnectedly . [He]868-the lama was plunging into [a beautiful dreamland]6216-a beautiful dreamland when [his]868-the lama ears caught a whisper , thin and sharp , above the monotonous babble round the fire . It came from behind [the iron - skinned horse - truck]6217-the iron - skinned horse - truck . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama is not here , then ? ' '[868-the lama] Where should [he]868-the lama be but roystering in [the city]4596-the city . Who looks for a rat in [a frog - pond]2800-a frog - pond ? Come away . [He]868-the lama is not [[our]2801-our man]2802-our man . ' '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama must not go back beyond [the Passes]2803-the passes a second time . It is the order . ' '[2804-some woman] Hire [some woman]2804-some woman to drug [him]868-the lama . It is a few rupees only , and there is no evidence . ' '[766-the woman] Except [the woman]766-the woman . It must be more certain ; and remember the price upon [his]868-the lama head . ' '[766-the woman] Ay , but [the police]1665-the police have a long arm , and [we]2801-our are far from [the Border]59-the border . If it were in [Peshawur]55-peshawur , now ! ' '[55-peshawur] Yes - in [Peshawur]55-peshawur , ' [the second voice]6218-the second voice sneered . '[55-peshawur] [Peshawur]55-peshawur , full of [his]868-the lama blood - kin - full of bolt - holes and women behind whose clothes [he]868-the lama will hide . Yes , [Peshawur]55-peshawur or [Jehannum]407-jehannum would suit [us]2801-our equally well . ' '[407-jehannum] Then what is the plan ? ' '[2807-o fool] [O fool]2807-o fool , have [I]0-i not told it a hundred times ? Wait till [he]868-the lama comes to lie down , and then one sure shot . [The trucks]2808-the trucks are between [us]2801-our and pursuit . [We]2801-our have but to run back over the lines and go [our]2801-our way . [They]1665-the police will not see whence the shot came . Wait here at least till the dawn . What manner of fakir art [thou]2809-thou , to shiver at a little watching ? ' '[2809-thou] Oho ! ' thought [Kim]344-kim , behind close - shut eyes . '[2809-thou] Once again it is [Mahbub]383-mahbub . [Indeed a white stallion]2810-indeed a white stallion 's pedigree is not a good thing to peddle to [Sahibs]552-the sahibs ! Or maybe [Mahbub]383-mahbub has been selling other news . Now what is to do , [Kim]344-kim ? [I]0-i know not where [[Mahbub]383-mahbub houses]2811-mahbub houses , and if [he]868-the lama comes here before the dawn [they]1665-the police will shoot [him]868-the lama . That would be no profit for [thee]2812-thee , [Kim]344-kim . And this is not a matter for [the police]1665-the police . That would be no profit for [Mahbub]383-mahbub ; and ' - [he]0-i giggled almost aloud - '[0-i] [I]0-i do not remember any lesson at [Nucklao]127-nucklao which will help [me]0-i . Allah ! Here is [Kim]344-kim and [yonder]2814-yonder are [they]1665-the police . First , then , [Kim]344-kim must wake and go away , so that [they]1665-the police shall not suspect . A bad dream wakes [a man]750-a man - thus - ' [He]0-i threw the blanket off [his]0-i face , and raised [himself]0-i suddenly with the terrible , bubbling , meaningless yell of [the Asiatic roused by nightmare]6219-the asiatic roused by nightmare . '[750-a man] Urr - urr - urr - urr ! [Ya]2816-ya - la - la - la - la ! [Narain]394-luchman narain ! [The churel]2817-the churel ! [The churel]2817-the churel ! ' [A churel]6220-a churel is the peculiarly malignant ghost of [a woman who has died in child - bed]6221-a woman who has died in child - bed . [She]6220-a churel haunts [lonely roads]6222-lonely roads , [her]6220-a churel feet are turned backwards on the ankles , and [she]6220-a churel leads [men]752-men to torment . Louder rose [Kim]344-kim 's quavering howl , till at last [he]344-kim leaped to [his]344-kim feet and staggered off sleepily , while [the camp]2037-the camp cursed [him]344-kim for waking [them]752-men . Some twenty yards farther up the line [he]344-kim lay down again , taking care that [the whisperers]6225-the whisperers should hear [his]344-kim grunts and groans as [he]344-kim recomposed [himself]344-kim . After a few minutes [he]344-kim rolled towards [the road]4566-the road and stole away into the thick darkness . [He]344-kim paddled along swiftly till [he]344-kim came to a culvert , and dropped behind [it]6227-it , [his]344-kim chin on a level with the coping - stone . Here [he]344-kim could command all the night - traffic , [himself]344-kim unseen . [Two or three carts]6228-two or three carts passed , jingling out to [the suburbs]6229-the suburbs ; [a coughing policeman]6230-a coughing policeman and [a hurrying foot - passenger or two who sang to keep off evil spirits]6231-a hurrying foot - passenger or two who sang to keep off evil spirits . Then rapped the shod feet of a horse . '[2817-the churel] Ah ! This is more like [Mahbub]383-mahbub , ' thought [Kim]344-kim , as the beast shied at the little head above the culvert . '[383-mahbub] Ohe ' , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , '[2819-he] [he]2819-he whispered , ' have a care ! '[2819-he] The horse was reined back almost on its haunches , and forced towards [the culvert]2820-the culvert . ' Never again , '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub , ' will [I]383-mahbub take a shod horse for night- work . [They]6232-they pick up all the bones and nails in [the city]4596-the city . '[383-mahbub] [He]383-mahbub stooped to lift its forefoot , and that brought [his]383-mahbub head within a foot of [Kim]344-kim 's . ' Down - keep down , '[383-mahbub] [he]383-mahbub muttered . ' The night is full of eyes . '[383-mahbub] ' [Two men]1385-two men wait [thy]344-kim coming behind [the horse - trucks]6235-the horse - trucks . [They]1385-two men will shoot [thee]344-kim at [thy]344-kim lying down , because there is a price on [thy]344-kim head . [I]383-mahbub heard , sleeping near the horses . '[383-mahbub] ' Didst [thou]344-kim see [them]1385-two men ? ... Hold still , [Sire of Devils]6236-sire of devils ! '[383-mahbub] This furiously to the horse . ' No . '[383-mahbub] ' Was [one dressed belike as a fakir]6237-one dressed belike as a fakir ? '[383-mahbub] ' [One]385-holy one said to [the other]1360-the other , " What manner of [fakir]6239-fakir art [thou]344-kim , to shiver at a little watching ? " '[383-mahbub] ' Good . Go back to [the camp]2037-the camp and lie down . [I]383-mahbub do not die tonight . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub wheeled [his]383-mahbub horse and vanished . [Kim]344-kim tore back down [the ditch]2821-the ditch till [he]344-kim reached a point opposite [his]344-kim second resting - place , slipped across [the road]4566-the road like a weasel , and re - coiled [himself]344-kim in the blanket . ' At least [Mahbub]383-mahbub knows , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim thought contentedly . ' And certainly [he]383-mahbub spoke as one expecting it . [I]344-kim do not think [those two men]6241-those two men will profit by tonight 's watch . '[344-kim] An hour passed , and , with the best will in [the world]759-the world to keep awake all night , [he]344-kim slept deeply . Now and again [a night train]2824-a night train roared along the metals within twenty feet of [him]344-kim ; but [he]344-kim had all the [Oriental]530-oriental 's indifference to mere noise , and it did not even weave a dream through [his]344-kim slumber . [Mahbub]383-mahbub was anything but asleep . It annoyed [him]383-mahbub vehemently that [people outside [his]383-mahbub tribe]2825-people outside his tribe and unaffected by [his]383-mahbub casual amours should pursue [him]383-mahbub for the life . [His]383-mahbub first and natural impulse was to cross the line lower down , work up again , and , catching [[his]383-mahbub well - wishers]2826-his well - wishers from behind , summarily slay [them]2826-his well - wishers . Here , [he]383-mahbub reflected with sorrow , [another branch of [the Government]85-the government]2827-another branch of the government , totally unconnected with [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton , might demand explanations which would be hard to supply ; and [he]383-mahbub knew that south of [the Border]59-the border a perfectly ridiculous fuss is made about a corpse or so . [He]383-mahbub had not been troubled in this way since [he]383-mahbub sent [Kim]344-kim to [Umballa]52-umballa with the message , and hoped that suspicion had been finally diverted . Then a most brilliant notion struck [him]383-mahbub . ' [The English]346-the english do eternally tell the truth , '[383-mahbub] [he]383-mahbub said , ' therefore [we]6242-we of [this country]5119-this country are eternally made foolish . By [Allah]382-allah , [I]383-mahbub will tell the truth to [an Englishman]1107-an englishman ! Of what use is [the Government police]6245-the government police if [a poor Kabuli]6246-a poor kabuli be robbed of [his]6246-a poor kabuli horses in [[their]6246-a poor kabuli very trucks]6247-their very trucks . This is as bad as [Peshawur]55-peshawur ! [I]383-mahbub should lay a complaint at [the station]4741-the station . Better still , [some young Sahib on the Railway]6249-some young sahib on the railway ! [They]6249-some young sahib on the railway are zealous , and if [they]6249-some young sahib on the railway catch [thieves]4667-thieves it is remembered to [their]6249-some young sahib on the railway honour . '[383-mahbub] [He]383-mahbub tied up [his]383-mahbub horse outside [the station]4741-the station , and strode on to [the platform]4808-the platform . ' Hullo , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub '[2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line] said [a young Assistant District Traffic Superintendent who was waiting to go down the line]2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line - [a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen]2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen . ' What are [you]2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line doing here ? Selling weeds - eh ? '[2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen] ' No ; [I]2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line am not troubled for [my]2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line horses . [I]2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line come to look for [Lutuf Ullah]381-lutuf ullah . [I]2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line have a truck - load up [the line]6251-the line . Could [anyone]1036-anyone take [them]6253-them out without [the Railway]6000-the railway 's knowledge ? '[2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line] ' Should n't think so , [Mahbub]383-mahbub . [You]383-mahbub can claim against [us]6255-us if [they]6253-them do . '[2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen] ' [I]2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen have seen [two men]1385-two men crouching under the wheels of [one of the trucks]6257-one of the trucks nearly all night . [Fakirs]6258-fakirs do not steal horses , so [I]2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen gave [them]6258-fakirs no more thought . [I]2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen would find [Lutuf Ullah]381-lutuf ullah , [[my]2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen partner]6259-my partner . '[2831-a tall , tow- haired , horsey youth in dingy white linen] ' The deuce [you]2832-you did ? And [you]2832-you did n't bother [your]2832-you head about it ? '[2830-a young assistant district traffic superintendent who was waiting to go down the line] Pon [my]0-i word , it 's just almost as well that [I]0-i met [you]2832-you . What were [they]2833-they like , eh ? ' '[2833-they] [They]2833-they were [only fakirs]2834-only fakirs . [They]2833-they will no more than take a little grain , perhaps , from one of [the trucks]2808-the trucks . There are many up the line . [The State]1591-the state will never miss the dole . [I]0-i came here seeking for [[my]0-i partner]6259-my partner , [Lutuf Ullah]381-lutuf ullah . ' '[381-lutuf ullah] Never mind [[your]0-i partner]2838-your partner . Where are [your]0-i [horse - trucks]2839-horse - trucks ? ' '[2839-horse - trucks] A little to this side of the farthest place where [they]2839-horse - trucks make lamps for [the trains]4565-the trains . ' '[2839-horse - trucks] [The signal - box]2841-the signal - box ! Yes . ' '[2839-horse - trucks] And upon the rail nearest to [the road]4566-the road upon the right - hand side - looking up the line thus . But as regards [Lutuf Ullah]381-lutuf ullah - [a tall man with a broken nose]2843-a tall man with a broken nose , and [a Persian greyhound Aie]2844-a persian greyhound aie ! ' [The boy]986-the boy had hurried off to wake up [a young and enthusiastic policeman]6261-a young and enthusiastic policeman ; for , as [he]6261-a young and enthusiastic policeman said , [the Railway]6000-the railway had suffered much from depredations in [the goods - yard]4730-the goods - yard . [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub chuckled in [his]383-mahbub dyed beard . '[2845-they] [They]2845-they will walk in [their]2845-they boots , making a noise , and then [they]2845-they will wonder why there are [no fakirs]2846-no fakirs . [They]2845-they are [very clever boys]2847-very clever boys - [Barton Sahib]531-sahib and [Young Sahib]532-young sahib . ' [He]383-mahbub waited idly for a few minutes , expecting to see [them]2845-they hurry up [the line girt]6264-the line girt for action . A light engine slid through [the station]4741-the station , and [he]383-mahbub caught a glimpse of [young Barton]531-sahib in [the cab]6266-the cab . '[0-i] [I]0-i did [that child]2848-that child an injustice . [He]2848-that child is not altogether [a fool]5333-a fool , ' said [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub . '[2848-that child] To take [a fire - carriage]2850-a fire - carriage for [a thief]2127-a thief is a new game ! ' When [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub came to [[his]383-mahbub camp]6267-his camp in the dawn , [no one]786-no one thought it worth while to tell [him]383-mahbub any news of the night . [No one]786-no one , at least , but [one small horseboy , newly advanced to [the great man]1485-the great man 's service]6270-one small horseboy , newly advanced to the great man 's service , whom [Mahbub]383-mahbub called to [[his]383-mahbub tiny tent]6272-his tiny tent to assist in some packing . '[2848-that child] It is all known to [me]0-i , ' whispered [Kim]344-kim , bending above saddlebags . '[2848-that child] [Two Sahibs]2852-two sahibs came up on [a te - train]2853-a te - train . [I]0-i was running to and fro in the dark on this side of [the trucks]2808-the trucks as [the te - train]2855-the te - train moved up and down slowly . [They]2852-two sahibs fell upon [two men sitting under this truck]2856-two men sitting under this truck - [Hajji]388-hajji , what shall [I]0-i do with this lump of tobacco ? Wrap it in paper and put it under the salt - bag ? Yes - and struck [them]2852-two sahibs down . But [one man]2857-one man struck at a [Sahib]531-sahib with a fakir 's buck 's horn ' [Kim]344-kim meant the conjoined black - buck horns , which are [a fakir]6273-a fakir 's sole temporal weapon - '[2857-one man] the blood came . So [the other Sahib]2858-the other sahib , first smiting [[his]2858-the other sahib own man]2859-his own man senseless , smote the stabber with a short gun which had rolled from [the first man]2860-the first man 's hand . [They]2852-two sahibs all raged as though mad together . ' [Mahbub]383-mahbub smiled with heavenly resignation . '[2852-two sahibs] No ! That is not so much dewanee madness , or a case for [the civil court]2861-the civil court - the word can be punned upon both ways as nizamut a criminal case . A gun , sayest [thou]2862-thou ? Ten good years in [jail]2416-jail . ' '[2862-thou] Then [they]2852-two sahibs both lay still , but [I]0-i think [they]2852-two sahibs were nearly dead when [they]2852-two sahibs were put on [the te - train]2855-the te - train . [Their]2852-two sahibs heads moved thus . And there is much blood on the line . Come and see ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i have seen blood before . [Jail]2416-jail is [the sure place]2866-the sure place - and assuredly [they]2852-two sahibs will give false names , and assuredly [no man]5156-no man will find [them]2852-two sahibs for a long time . [They]2852-two sahibs were unfriends of mine . [Thy]2868-thy fate and [mine]0-i seem on one string . What a tale for [the healer of pearls]2721-the healer of pearls ! Now swiftly with the saddle - bags and the cooking - platter . [We]2870-we will take out the horses and away to [Simla]159-simla . ' Swiftly - as [Orientals]399-orientals understand speed - with long explanations , with abuse and windy talk , carelessly , amid a hundred checks for little things forgotten , [the untidy camp]6274-the untidy camp broke up and led the half- dozen stiff and fretful horses along [the Kalka road]6132-the kalka road in the fresh of the rain - swept dawn . [Kim]344-kim , regarded as [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's favourite by all who wished to stand well with [the Pathan]533-the pathan , was not called upon to work . [They]2852-two sahibs strolled on by the easiest of stages , halting every few hours at [a wayside shelter]6276-a wayside shelter . [Very many Sahibs]6277-very many sahibs travel along [the Kalka road]6132-the kalka road ; and , as [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub says , [every young Sahib]6279-every young sahib must needs esteem [himself]6279-every young sahib [a judge of a horse]6280-a judge of a horse , and , though [he]6279-every young sahib be over head in debt to [the money - lender]4771-the money - lender , must make as if to buy . That was the reason that [Sahib]531-sahib after [Sahib]531-sahib , rolling along in [a stage - carriage]6282-a stage - carriage , would stop and open talk . [Some]6283-some would even descend from [[their]6283-some vehicles]6284-their vehicles and feel the horses '[2870-we] legs ; asking inane questions , or , through sheer ignorance of the vernacular , grossly insulting [the imperturbable trader]2871-the imperturbable trader . ' When first [I]383-mahbub dealt with [Sahibs]552-the sahibs , and that was when [Colonel Soady Sahib]534-colonel soady sahib was [Governor of [Fort Abazai]169-fort abazai]6285-governor of fort abazai and flooded [the Commissioner]6286-the commissioner 's camping - ground for spite , '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub confided to [Kim]344-kim as [the boy]986-the boy filled [his]986-the boy pipe under a tree , ' [I]383-mahbub did not know how greatly [they]552-the sahibs were [fools]2559-fools , and this made [me]383-mahbub wroth . As thus - , '[383-mahbub] and [he]383-mahbub told [Kim]344-kim a tale of an expression , misused in all innocence , that doubled [Kim]344-kim up with mirth . ' Now [I]383-mahbub see , however , '[383-mahbub] - [he]383-mahbub exhaled smoke slowly - ' that it is with [them]552-the sahibs as with [all men]4849-all men - in certain matters [they]552-the sahibs are wise , and in others most foolish . Very foolish it is to use the wrong word to [a stranger]857-a stranger ; for though the heart may be clean of offence , how is [the stranger]1130-the stranger to know that ? [He]1130-the stranger is more like to search truth with a dagger . '[383-mahbub] ' True . True talk , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim solemnly . ' [Fools]2559-fools speak of a cat when [a woman]1192-a woman is brought to bed , for instance . [I]344-kim have heard [them]2559-fools . '[344-kim] ' Therefore , in one situate as [thou]383-mahbub art , it particularly behoves [thee]383-mahbub to remember this with both kinds of faces . Among [Sahibs]552-the sahibs , never forgetting [thou]383-mahbub art [a Sahib]5596-a sahib ; among [the folk of [Hind]70-hind]6294-the folk of hind , always remembering [thou]383-mahbub art - '[383-mahbub] [He]383-mahbub paused , with a puzzled smile . ' What am [I]383-mahbub ? [Mussalman]456-mussalman , [Hindu]6295-hindu , [Jain]6296-jain , or [Buddhist]6297-buddhist ? That is a hard knot . '[383-mahbub] ' [Thou]383-mahbub art beyond question [an unbeliever]6298-an unbeliever , and therefore [thou]383-mahbub wilt be damned . So says [my]383-mahbub Law - or [I]383-mahbub think it does . But [thou]383-mahbub art also [my]383-mahbub Little Friend of all [the World]14-the world , and [I]383-mahbub love [thee]383-mahbub . So says [my]383-mahbub heart . This matter of creeds is like horseflesh . [The wise man]6299-the wise man knows horses are good - that there is a profit to be made from all ; and for [myself]383-mahbub - but that [I]383-mahbub am [a good Sunni]6300-a good sunni and hate [the men of [Tirah]170-tirah]6301-the men of tirah - [I]383-mahbub could believe the same of all the Faiths . Now manifestly [a Kathiawar mare taken from the sands of [[her]6302-a kathiawar mare taken from the sands of her birthplace and removed to the west of bengal founders birthplace]6303-her birthplace and removed to [the west of [Bengal]171-bengal founders]6304-the west of bengal founders]6302-a kathiawar mare taken from the sands of her birthplace and removed to the west of bengal founders - nor is even a Balkh stallion and there are no better horses than [those of [Balkh]165-balkh]6305-those of balkh , were [they]6305-those of balkh not so heavy in the shoulder of any account in [the great Northern deserts beside the snow - camels [I]383-mahbub have seen]6306-the great northern deserts beside the snow - camels i have seen . Therefore [I]383-mahbub say in [my]383-mahbub heart the Faiths are like the horses . Each has merit in [its own country]6307-its own country . '[383-mahbub] ' But [[my]344-kim lama]2421-my lama said altogether a different thing . '[344-kim] ' Oh , [he]2421-my lama is [an old dreamer of dreams from [Bhotiyal]172-bhotiyal]6309-an old dreamer of dreams from bhotiyal . [My]383-mahbub heart is a little angry , Friend of all [the World]759-the world , that [thou]6311-thou shouldst see such worth in [a man so little known]6312-a man so little known . '[383-mahbub] ' It is true , [Hajji]388-hajji ; but that worth do [I]383-mahbub see , and to [him]2421-my lama [my]383-mahbub heart is drawn . '[383-mahbub] ' And [his]2421-my lama to thine , [I]344-kim hear . [Hearts]535-hearts are like horses . [They]535-hearts come and [they]535-hearts go against bit or spur . [Shout Gul Sher Khan]536-shout gul sher khan yonder to drive in [that bay stallion 's pickets]6313-that bay stallion 's pickets more firmly . [We]6314-we do not want a horse- fight at every resting - stage , and [the dun]6315-the dun and the black will be locked in a little ... Now hear [me]344-kim . Is it necessary to the comfort of [thy]6311-thou heart to see [that lama]1059-that lama ? '[344-kim] ' It is one part of [my]344-kim bond , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . ' If [I]344-kim do not see [him]1059-that lama , and if [he]1059-that lama is taken from [me]344-kim , [I]344-kim will go out of [that madrissah]6317-that madrissah in [Nucklao]127-nucklao and , and - once gone , who is to find [me]344-kim again ? '[344-kim] ' It is true . Never was [colt held on a lighter heel - rope]6318-colt held on a lighter heel - rope than [thou]6319-thou . '[344-kim] [Mahbub]383-mahbub nodded [his]383-mahbub head . ' Do not be afraid . '[383-mahbub] [Kim]344-kim spoke as though [he]383-mahbub could have vanished on the moment . ' [[My]383-mahbub lama]2421-my lama has said that [he]1059-that lama will come to see [me]383-mahbub at [the madrissah]2740-the madrissah - '[383-mahbub] ' [A beggar]1196-a beggar and [his]1059-that lama bowl in the presence of [those young Sa]6323-those young sa - '[344-kim] ' Not all ! '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim cut in with a snort . ' [Their]6323-those young sa eyes are blued and [their]6323-those young sa nails are blackened with low - caste blood , many of them . [Sons of [mehteranees]6325-mehteranees]6324-sons of mehteranees - [brothers - in - law]6326-brothers - in - law to [the bhungi sweeper]6327-the bhungi sweeper . '[344-kim] [We]2873-we need not follow the rest of the pedigree ; but [Kim]344-kim made [his]344-kim little point clearly and without heat , chewing a piece of sugar- cane the while . ' Friend of all [the World]14-the world , '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub , pushing over the pipe for [the boy]986-the boy to clean , ' [I]383-mahbub have met [many men]5386-many men , [women]4700-women , and [boys]856-boys , and [not a few Sahibs]6331-not a few sahibs . [I]383-mahbub have never in all [my]383-mahbub days met such an imp as [thou]6332-thou art . '[383-mahbub] ' And why ? When [I]344-kim always tell [thee]6332-thou the truth . '[344-kim] ' Perhaps the very reason , for this is a world of danger to [honest men]6333-honest men . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub hauled [himself]383-mahbub off the ground , girt in [his]383-mahbub belt , and went over to the horses . ' Or sell it ? '[344-kim] There was that in the tone that made [Mahbub]383-mahbub halt and turn . ' What new devilry ? '[344-kim] ' Eight annas , and [I]344-kim will tell , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , grinning . '[383-mahbub] ' Seeing [they]6334-the thieves in the dark sought [my]344-kim life , [I]344-kim have not altogether forgotten . Why ? '[383-mahbub] ' No need - Pathan . '[537-mahbub] said [Mahbub Ah]537-mahbub . ' Wilt [thou]6332-thou some day sell [my]537-mahbub head for a few sweetmeats if the fit takes [thee]6332-thou ? '[537-mahbub] [Kim]344-kim will remember till [he]344-kim dies that long , lazy journey from [Umballa]52-umballa , through [Kalka]173-kalka and [the Pinjore Gardens near by]2875-the pinjore gardens near by , up to [Simla]159-simla . A sudden spate in [the Gugger River]174-the gugger river swept down one horse the most valuable , be sure , and nearly drowned [Kim]344-kim among the dancing boulders . Farther up [the road]4566-the road [the horses]2877-the horses were stampeded by [a Government elephant]2878-a government elephant , and being in high condition of grass food , it cost a day and a half to get [them]2877-the horses together again . Then [they]2877-the horses met [Sikandar Khan]396-sikandar khan coming down with a few unsaleable screws - remnants of [his]396-sikandar khan string - and [Mahbub]537-mahbub , who has more of horse - coping in [his]537-mahbub little fingernail than [Sikandar Khan]396-sikandar khan in all [[his]537-mahbub tents]2879-his tents , must needs buy two of the worst , and that meant eight hours ' laborious diplomacy and untold tobacco . But it was all pure delight - [the wandering road]6340-the wandering road , climbing , dipping , and sweeping about the growing spurs ; the flush of the morning laid along the distant snows ; the branched cacti , tier upon tier on [the stony hillsides]6341-the stony hillsides ; the voices of a thousand water - channels ; the chatter of [the monkeys]6342-the monkeys ; [the solemn deodars]6343-the solemn deodars , climbing one after another with down - drooped branches ; the vista of [the Plains]175-the plains rolled out far beneath [them]2877-the horses ; the incessant twanging of the tonga - horns and the wild rush of the led horses when a tonga swung round a curve ; the halts for prayers [Mahbub]537-mahbub was very religious in dry - washings and bellowings when time did not press ; the evening conferences by the halting - places , when camels and bullocks chewed solemnly together and [the stolid drivers]6344-the stolid drivers told the news of [the Road]4566-the road - all these things lifted [Kim]344-kim 's heart to song within [him]344-kim . '[537-mahbub] But , when the singing and dancing is done , ' said [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , '[534-colonel soady sahib] comes [the Colonel Sahib]534-colonel soady sahib 's , and that is not so sweet . ' '[534-colonel soady sahib] [A fair land]2880-a fair land - [a most beautiful land is this of [Hind]70-hind]2881-a most beautiful land is this of hind - and [the land of [the Five Rivers]176-the five rivers]2882-the land of the five rivers is fairer than all , ' [Kim]344-kim half chanted . '[0-i] Into it [I]0-i will go again if [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub or [the Colonel]757-the colonel lift hand or foot against [me]0-i . Once gone , who shall find [me]0-i ? Look , [Hajji]388-hajji , is [yonder]2884-yonder [the city of Simla]2885-the city of simla ? [Allah]382-allah , what [a city]2886-a city ! ' '[2887-my father 's brother] [[My]0-i father 's brother]2887-my father 's brother , and [he]2887-my father 's brother was [an old man]831-an old man when [Mackerson Sahib]538-mackerson sahib 's well was new at [Peshawur]55-peshawur , could recall when there were but [two houses in [it]2890-it]2889-two houses in it . ' [He]383-mahbub led the horses below [the main road]5082-the main road into [the lower Simla bazar]6347-the lower simla bazar - [the crowded rabbit - warren that climbs up from [the valley]6349-the valley to [the Town Hall at an angle of forty - five]6350-the town hall at an angle of forty - five]6348-the crowded rabbit - warren that climbs up from the valley to the town hall at an angle of forty - five . [A man who knows [his]6351-a man who knows his way there way [there]4784-there]6351-a man who knows his way there can defy [all the police of [[India]8-india 's summer capital]6354-india 's summer capital]6353-all the police of india 's summer capital , so cunningly does [veranda]6355-veranda communicate with [veranda]6355-veranda , alley - way with alley - way , and bolt - hole with bolt - hole . Here live [those who minister to the wants of [the glad city]6358-the glad city]6357-those who minister to the wants of the glad city - jhampanis who pull [the pretty ladies]6359-the pretty ladies '[538-mackerson sahib] ' rickshaws by night and gamble till the dawn ; [grocers]6360-grocers , [oil - sellers]6361-oil - sellers , [curio - vendors]6362-curio - vendors , [firewood - dealers]6363-firewood - dealers , [priests]5362-priests , [pickpockets]6365-pickpockets , and [native employees of [the Government]852-the government]6366-native employees of the government . Here are discussed by [courtesans]6368-courtesans the things which are supposed to be profoundest secrets of [the India Council]6369-the india council ; and here gather [all the sub - sub - agents of [half the Native States]6371-half the native states]6370-all the sub - sub - agents of half the native states . Here , too , [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub rented [a room]6372-a room , much more securely locked than [his]383-mahbub bulkhead at [Lahore]11-lahore , in [the house of [a Mohammedan cattle - dealer]6374-a mohammedan cattle - dealer]6373-the house of a mohammedan cattle - dealer . It was [a place of miracles]6375-a place of miracles , too , for there went in at twilight a Mohammedan horseboy , and there came out an hour later [a Eurasian lad]6376-a eurasian lad - [the Lucknow girl]6377-the lucknow girl 's dye was of the best - in badly- fitting shop - clothes . '[0-i] [I]0-i have spoken with [Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton , ' quoth [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , '[0-i] and a second time has [the Hand of Friendship]2705-the hand of friendship averted the Whip of Calamity . '[539-lurgan sahib] Chapter 9 S ' doaks was [son of Yelth the wise - Chief of [the Raven clan]6387-the raven clan]542-son of yelth the wise - chief of the raven clan . Oregon Legend [Kim]344-kim flung [himself]344-kim whole - heartedly upon the next turn of the wheel . [He]344-kim would be [a Sahib]5596-a sahib again for a while . In that idea , so soon as [he]344-kim had reached [the broad road under [Simla Town Hall]180-simla town hall]6391-the broad road under simla town hall , [he]344-kim cast about for one to impress . [A Hindu child , some ten years old]6392-a hindu child , some ten years old , squatted under a lamp - post . '[539-lurgan sahib] Where is [[Mr Lurgan]544-mr lurgan 's house]2899-mr lurgan 's house ? ' demanded [Kim]344-kim . '[0-i] [I]0-i do not understand English , ' was the answer , and [Kim]344-kim shifted [his]344-kim speech accordingly . '[0-i] [I]0-i will show . ' Together [they]6393-they set off through the mysterious dusk , full of the noises of [[a city]2886-a city below [the hillside]6396-the hillside]6395-a city below the hillside , and the breath of a cool wind in deodar - crowned [Jakko]181-jakko , shouldering the stars . [The house - lights , scattered on every level]6397-the house - lights , scattered on every level , made , as it were , a double firmament . Some were fixed , others belonged to the '[0-i] rickshaws of [the careless , open - spoken English folk]2900-the careless , open - spoken english folk , going out to dinner . ' [It]6397-the house - lights , scattered on every level is here , '[344-kim] said [[Kim]344-kim 's guide]2901-kim 's guide , and halted in [a veranda flush with [the main road]5082-the main road]2902-a veranda flush with the main road . No door stayed [them]2904-them , but a curtain of beaded reeds that split up the lamplight beyond . ' [He]2907-a black - bearded man is come , '[986-the boy] said [the boy]986-the boy , in a voice little louder than a sigh , and vanished . [Kim]344-kim felt sure that [the boy]986-the boy had been posted to guide [him]344-kim from the first , but , putting a bold face on it , parted the curtain . [A black - bearded man]2907-a black - bearded man , with a green shade over [his]2907-a black - bearded man eyes , sat at a table , and , one by one , with short , white hands , picked up globules of light from a tray before [him]2907-a black - bearded man , threaded them on a glancing silken string , and hummed to [himself]2907-a black - bearded man the while . [Kim]344-kim was conscious that beyond the circle of light [the room]2908-the room was full of things that smelt like [all the temples of [all the East]2910-all the east]2909-all the temples of all the east . A whiff of musk , a puff of sandal - wood , and a breath of sickly jessamine - oil caught [his]344-kim opened nostrils . ' [I]344-kim am here , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim at last , speaking in the vernacular : the smells made [him]344-kim forget that [he]344-kim was to be [a Sahib]539-lurgan sahib . ' [Seventy - nine , eighty , eighty - one]6398-seventy - nine , eighty , eighty - one , '[4471-the man] [the man]4471-the man counted to [himself]4471-the man , stringing pearl after pearl so quickly that [Kim]344-kim could scarcely follow [his]4471-the man fingers . [He]4471-the man slid off the green shade and looked fixedly at [Kim]344-kim for a full half - minute . The pupils of the eye dilated and closed to pin - pricks , as if at will . There was [a fakir by the Taksali Gate who had just this gift and made money by it]2912-a fakir by the taksali gate who had just this gift and made money by it , especially when cursing [silly women]2913-silly women . [Kim]344-kim stared with interest . [[His]344-kim disreputable friend]2914-his disreputable friend could further twitch [his]4471-the man ears , almost like a goat , and [Kim]344-kim was disappointed that [this new man]2915-this new man could not imitate [him]4471-the man . ' Do not be afraid , '[539-lurgan sahib] said [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib suddenly . ' Why should [I]539-lurgan sahib fear ? '[539-lurgan sahib] ' [Thou]6399-thou wilt sleep here tonight , and stay with [me]539-lurgan sahib till it is time to go again to [Nucklao]127-nucklao . It is an order . '[539-lurgan sahib] ' It is an order , '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim repeated . ' But where shall [I]344-kim sleep ? '[344-kim] ' Here , in [this room]6400-this room . '[539-lurgan sahib] [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib waved [his]539-lurgan sahib hand towards the darkness behind [him]539-lurgan sahib . ' So be it , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim composedly . ' Now ? '[344-kim] [He]344-kim nodded and held the lamp above [his]344-kim head . As the light swept [them]2916-them , there leaped out from the walls a collection of Tibetan devil - dance masks , hanging above the fiend - embroidered draperies of those ghastly functions - horned masks , scowling masks , and masks of idiotic terror . In a corner , [a Japanese warrior]2917-a japanese warrior , mailed and plumed , menaced [him]344-kim with a halberd , and a score of lances and khandas and kuttars gave back the unsteady gleam . But what interested [Kim]344-kim more than all these things - [he]344-kim had seen devil - dance masks at [the Lahore Museum]182-the lahore museum - was a glimpse of [the soft - eyed Hindu child who had left [him]344-kim in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on [his]344-kim scarlet lips]2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips . ' [I]2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips think that [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib wishes to make [me]2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips afraid . And [I]2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips am sure that [that devil 's brat below the table]6401-that devil 's brat below the table wishes to see [me]2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips afraid . '[2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips] [This place]2919-this place , ' [he]2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips said aloud , '[2918-the soft - eyed hindu child who had left him in the doorway , sitting cross - legged under the table of pearls with a little smile on his scarlet lips] is like [a Wonder House]2920-a wonder house . Where is [[my]0-i bed]2921-my bed ? ' [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib pointed to a native quilt in a corner by the loathsome masks , picked up the lamp , and left [the room]2908-the room black . '[539-lurgan sahib] Was that [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib ? ' [Kim]344-kim asked as [he]344-kim cuddled down . No answer . [He]344-kim could hear [the Hindu boy]6403-the hindu boy breathing , however , and , guided by the sound , crawled across the floor , and cuffed into the darkness , crying : '[539-lurgan sahib] Give answer , [devil]2922-devil ! Is this the way to lie to [a Sahib]5596-a sahib ? ' From the darkness [he]344-kim fancied [he]344-kim could hear the echo of a chuckle . It could not be [[his]344-kim soft - fleshed companion]6404-his soft - fleshed companion , because [he]344-kim was weeping . So [Kim]344-kim lifted up [his]344-kim voice and called aloud : '[539-lurgan sahib] [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib ! O [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib ! Is it an order that [[thy]2924-thy servant]2925-thy servant does not speak to [me]0-i ? ' '[2925-thy servant] It is an order . ' The voice came from behind [him]344-kim and [he]344-kim started . '[2925-thy servant] Very good . But remember , ' [he]0-i muttered , as [he]0-i resought the quilt , '[0-i] [I]0-i will beat [thee]2924-thy in the morning . [I]0-i do not love [Hindus]359-hindus . ' That was no cheerful night ; [the room]2908-the room being overfull of voices and music . [Kim]344-kim was waked twice by [someone]4966-someone calling [his]344-kim name . The second time [he]344-kim set out in search , and ended by bruising [his]344-kim nose against a box that certainly spoke with a human tongue , but in no sort of human accent . It seemed to end in a tin trumpet and to be joined by wires to a smaller box on the floor - so far , at least , as [he]344-kim could judge by touch . And the voice , very hard and whirring , came out of the trumpet . [Kim]344-kim rubbed [his]344-kim nose and grew furious , thinking , as usual , in Hindi . '[0-i] This with [a beggar from [the bazar]729-the bazar]2926-a beggar from the bazar might be good , but - [I]0-i am [a Sahib]5596-a sahib and [the son of [a Sahib]5596-a sahib]5595-the son of a sahib and , which is twice as much more beside , [a student of [Nucklao]127-nucklao]2931-a student of nucklao . Yess ' here [he]344-kim turned to English , '[2932-a boy of st xavier] [a boy of [St Xavier]495-st xavier]2932-a boy of st xavier 's . [Damn Mr Lurgan]544-mr lurgan 's eyes ! - It is some sort of machinery like a sewing - machine . Oh , it is a great cheek of [him]2933-he - [we]2934-we are not frightened that way at [Lucknow]121-lucknow - No ! ' Then in Hindi : '[2933-he] But what does [he]2933-he gain ? [He]2933-he is only [a trader]2935-a trader - [I]0-i am in [[his]2933-he shop]4476-his shop . But [Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton is [a Colonel]738-a colonel - and [I]0-i think [Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton gave orders that it should be done . How [I]0-i will beat [that Hindu]2938-that hindu in the morning ! What is this ? ' The trumpet - box was pouring out a string of the most elaborate abuse that even [Kim]344-kim had ever heard , in a high uninterested voice , that for a moment lifted the short hairs of [his]344-kim neck . When [the vile thing]6407-the vile thing drew breath , [Kim]344-kim was reassured by the soft , sewing - machine- like whirr . '[545-chup] Chup ! Be still ' [he]344-kim cried , and again [he]344-kim heard a chuckle that decided [him]344-kim . '[545-chup] [Chup]545-chup - or [I]0-i break [your]0-i head . ' The box took no heed . [Kim]344-kim wrenched at the tin trumpet and something lifted with a click . [He]344-kim had evidently raised a lid . If there were a devil inside , now was its time , for - [he]344-kim sniffed -thus did the sewing - machines of the bazar smell . [He]344-kim would clean that shaitan . [He]344-kim slipped off [his]344-kim jacket , and plunged it into the box 's mouth . Something long and round bent under the pressure , there was a whirr and the voice stopped - as voices must if [you]6408-you ram a thrice - doubled coat on to the wax cylinder and into the works of an expensive phonograph . [Kim]344-kim finished [his]344-kim slumbers with a serene mind . In the morning [he]344-kim was aware of [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib looking down on [him]344-kim . '[0-i] Oah ! ' said [Kim]344-kim , firmly resolved to cling to [his]344-kim Sahib - dom . '[0-i] There was a box in the night that gave [me]0-i bad talk . So [I]0-i stopped it . Was it [[your]0-i box]2939-your box ? ' [The man]4471-the man held out [his]4471-the man hand . '[0-i] Shake hands , [O'Hara]347-o'hara , ' [he]4471-the man said . '[347-o'hara] Yes , it was [[my]0-i box]2940-my box . [I]0-i keep such things because [[my]0-i friends]1569-my friends [the Rajahs]2942-the rajahs like [them]2943-them . [That one]5323-that one is broken , but it was cheap at the price . Yes , [[my]0-i friends]1569-my friends , [the Kings]2946-the kings , are very fond of toys - and so am [I]0-i sometimes . ' [Kim]344-kim looked [him]4471-the man over out of the corners of [his]344-kim eyes . [He]4471-the man was [a Sahib]5596-a sahib in that [he]4471-the man wore [Sahib]539-lurgan sahib 's clothes ; the accent of [his]4471-the man Urdu , the intonation of [his]4471-the man English , showed that [he]4471-the man was anything but [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . [He]4471-the man seemed to understand what moved in [Kim]344-kim 's mind ere [the boy]986-the boy opened [his]986-the boy mouth , and [he]4471-the man took no pains to explain [himself]4471-the man as did [Father Victor]452-father victor or [the Lucknow masters]6413-the lucknow masters . Sweetest of all - [he]0-i treated [Kim]344-kim as [an equal on the Asiatic side]6414-an equal on the asiatic side . '[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry [you]0-i can not beat [[my]0-i boy]5796-my boy this morning . [He]5796-my boy says [he]5796-my boy will kill [you]0-i with a knife or poison . ' Now [a genuine imported Sahib from [England]114-england]6415-a genuine imported sahib from england would have made a great to - do over this tale .
