[The back veranda of [the shop]960-the shop]6417-the back veranda of the shop was built out over [the sheer hillside]6419-the sheer hillside , and [they]6420-they looked down into [[their]6420-they neighbours]6421-their neighbours '[5796-my boy] chimney - pots , as is the custom of [Simla]159-simla . But even more than the purely Persian meal cooked by [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib with [his]539-lurgan sahib own hands , [the shop]960-the shop fascinated [Kim]344-kim . [The Lahore Museum]723-the lahore museum was larger , but here were more wonders - ghost- daggers and prayer - wheels from [Tibet]22-tibet ; turquoise and raw amber necklaces ; green jade bangles ; curiously packed incense - sticks in jars crusted over with raw garnets ; the devil - masks of overnight and a wall full of peacock - blue draperies ; gilt figures of [Buddha]360-god , and little portable lacquer altars ; Russian samovars with turquoises on the lid ; egg - shell china sets in quaint octagonal cane boxes ; yellow ivory crucifixes - from [Japan]183-japan of [all places in [the world]759-the world]2950-all places in the world , so [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib said ; carpets in dusty bales , smelling atrociously , pushed back behind torn and rotten screens of geometrical work ; Persian water - jugs for the hands after meals ; dull copper incense - burners neither Chinese nor Persian , with friezes of fantastic devils running round them ; tarnished silver belts that knotted like raw hide ; hairpins of jade , ivory , and plasma ; arms of all sorts and kinds , and a thousand other oddments were cased , or piled , or merely thrown into [the room]2908-the room , leaving a clear space only round the rickety deal table , where [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib worked . ' Those things are nothing , '[2953-his host] said [[his]539-lurgan sahib host]2953-his host , following [Kim]344-kim 's glance . ' [I]2953-his host buy them because they are pretty , and sometimes [I]2953-his host sell - if [I]2953-his host like [the buyer]6422-the buyer 's look . [My]2953-his host work is on the table - some of it . '[2953-his host] It blazed in the morning light - all red and blue and green flashes , picked out with the vicious blue - white spurt of a diamond here and there . [Kim]344-kim opened [his]344-kim eyes . ' Oh , they are quite well , those stones . It will not hurt [them]6423-them to take the sun . Besides , they are cheap . But with sick stones it is very different . '[539-lurgan sahib] [He]539-lurgan sahib piled [Kim]344-kim 's plate anew . ' There is [no one]786-no one but [me]539-lurgan sahib can doctor a sick pearl and re - blue turquoises . [I]539-lurgan sahib grant [you]344-kim opals - [any fool]6425-any fool can cure an opal - but for a sick pearl there is only [me]539-lurgan sahib . Suppose [I]539-lurgan sahib were to die ! Then there would be [no one]786-no one ... Oh no ! [You]344-kim can not do anything with jewels . It will be quite enough if [you]344-kim understand a little about the Turquoise - some day . '[539-lurgan sahib] [He]539-lurgan sahib moved to the end of [the veranda]765-the veranda to refill the heavy , porous clay water - jug from the filter . ' Do [you]344-kim want drink ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim nodded . [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib , fifteen feet off , laid one hand on the jar . Next instant , it stood at [Kim]344-kim 's elbow , full to within half an inch of the brim - the white cloth only showing , by a small wrinkle , where it had slid into place . ' Wah ! '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim in most utter amazement . ' That is magic . '[344-kim] [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib 's smile showed that the compliment had gone [home]743-home . ' Throw it back . '[539-lurgan sahib] ' It will break . '[344-kim] ' [I]344-kim say , throw it back . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim pitched it at random . It fell short and crashed into fifty pieces , while the water dripped through the rough veranda boarding . ' [I]344-kim said it would break . '[344-kim] ' All one . Look at it . Look at the largest piece . '[344-kim] That lay with a sparkle of water in its curve , as it were a star on the floor . [Kim]344-kim looked intently . [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib laid one hand gently on the nape of [his]344-kim neck , stroked it twice or thrice , and whispered : ' Look ! It shall come to life again , piece by piece . First the big piece shall join itself to two others on the right and the left - on the right and the left . Look ! '[539-lurgan sahib] To save [his]344-kim life , [Kim]344-kim could not have turned [his]344-kim head . The light touch held [him]344-kim as in a vice , and [his]344-kim blood tingled pleasantly through [him]344-kim . There was one large piece of the jar where there had been three , and above them the shadowy outline of the entire vessel . [He]344-kim could see [the veranda]765-the veranda through it , but it was thickening and darkening with each beat of [his]344-kim pulse . Yet the jar - how slowly the thoughts came ! - the jar had been smashed before [his]344-kim eyes . Another wave of prickling fire raced down [his]344-kim neck , as [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib moved [his]539-lurgan sahib hand . ' Look ! It is coming into shape , '[539-lurgan sahib] said [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib . So far [Kim]344-kim had been thinking in Hindi , but a tremor came on [him]344-kim , and with an effort like that of [a swimmer before sharks]2957-a swimmer before sharks , who hurls [himself]2957-a swimmer before sharks half out of the water , [his]344-kim mind leaped up from a darkness that was swallowing it and took refuge in - the multiplication- table in English ! ' Look ! It is coming into shape , '[539-lurgan sahib] whispered [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib . The jar had been smashed - yess , smashed - not the native word , [he]344-kim would not think of that - but smashed - into fifty pieces , and twice three was six , and thrice three was nine , and four times three was twelve . [He]344-kim clung desperately to the repetition . The shadow - outline of the jar cleared like a mist after rubbing eyes . There were the broken shards ; there was the spilt water drying in the sun , and through the cracks of [the veranda]765-the veranda showed , all ribbed , [the white house]2959-the white house - wall below - and thrice twelve was thirty - six ! ' Look ! Is it coming into shape ? '[539-lurgan sahib] asked [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib . ' But it is smashed - smashed , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim gasped - [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib had been muttering softly for the last half - minute . [Kim]344-kim wrenched [his]344-kim head aside . ' Look ! Dekho ! [It]6427-it is there as it was there . '[344-kim] ' It is there as it was there , '[539-lurgan sahib] said [Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib , watching [Kim]344-kim closely while [the boy]986-the boy rubbed [his]986-the boy neck . The tingle had gone from [his]344-kim veins ; [he]344-kim felt unusually wide awake . ' No , that was not magic . It was only to see if there was - a flaw in a jewel . Sometimes very fine jewels will fly all to pieces if [a man]750-a man holds them in [his]750-a man hand , and knows the proper way . That is why [one]1164-one must be careful before one sets them . [We]2997-we shall , [I]0-i think , be [friends]2013-friends . ' [They]6443-they were a most mad ten days , but [Kim]344-kim enjoyed [himself]344-kim too much to reflect on [their]6443-they craziness . In the morning [they]2997-we played the Jewel Game - sometimes with veritable stones , sometimes with piles of swords and daggers , sometimes with photo - graphs of [natives]2505-natives . Through the afternoons [he]344-kim and [the Hindu boy]6403-the hindu boy would mount guard in [the shop]960-the shop , sitting dumb behind a carpet - bale or a screen and watching [[Mr Lurgan]544-mr lurgan 's many and [very curious visitors]6448-very curious visitors]6447-mr lurgan 's many and very curious visitors . There were [small Rajahs]6449-small rajahs , [escorts coughing in [the veranda]765-the veranda]6450-escorts coughing in the veranda , who came to buy curiosities - such as phonographs and mechanical toys . There were [ladies in search of necklaces]6452-ladies in search of necklaces , and [men]752-men , it seemed to [Kim]344-kim - but [his]344-kim mind may have been vitiated by early training - in search of [the ladies]4959-the ladies ; natives from [independent and feudatory Courts whose ostensible business was the repair of broken necklaces - rivers of light poured out upon the table]6455-independent and feudatory courts whose ostensible business was the repair of broken necklaces - rivers of light poured out upon the table - but whose true end seemed to be to raise money for [angry Maharanees]6456-angry maharanees or [young Rajahs]408-rajahs . There were [Babus]548-babus to whom [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib talked with austerity and authority , but at the end of each interview [he]539-lurgan sahib gave [them]548-babus money in coined silver and currency notes . There were occasional gatherings of [long - coated theatrical natives who discussed metaphysics in English and [Bengali]549-bengali]6457-long - coated theatrical natives who discussed metaphysics in english and bengali , to [Mr Lurgan]544-mr lurgan 's great edification . [He]539-lurgan sahib was always interested in religions . At the end of the day , [Kim]344-kim and [the Hindu boy]6403-the hindu boy - whose name varied at [Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib 's pleasure - were expected to give a detailed account of all that [they]6459-their had seen and heard - [their]6459-their view of [each man]6460-each man 's character , as shown in [his]6460-each man face , talk , and manner , and [their]6459-their notions of [his]6460-each man real errand . After dinner , [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib 's fancy turned more to what might be called dressing - up , in which game [he]539-lurgan sahib took a most informing interest . [He]539-lurgan sahib could paint faces to a marvel ; with a brush - dab here and a line there changing [them]6459-their past recognition . [The shop]960-the shop was full of all manner of dresses and turbans , and [Kim]344-kim was apparelled variously as [a young Mohammedan of good family]6462-a young mohammedan of good family , [an oilman]6463-an oilman , and once - which was a joyous evening - as [the son of [an Oudh landholder in the fullest of full dress]6465-an oudh landholder in the fullest of full dress]6464-the son of an oudh landholder in the fullest of full dress . [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib had a hawk 's eye to detect the least flaw in the make - up ; and lying on a worn teak - wood couch , would explain by the half - hour together how [such and such a caste]6466-such and such a caste talked , or walked , or coughed , or spat , or sneezed , and , since '[0-i] how s ' matter little in [this world]1066-this world , the '[0-i] why ' of everything . [The Hindu child]2962-the hindu child played this game clumsily . That little mind , keen as an icicle where tally of jewels was concerned , could not temper itself to enter another 's soul ; but [a demon in [Kim]344-kim]6469-a demon in kim woke up and sang with joy as [he]6469-a demon in kim put on the changing dresses , and changed speech and gesture therewith . Carried away by enthusiasm , [he]6469-a demon in kim volunteered to show [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib one evening how [the disciples of [a certain caste of fakir]6471-a certain caste of fakir]6470-the disciples of a certain caste of fakir , [old Lahore acquaintances]6472-old lahore acquaintances , begged doles by the roadside ; and what sort of language [he]539-lurgan sahib would use to [an Englishman]1107-an englishman , to [a Punjabi farmer]6474-a punjabi farmer going to a fair , and to [a woman without a veil]6475-a woman without a veil . [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib laughed immensely , and begged [Kim]344-kim to stay as [he]344-kim was , immobile for half an hour - cross - legged , ash - smeared , and wild - eyed , in [the back room]6476-the back room . At the end of that time entered [a hulking , obese Babu whose stockinged legs shook with fat]6477-a hulking , obese babu whose stockinged legs shook with fat , and [Kim]344-kim opened on [him]0-i with a shower of wayside chaff . [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib - this annoyed [Kim]344-kim - watched [the Babu]400-hurree babu and not the play . '[0-i] [I]0-i think , ' said [the Babu]6478-the babu heavily , lighting a cigarette , '[0-i] [I]0-i am of opeenion that it is most extraordinary and effeecient performance . Except that [you]0-i had told [me]0-i [I]0-i should have opined that- that- that [you]0-i were pulling [my]0-i legs . How soon can [he]0-i become [approximately effeecient chain - man]2999-approximately effeecient chain - man ? Because then [I]0-i shall indent for [him]0-i . ' '[0-i] That is what [he]0-i must learn at [Lucknow]121-lucknow . ' '[0-i] Then order [him]0-i to be jolly - dam'-quick . Good - night , [Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib . ' [The Babu]400-hurree babu swung out with the gait of a bogged cow . When [they]6479-they were telling over the day 's list of [visitors]6480-visitors , [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib asked [Kim]344-kim who [he]344-kim thought [the man]4471-the man might be . '[539-lurgan sahib] [God]360-god knows ! ' said [Kim]344-kim cheerily . The tone might almost have deceived [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , but it failed entirely with [the healer of sick pearls]6482-the healer of sick pearls . '[360-god] That is true . [God]360-god , [He]0-i knows ; but [I]0-i wish to know what [you]0-i think . ' [Kim]344-kim glanced sideways at [[his]344-kim companion]2044-his companion , whose eye had a way of compelling truth . '[0-i] [I]0-i - [I]0-i think [he]0-i will want [me]0-i when [I]0-i come from [the school]2541-the school , but ' - confidentially , as [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib nodded approval - '[0-i] [I]0-i do not understand how [he]0-i can wear many dresses and talk many tongues . ' '[0-i] [Thou]3001-thou wilt understand many things later . [He]0-i is a writer of tales for [a certain Colonel]3002-a certain colonel . [His]0-i honour is great only in [Simla]159-simla , and it is noticeable that [he]0-i has no name , but only a number and a letter - that is a custom among [us]3003-us . ' '[0-i] And is there a price upon [his]0-i head too - as upon [Mah]550-mah - all the others ? ' '[550-mah] Not yet ; but if [a boy]4870-a boy rose up who is now sitting here and went - look , the door is open ! - as far as [a certain house with [a red- painted veranda]3006-a red- painted veranda]3005-a certain house with a red- painted veranda , behind that which was [the old theatre in [the Lower Bazar]3008-the lower bazar]3007-the old theatre in the lower bazar , and whispered through the shutters : " [Hurree Chunder Mookerjee]551-hurree chunder mookerjee bore the bad news of last month " , [that boy]2413-that boy might take away a belt full of rupees . ' '[2413-that boy] How many ? ' said [Kim]344-kim promptly . '[2413-that boy] Five hundred - a thousand - as many as [he]2413-that boy might ask for . ' '[2413-that boy] Good . And for how long might [such a boy]3010-such a boy live after the news was told ? ' [He]344-kim smiled merrily at [Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib 's [Sahib]539-lurgan sahib 's very beard . '[2413-that boy] Ah ! That is to be well thought of . Perhaps if [he]2413-that boy were very clever , [he]2413-that boy might live out the day - but not the night . By no means the night . ' '[2413-that boy] Then what is [the Babu]6478-the babu 's pay if so much is put upon [his]6478-the babu head ? ' '[6478-the babu] Eighty - perhaps a hundred - perhaps a hundred and fifty rupees ; but the pay is the least part of the work . From time to time , [God]360-god causes [men]752-men to be born - and [thou]3013-thee art one of [them]752-men - who have a lust to go abroad at the risk of [their]752-men lives and discover news - today it may be of far - off things , tomorrow of [some hidden mountain]3014-some hidden mountain , and the next day of some near - by [men who have done a foolishness against the State]3015-men who have done a foolishness against the state . [These souls]3016-these souls are very few ; and of these few , not more than ten are of the best . Among these ten [I]0-i count [the Babu]400-hurree babu , and that is curious . How great , therefore , and desirable must be a business that brazens the heart of [a Bengali]3017-a bengali ! ' '[400-hurree babu] True . But the days go slowly for [me]0-i . [I]0-i am yet [a boy]4870-a boy , and it is only within two months [I]0-i learned to write [Angrezi]552-the sahibs . Even now [I]0-i can not read it well . And there are yet years and years and long years before [I]0-i can be even [a chain - man]5919-a chain - man . ' '[5919-a chain - man] Have patience , Friend of all [the World]14-the world ' - [Kim]344-kim started at the title . '[5919-a chain - man] Would [I]0-i had a few of the years that so irk [thee]3013-thee . [I]0-i have proved [thee]3013-thee in several small ways . This will not be forgotten when [I]0-i make [my]0-i report to [the Colonel Sahib]393-colonel creighton . ' Then , changing suddenly into English with a deep laugh : '[393-colonel creighton] By Jove ! [O'Hara]347-o'hara , [I]0-i think there is a great deal in [you]347-o'hara ; but [you]347-o'hara must not become proud and [you]347-o'hara must not talk . [You]347-o'hara must go back to [Lucknow]121-lucknow and be [a good little boy]3020-a good little boy and mind [your]347-o'hara book , as [the English]346-the english say , and perhaps , next holidays if [you]347-o'hara care , [you]347-o'hara can come back to [me]0-i ! ' [Kim]344-kim 's face fell . '[346-the english] Oh , [I]0-i mean if [you]347-o'hara like . [I]0-i know where [you]347-o'hara want to go . ' Four days later a seat was booked for [Kim]344-kim and [his]344-kim small trunk at [the rear of [a Kalka tonga]6485-a kalka tonga]6484-the rear of a kalka tonga . [[His]344-kim companion]2044-his companion was [the whale - like [Babu]400-hurree babu , who , with a fringed shawl wrapped round [his]400-hurree babu head , and [his]400-hurree babu fat openwork- stockinged left leg tucked under [him]400-hurree babu]6487-the whale - like babu , who , with a fringed shawl wrapped round his head , and his fat openwork- stockinged left leg tucked under him , shivered and grunted in the morning chill . '[0-i] How comes it that [this man]937-this man is one of [us]3022-us ? ' thought [Kim]344-kim considering the jelly back as [they]3022-us jolted down [the road]4566-the road ; and the reflection threw [him]344-kim into most pleasant day - dreams . [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib had given [him]344-kim five rupees - a splendid sum - as well as the assurance of [his]344-kim protection if [he]344-kim worked . Unlike [Mahbub]383-mahbub , [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib had spoken most explicitly of the reward that would follow obedience , and [Kim]344-kim was content . If only , like [the Babu]400-hurree babu , [he]344-kim could enjoy the dignity of a letter and a number - and a price upon [his]344-kim head ! Some day [he]344-kim would be all that and more . Some day [he]344-kim might be almost as great as [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub ! [The housetops of [his]344-kim search]6489-the housetops of his search should be half [India]8-india ; [he]344-kim would follow [Kings]870-kings and [Ministers]6491-ministers , as in the old days [he]344-kim had followed vakils and [lawyers]6492-lawyers '[937-this man] touts across [[Lahore]11-lahore city]939-lahore city for [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's sake . Meantime , there was the present , and not at all unpleasant , fact of [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's immediately before [him]3024-him . There would be [new boys to condescend to]3025-new boys to condescend to , and there would be tales of holiday adventures to hear . [Young Martin]553-young martin , [son of [the tea - planter at [Manipur]186-manipur]3027-the tea - planter at manipur]3026-son of the tea - planter at manipur , had boasted that [he]553-young martin would go to war , with a rifle , against [the head - hunters]3028-the head - hunters . That might be , but it was certain [young Martin]553-young martin had not been blown half across the forecourt of [a Patiala palace]3029-a patiala palace by an explosion of fireworks ; nor had [he]553-young martin ... [Kim]344-kim fell to telling [himself]344-kim the story of [his]344-kim own adventures through the last three months . [He]344-kim could paralyse [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's - even [the biggest boys who shaved]3030-the biggest boys who shaved - with the recital , were that permitted . But it was , of course , out of the question . There would be a price upon [his]3024-him head in good time , as [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib had assured [him]3024-him ; and if [he]3024-him talked foolishly now , not only would that price never be set , but [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton would cast [him]3024-him off - and [he]3024-him would be left to the wrath of [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib and [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub - for the short space of life that would remain to [him]3024-him . ' So [I]3024-him should lose [Delhi]12-delhi for the sake of a fish , '[3024-him] was [his]3024-him proverbial philosophy . It behoved [him]3024-him to forget [his]3024-him holidays there would always remain the fun of inventing imaginary adventures and , as [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib had said , to work . Of [all [the boys]4472-the boys hurrying back to [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier]3031-all the boys hurrying back to st xavier 's , from [Sukkur]187-sukkur in [the sands]3033-the sands to [Galle]188-galle beneath the palms , none was so filled with virtue as [Kimball O'Hara]347-o'hara , jiggeting down to [Umballa]52-umballa behind [Hurree Chunder Mookerjee]551-hurree chunder mookerjee , whose name on the books of one section of the Ethnological Survey was R.17 . And if additional spur were needed , [the Babu]6478-the babu supplied it . After a huge meal at [Kalka]173-kalka , [he]3024-him spoke uninterruptedly . Was [Kim]344-kim going to [school]5886-school ? Then [he]344-kim , [an M A of [Calcutta]84-calcutta University]3036-an m a of calcutta university , would explain the advantages of education . There were marks to be gained by due attention to Latin and [Wordsworth]554-wordsworth 's Excursion all this was Greek to [Kim]344-kim . French , too was vital , and the best was to be picked up in [Chandernagore]189-chandernagore [a few miles from [Calcutta]84-calcutta]3037-a few miles from calcutta . Also [a man]750-a man might go far , as [he]750-a man [himself]750-a man had done , by strict attention to plays called [Lear]555-lear and [Julius Caesar]556-julius caesar , both much in demand by [examiners]3039-examiners . [Lear]555-lear was not so full of historical allusions as [Julius Caesar]556-julius caesar ; the book cost four annas , but could be bought second - hand in [Bow Bazar]190-bow bazar for two . Still more important than [Wordsworth]554-wordsworth , or [the eminent authors]3040-the eminent authors , [Burke]557-burke and [Hare]558-hare , was the art and science of mensuration . [A boy who had passed [his]3041-a boy who had passed his examination in these branches - for which , by the way , there were no cram - books examination in these branches - for which , by the way , there were no cram - books]3041-a boy who had passed his examination in these branches - for which , by the way , there were no cram - books - could , by merely marching over [a country]5554-a country with a compass and a level and a straight eye , carry away a picture of [that country]3043-that country which might be sold for large sums in coined silver . But as it was occasionally inexpedient to carry about measuring - chains [a boy]4870-a boy would do well to know the precise length of [his]4870-a boy own foot - pace , so that when [he]4870-a boy was deprived of what [Hurree Chunder]551-hurree chunder mookerjee called adventitious aids ' [he]4870-a boy might still tread [his]4870-a boy distances . To keep count of thousands of paces , [Hurree Chunder]551-hurree chunder mookerjee 's experience had shown [him]4870-a boy nothing more valuable than a rosary of eighty - one or a hundred and eight beads , for '[551-hurree chunder mookerjee] it was divisible and sub - divisible into many multiples and sub - multiples ' . Through the volleying drifts of English , [Kim]344-kim caught the general trend of the talk , and it interested [him]344-kim very much . Here was a new craft that [a man]750-a man could tuck away in [his]750-a man head and by the look of the large wide world unfolding itself before [him]750-a man , it seemed that the more [a man]750-a man knew the better for [him]750-a man . Said [the Babu]6478-the babu when [he]0-i had talked for an hour and a half '[0-i] [I]0-i hope some day to enjoy [your]3045-you offeecial acquaintance . Ad interim , if [I]0-i may be pardoned that expression , [I]0-i shall give [you]3045-you this betel - box , which is highly valuable article and cost [me]0-i two rupees only four years ago . ' It was a cheap , heart - shaped brass thing with three compartments for carrying the eternal betel - nut , lime and pan - leaf ; but it was filled with little tabloid - bottles . '[0-i] That is reward of merit for [your]3045-you performance in character of [that holy man]1051-that holy man . [You]3045-you see , [you]3045-you are so young [you]3045-you think [you]3045-you will last for ever and not take care of [your]3045-you body . It is great nuisance to go sick in the middle of business . [I]0-i am fond of drugs [myself]0-i , and they are handy to cure [poor people]3047-poor people too . These are good Departmental drugs - quinine and so on . [I]0-i give it [you]3045-you for souvenir . Now good - bye . [I]0-i have urgent private business here by the roadside . ' [He]0-i slipped out noiselessly as a cat , on [the Umballa road]6496-the umballa road , hailed [a passing cart]6497-a passing cart and jingled away , while [Kim]344-kim , tongue - tied , twiddled the brass betel - box in [his]344-kim hands . The record of [a boy]4870-a boy 's education interests few save [[his]4870-a boy parents]6499-his parents , and , as [you]3045-you know , [Kim]344-kim was [an orphan]6500-an orphan . It is written in the books of [[St Xavier]495-st xavier 's in Partibus]6501-st xavier 's in partibus that a report of [Kim]344-kim 's progress was forwarded at the end of each term to [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton and to [Father Victor]452-father victor , from whose hands duly came the money for [his]344-kim schooling . It is further recorded in the same books that [he]344-kim showed a great aptitude for mathematical studies as well as map - making , and carried away a prize The Life of [Lord Lawrence]559-lord lawrence , tree - calf , two vols . , nine rupees , eight annas for proficiency therein ; and the same term played in [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's eleven against [the Alighur Mohammedan College]6502-the alighur mohammedan college , [his]344-kim age being fourteen years and ten months . [He]344-kim was also re - vaccinated from which [we]6503-we may assume that there had been another epidemic of smallpox at [Lucknow]121-lucknow about the same time . [Pencil]560-pencil notes on the edge of an old muster - roll record that [he]344-kim was punished several times for '[0-i] conversing with [improper persons]3048-improper persons ' , and it seems that [he]344-kim was once sentenced to heavy pains for '[3049-himself] absenting [himself]3049-himself for a day in the company of [a street beggar]3050-a street beggar ' . That was when [he]344-kim got over the gate and pleaded with [the lama]868-the lama through a whole day down [the banks of [the Gumti]191-the gumti]6505-the banks of the gumti to accompany [him]344-kim on [the Road]4566-the road next holidays - for one month - for a little week ; and [the lama]868-the lama set [his]868-the lama face as a flint against it , averring that the time had not yet come . [Kim]344-kim 's business , said [the old man]861-the old man as [they]6509-they ate cakes together , was to get all the wisdom of [the Sahibs]552-the sahibs and then [he]861-the old man would see . [The Hand of Friendship]2705-the hand of friendship must in some way have averted the Whip of Calamity , for six weeks later [Kim]344-kim seems to have passed an examination in elementary surveying '[3049-himself] with great credit ' , [his]344-kim age being fifteen years and eight months . From this date the record is silent . [His]344-kim name does not appear in the year 's batch of [those who entered for the subordinate Survey of]6511-those who entered for the subordinate survey of [India]8-india , but against it stand the words '[3049-himself] removed on appointment . ' Several times in those three years , cast up at [the Temple of [the Tirthankars]498-the tirthankars in [Benares]37-benares]6512-the temple of the tirthankars in benares [the lama]868-the lama , a little thinner and a shade yellower , if that were possible , but gentle and untainted as ever . Sometimes it was from [the South]1783-the south that [he]344-kim came - from [south of [Tuticorin]192-tuticorin]6515-south of tuticorin , whence [the wonderful fire - boats]6516-the wonderful fire - boats go to [Ceylon]193-ceylon where are [[priests]5362-priests who know [Pali]561-pali]6518-priests who know pali ; sometimes it was from [the wet green West]194-the wet green west and [the thousand cotton - factory chimneys that ring [Bombay]60-bombay]6519-the thousand cotton - factory chimneys that ring bombay ; and once from [the North]1534-the north , where [he]344-kim had doubled back eight hundred miles to talk for a day with [the Keeper of the Images]4642-the keeper of the images in [the Wonder House]721-the wonder house . [He]344-kim would stride to [[his]344-kim cell]6523-his cell in the cool , cut marble - [the priests of [the Temple]1515-the temple]6524-the priests of the temple were good to [the old man]861-the old man , - wash off the dust of travel , make prayer , and depart for [Lucknow]121-lucknow , well accustomed now to the way of the rail , in [a third - class carriage]6527-a third - class carriage . Returning , it was noticeable , as [[his]344-kim friend]6528-his friend [the Seeker]562-the seeker pointed out to [the head - priest]6529-the head - priest , that [he]344-kim ceased for a while to mourn the loss of [[his]344-kim River]5475-his river , or to draw wondrous pictures of the Wheel of Life , but preferred to talk of the beauty and wisdom of [a certain mysterious chela whom [no man of the Temple]6532-no man of the temple had ever seen]6531-a certain mysterious chela whom no man of the temple had ever seen . Yes , [he]344-kim had followed the traces of the Blessed Feet throughout all [India]8-india . [The Curator]563-the curator has still in [his]563-the curator possession a most marvellous account of [his]344-kim wanderings and meditations . There remained nothing more in life but to find [the River of the Arrow]39-the river of the arrow . Yet it was shown to [him]344-kim in dreams that it was a matter not to be undertaken with any hope of success unless [that seeker]6533-that seeker had with [him]6533-that seeker the one chela appointed to bring the event to a happy issue , and versed in great wisdom - such wisdom as [white - haired Keepers of Images]6534-white - haired keepers of images possess . For example here came out the snuff - gourd , and [the kindly Jain priests]6535-the kindly jain priests made haste to be silent : '[429-devadatta] Long and long ago , when [Devadatta]429-devadatta was [King of [Benares]37-benares]3051-king of benares - let [all]3052-all listen to [the Tataka]195-the tataka ! - an elephant was captured for a time by [[the king]3053-the king 's hunters]3054-the king 's hunters and ere [he]3053-the king broke free , beringed with a grievous legiron . This [he]3053-the king strove to remove with hate and frenzy in [his]3053-the king heart , and hurrying up and down [the forests]3055-the forests , besought [[his]3053-the king brother]3056-his brother - elephants to wrench it asunder . One by one , with [their]3056-his brother strong trunks , [they]3056-his brother tried and failed . At the last [they]3056-his brother gave it as [their]3056-his brother opinion that the ring was not to be broken by any bestial power . And in a thicket , new - born , wet with moisture of birth , lay [a day - old calf of the herd whose mother had died]3057-a day - old calf of the herd whose mother had died . [The fettered elephant]3058-the fettered elephant , forgetting [his]3058-the fettered elephant own agony , said : " If [I]0-i do not help this suckling it will perish under [our]3059-our feet . " So [he]3058-the fettered elephant stood above [the young thing]3060-the young thing , making [his]3058-the fettered elephant legs buttresses against the uneasily moving herd ; and [he]3058-the fettered elephant begged milk of a virtuous cow , and the calf throve , and [the ringed elephant]3061-the ringed elephant was [the calf]3062-the calf 's guide and defence . Now the days of an elephant - let [all]3052-all listen to [the Tataka]195-the tataka ! - are thirty - five years to [his]3058-the fettered elephant full strength , and through [thirty - five Rains the ringed elephant]3064-thirty - five rains the ringed elephant befriended [the younger]5249-the younger , and all the while the fetter ate into the flesh . ' Then one day [the young elephant]6536-the young elephant saw the half - buried iron , and turning to [the elder]1330-the elder said : " What is this ? " " It is even [my]3058-the fettered elephant sorrow , " said [he]3058-the fettered elephant who had befriended [him]6536-the young elephant . Then [that other]5150-that other put out [his]3058-the fettered elephant trunk and in the twinkling of an eyelash abolished the ring , saying : " The appointed time has come . " So [the virtuous elephant who had waited temperately and done kind acts]6539-the virtuous elephant who had waited temperately and done kind acts was relieved , at the appointed time , by [the very calf whom [he]3058-the fettered elephant had turned aside to cherish]6540-the very calf whom he had turned aside to cherish - let [all]3052-all listen to [the Tataka]195-the tataka ! for [the Elephant]565-the elephant was [Ananda]363-ananda , and [the Calf that broke the ring]6542-the calf that broke the ring was none other than [The Lord]4482-the lord [Himself]6539-the virtuous elephant who had waited temperately and done kind acts ... '[3058-the fettered elephant] Then [he]3058-the fettered elephant would shake [his]3058-the fettered elephant head benignly , and over the ever - clicking rosary point out how free that elephant - calf was from the sin of pride . [He]3058-the fettered elephant was as humble as [a chela who , seeing [[his]3058-the fettered elephant master]6109-his master sitting in the dust outside [the Gates of [Learning]196-learning]2673-the gates of learning]3066-a chela who , seeing his master sitting in the dust outside the gates of learning , over - leapt the gates though [they]2673-the gates of learning were locked and took [[his]3058-the fettered elephant master]6109-his master to [his]3058-the fettered elephant heart in the presence of [the proud - stomached city]3070-the proud - stomached city . Rich would be the reward of [such a master]3071-such a master and [such a chela]3072-such a chela when the time came for [them]3073-them to seek freedom together ! So did [the lama]868-the lama speak , coming and going across [India]8-india as softly as a bat . [A sharp - tongued old woman in [a house among the fruit - trees behind [Saharunpore]100-saharunpore]3076-a house among the fruit - trees behind saharunpore]3075-a sharp - tongued old woman in a house among the fruit - trees behind saharunpore honoured [him]868-the lama as [the woman]766-the woman honoured [the prophet]1134-the prophet , but [[his]868-the lama chamber]3079-his chamber was by no means upon the wall . In [an apartment of the forecourt overlooked by cooing doves]3080-an apartment of the forecourt overlooked by cooing doves [he]868-the lama would sit , while [she]3075-a sharp - tongued old woman in a house among the fruit - trees behind saharunpore laid aside [her]3075-a sharp - tongued old woman in a house among the fruit - trees behind saharunpore useless veil and chattered of spirits and fiends of [Kulu]19-kulu , of [grandchildren unborn]3081-grandchildren unborn , and of [the free - tongued brat who had talked to [her]3075-a sharp - tongued old woman in a house among the fruit - trees behind saharunpore in the resting - place]3082-the free - tongued brat who had talked to her in the resting - place . Once , too , [he]868-the lama strayed alone from [the Grand Trunk Road]5057-the grand trunk road below [Umballa]52-umballa to [the very village whose priest had tried to drug [him]868-the lama]3084-the very village whose priest had tried to drug him ; but the kind Heaven that [guards lamas]3085-guards lamas sent [him]868-the lama at twilight through the crops , absorbed and unsuspicious , to [the [Rissaldar]446-rissaldar sahib 's door]3086-the rissaldar 's door . Here was like to have been a grave misunderstanding , for [the old soldier]5092-the old soldier asked [him]868-the lama why [the Friend of the Stars]1491-the friend of the stars had gone that way only six days before . ' That may not be , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' [He]868-the lama has gone back to [[his]868-the lama own people]5647-his own people . '[868-the lama] ' [He]868-the lama sat in that corner telling a hundred merry tales five nights ago , '[2953-his host] [[his]868-the lama host]2953-his host insisted . ' True , [he]868-the lama vanished somewhat suddenly in the dawn after foolish talk with [[my]2953-his host granddaughter]6545-my granddaughter . [He]868-the lama grows apace , but [he]868-the lama is [the same Friend of [the Stars]438-the stars]6546-the same friend of the stars as brought [me]2953-his host true word of the war . Have [ye]2953-his host parted ? '[2953-his host] ' Yes - and no , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama replied . ' [We]6547-we - [we]6547-we have not altogether parted , but the time is not ripe that [we]6547-we should take [the Road]4566-the road together . [He]868-the lama acquires wisdom in another place . [We]6547-we must wait . '[868-the lama] ' All one - but if it were not [the boy]986-the boy how did [he]868-the lama come to speak so continually of [thee]2953-his host ? '[2953-his host] ' And what said [he]868-the lama ? '[868-the lama] asked [the lama]868-the lama eagerly . '[868-the lama] This news amazed [the lama]868-the lama , who did not then know how religiously [Kim]344-kim kept to the contract made with [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , and perforce ratified by [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton ... ' There is no holding the young pony from the game , '[5835-the horse- dealer] said [the horse- dealer]5835-the horse- dealer when [the Colonel]757-the colonel pointed out that vagabonding over [India]8-india in holiday time was absurd . ' If permission be refused to go and come as [he]3098-he chooses , [he]3098-he will make light of the refusal . Then who is to catch [him]3098-he ? [Colonel Sahib]393-colonel creighton , only once in a thousand years is a horse born so well fitted for the game as this [[our]3099-we colt]6552-our colt . And [we]3099-we need [men]752-men . '[5835-the horse- dealer] Chapter 10 [Your]3096-your tiercel 's too long at hack , [Sire]3097-sire . [Gow]567-gow 's Watch [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib did not use as direct speech , but [his]539-lurgan sahib advice tallied with [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's ; and the upshot was good for [Kim]344-kim . [He]539-lurgan sahib knew better now than to leave [[Lucknow]121-lucknow city]6555-lucknow city in native garb , and if [Mahbub]383-mahbub were anywhere within reach of a letter , it was to [[Mahbub]383-mahbub 's camp [he]539-lurgan sahib headed]6556-mahbub 's camp he headed , and made [his]539-lurgan sahib change under [the Pathan]533-the pathan 's wary eye . Could the little Survey paint - box that [he]539-lurgan sahib used for map - tinting in term- time have found a tongue to tell of holiday doings , [he]539-lurgan sahib might have been expelled . Once [Mahbub]383-mahbub and [he]539-lurgan sahib went together as far as [the beautiful city of]6557-the beautiful city of [Bombay]60-bombay , with [three truckloads of tram - horses]6558-three truckloads of tram - horses , and [Mahbub]383-mahbub nearly melted when [Kim]344-kim proposed a sail in a dhow across [the Indian Ocean]198-the indian ocean to buy [Gulf Arabs]568-gulf arabs , which , [he]539-lurgan sahib understood from a hanger- on of [the dealer]5821-the dealer [Abdul Rahman]569-abdul rahman , fetched better prices than [mere Kabulis]6560-mere kabulis . [He]539-lurgan sahib dipped [his]539-lurgan sahib hand into the dish with [that great trader]6561-that great trader when [Mahbub]383-mahbub and [a few co - religionists]6562-a few co - religionists were invited to a big Haj dinner . [They]6563-they came back by way of [Karachi]199-karachi by [sea]6564-sea , when [Kim]344-kim took [his]344-kim first experience of sea - sickness sitting on the fore - hatch of [a coasting- steamer]6565-a coasting- steamer , well persuaded [he]344-kim had been poisoned . [The Babu]400-hurree babu 's famous drug - box proved useless , though [Kim]344-kim had restocked it at [Bombay]60-bombay . [Mahbub]383-mahbub had business at [Quetta]200-quetta , and there [Kim]344-kim , as [Mahbub]383-mahbub admitted , earned [his]344-kim keep , and perhaps a little over , by spending four curious days as scullion in [the house of [a fat Commissariat sergeant]6567-a fat commissariat sergeant]6566-the house of a fat commissariat sergeant , from whose [office - box]6568-office - box , in an auspicious moment , [he]344-kim removed a little vellum ledger which [he]344-kim copied out - it seemed to deal entirely with cattle and camel sales - by moonlight , lying behind [an outhouse]6569-an outhouse , all through one hot night . Then [he]344-kim returned the ledger to its place , and , at [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's word , left that service unpaid , rejoining [him]344-kim six miles down [the road]4566-the road , the clean copy in [his]344-kim bosom . '[3100-that soldier] [That soldier]3100-that soldier is a small fish , ' [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub explained , '[3100-that soldier] but in time [we]3101-we shall catch the larger one . [He]3100-that soldier only sells oxen at two prices - one for [himself]3100-that soldier and one for [the Government]852-the government - which [I]0-i do not think is a sin . ' '[0-i] Why could not [I]0-i take away the little book and be done with it ? ' '[0-i] Then [he]3100-that soldier would have been frightened , and [he]3100-that soldier would have told [[his]3100-that soldier master]6109-his master . Then [we]3101-we should miss , perhaps , a great number of new rifles which seek [their]3104-their way up from [Quetta]200-quetta to [the North]48-the north . The Game is so large that [one]1164-one sees but a little at a time . ' '[1164-one] Oho ! ' said [Kim]344-kim , and held [his]344-kim tongue . That was in the monsoon holidays , after [he]344-kim had taken the prize for mathematics . The Christmas holidays [he]344-kim spent - deducting ten days for private amusements - with [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib , where [he]344-kim sat for the most part in front of a roaring wood - fire - [Jakko road]6571-jakko road was four feet deep in snow that year - and - [the small Hindu]6572-the small hindu had gone away to be married - helped [Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib to thread pearls . [He]344-kim made [Kim]344-kim learn whole chapters of the Koran by heart , till [he]344-kim could deliver them with the very roll and cadence of [a mullah]6573-a mullah . Moreover , [he]344-kim told [Kim]344-kim the names and properties of many native drugs , as well as the runes proper to recite when [you]6574-you administer them . And in the evenings [he]344-kim wrote charms on parchment - elaborate pentagrams crowned with the names of devils - [Murra]570-murra , and [Awan]571-awan [the Companion of [Kings]870-kings]6575-the companion of kings - all fantastically written in the corners . More to the point , [he]344-kim advised [Kim]344-kim as to the care of [his]344-kim own body , the cure of fever - fits , and simple remedies of [the Road]4566-the road . A week before it was time to go down , [Colonel Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton - this was unfair - sent [Kim]344-kim a written examination paper that concerned itself solely with rods and chains and links and angles . Next holidays [he]344-kim was out with [Mahbub]383-mahbub , and here , by the way , [he]344-kim nearly died of thirst , plodding through the sand on a camel to [the mysterious city of [Bikanir]201-bikanir]6578-the mysterious city of bikanir , where the wells are four hundred feet deep , and lined throughout with camel - bone . It was not an amusing trip from [Kim]344-kim 's point of view , because - in defiance of the contract - [the Colonel]757-the colonel ordered [him]344-kim to make a map of [that wild , walled city]6580-that wild , walled city ; and since [Mohammedan horse - boys]6581-mohammedan horse - boys and [pipe - tenders]6582-pipe - tenders are not expected to drag Survey - chains round [the capital of [an independent Native State]6584-an independent native state]6583-the capital of an independent native state , [Kim]344-kim was forced to pace all [his]344-kim distances by means of a bead rosary . [He]344-kim used the compass for bearings as occasion served - after dark chiefly , when the camels had been fed - and by the help of [his]344-kim little Survey paint - box of six colour - cakes and three brushes , [he]344-kim achieved something not remotely unlike [the city of Jeysulmir]6585-the city of jeysulmir . [Mahbub]383-mahbub laughed a great deal , and advised [him]344-kim to make up a written report as well ; and in the back of the big account - book that lay under the flap of [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's pet saddle [Kim]344-kim fell to work .. '[1164-one] It must hold everything that [thou]3106-thou hast seen or touched or considered . ' '[3107-the jung - i - lat sahib] How great [an army]3109-an army ? ' '[752-men] Oh , half a lakh of [men]752-men . ' '[752-men] Folly ! Remember how few and bad were [the wells in the sand]3111-the wells in the sand . [Not a thousand thirsty men]3112-not a thousand thirsty men could come near by here . ' '[3107-the jung - i - lat sahib] Then write that down - also all the old breaches in the walls and whence the firewood is cut - and what is the temper and disposition of [the King]3053-the king . [I]0-i stay [here]4484-here till all [my]0-i horses are sold . [I]0-i will hire [a room by the gateway]3115-a room by the gateway , and [thou]3106-thou shalt be [[my]0-i accountant]3116-my accountant . There is a good lock to the door . ' The report in its unmistakable St [Xavier]495-st xavier 's running script , and the brown , yellow , and lake - daubed map , was on hand a few years ago [a careless clerk]6586-a careless clerk filed it with the rough notes of [E]572-e 's second Seistan survey , but by now the pencil characters must be almost illegible . [Kim]344-kim translated it , sweating under the light of an oil - lamp , to [Mahbub]383-mahbub , the second day of [their]3117-we return - journey . [The Pathan]2753-the pathan rose and stooped over [his]2753-the pathan dappled saddle - bags . '[0-i] [I]0-i knew it would be worthy a dress of honour , and so [I]0-i made one ready , ' [he]0-i said , smiling . '[0-i] Were [I]0-i Amir of [Afghanistan]202-afghanistan and some day [we]3117-we may see [him]0-i , [I]0-i would fill [thy]3106-thou mouth with gold . ' [He]0-i laid the garments formally at [Kim]344-kim 's feet . There was a gold - embroidered Peshawur turban - cap , rising to a cone , and a big turban - cloth ending in a broad fringe of gold . There was a Delhi embroidered waistcoat to slip over a milky white shirt , fastening to the right , ample and flowing ; green pyjamas with twisted silk waist - string ; and that nothing might be lacking , russia - leather slippers , smelling divinely , with arrogantly curled tips . '[0-i] Upon a Wednesday , and in the morning , to put on new clothes is auspicious , ' said [Mahbub]383-mahbub solemnly . '[0-i] But [we]3117-we must not forget [the wicked folk in [the world]759-the world]3118-the wicked folk in the world . So ! ' [He]0-i capped all the splendour , that was taking [Kim]344-kim 's delighted breath away , with a mother - of - pearl , nickel - plated , self - extracting .450 revolver . '[0-i] [I]0-i had thought of a smaller bore , but reflected that this takes Government bullets . [A man]750-a man can always come by those - especially across [the Border]59-the border . Stand up and let [me]0-i look . ' [He]0-i clapped [Kim]344-kim on the shoulder . '[0-i] May [you]3106-thou never be tired , [Pathan]533-the pathan ! Oh , the hearts to be broken ! Oh , the eyes under the eyelashes , looking sideways ! ' [Kim]344-kim turned about , pointed [his]344-kim toes , stretched , and felt mechanically for the moustache that was just beginning . Then [he]344-kim stooped towards [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's feet to make proper acknowledgment with fluttering , quick- patting hands ; [his]344-kim heart too full for words . [Mahbub]383-mahbub forestalled and embraced [him]344-kim . '[0-i] [[My]0-i son]4602-my son , said [he]0-i , ' what need of words between [us]6588-us ? But is not the little gun a delight ? All six cartridges come out at one twist . It is borne in the bosom next the skin , which , as it were , keeps it oiled . Never put it elsewhere , and please [God]360-god , [thou]6589-thou shalt some day kill [a man with it]6590-a man with it . '[0-i] ' Hai mai ! '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim ruefully . '[0-i] ' [Son]1693-son , [I]344-kim am wearied of [that madrissah]6317-that madrissah , where [they]2740-the madrissah take the best years of [a man]750-a man to teach [him]750-a man what [he]750-a man can only learn upon the Road . Maybe [thy]552-the sahibs written report shall save [thee]552-the sahibs further bondage ; and [God]360-god [He]360-god knows [we]3122-we need [men]752-men more and more in the Game . '[344-kim] [They]3122-we marched , jaw - bound against blowing sand , across [the salt desert]3123-the salt desert to [Jodhpur]203-jodhpur , where [Mahbub]383-mahbub and [[his]383-mahbub handsome nephew]3124-his handsome nephew [Habib Ullah]573-habib ullah did much trading ; and then sorrowfully , in European clothes , which [he]383-mahbub was fast outgrowing , [Kim]344-kim went second - class to [[St Xavier]495-st xavier 's]6015-st xavier 's . That is [a man]750-a man 's job , ' said [Creighton]393-colonel creighton . It was a wry - necked matter of unauthorized and incendiary correspondence between [a person who claimed to be [the ultimate authority in all matters of the Mohammedan religion throughout [the world]759-the world]6610-the ultimate authority in all matters of the mohammedan religion throughout the world , and a younger member of [a royal house who had been brought to book for kidnapping women within [British territory]6613-british territory]6612-a royal house who had been brought to book for kidnapping women within british territory]6609-a person who claimed to be the ultimate authority in all matters of the mohammedan religion throughout the world , and a younger member of a royal house who had been brought to book for kidnapping women within british territory . [The Moslem Archbishop]6614-the moslem archbishop had been emphatic and over - arrogant ; [the young prince]6615-the young prince was merely sulky at the curtailment of [his]6615-the young prince privileges , but there was no need [he]6615-the young prince should continue a correspondence which might some day compromise [him]6615-the young prince . One letter indeed had been procured , but [the finder]6616-the finder was later found dead by the roadside in the habit of [an Arab trader]6617-an arab trader , as [E.23]574-e.23 , taking up the work , duly reported . These facts , and a few others not to be published , made both [Mahbub]383-mahbub and [Creighton]393-colonel creighton shake [their]6618-their heads . '[750-a man] Let [him]383-mahbub go out with [[his]383-mahbub Red Lama]3135-his red lama , ' said [the horse - dealer]2470-the horse - dealer with visible effort . '[383-mahbub] [He]383-mahbub is fond of [the old man]861-the old man . [He]383-mahbub can learn [his]383-mahbub paces by the rosary at least . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i have had some dealings with [the old man]861-the old man - by letter , ' said [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton , smiling to [himself]0-i . '[0-i] Whither goes [he]383-mahbub ? ' '[383-mahbub] Up and down [the land]4998-the land , as [he]383-mahbub has these three years . [He]383-mahbub seeks [a River of Healing]3139-a river of healing . [God]360-god 's curse upon all - ' [Mahbub]383-mahbub checked [himself]383-mahbub . [He]383-mahbub is quite mad , but [a peaceful man]3146-a peaceful man . [I]0-i have met [him]383-mahbub . [The Babu]400-hurree babu also has had dealings with [him]383-mahbub . ' '[548-babus] [Babus]548-babus are very curious , ' said [Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib meditatively . '[548-babus] Do [you]3148-you know what [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu really wants ? '[393-colonel creighton] No money and no preferment would have drawn [Creighton]393-colonel creighton from [his]393-colonel creighton work on the Indian Survey , but deep in [his]393-colonel creighton heart also lay the ambition to write ' F R S '[393-colonel creighton] after [his]393-colonel creighton name . Honours of a sort [he]393-colonel creighton knew could be obtained by ingenuity and the help of [friends]2013-friends , but , to the best of [his]393-colonel creighton belief , nothing save work - papers representing a life of it - took [a man]750-a man into [the Society which [he]393-colonel creighton had bombarded for years with monographs on strange Asiatic cults and unknown customs]3158-the society which he had bombarded for years with monographs on strange asiatic cults and unknown customs . [Nine men out of ten]3159-nine men out of ten would flee from a Royal Society soiree in extremity of boredom ; but [Creighton]393-colonel creighton was the tenth , and at times [his]393-colonel creighton soul yearned for [the crowded rooms in [easy [London]204-london where [silver - haired , bald- headed gentlemen who know nothing of the Army]3162-silver - haired , bald- headed gentlemen who know nothing of the army]3161-easy london where silver - haired , bald- headed gentlemen who know nothing of the army]3160-the crowded rooms in easy london where silver - haired , bald- headed gentlemen who know nothing of the army move among spectroscopic experiments , the lesser plants of [the frozen tundras]3163-the frozen tundras , electric flight - measuring machines , and apparatus for slicing into fractional millimetres the left eye of the female mosquito . By all right and reason , it was the Royal Geographical that should have appealed to [him]393-colonel creighton , but [men]752-men are as chancy as [children]848-children in [their]848-children choice of playthings . So [Creighton]393-colonel creighton smiled , and thought the better of [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu , moved by like desire . [He]539-lurgan sahib considered the years to come when [Kim]344-kim would have been entered and made to the Great Game that never ceases day and night , throughout [India]8-india . ' [I]393-colonel creighton understand , [O'Hara]347-o'hara , that [he]393-colonel creighton has found [you]347-o'hara a place as [an assistant chain - man in [the Canal Department]2151-the canal department]6636-an assistant chain - man in the canal department : that comes of taking up mathematics . ' [I]383-mahbub have no regard for [the devils of [Hind]515-hind]6676-the devils of hind , but [the Sons of Eblis]6677-the sons of eblis are far otherwise , and whether [they]6677-the sons of eblis be jumalee well - affected or jullalee terrible [they]6677-the sons of eblis love not [Kafirs]591-kafirs . '[383-mahbub] ' Then [you]400-hurree babu think [I]400-hurree babu had better go ? '[400-hurree babu] said [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu , half rising . ' [They]6678-they are , of course , dematerialized phenomena . '[601-the jat] [The child]747-the child turned on the cushion of the huge corded arms and looked at [Kim]344-kim through heavy eyelids . ' And was it all worthless ? ' [The Gods]402-the gods have given [him]747-the child a good mind , at least '[3287-the father] said [the father]3287-the father proudly . ' To think [he]747-the child should have listened so cleverly . [Yonder]24-yonder is [[thy]24-yonder Temple]6734-thy temple . Now [I]3287-the father am [a poor man]6735-a poor man - [many priests]6736-many priests have dealt with [me]3287-the father - but [[my]3287-the father son]4602-my son is [[my]3287-the father son]4602-my son , and if a gift to [[thy]24-yonder master]2991-thy master can cure [him]747-the child - [I]3287-the father am at [my]3287-the father very wits '[3287-the father] end . ' [Kim]344-kim considered for a while , tingling with pride . Three years ago [he]344-kim would have made prompt profit on the situation and gone [his]344-kim way without a thought ; but now , the very respect [the Jat]601-the jat paid [him]344-kim proved that [he]344-kim was [a man]750-a man . Moreover , [he]344-kim had tasted fever once or twice already , and knew enough to recognize starvation when [he]344-kim saw it . '[3288-him] Call [him]3288-him forth and [I]0-i will give [him]3288-him a bond on [my]0-i best yoke , so that [the child]747-the child is cured . ' [Kim]344-kim halted at the carved outer door of [the temple]1515-the temple . [A white - clad Oswal banker from [Ajmir]215-ajmir]6742-a white - clad oswal banker from ajmir , [his]6742-a white - clad oswal banker from ajmir sins of [usury]6743-usury new wiped out , asked [him]344-kim what [he]344-kim did . '[0-i] [I]0-i am chela to [Teshoo Lama]497-teshoo lama , [an Holy One from [Bhotiyal]172-bhotiyal -within [there]4784-there]3290-an holy one from bhotiyal -within there . [He]3288-him bade [me]0-i come . [I]0-i wait . Tell [him]3288-him . ' '[3288-him] Do not forget [the child]747-the child , ' cried [the importunate Jat]6744-the importunate jat over [his]6744-the importunate jat shoulder , and then bellowed in [Punjabi]352-punjabi ; '[3288-him] O Holy One - [O disciple of [the Holy One]385-holy one - O Gods above all [the Worlds]217-the worlds -behold affliction sitting at the gate]3293-o disciple of the holy one - o gods above all the worlds -behold affliction sitting at the gate ! ' That cry is so common in [Benares]37-benares that [the passers]6745-the passers never turned [their]6745-the passers heads . [The Oswal , at peace with mankind]6746-the oswal , at peace with mankind , carried the message into the darkness behind [him]6746-the oswal , at peace with mankind , and [the easy , uncounted Eastern minutes]6747-the easy , uncounted eastern minutes slid by ; for [the lama]868-the lama was asleep in [[his]868-the lama cell]6523-his cell , and [no priest]1499-no priest would wake [him]868-the lama . When the click of [his]868-the lama rosary again broke the hush of [the inner court where the calm images of [the Arhats]604-the arhats]6751-the inner court where the calm images of the arhats stand , [a novice]6752-a novice whispered , '[3294-thy] [Thy]3294-thy chela is here , ' and [the old man]861-the old man strode forth , forgetting the end of that prayer . Hardly had the tall figure shown in the doorway than [the Jat]6754-the jat ran before [him]861-the old man , and , lifting up [the child]747-the child , cried : '[3294-thy] Look upon this , [Holy One]385-holy one ; and if [the Gods]1244-the gods will , [he]385-holy one lives - [he]385-holy one lives ! ' [He]861-the old man fumbled in [his]861-the old man waist - belt and drew out a small silver coin . '[385-holy one] What is now ? ' [The lama]868-the lama 's eyes turned to [Kim]344-kim . It was noticeable [he]868-the lama spoke far clearer Urdu than long ago , under [ZamZammah]605-zamzammah ; but [father]4506-father would allow no private talk . '[3294-thy] It is no more than a fever , ' said [Kim]344-kim . '[747-the child] [The child]747-the child is not well fed . ' '[747-the child] [He]747-the child sickens at everything , and [[his]747-the child mother]727-his mother is not [here]4484-here . ' '[727-his mother] If it be permitted , [I]0-i may cure , [Holy One]385-holy one . ' '[385-holy one] What ! Have [they]3299-they made [thee]385-holy one [a healer]3300-a healer ? Wait here , ' said [the lama]868-the lama , and [he]868-the lama sat down by [the Jat]601-the jat upon the lowest step of [the temple]1515-the temple , while [Kim]344-kim , looking out of the corner of [his]344-kim eyes , slowly opened the little betel - box . [He]344-kim had dreamed dreams at school of returning to [the lama]868-the lama as [a Sahib]5596-a sahib - of chaffing [the old man]861-the old man before [he]861-the old man revealed [himself]861-the old man - [boy]1397-boy 's dreams all . There was more drama in this abstracted , brow- puckered search through the tabloid - bottles , with a pause here and there for thought and a muttered invocation between whiles . Quinine [he]344-kim had in tablets , and dark brown meat - lozenges - beef most probably , but that was not [his]344-kim business . [The little thing]6764-the little thing would not eat , but it sucked at a lozenge greedily , and said it liked the salt taste . '[3299-they] Take then these six . ' [Kim]344-kim handed them to [the man]4471-the man . '[3299-they] Praise [the Gods]402-the gods , and boil three in milk ; other three in water . After [he]3301-he has drunk the milk give [him]3301-he this ' it was the half of a quinine pill , '[402-the gods] and wrap [him]3301-he warm . Give [him]3301-he the water of the other three , and the other half of this white pill when [he]3301-he wakes . Meantime , here is another brown medicine that [he]3301-he may suck at on the way [home]743-home . ' '[402-the gods] [Gods]402-the gods , what wisdom ! ' said [the Kamboh]6766-the kamboh , snatching . It was as much as [Kim]344-kim could remember of [his]344-kim own treatment in a bout of autumn malaria - if [you]6767-you except the patter that [he]344-kim added to impress [the lama]868-the lama . '[402-the gods] Now go ! Come again in the morning . ' '[402-the gods] But the price - the price , ' said [the Jat]6754-the jat , and threw back [his]6754-the jat sturdy shoulders . '[0-i] [[My]0-i son]4602-my son is [[my]0-i son]4602-my son . Now that [he]4602-my son will be whole again , how shall [I]0-i go back to [[his]4602-my son mother]727-his mother and say [I]0-i took help by the wayside and did not even give a bowl of curds in return ? ' '[3306-they] [They]3306-they are alike , [these Jats]606-jats , ' said [Kim]344-kim softly . '[606-jats] [The Jat]601-the jat stood on [[his]601-the jat dunghill]3307-his dunghill and [the King]3053-the king 's elephants went by . " [O driver]3309-o driver , " said [he]601-the jat , " what will [you]3309-o driver sell those little donkeys for ? " ' [The Jat]601-the jat burst into a roar of laughter , stifled with apologies to [the lama]868-the lama . '[601-the jat] It is the saying of [[my]0-i own country]3310-my own country the very talk of it . So are [we]3311-we [Jats]606-jats all . ' [He]0-i moved away , crooning and mumbling . That was wisely done , [O Friend of [all the World]2492-all the world]822-o friend of all the world . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i was made wise by [thee]3325-thee , [Holy One]385-holy one , ' said [Kim]344-kim , forgetting the little play just ended ; forgetting [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's ; forgetting [his]495-st xavier white blood ; forgetting even the Great Game as [he]0-i stooped , Mohammedan - fashion , to touch [[his]0-i master]6109-his master 's feet in the dust of [the Jain temple]6774-the jain temple . '[4501-a child] It is no longer [a child]4501-a child , but [a man , ripened in wisdom]3328-a man , ripened in wisdom , walking as [a physician]3329-a physician . [I]0-i did well - [I]0-i did well when [I]0-i gave [thee]3325-thee up to [the armed men]3330-the armed men on that black night . '[344-kim] ' Yes , that am [I]344-kim - [a scribe]4577-a scribe , when [I]344-kim am [a Sahib]5596-a sahib , but it is set aside when [I]344-kim come as [[thy]6792-thou disciple]4637-thy disciple . '[868-the lama] ' [I]344-kim am all free . In due time [I]344-kim take service under [the Government]85-the government as [a scribe]4577-a scribe - '[344-kim] ' Not as [a warrior]6801-a warrior . That is well . '[344-kim] ' But first [I]868-the lama come to wander with [thee]6792-thou . Therefore [I]868-the lama am [here]4484-here . Who begs for [thee]6792-thou , these days ? '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama went on quickly . The ice was thin . ' Very often [I]868-the lama beg [myself]868-the lama ; but , as [thou]6792-thou knowest , [I]868-the lama am seldom here , except when [I]868-the lama come to look again at [[my]868-the lama disciple]1064-my disciple . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama looked round the little clean cell complacently . In one corner stood a tiny altar , also of heavily carved teak , bearing a copper - gilt image of [the seated Buddha]3350-the seated buddha and fronted by a lamp , an incense - holder , and a pair of copper flower- pots . ' [The Keeper of the Images in [the Wonder House]721-the wonder house]6806-the keeper of the images in the wonder house acquired merit by giving [me]868-the lama these a year since , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama said , following [Kim]344-kim 's eye . ' When one is far from [one 's own land]6808-one 's own land such things carry remembrance ; and [we]6809-we must reverence [the Lord]4482-the lord for that [He]4482-the lord showed the Way . See ! '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama pointed to a curiously - built mound of coloured rice crowned with a fantastic metal ornament . ' When [I]868-the lama was [Abbot]6811-abbot in [[my]868-the lama own place]1432-my own place - before [I]868-the lama came to better knowledge [I]868-the lama made that offering daily . ' It is well done , [Holy One]385-holy one , '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim murmured , sinking at ease on the cushions , very happy and rather tired . ' And also , '[861-the old man] [the old man]861-the old man chuckled , ' [I]868-the lama write pictures of the Wheel of Life . Three days to a picture . [I]868-the lama was busied on it - or it may be [I]868-the lama shut [my]868-the lama eyes a little - when [they]6817-they brought word of [thee]6818-thee . It is good to have [thee]6818-thee here : [I]868-the lama will show [thee]6818-thee [my]868-the lama art - not for pride 's sake , but because [thou]6818-thee must learn . [The Sahibs]552-the sahibs have not all [this world]1066-this world 's wisdom . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama drew from under the table a sheet of strangely scented yellow Chinese paper , the brushes , and slab of Indian ink . In cleanest , severest outline [he]868-the lama had traced the Great Wheel with its six spokes , whose centre is the conjoined Hog , Snake , and [Dove Ignorance]610-dove ignorance , Anger , and Lust , and whose compartments are all [the Heavens and Hells]219-the heavens and hells , and all the chances of human life . [Men]752-men say that [the Bodhisat Himself]364-the bodhisat first drew it with grains of rice upon dust , to teach [[His]364-the bodhisat disciples]3353-his disciples the cause of things . Many ages have crystallized it into a most wonderful convention crowded with [hundreds of little figures whose every line carries a meaning]3354-hundreds of little figures whose every line carries a meaning . [Few]1882-few can translate the picture- parable ; there are not twenty in all [the world]759-the world [who can draw it surely without a copy]3357-who can draw it surely without a copy : of [those who can both draw and expound]3358-those who can both draw and expound are but three . ' [I]344-kim have a little learned to draw , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . ' But this is a marvel beyond marvels . '[344-kim] ' [I]868-the lama have written it for many years , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' Time was when [I]868-the lama could write it all between one lamp - lighting and the next . [I]868-the lama will teach [thee]3353-his disciples the art - after due preparation ; and [I]868-the lama will show [thee]3353-his disciples the meaning of the Wheel . '[868-the lama] ' [We]6820-we take [the Road]4566-the road , then ? '[344-kim] ' [The Road]4566-the road and [our]6820-we Search . [I]3360-i was but waiting for [thee]3353-his disciples . It was made plain to [me]3360-i in a hundred dreams - notably one that came upon the night of the day that [the Gates of Learning]2673-the gates of learning first shut that without [thee]3353-his disciples [I]3360-i should never find [[my]3360-i River]1074-my river . Again and again , as [thou]3353-his disciples knowest , [I]3360-i put this from [me]3360-i , fearing an illusion . Therefore [I]3360-i would not take [thee]3353-his disciples with [me]3360-i that day at [Lucknow]121-lucknow , when [we]6820-we ate the cakes . [I]3360-i would not take [thee]3353-his disciples till the . time was ripe and auspicious . From [the Hills]10-the hills to [the Sea]220-the sea , from [the Sea]220-the sea to [the Hills]10-the hills have [I]3360-i gone , but it was vain . Then [I]3360-i remembered [the Tataka]195-the tataka . '[3360-i] [He]3360-i told [Kim]344-kim the story of the elephant with the leg - iron , as [he]3360-i had told it so often to [the Jam priests]3361-the jam priests . ' Further testimony is not needed , '[3360-i] [he]3360-i ended serenely . ' [Thou]3353-his disciples wast sent for an aid . That aid removed , [my]3360-i Search came to naught . Therefore [we]6820-we will go out again together , and [our]6820-we Search sure . '[3360-i] ' Whither go [we]6820-we ? '[3360-i] ' What matters , Friend of all [the World]14-the world ? The Search , [I]3360-i say , is sure . If need be , [the River]33-the river will break from [the ground before [us]6820-we]6825-the ground before us . [I]3360-i acquired merit when [I]3360-i sent [thee]3353-his disciples to [the Gates of [Learning]196-learning]221-the gates of learning , and gave [thee]3353-his disciples the jewel that is Wisdom . [Thou]3353-his disciples didst return , [I]3360-i saw even now , [a follower of [Sakyamuni]611-sakyamuni]6826-a follower of sakyamuni , [the Physician]6827-the physician , whose altars are many in [Bhotiyal]172-bhotiyal . It is sufficient . [We]6820-we are together , and all things are as they were - Friend of all [the World]14-the world - [Friend of [the Stars]438-the stars]6828-friend of the stars - [[my]3360-i chela]4863-my chela ! '[3360-i] Then [they]3362-they talked of matters secular ; but it was noticeable that [the lama]868-the lama never demanded any details of life at [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier , nor showed the faintest curiosity as to the manners and customs of [Sahibs]552-the sahibs . [His]868-the lama mind moved all in the past , and [he]868-the lama revived every step of [their]3362-they wonderful first journey together , rubbing [his]868-the lama hands and chuckling , till it pleased [him]868-the lama to curl [himself]868-the lama up into the sudden sleep of old age . [Kim]344-kim watched the last dusty sunshine fade out of [the court]3364-the court , and played with [his]344-kim ghost - dagger and rosary . The clamour of [Benares]37-benares , oldest of [[all earth]1556-all earth 's cities]3366-all earth 's cities awake before [the Gods]402-the gods , day and night , beat round the walls as [the sea]1554-the sea 's roar round a breakwater . Now and again , [a Jain priest]3368-a jain priest crossed [the court]3364-the court , with some small offering to the images , and swept the path about [him]3368-a jain priest lest by chance [he]3368-a jain priest should take the life of a living thing . A lamp twinkled , and there followed the sound of a prayer . [Kim]344-kim watched the stars as they rose one after another in the still , sticky dark , till [he]344-kim fell asleep at the foot of the altar . That night [he]868-the lama dreamed in Hindustani , with never an English word ... ' [Holy One]385-holy one , there is [the child to whom [we]6831-we gave the medicine]6830-the child to whom we gave the medicine , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama said , about three o'clock in the morning , when [the lama , also waking from dreams , would have fared forth on pilgrimage]3370-the lama , also waking from dreams , would have fared forth on pilgrimage . ' [The Jat]601-the jat will be here at the light . '[868-the lama] ' [I]868-the lama am well answered . In [my]868-the lama haste [I]868-the lama would have done a wrong . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama sat down on the cushions and returned to [his]868-the lama rosary . ' Surely [old folk]6832-old folk are as [children]848-children , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama said pathetically . ' [They]6832-old folk desire a matter - behold , it must be done at once , or [they]6832-old folk fret and weep ! Many times when [I]868-the lama was upon [the Road]4566-the road [I]868-the lama have been ready to stamp with [my]868-the lama feet at the hindrance of [an ox - cart]6835-an ox - cart in the way , or a mere cloud of dust . It was not so when [I]868-the lama was [a man]750-a man - a long time ago . None the less it is wrongful - '[868-the lama] ' But [thou]6837-thou art indeed old , [Holy One]385-holy one . '[868-the lama] ' The thing was done . A Cause was put out into [the world]759-the world , and , old or young , sick or sound , knowing or unknowing , who can rein in the effect of that Cause ? Does the Wheel hang still if [a child]4501-a child spin it - or [a drunkard]6840-a drunkard ? [Chela]439-chela , this is [a great and a terrible world]5317-a great and a terrible world . '[868-the lama] ' [I]344-kim think it good , '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim yawned . ' What is there to eat ? [I]344-kim have not eaten since yesterday even . '[344-kim] ' [I]868-the lama had forgotten [thy]1409-the farmer need . [Yonder]24-yonder is good Bhotiyal tea and cold rice . '[868-the lama] ' [We]6842-we can not walk far on such stuff . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim felt all [the European]595-european 's lust for flesh - meat , which is not accessible in [a Jain temple]3371-a jain temple . Yet , instead of going out at once with the begging - bowl , [he]344-kim stayed [his]344-kim stomach on slabs of cold rice till the full dawn . It brought [the farmer]1409-the farmer , voluble , stuttering with gratitude . ' In the night the fever broke and the sweat came , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim cried . ' Feel here - [his]1409-the farmer skin is fresh and new ! [He]1409-the farmer esteemed the salt lozenges , and took milk with greed . '[344-kim] [He]344-kim drew the cloth from [the child]747-the child 's face , and it smiled sleepily at [Kim]344-kim . A little knot of [Jain priests , silent but all - observant]3374-jain priests , silent but all - observant , gathered by the temple door . [They]3374-jain priests , silent but all - observant knew , and [Kim]344-kim knew that [they]3374-jain priests , silent but all - observant knew , how [the old lama]3375-the old lama had met [[his]3375-the old lama disciple]949-his disciple . Being [courteous folk]2669-courteous folk , [they]3374-jain priests , silent but all - observant had not obtruded [themselves]3374-jain priests , silent but all - observant overnight by presence , word , or gesture . Wherefore [Kim]344-kim repaid [them]3374-jain priests , silent but all - observant as the sun rose . ' Thank [the Gods of [the Jains]612-the jains]6843-the gods of the jains , [brother]5021-brother , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim said , not knowing how [those Gods]3378-those gods were named . ' The fever is indeed broken . '[344-kim] ' Look ! See ! '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama beamed in the background upon [his]868-the lama hosts of three years . ' Was there ever [such a chela]3072-such a chela ? [He]3072-such a chela follows [[our]3380-the jains Lord [the Healer]6847-the healer]6846-our lord the healer . '[868-the lama] Now [the Jains]3380-the jains officially recognize [all the Gods of the Hindu creed]3381-all the gods of the hindu creed , as well as the Lingam and the Snake . [They]3380-the jains wear the Brahminical thread ; [they]3380-the jains adhere to every claim of Hindu caste - law . But , because [they]3380-the jains knew and loved [the lama]868-the lama , because [he]868-the lama was [an old man]831-an old man , because [he]868-the lama sought the Way , because [he]868-the lama was [[their]3380-the jains guest]3384-their guest , and because [he]868-the lama collogued long of nights with [the head - priest]6529-the head - priest - as free - thinking [a metaphysician as ever]3386-a metaphysician as ever split one hair into seventy - [they]3380-the jains murmured assent . ' Remember , '[344-kim] - [Kim]344-kim bent over [the child]747-the child - . ' this trouble may come again . '[344-kim] ' Not if [thou]6848-thou hast the proper spell , '[3287-the father] said [the father]3287-the father . ' But in a little while [we]3380-the jains go away . '[3287-the father] ' True , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama to [all the Jains]3390-all the jains . ' [We]3380-the jains go now together upon [the Search]222-the search whereof [I]868-the lama have often spoken . [I]868-the lama waited till [my]868-the lama chela was ripe . '[868-the lama] ' But [I]4769-the cultivator am not [a beggar]1196-a beggar . '[4769-the cultivator] [The cultivator]4769-the cultivator rose to [his]4769-the cultivator feet , clutching [the child]747-the child . ' Be still .
