' Meet [us]3380-the jains again under [the big railway bridge]6852-the big railway bridge , and for the sake of [all the Gods of [[our]3380-the jains Punjab]6854-our punjab]6853-all the gods of our punjab , bring food - curry , pulse , cakes fried in fat , and sweetmeats . Specially sweetmeats . Be swift ! '[344-kim] The pallor of hunger suited [Kim]344-kim very well as [he]344-kim stood , tall and slim , in [his]344-kim sand - coloured , sweeping robes , one hand on [his]344-kim rosary and the other in the attitude of benediction , faithfully copied from [the lama]868-the lama . [An English observer]3395-an english observer might have said that [he]344-kim looked rather like [the young saint of a stained - glass window]3396-the young saint of a stained - glass window , whereas [he]344-kim was but [a growing lad faint with emptiness]3397-a growing lad faint with emptiness . Long and formal were the farewells , thrice ended and thrice renewed . [The Seeker]562-the seeker - [he]562-the seeker who had invited [the lama]868-the lama to [that haven from far- away [Tibet]22-tibet]3399-that haven from far- away tibet , [a silver - faced , hairless ascetic]3400-a silver - faced , hairless ascetic -took no part in it , but meditated , as always , alone among the images . [The others]5143-the others were very human ; pressing small comforts upon [the old man]861-the old man - a betel - box , a fine new iron pencase , a food - bag , and such - like - warning [him]861-the old man against the dangers of [the world]759-the world without , and prophesying a happy end to the Search . [Meantime Kim]344-kim , lonelier than ever , squatted on the steps , and swore to [himself]344-kim in the language of [St Xavier]495-st xavier 's . ' But it is [my]344-kim own fault , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim concluded . ' With [Mahbub]383-mahbub , [I]344-kim ate [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's bread , or [Lurgan Sahib]539-lurgan sahib 's . At [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier , three meals a day . [Here]4484-here [I]344-kim must jolly - well look out for [myself]344-kim . Besides , [I]344-kim am not in good training . How [I]344-kim could eat a plate of beef now ! ... Is it finished , [Holy One]385-holy one ? '[344-kim] [The lama]868-the lama , both hands raised , intoned a final blessing in ornate Chinese . ' [I]868-the lama must lean on [thy]868-the lama shoulder , '[868-the lama] said [he]868-the lama , as the temple gates closed . ' [We]6856-we grow stiff , [I]868-the lama think . '[868-the lama] The weight of [a six - foot man]3405-a six - foot man is not light to steady through miles of [crowded streets]3406-crowded streets , and [Kim]344-kim , loaded down with bundles and packages for the way , was glad to reach the shadow of [the railway bridge]3407-the railway bridge . ' Here [we]6856-we eat , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama said resolutely , as [the Kamboh]614-the kamboh , blue - robed and smiling , hove in sight , a basket in one hand and [the child]747-the child in the other . ' Fall to , [Holy Ones]615-holy ones ! '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama cried from fifty yards . [They]3409-they were by the shoal under the first bridge - span , out of sight of [hungry priests]3410-hungry priests . ' Rice and good curry , cakes all warm and well scented with hing asafoetida , curds and sugar . [King of [[my]3409-they fields]6858-my fields]6857-king of my fields , '[3409-they] -this to [the small son]3411-the small son - ' let [us]6856-we show [these holy men]6859-these holy men that [[we]6856-we Jats of [Jullundur]71-jullundur]6860-we jats of jullundur can pay a service ... '[868-the lama] ' And [we]6856-we , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , turning [his]344-kim back and heaping a leafplatter for [the lama]868-the lama , ' are beyond all castes . '[344-kim] [They]3414-they gorged [themselves]3414-they on the good food in silence . ' If [[our]6856-we roads]1919-our roads lie together , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama said roughly , ' [I]868-the lama go with [thee]6864-thee . ' [The Jats]606-jats are called quarrel - some , but that is not true . Except when [we]6856-we are crossed , [we]6856-we are like [our]6856-we own buffaloes . '[868-the lama] ' So be it , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . ' A good stick is a good reason . '[344-kim] [The lama]868-the lama gazed placidly up - stream , where in long , smudged perspective the ceaseless columns of smoke go up from [the burning- ghats by [the river]5005-the river]3416-the burning- ghats by the river . Now and again , despite all municipal regulations , the fragment of a half - burned body bobbed by on the full current . ' But for [thee]6864-thee , '[614-the kamboh] said [the Kamboh]614-the kamboh to [Kim]344-kim , drawing [the child]747-the child into [his]868-the lama hairy breast , ' [I]614-the kamboh might today have gone thither - with [this one]1289-this one . [The priests]6870-the priests tell [us]6856-we that [Benares]37-benares is holy - which none doubt - and desirable to die in . But [I]614-the kamboh do not know [[their]6870-the priests Gods]5135-their gods , and [they]6870-the priests ask for money ; and when one has done one worship a shaved - head vows it is of none effect except one do another . '[614-the kamboh] ' [I]868-the lama have said many times - in [the Temple]1515-the temple , [I]868-the lama think - that if need be , [the River]5005-the river will open at [our]6856-we feet . ' [I]868-the lama remember [a pleasant place , set about with fruit - trees]6877-a pleasant place , set about with fruit - trees , where [one]1164-one can walk in meditation - and the air is cooler there . [[My]3421-my son]4602-my son is best in [[his]4602-my son mother]727-his mother 's arms . [The Government]85-the government has brought on [us]6886-us many taxes , but it gives [us]6886-us one good thing - the te - rain that joins [friends]2013-friends and unites [the anxious]6890-the anxious . A wonderful matter is the te - rain . '[3421-my] [They]3421-my all piled into it a couple of hours later , and slept through the heat of the day . [The Kamboh]614-the kamboh plied [Kim]344-kim with ten thousand questions as to [the lama]868-the lama 's walk and work in life , and received some curious answers . [Kim]344-kim was content to be where [he]344-kim was , to look out upon [the flat North - Western landscape]3423-the flat north - western landscape , and to talk to [the changing mob of [fellow - passengers]3425-fellow - passengers]3424-the changing mob of fellow - passengers . Even today , tickets and ticket- clipping are dark oppression to [Indian rustics]3426-indian rustics . [They]3426-indian rustics do not understand why , when [they]3426-indian rustics have paid for a magic piece of paper , [strangers]4994-strangers should punch great pieces out of the charm . So , long and furious are the debates between [travellers]3428-travellers and [Eurasian ticket- collectors]3429-eurasian ticket- collectors . [Kim]344-kim assisted at two or three with grave advice , meant to darken counsel and to show off [his]344-kim wisdom before [the lama]868-the lama and [the admiring Kamboh]614-the kamboh . But at [Somna Road]225-somna road [the Fates]3431-the fates sent [him]344-kim a matter to think upon . There tumbled into [the compartment]3432-the compartment , as [the train]913-the train was moving off , [a mean , lean little person]3434-a mean , lean little person - [a Mahratta]3435-a mahratta , so far as [Kim]344-kim could judge by the cock of the tight turban . [His]3434-a mean , lean little person face was cut , [his]3434-a mean , lean little person muslin upper - garment was badly torn , and one leg was bandaged . [He]3434-a mean , lean little person told [them]3426-indian rustics that [a country - cart]3436-a country - cart had upset and nearly slain [him]3434-a mean , lean little person : [he]3434-a mean , lean little person was going to [Delhi]12-delhi , where [[his]3434-a mean , lean little person son]1704-his son lived . [Kim]344-kim watched [him]3434-a mean , lean little person closely . If , as [he]3434-a mean , lean little person asserted , [he]3434-a mean , lean little person had been rolled over and over on the earth , there should have been signs of gravel - rash on the skin . But all [his]3434-a mean , lean little person injuries seemed clean cuts , and a mere fall from a cart could not cast [a man]750-a man into such extremity of terror . As , with shaking fingers , [he]3434-a mean , lean little person knotted up the torn cloth about [his]3434-a mean , lean little person neck [he]3434-a mean , lean little person laid bare an amulet of the kind called [a keeper - up of the heart]3439-a keeper - up of the heart . Now , amulets are common enough , but they are not generally strung on square - plaited copper wire , and still fewer amulets bear black enamel on silver . There were none except [the Kamboh]614-the kamboh and [the lama in [the compartment]3432-the compartment]3440-the lama in the compartment , which , luckily , was of an old type with solid ends . [Kim]344-kim made as to scratch in [his]3434-a mean , lean little person bosom , and thereby lifted [his]344-kim own amulet . [The Mahratta]3442-the mahratta 's face changed altogether at the sight , and [he]3442-the mahratta disposed the amulet fairly on [his]3442-the mahratta breast . ' Yes , '[3442-the mahratta] [he]3442-the mahratta went on to [the Kamboh]614-the kamboh , ' [I]3442-the mahratta was in haste , and the cart , driven by [a bastard]6891-a bastard , bound its wheel in a water - cut , and besides the harm done to [me]3442-the mahratta there was lost a full dish of tarkeean . '[614-the kamboh] ' [I]344-kim come from [the South]1783-the south , where [my]344-kim work lay . One of [us]6918-us [they]6918-us slew by the roadside . Hast [thou]3442-the mahratta heard ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim shook [his]344-kim head . ' Having found a certain letter which [I]344-kim was sent to seek , [I]344-kim came away . [I]344-kim escaped from [the city]4596-the city and ran to [Mhow]227-mhow . So sure was [I]344-kim that [none]4586-none knew , [I]344-kim did not change [my]344-kim face . At [Mhow]227-mhow [a woman]1192-a woman brought charge against [me]344-kim of theft of jewellery in [that city]4559-that city which [I]344-kim had left . Then [I]344-kim saw the cry was out against [me]344-kim . [I]344-kim ran from [Mhow]227-mhow by night , bribing [the police]1665-the police , who had been bribed to hand [me]344-kim over without question to [[my]344-kim enemies]6924-my enemies in [the South]74-the south . Then [I]344-kim lay in [old Chitor city]6925-old chitor city a week , a penitent in [a temple]6926-a temple , but [I]344-kim could not get rid of the letter which was [my]344-kim charge . [I]344-kim buried it under [[the Queen]6927-the queen 's Stone]6928-the queen 's stone , at [Chitor]228-chitor , in [the place known to [us]6930-us all]6929-the place known to us all . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim did not know , but not for worlds would [he]344-kim have broken the thread . ' At [Chitor]228-chitor , look [you]228-chitor , [I]344-kim was all in [[Kings]870-kings '[344-kim] country]6932-kings ' country ; for [Kotah]229-kotah to the east is beyond [the Queen]6927-the queen 's law , and east again lie [Jaipur]230-jaipur and [Gwalior]231-gwalior . Neither love [spies]3450-spies , and there is no justice . [I]0-i was hunted like [a wet jackal]3451-a wet jackal ; but [I]0-i broke through at [Bandakui]232-bandakui , where [I]0-i heard there was a charge against [me]0-i of murder in [the city]4596-the city [I]0-i had left - of the murder of [a boy]4870-a boy . [They]3454-they have both the corpse and [the witnesses]3455-the witnesses waiting . ' '[3454-they] But can not [the Government]852-the government protect ? ' '[3457-we] [We]3457-we of [the Game]618-the game are beyond protection . If [we]3457-we die , [we]3457-we die . [Our]3457-we names are blotted from the book . That is all . At [Bandakui]232-bandakui , where lives one of [Us]3457-we , [I]0-i thought to slip the scent by changing [my]0-i face , and so made [me]0-i [a Mahratta]3435-a mahratta . Then [I]0-i came to [Agra]233-agra , and would have turned back to [Chitor]228-chitor to recover the letter . So sure [I]0-i was [I]0-i had slipped them . Therefore [I]0-i did not send a tar telegram to any one saying where the letter lay . [I]0-i wished the credit of it all . ' [Kim]344-kim nodded . [He]344-kim understood that feeling well . '[0-i] But at [Agra]233-agra , walking in [the streets]3459-the streets , [a man]750-a man cried a debt against [me]0-i , and approaching with [many witnesses]3461-many witnesses , would hale [me]0-i to [the courts]3462-the courts then and there . Oh , [they]3463-they are clever in [the South]74-the south ! [He]750-a man recognized [me]0-i as [[his]750-a man agent]3464-his agent for cotton . May [he]750-a man burn in [Hell]234-hell for it ! ' '[750-a man] And wast [thou]3465-thou ? ' '[3465-thou] [O fool]2807-o fool ! [I]0-i was [the man [they]3463-they sought for the matter of the letter]3467-the man they sought for the matter of the letter ! [I]0-i ran into [the Fleshers ' Ward]6933-the fleshers ' ward and came out by the House of [the Jew]6934-the jew , who feared a riot and pushed [me]0-i forth . [I]0-i came afoot to [Somna Road]225-somna road - [I]0-i had only money for [my]0-i tikkut to [Delhi]12-delhi - and there , while [I]0-i lay in [a ditch]6935-a ditch with a fever , [one]1164-one sprang out of the bushes and beat [me]0-i and cut [me]0-i and searched [me]0-i from head to foot . Within earshot of the te- rain it was ! '[0-i] ' Why did [he]1164-one not slay [thee]0-i out of hand ? '[3468-i] ' [They]3463-they are not so foolish . If [I]3468-i am taken in [Delhi]12-delhi at the instance of [lawyers]6492-lawyers , upon a proven charge of murder , [my]3468-i body is handed over to [the State that desires it]6938-the state that desires it . [I]3468-i go back guarded , and then - [I]3468-i die slowly for an example to [the rest of [Us]6940-us]5489-the rest of us . [The South]74-the south is not [[my]3468-i country]5304-my country . [I]3468-i run in circles - like a goat with one eye . [I]3468-i have not eaten for two days . '[3468-i] ' [Thou]6942-thou art safe in the te - rain , at least . '[3468-i] ' Live a year at [the Great Game]235-the great game and tell [me]344-kim that again ! Twenty - a hundred , if need be - will have seen [me]344-kim slay [that boy]2413-that boy . And [thou]6942-thou art useless ! '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim knew enough of native methods of attack not to doubt that the case would be deadly complete - even to the corpse . [The Mahratta]617-the mahratta twitched [his]617-the mahratta fingers with pain from time to time . '[4471-the man] It was the usual collection of small oddments : bits of cloth , quack medicines , cheap fairings , a clothful of atta - greyish , rough- ground native flour - twists of down - country tobacco , tawdry pipe- stems , and a packet of curry - stuff , all wrapped in . a quilt . Chapter 12 Who hath desired [the Sea]220-the sea - the sight of salt - water unbounded ? The heave and the halt and the hurl and the crash of the comber wind - hounded ? The sleek - barrelled swell before storm - grey , foamless , enormous , and growing ? Stark calm on the lap of [the Line]239-the line - or the crazy - eyed hurricane blowing ? [His]868-the lama Sea in no showing the same - [[his]868-the lama Sea]3498-his sea and the same ' neath all showing - [[His]868-the lama Sea]3498-his sea that [his]868-the lama being fulfils ? So and no otherwise - so and [no otherwise hill - men]6996-no otherwise hill - men desire [[their]6996-no otherwise hill - men [Hills]10-the hills]6997-their hills ! '[0-i] Hunger and fear make [men]752-men dazed , or [I]0-i might have thought of this escape before . [I]0-i was right . [They]752-men come to hunt for [me]0-i . ' [A group of yellow - trousered Punjab policemen , headed by [a hot and perspiring young Englishman]6999-a hot and perspiring young englishman]6998-a group of yellow - trousered punjab policemen , headed by a hot and perspiring young englishman , parted [the crowd]4816-the crowd about [the carriages]7001-the carriages . ' Oh , [zoolum]7018-zoolum ! What oppression ! '[6754-the jat] growled [the Jat]6754-the jat from [his]6754-the jat corner . ' All for the sake of a jest too . '[6754-the jat] [The Saddhu]620-the saddhu followed [the policeman]4469-the policeman , fawning and supplicating . ' It is well '[620-the saddhu] , [the Saddhu]620-the saddhu whispered , jammed in the calling , shouting , bewildered press - a Persian greyhound between [his]6754-the jat feet and [a cageful of yelling hawks under charge of [a Rajput falconer in the small of [his]6754-the jat back]3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back]3521-a cageful of yelling hawks under charge of a rajput falconer in the small of his back . ' [He]6754-the jat has gone now to send word of the letter which [I]3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back hid . [They]7019-they told [me]3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back [he]6754-the jat was in [Peshawur]55-peshawur . [I]3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back might have known that [he]6754-the jat is like the crocodile - always at the other ford . [He]6754-the jat has saved [me]3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back from present calamity , but [I]3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back owe [my]3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back life to [thee]7020-thou . '[3522-a rajput falconer in the small of his back] ' Is [he]6754-the jat also one of [Us]7021-us ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim ducked under [a Mewar camel - driver]3523-a mewar camel - driver 's greasy armpit and cannoned off [a covey of jabbering Sikh matrons]3524-a covey of jabbering sikh matrons . ' Not less than the greatest . [We]7021-us are both fortunate ! [I]344-kim will make report to [him]6754-the jat of what [thou]7020-thou hast done . [I]344-kim am safe under [his]6754-the jat protection . '[344-kim] [He]344-kim bored through the edge of the crowd besieging [the carriages]7001-the carriages , and squatted by the bench near [the telegraph - office]3526-the telegraph - office . ' Return , or [they]7022-they take [thy]7020-thou place ! [Have]7023-have no fear for the work , [brother]5021-brother - or [my]344-kim life . [Thou]7020-thou hast given [me]344-kim breathing - space , and [Strickland Sahib]623-strickland sahib has pulled [me]344-kim to [land]7025-land . [We]7026-we may work together at the Game yet . Farewell ! '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim hurried to [[his]344-kim carriage]3527-his carriage : elated , bewildered , but a little nettled in that [he]344-kim had no key to the secrets about [him]344-kim . ' [I]344-kim am only [a beginner at the Game]7027-a beginner at the game , that is sure . [I]344-kim could not have leaped into safety as did [the Saddhu]620-the saddhu . [He]620-the saddhu knew it was darkest under the lamp . [I]344-kim could not have thought to tell news under pretence of cursing ... and how clever was [the Sahib]623-strickland sahib ! No matter , [I]344-kim saved the life of one ... Where is [the Kamboh]614-the kamboh gone , [Holy One]385-holy one ? '[344-kim] [he]344-kim whispered , as [he]344-kim took [his]344-kim seat in the now crowded compartment . ' A fear gripped [him]620-the saddhu , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama replied , with a touch of tender malice . ' [He]620-the saddhu saw [thee]868-the lama change [the Mahratta]617-the mahratta to a Saddhu in the twinkling of an eye , as a protection against evil . That shook [him]620-the saddhu . '[868-the lama] [Kim]344-kim controlled [himself]344-kim with an effort beyond [his]344-kim years . ' Where [I]344-kim have offended [thee]868-the lama [I]344-kim have done wrong . '[344-kim] ' It is more , [chela]5580-chela . '[344-kim] This ignorance was well both for [Kim]344-kim 's vanity and for [the lama]868-the lama 's peace of mind , when [we]3533-we think that there was then being handed in at [Simla]159-simla a code - wire reporting the arrival of [E23]619-e23 at [Delhi]12-delhi , and , more important , the whereabouts of a letter [he]868-the lama had been commissioned to - abstract . [The lama]868-the lama made [his]868-the lama in ample form near the dewy bougainvillea - trellis near [the platform]4808-the platform , cheered by the clear sunshine and the presence of [[his]868-the lama disciple]949-his disciple . ' [We]7040-we will put these things behind [us]7040-we , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama said , indicating the brazen engine and the gleaming track . '[868-the lama] ' Let [us]7040-we go to [[the Kulu woman]2181-the kulu woman 's house]7042-the kulu woman 's house '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , and stepped forth cheerily under the bundles . Early morning [Saharunpore]100-saharunpore - way is clean and well scented . [He]868-the lama thought of the other mornings at [St Xavier 's]495-st xavier , and it topped [his]868-the lama already thrice - heaped contentment . ' Where is [this new haste born from]7043-this new haste born from ? [Wise men]2663-wise men do not run about like chickens in the sun . [We]7040-we have come hundreds upon hundreds of koss already , and , till now , [I]868-the lama have scarcely been alone with [thee]3548-the disciple an instant . '[868-the lama] ' [Her]2181-the kulu woman tongue grows no shorter with the years , then ? '[3548-the disciple] [the disciple]3548-the disciple smiled . Now [we]3550-they will wander loose - foot , waiting upon the Chain of Things . [The Search]7047-the search is sure . '[3548-the disciple] So [they]3550-they travelled very easily across and among [the broad bloomful fruit - gardens]3551-the broad bloomful fruit - gardens - by way of [Aminabad]243-aminabad , [Sahaigunge]244-sahaigunge , [Akrola]245-akrola of [the Ford]246-the ford , and [little Phulesa]247-little phulesa - [the line of [the Siwaliks]625-the siwaliks]3552-the line of the siwaliks always to the north , and behind [them]3550-they again the snows . After long , sweet sleep under the dry stars came the lordly , leisurely passage through [a waking village]3553-a waking village - begging - bowl held forth in silence , but eyes roving in defiance of the Law from [sky 's edge to sky 's edge]3554-sky 's edge to sky 's edge . Then would [Kim]344-kim return soft - footed through the soft dust to [[his]344-kim master]6109-his master under the shadow of a mango - tree or the thinner shade of a white Doon siris , to eat and drink at ease . At mid - day , after talk and a little wayfaring , [they]3550-they slept ; meeting [the world]759-the world refreshed when the air was cooler . Night found [them]3550-they adventuring into [new territory]3557-new territory - [some chosen village]3558-some chosen village spied three hours before across [the fat land]3559-the fat land , and much discussed upon [the road]4566-the road . There [they]3550-they told [their]3550-they tale - a new one each evening so far as [Kim]344-kim was concerned - and there were [they]3550-they made welcome , either by [priest]4580-priest or [headman]3562-headman , after the custom of [the kindly East]64-the east . When the shadows shortened and [the lama]868-the lama leaned more heavily upon [Kim]344-kim , there was always the Wheel of Life to draw forth , to hold flat under wiped stones , and with a long straw to expound cycle by cycle . Here sat [the Gods on high]3564-the gods on high - and [they]3564-the gods on high were dreams of dreams . Here was [[our]3565-our Heaven]3566-our heaven and [the world of [the demi - Gods]3568-the demi - gods]3567-the world of the demi - gods - horsemen fighting among [the hills]833-the hills . Here were the agonies done upon the beasts , souls ascending or descending the ladder and therefore not to be interfered with . Here were [the Hells]249-the hells , hot and cold , and the abodes of tormented ghosts . Let [the chela]3570-the chela study the troubles that come from over - eating - bloated stomach and burning bowels . Obediently , then , with bowed head and brown finger alert to follow the pointer , did [the chela]3570-the chela study ; but when [they]3550-they came to the Human World , busy and profitless , that is just above [the Hells]249-the hells , [his]344-kim mind was distracted ; for by the roadside trundled the very Wheel itself , eating , drinking , trading , marrying , and quarrelling - all warmly alive . Often [the lama]868-the lama made the living pictures the matter of [his]868-the lama text , bidding [Kim]344-kim - too ready - note how the flesh takes a thousand shapes , desirable or detestable as [men]752-men reckon , but in truth of no account either way ; and how [the stupid spirit]3574-the stupid spirit , bond - slave to [the Hog]626-the hog , [the Dove]3575-the dove , and the Serpent - lusting after betel - nut , a new yoke of oxen , [women]4700-women , or the favour of [kings]870-kings - is bound to follow the body through all [the Heavens]250-the heavens and [all the Hells]3578-all the hells , and strictly round again . Sometimes [a woman]1192-a woman or [a poor man , watching the ritual]3580-a poor man , watching the ritual - it was nothing less - when the great yellow chart was unfolded , would throw a few flowers or a handful of cowries upon its edge . It sufficed [these humble ones]3581-these humble ones that [they]3550-they had met [a Holy One who might be moved to remember [them]3581-these humble ones in [his]3582-a holy one who might be moved to remember them in his prayers prayers]3582-a holy one who might be moved to remember them in his prayers . ' Cure [them]3581-these humble ones if [they]3581-these humble ones are sick , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama , when [Kim]344-kim 's sporting instincts woke . ' Cure [them]3581-these humble ones if [they]3581-these humble ones have fever , but by no means work charms . Remember what befell [the Mahratta]617-the mahratta . '[868-the lama] ' Then all Doing is evil ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim replied , lying out under a big tree at [the fork of [the Doon road]3585-the doon road]3584-the fork of the doon road , watching the little ants run over [his]344-kim hand . ' To abstain from action is well - except to acquire merit . And [I]868-the lama am [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . '[868-the lama] ' Friend of all [the World]14-the world , '[868-the lama] - [the lama]868-the lama looked directly at [Kim]344-kim - ' [I]868-the lama am [an old man]831-an old man - pleased with shows as are [children]848-children . Hai ! [My]868-the lama bones ache for [that River]33-the river , as they ached in the te - rain ; but [my]868-the lama spirit sits above [my]868-the lama bones , waiting . The Search is sure ! '[868-the lama] ' [I]868-the lama am answered . Is it permitted to ask a question ? '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama inclined [his]868-the lama stately head . '[868-the lama] And [he]868-the lama told stories , tracing with a finger in the dust , of the immense and sumptuous ritual of avalanche - guarded cathedrals ; of processions and devil - dances ; of the changing of [monks]3589-monks and [nuns]3590-nuns into swine ; of holy cities fifteen thousand feet in the air ; of intrigue between [monastery]3591-monastery and [monastery]3591-monastery ; of voices among [the hills]833-the hills , and of [that mysterious mirage that dances on dry snow]3594-that mysterious mirage that dances on dry snow . [He]868-the lama spoke even of [Lhassa]264-lhassa and of [the Dalai Lama]3595-the dalai lama , whom [he]868-the lama had seen and adored . Each long , perfect day rose behind [Kim]344-kim for a barrier to cut [him]344-kim off from [his]344-kim race and [[his]344-kim mother]727-his mother - tongue . [He]868-the lama slipped back to thinking and dreaming in the vernacular , and mechanically followed [the lama]868-the lama 's ceremonial observances at eating , drinking , and the like . [The old man]861-the old man 's mind turned more and more to [[his]861-the old man monastery]1000-his monastery as [his]861-the old man eyes turned to the steadfast snows . [[His]861-the old man River]5475-his river troubled [him]861-the old man nothing . Now and again , indeed , [he]861-the old man would gaze long and long at a tuft or a twig , expecting , [he]861-the old man said , the earth to cleave and deliver its blessing ; but [he]861-the old man was content to be with [[his]861-the old man disciple]949-his disciple , at ease in the temperate wind that comes down from [the Doon]251-the doon . This was not [Ceylon]193-ceylon , nor [Buddh Gaya]36-buddh gaya , nor [Bombay]60-bombay , nor [some grass - tangled ruins]3602-some grass - tangled ruins that [he]861-the old man seemed to have stumbled upon two years ago . [He]861-the old man spoke of [those places]3603-those places as [a scholar removed from vanity]3604-a scholar removed from vanity , as [a Seeker walking in humility]3605-a seeker walking in humility , as [an old man , wise and temperate , illumining knowledge with brilliant insight]3606-an old man , wise and temperate , illumining knowledge with brilliant insight . Bit by bit , disconnectedly , each tale called up by some wayside thing , [he]861-the old man spoke of all [his]861-the old man wanderings up and down [Hind]70-hind ; till [Kim]344-kim , who had loved [him]861-the old man without reason , now loved [him]861-the old man for fifty good reasons . So [they]3607-their enjoyed [themselves]3607-their in high felicity , abstaining , as the Rule demands , from evil words , covetous desires ; not over- eating , not lying on high beds , nor wearing rich clothes . [Their]3607-their stomachs told [them]3607-their the time , and [the people]4594-the people brought [them]3607-their [their]3607-their food , as the saying is . [They]3607-their were [lords of [the villages of [Aminabad]243-aminabad]3610-the villages of aminabad , [Sahaigunge]244-sahaigunge , [[Akrola]245-akrola of [the Ford]246-the ford]253-akrola of the ford]3609-lords of the villages of aminabad , sahaigunge , akrola of the ford , and [little Phulesa]247-little phulesa , where [Kim]344-kim gave [the soulless woman]3611-the soulless woman a blessing . ' Now do [I]868-the lama remember '[868-the lama] - [the lama]868-the lama spoke as though it were a wholly new proposition . ' [She]1981-his mistress is virtuous , but [an inordinate talker]7062-an inordinate talker . '[868-the lama] [Kim]344-kim was sitting on the edge of a cow 's manger , telling stories to [[a village smith]3617-a village smith 's children]3618-a village smith 's children . ' [She]1981-his mistress will only ask for [another son]7063-another son for [[her]1981-his mistress daughter]1847-her daughter . '[868-the lama] [They]3619-we covered eleven miles through [the fields]4992-the fields in two days , and were overwhelmed with attentions at the end ; for [the old lady]1825-the old lady held a fine tradition of hospitality , to which [she]1825-the old lady forced [[[her]1825-the old lady son]3622-her son - in - law , who was under the thumb of [[his]3622-her son women - folk]3624-his women - folk and bought peace by borrowing of [the money - lender]4771-the money - lender]3623-her son - in - law , who was under the thumb of his women - folk and bought peace by borrowing of the money - lender . '[1825-the old lady] For proof , [she]1825-the old lady harangued [the entire household]3628-the entire household unsparingly till food and drink were brought ; and in the evening - the smoke - scented evening , copper - dun and turquoise across [the fields]4992-the fields - it pleased [her]1825-the old lady to order [her]1825-the old lady palanquin to be set down in [the untidy forecourt]3630-the untidy forecourt by smoky torchlight ; and there , behind not too closely drawn curtains , [she]1825-the old lady gossiped . ' Had [the Holy One]4553-the holy one come alone , [I]1825-the old lady should have received [him]4553-the holy one otherwise ; but with [this rogue , who can be too careful]7072-this rogue , who can be too careful ? '[1825-the old lady] ' [Maharanee]629-maharanee , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , choosing as always the amplest title , ' is it [my]344-kim fault that none other than [a Sahib]5596-a sahib - [a polis - Sahib]7074-a polis - sahib - called the Maharanee whose face [he]4553-the holy one - '[344-kim] ' [Chutt]630-chutt ! But [I]1825-the old lady would ask [thy]7075-we Holy One - stand aside , rogue - a charm against most lamentable windy colics that in mango - time overtake [[[my]1825-the old lady daughter]4623-my daughter 's eldest]7086-my daughter 's eldest . " ' Cure [them]7087-them if [they]7087-them are sick , " '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim quoted relishingly , " ' but by no means work charms . Remember what befell [the Mahratta]617-the mahratta . " '[344-kim] ' That was two Rains ago ; [she]4623-my daughter wearied [me]868-the lama with [her]4623-my daughter continual importunity . ' Thus it comes - take note , [[my]3634-the unjust judge chela]4863-my chela - that [even those who would follow the Way]7089-even those who would follow the way are thrust aside by [idle women]7090-idle women . '[3634-the unjust judge] ' [Arre]632-arre ! and to whom else should [I]868-the lama talk ? [[The boy]986-the boy 's mother]7093-the boy 's mother knew nothing , and [the father]3287-the father - in the nights of the cold weather it was - " Pray to [the Gods]402-the gods , " said [he]3287-the father , forsooth , and turning over , snored ! '[868-the lama] ' [I]1825-the old lady gave [her]4623-my daughter the charm . What is [an old man]831-an old man to do ? '[1825-the old lady] " ' To abstain from action is well - except to acquire merit . [The troops]7223-the troops were recalled because [the Government]852-the government believed [the Five Kings]7225-the five kings were cowed ; and it is not cheap to feed [men]752-men among [the high Passes]49-the passes . '[3683-i] [He]3683-i broke off with a giggle into English : ' Of course , [I]3683-i tell [you]7228-you this unoffeecially to elucidate political situation , [Mister O'Hara]636-mister o'hara . '[344-kim] ' [I]400-hurree babu tell [you]400-hurree babu , it was jolly - beastly cold up there too , after summer , '[400-hurree babu] said [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu confidentially . Nothing was done . Only [my]400-hurree babu feet were frozen , and a toe dropped off . [I]400-hurree babu sent word that [the roads for which [I]400-hurree babu was paying money to [the diggers]7245-the diggers]7244-the roads for which i was paying money to the diggers were being made for the feet of [strangers]4994-strangers and [enemies]7247-enemies . '[400-hurree babu] ' For ? '[344-kim] ' For [the Russians]642-the russians . The thing was an open jest among [the coolies]7248-the coolies . Then [I]3684-i was called down to tell what [I]3684-i knew by speech of tongue . [Mahbub]383-mahbub came [South]1840-south too . See the end ! Over the Passes this year after snow - melting '[3684-i] - [he]3684-i shivered afresh - ' come [two strangers under cover of shooting wild goats]7250-two strangers under cover of shooting wild goats . [They]7250-two strangers under cover of shooting wild goats bear guns , but [they]7250-two strangers under cover of shooting wild goats bear also chains and levels and compasses . '[3684-i] ' Oho ! The thing gets clearer . '[400-hurree babu] ' [They]7250-two strangers under cover of shooting wild goats are well received by [Hilas]639-hilas and [Bunar]261-bunar . [They]7250-two strangers under cover of shooting wild goats make great promises ; [they]7250-two strangers under cover of shooting wild goats speak as the mouthpiece of [a Kaisar with gifts]7251-a kaisar with gifts . Here can [ye]7256-ye hold the road against [an army]3109-an army " - [the very roads for which [I]400-hurree babu paid out the rupees monthly]7259-the very roads for which i paid out the rupees monthly . [The Government]85-the government knows , but does nothing . [The three other Kings]7260-the three other kings , who were not paid for guarding [the Passes]49-the passes , tell [them]7260-the three other kings by runner of the bad faith of [Bunar]261-bunar and [Hilas]639-hilas . When all the evil is done , look [you]7261-you - when [these two strangers with the levels and the compasses]7262-these two strangers with the levels and the compasses make [the Five Kings]7225-the five kings to believe that a great army will sweep [the Passes]49-the passes tomorrow or the next day - [Hill]7264-hill - [people]4650-people are [all fools]7266-all fools - comes the order to [me]400-hurree babu , [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu , " Go North and see what [those strangers]7267-those strangers do . " [I]400-hurree babu say to [Creighton Sahib]393-colonel creighton , " This is not a lawsuit , that [we]7268-we go about to collect evidence . " '[400-hurree babu] [Hurree]400-hurree babu returned to [his]400-hurree babu English with a jerk : " ' By [Jove]638-jove , " [I]400-hurree babu said , " why the dooce do [you]400-hurree babu not issue demi - offeecial orders to [some brave man]7269-some brave man to poison [them]7269-some brave man , for an example ? " And [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton , [he]393-colonel creighton laughed at [me]400-hurree babu ! It is all [your]400-hurree babu beastly English pride . '[400-hurree babu] [Kim]344-kim smoked slowly , revolving the business , so far as [he]344-kim understood it , in [his]344-kim quick mind . ' Then [thou]7271-thou goest forth to follow [the strangers]7272-the strangers ? '[344-kim] ' No . To meet [them]7272-the strangers . Of course , [we]7275-we always do that . It is [our]7275-we British pride . '[400-hurree babu] ' Then what is to fear from [them]7272-the strangers ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , quoting the proverb . ' It was process of Evolution , [I]3685-i think , from Primal Necessity , but the fact remains in all the cui bono . ' All [his]400-hurree babu speech these ten days past has been of little else . If [we]7295-we go together - '[344-kim] ' Oah ! '[344-kim] [He]344-kim yawned ponderously , and with never a civil word lumbered off to [his]344-kim sleeping - place . But [Kim]344-kim slept little , and [his]344-kim thoughts ran in [Hindustani]77-hindustani : ' Well is the Game called great ! And [my]344-kim share and [my]344-kim joy '[344-kim] - [he]344-kim smiled to the darkness- ' [I]344-kim owe to [the lama]868-the lama [here]4484-here . '[400-hurree babu] [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu came out from behind the dovecote washing [his]400-hurree babu teeth with ostentatious ritual . Full - fleshed , heavy - haunched , bull - necked , and deep - voiced , [he]400-hurree babu did not look like ' [a fearful man]3229-a fearful man '[400-hurree babu] . [Kim]344-kim signed almost imperceptibly that matters were in good train , and when the morning toilet was over , [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu , in flowery speech , came to do honour to [the lama]868-the lama . [They]3690-they ate , of course , apart , and afterwards [the old lady , more or less veiled behind a window]3691-the old lady , more or less veiled behind a window , returned to the vital business of green - mango colics in [the young]3692-the young . [The lama]868-the lama 's knowledge of medicine was , of course , sympathetic only . [He]868-the lama believed that the dung of a black horse , mixed with sulphur , and carried in a snake- skin , was a sound remedy for cholera ; but the symbolism interested [him]868-the lama far more than the science . [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu deferred to these views with enchanting politeness , so that [the lama]868-the lama called [him]400-hurree babu [a courteous physician]3695-a courteous physician . [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu replied that [he]400-hurree babu was no more than [an inexpert dabbler in the mysteries]3696-an inexpert dabbler in the mysteries ; but at least - [he]400-hurree babu thanked [the Gods]402-the gods therefore - [he]400-hurree babu knew when [he]400-hurree babu sat in the presence of [a master]3697-a master . [He]400-hurree babu [himself]400-hurree babu had been taught by [the Sahibs , who do not consider expense]3698-the sahibs , who do not consider expense , in [the lordly halls of [Calcutta]84-calcutta]3699-the lordly halls of calcutta ; but , as [he]400-hurree babu was ever first to acknowledge , there lay a wisdom behind earthly wisdom - the high and lonely lore of meditation . [Kim]344-kim looked on with envy . [The Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu of [his]400-hurree babu knowledge - oily , effusive , and nervous - was gone ; gone , too , was [the brazen drug - vendor of overnight]3700-the brazen drug - vendor of overnight . There remained - polished , polite , attentive - [a sober , learned son of experience and adversity]3701-a sober , learned son of experience and adversity , gathering wisdom from [the lama]868-the lama 's lips . [The old lady]1825-the old lady confided to [Kim]344-kim that these rare levels were beyond [her]1825-the old lady . [She]1825-the old lady liked charms with plenty of ink that one could wash off in water , swallow , and be done with . Else what was the use of [the Gods]1244-the gods ? [She]1825-the old lady liked [men]752-men and [women]4700-women , and [she]1825-the old lady spoke of [them]3707-them - of kinglets [she]1825-the old lady had known in the past ; of [her]1825-the old lady own youth and beauty ; of the depredations of leopards and the eccentricities of love [Asiatic]644-asiatic ; of the incidence of taxation , rack - renting , funeral ceremonies , [[her]1825-the old lady son]3622-her son - in - law this by allusion , easy to be followed , the care of [the young]3692-the young , and the age 's lack of decency . And [Kim]344-kim , as interested in the life of [this world]1066-this world as [she]1825-the old lady soon to leave it , squatted with [his]344-kim feet under the hem of [his]344-kim robe , drinking all in , while [the lama]868-the lama demolished one after another every theory of body - curing put forward by [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu . At noon [the Babu]400-hurree babu strapped up [his]400-hurree babu brass - bound drug - box , took [his]400-hurree babu patent - leather shoes of ceremony in one hand , a gay blue - and - white umbrella in the other , and set off northwards to [the Doon]251-the doon , where , [he]400-hurree babu said , [he]400-hurree babu was in demand among [the lesser kings of [those parts]3713-those parts]3712-the lesser kings of those parts . And by [Kulu road]19-kulu ? Oh , thrice happy ! '[1825-the old lady] shrilled [the old lady]1825-the old lady . '[1825-the old lady] ' What [a woman]1192-a woman is [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba ! '[467-the oorya] said [the white - bearded Oorya]467-the oorya , when a tumult rose by the [kitchen quarters]3716-kitchen quarters . ' [She]1192-a woman has never forgotten [a friend]4668-a friend : [she]1192-a woman has never forgotten [an enemy]4712-an enemy in all [her]1192-a woman years . And [her]1192-a woman cookery - wah ! '[3717-he] [He]3717-he rubbed [his]3717-he slim stomach . But [she]3718-she has skill . [I]868-the lama am refreshed all over . When [we]7352-we reach [the lower hills]1913-the lower hills [I]868-the lama shall be yet stronger . [The hakim]7103-the hakim spoke truly to [me]868-the lama this morn when [he]7103-the hakim said a breath from the snows blows away twenty years from the life of [a man]750-a man . [We]7352-we will go up into [the Hills]10-the hills - [the high hills]7356-the high hills - up to the sound of snow - waters and the sound of the trees - for a little while . [The hakim]7103-the hakim is full of learning ; but [he]7103-the hakim is in no way proud . [I]868-the lama spoke to [him]7103-the hakim - when [thou]7360-thou wast talking to [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba - of a certain dizziness that lays hold upon the back of [my]868-the lama neck in the night , and [he]7103-the hakim said it rose from excessive heat - to be cured by cool air . Upon consideration , [I]868-the lama marvelled that [I]868-the lama had not thought of such a simple remedy . '[868-the lama] ' Didst [thou]7360-thou tell [him]7103-the hakim of [thy]7360-thou Search ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim , a little jealously . [He]344-kim preferred to sway [the lama]868-the lama by [his]344-kim own speech - not through the wiles of [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu . ' Assuredly . [I]344-kim told [him]7103-the hakim of [my]344-kim dream , and of the manner by which [I]344-kim had acquired merit by causing [thee]868-the lama to be taught wisdom . '[344-kim] ' [Thou]7360-thou didst not say [I]868-the lama was [a Sahib]5596-a sahib ? '[868-the lama] ' What need ? [I]3722-i have told [thee]868-the lama many times [we]7362-we be but [two souls]7363-two souls seeking escape . [He]7103-the hakim said - and [he]7103-the hakim is just herein - that [the River of Healing]272-the river of healing will break forth even as [I]3722-i dreamed - at [my]3722-i feet , if need be . Having found the Way , seest [thou]868-the lama , that shall free [me]3722-i from [the Wheel]273-the wheel , need [I]3722-i trouble to find a way about [the mere fields of earth]7364-the mere fields of earth - which are illusion ? That were senseless . [I]3722-i have [my]3722-i dreams , night upon night repeated ; [I]3722-i have [Jataka]647-jataka ; and [I]3722-i have [thee]868-the lama , Friend of all [the World]759-the world . It was written in [thy]868-the lama horoscope that a Red Bull on [a green field]763-a green field - [I]3722-i have not forgotten - should bring [thee]868-the lama to honour . Who but [I]3722-i saw that prophecy accomplished ? Indeed , [I]3722-i was the instrument . [Thou]868-the lama shalt find [me]3722-i [[my]3722-i River]1074-my river , being in return the instrument . [The Search]222-the search is sure ! '[3722-i] [He]3722-i set [his]3722-i ivory - yellow face , serene and untroubled , towards [the beckoning Hills]10-the hills ; [his]3722-i shadow shouldering far before [him]3722-i in the dust . Chapter 13 Who hath desired [the Sea]220-the sea - the immense and contemptuous surges ? The shudder , the stumble , the swerve ere the star - stabbing bowsprit merges - The orderly clouds of [the Trades]276-the trades and the ridged roaring sapphire thereunder - Unheralded cliff - lurking flaws and the head - sails ' low - volleying thunder ? [His]3722-i Sea in no wonder the same - [his]3722-i Sea and the same in each wonder - [His]3722-i Sea that [his]3722-i being fulfils ? So and no otherwise - so and [no otherwise hill - men]6996-no otherwise hill - men desire [[their]6996-no otherwise hill - men hills]6997-their hills ! [The Sea]220-the sea and [the Hills]10-the hills . '[3722-i] Who goes to [the hills]833-the hills goes to [[his]3722-i mother]727-his mother . ' [They]7370-they had crossed [the Siwaliks]625-the siwaliks and [the half - tropical Doon]251-the doon , left [Mussoorie]257-mussoorie behind [them]7370-they , and headed north along [the narrow hill - roads]7371-the narrow hill - roads . Day after day [they]7370-they struck deeper into [the huddled mountains]7372-the huddled mountains , and day after day [Kim]344-kim watched [the lama]868-the lama return to [a man]750-a man 's strength . Among [the terraces of [the Doon]7376-the doon]7375-the terraces of the doon [he]868-the lama had leaned on [the boy]986-the boy 's shoulder , ready to profit by wayside halts . Under [the great ramp to [Mussoorie]257-mussoorie]7378-the great ramp to mussoorie [he]868-the lama drew [himself]868-the lama together as [an old hunter]7379-an old hunter faces a well - remembered bank , and where [he]868-the lama should have sunk exhausted swung [his]868-the lama long draperies about [him]868-the lama , drew a deep double - lungful of the diamond air , and walked as [only a hillman]7380-only a hillman can . [Kim]344-kim , plains - bred and plains - fed , sweated and panted astonished . '[3722-i] This is [[my]0-i country]5304-my country , ' said [the lama]868-the lama . '[3722-i] Beside Such - zen , this is flatter than a rice - field ' ; and with steady , driving strokes from the loins [he]868-the lama strode upwards . But it was on the steep downhill marches , three thousand feet in three hours , that [he]868-the lama went utterly away from [Kim]344-kim , whose back ached with holding back , and whose big toe was nigh cut off by [his]868-the lama grass sandal - string . Through the speckled shadow of [the great deodar - forests]7382-the great deodar - forests ; through oak feathered and plumed with ferns ; birch , ilex , rhododendron , and pine , out on to [the bare hillsides]7383-the bare hillsides '[3722-i] slippery sunburnt grass , and back into [the woodlands]3726-the woodlands ' coolth again , till oak gave way to bamboo and palm of [the valley]6349-the valley , [the lama]868-the lama swung untiring . Glancing back in the twilight at [the huge ridges behind [him]868-the lama]7386-the huge ridges behind him and the faint , thin line of the road whereby [they]7387-they had come , [he]868-the lama would lay out , with [a hillman]834-a hillman 's generous breadth of vision , fresh marches for the morrow ; or , halting in the neck of [some uplifted pass that gave on [Spiti]648-spiti and [Kulu]19-kulu]7389-some uplifted pass that gave on spiti and kulu , would stretch out [his]868-the lama hands yearningly towards the high snows of the horizon . In the dawns they flared windy - red above stark blue , as [Kedar- nath]649-kedar- nath and [Badrinath]650-badrinath - [kings of [that wilderness]7391-that wilderness]7390-kings of that wilderness - took the first sunlight . All day long [they]7387-they lay like molten silver under the sun , and at evening put on [their]7387-they jewels again . At first [they]7387-they breathed temperately upon [the travellers]4835-the travellers , winds good to meet when [one crawled over some gigantic hog's - back]7393-one crawled over some gigantic hog's - back ; but in a few days , at a height of nine or ten thousand feet , those breezes bit ; and [Kim]344-kim kindly allowed [a village of [hillmen]7395-hillmen]7394-a village of hillmen to acquire merit by giving [him]344-kim a rough blanket - coat . [The lama]868-the lama was mildly surprised that [anyone]1036-anyone should object to the knife - edged breezes which had cut the years off [his]868-the lama shoulders . '[3722-i] These are but [the lower hills]1913-the lower hills , chela . There is no cold till [we]3728-we come to [the true Hills]3729-the true hills . ' '[3722-i] Air and water are good , and [the people]4594-the people are devout enough , but the food is very bad , ' [Kim]344-kim growled ; '[3728-we] and [we]3728-we walk as though [we]3728-we were mad - or English . It freezes at night , too . ' '[3722-i] A little , maybe ; but only enough to make old bones rejoice in the sun . [We]3728-we must not always delight in soft beds and rich food . ' '[3728-we] [We]3728-we might at least keep to [the road]4566-the road . ' [Kim]344-kim had all [a plainsman]7398-a plainsman 's affection for the well - trodden track , not six feet wide , that snaked among [the mountains]1898-the mountains ; but [the lama , being Tibetan]7400-the lama , being tibetan , could not refrain from short cuts over spurs and [the rims of gravel - strewn slopes]7401-the rims of gravel - strewn slopes . As [he]868-the lama explained to [[his]868-the lama limping disciple]7402-his limping disciple , [a man bred among [mountains]7404-mountains]7403-a man bred among mountains can prophesy the course of [a mountain - road]7405-a mountain - road , and though low - lying clouds might be a hindrance to [a short - cutting stranger]7406-a short - cutting stranger , they made no earthly difference to [a thoughtful man]7407-a thoughtful man . Thus , after long hours of what would be reckoned very fair mountaineering in [civilized countries]7408-civilized countries , [they]3728-we would pant over [a saddle - back]7409-a saddle - back , sidle past [a few landslips]7410-a few landslips , and drop through [forest]7411-forest at an angle of forty- five onto [the road]4566-the road again . Along [[their]3728-we track]7413-their track lay [the villages of [the hillfolk]7415-the hillfolk]7414-the villages of the hillfolk - mud and [earth huts]7416-earth huts , timbers now and then rudely carved with an axe - clinging like swallows '[3728-we] nests against the steeps , huddled on [tiny flats half - way down a three - thousand - foot glissade]3732-tiny flats half - way down a three - thousand - foot glissade ; jammed into a corner between [cliffs that funnelled and focused every wandering blast]3733-cliffs that funnelled and focused every wandering blast ; or , for the sake of [summer pasture]3734-summer pasture , cowering down on a neck that in winter would be ten feet deep in snow . And [the people]4594-the people - [the sallow , greasy , duffle - clad people , with short bare legs and faces almost [Esquimaux]651-esquimaux]3736-the sallow , greasy , duffle - clad people , with short bare legs and faces almost esquimaux - would flock out and adore . [The Plains]175-the plains - kindly and gentle - had treated [the lama]868-the lama as [a holy man]4605-a holy man among [holy men]784-holy men . But [the Hills]10-the hills worshipped [him]868-the lama as one in the confidence of all [[their]10-the hills devils]3740-their devils . [Theirs]3741-they was an almost obliterated Buddhism , overlaid with a nature - worship fantastic as [their]3741-they own landscapes , elaborate as the terracing of [[their]3741-they tiny fields]3742-their tiny fields ; but [they]3741-they recognized the big hat , the clicking rosary , and the rare Chinese texts for great authority ; and [they]3741-they respected [the man beneath the hat]3743-the man beneath the hat . ' [We]3741-they saw [thee]7417-thee come down over [the black Breasts of [Eua]279-eua]7418-the black breasts of eua , '[3744-a betah] said [a Betah]3744-a betah who gave [them]3741-they cheese , sour milk , and stone - hard bread one evening . ' [We]3741-they do not use that often - except when calving cows stray in summer . There is a sudden wind among those stones that casts [men]752-men down on the stillest day . But what should [such folk]7420-such folk care for [the Devil of Eua]653-the devil of eua ! '[3744-a betah] Then did [Kim]344-kim , aching in every fibre , dizzy with looking down , footsore with cramping desperate toes into inadequate crannies , take joy in the day 's march - such joy as [a boy of St Xavier 's who had won the quarter - mile on [the flat]3746-the flat might take in the praises of [[his]3745-a boy of st xavier 's who had won the quarter - mile on the flat might take in the praises of his friends friends]5784-his friends]3745-a boy of st xavier 's who had won the quarter - mile on the flat might take in the praises of his friends . [The hills]833-the hills sweated the ghi and sugar suet off [his]3743-the man beneath the hat bones ; the dry air , taken sobbingly at the head of cruel passes , firmed and built out [his]3743-the man beneath the hat upper ribs ; and the tilted levels put new hard muscles into calf and thigh . [They]3741-they meditated often on the Wheel of Life - the more so since , as [the lama]868-the lama said , [they]3741-they were freed from its visible temptations . Except the grey eagle and an occasional far - seen bear grubbing and rooting on [the hillside]6396-the hillside ; a vision of a furious painted leopard met at dawn in [a still valley devouring a goat]3751-a still valley devouring a goat ; and now and again a bright- coloured bird , [they]3741-they were alone with the winds and the grass singing under the wind . [The women of [the smoky huts over whose roofs [the two]4989-the two walked as [they]4989-the two descended [the mountains]1898-the mountains]3753-the smoky huts over whose roofs the two walked as they descended the mountains]3752-the women of the smoky huts over whose roofs the two walked as they descended the mountains , were unlovely and unclean , [wives of many husbands]3756-wives of many husbands , and afflicted with goitre . [The men]5050-the men were [woodcutters]3758-woodcutters when [they]5050-the men were not [farmers]1169-farmers - meek , and of an incredible simplicity . But that suitable discourse might not fail , [Fate]654-fate sent [them]3741-they , overtaking and overtaken upon [the road]4566-the road , [the courteous Dacca physician , who paid for [his]3761-the courteous dacca physician , who paid for his food in ointments good for goitre and counsels that restore peace between men and women food in ointments good for goitre and counsels that restore peace between [men]752-men and [women]4700-women]3761-the courteous dacca physician , who paid for his food in ointments good for goitre and counsels that restore peace between men and women . [He]3761-the courteous dacca physician , who paid for his food in ointments good for goitre and counsels that restore peace between men and women seemed to know [these hills]3764-these hills as well as [he]3761-the courteous dacca physician , who paid for his food in ointments good for goitre and counsels that restore peace between men and women knew the hill dialects , and gave [the lama]868-the lama the lie of [the land]4998-the land towards [Ladakh]280-ladakh and [Tibet]22-tibet . [He]3761-the courteous dacca physician , who paid for his food in ointments good for goitre and counsels that restore peace between men and women said [they]3741-they could return to [the Plains]175-the plains at any moment . Meantime , for such as [loved mountains]3767-loved mountains , [yonder road]3768-yonder road might amuse . This was not all revealed in a breath , but at evening encounters on the stone threshing- floors , when , [patients]3769-patients disposed of , [the doctor]3770-the doctor would smoke and [the lama]868-the lama snuff , while [Kim]344-kim watched the wee cows grazing on the housetops , or threw [his]344-kim soul after [his]344-kim eyes across [the deep blue gulfs between range and range]3772-the deep blue gulfs between range and range . And there were talks apart in [the dark woods]3773-the dark woods , when [the doctor]3770-the doctor would seek herbs , and [Kim]344-kim , as [budding physician]3775-budding physician , must accompany [him]3770-the doctor . ' [You]3778-you see , [Mister O'Hara]636-mister o'hara , [I]344-kim do not know what [the deuce]2454-the deuce - an '[344-kim] all [I]0-i shall do when [I]0-i find [[our]3776-our sporting friends]3777-our sporting friends ; but if [you]3778-you will kindly keep within sight of [my]0-i umbrella , which is fine fixed point for cadastral survey , [I]0-i shall feel much better . ' [Kim]344-kim looked out across [the jungle of peaks]7422-the jungle of peaks . '[0-i] This is not [[my]0-i country]5304-my country , [hakim]655-hakim . Easier , [I]0-i think , to find [one louse in a bear - skin]3780-one louse in a bear - skin . ' '[0-i] Oah , thatt is [my]0-i strong points . There is no hurry for [Hurree]400-hurree babu . [They]3781-they were at [Leh]263-leh not so long ago . [They]3781-they said [they]3781-they had come down from [the Karakorum]281-the karakorum with [their]3781-they heads and horns and all . [I]0-i am onlee afraid [they]3781-they will have sent back all [their]3781-they letters and compromising things from [Leh]263-leh into [Russian territoree]3782-russian territoree . Of course [they]3781-they will walk away as far to [the East]64-the east as possible - just to show that [they]3781-they were never among [the Western States]3783-the western states . [You]0-i do not know [the Hills]10-the hills ? ' [He]0-i scratched with a twig on the earth . '[0-i] Look ! [They]3781-they should have come in by [Srinagar]79-srinagar or [Abbottabad]282-abbottabad . Thatt is [[their]3781-they short road]3784-their short road - down [the river]5005-the river by [Bunji]656-bunji and [Astor]283-astor . So ' - [he]0-i drew a furrow from left to right - '[3781-they] [they]3781-they march and [they]3781-they march away East to [Leh]263-leh ah ! it is cold there , and down [the Indus]285-the indus to [Hanle]286-hanle [I]0-i know [that road]7351-that road , and then down , [you]3787-you see , to [Bushahr]287-bushahr and [Chini]267-chini valley . That is ascertained by process of elimination , and also by asking questions from people that [I]0-i cure so well . [[Our]3788-they friends]3789-our friends have been a long time playing about and producing impressions . So [they]3789-our friends are well known from far off . ' It nodded like a wind - blown harebell down [the valleys]7252-the valleys and round [the mountain sides]7424-the mountain sides , and in due time [the lama]868-the lama and [Kim]344-kim , who steered by compass , would overhaul it , vending ointments and powders at eventide . '[3787-you] [We]3788-they came by such and such a way ! ' [The lama]868-the lama would throw a careless finger backward at the ridges , and the umbrella would expend itself in compliments . [They]3788-they crossed [a snowy pass]7427-a snowy pass in cold moonlight , when [the lama]868-the lama , mildly chaffing [Kim]344-kim , went through up to [his]868-the lama knees , like a Bactrian camel - the snow - bred , shag - haired sort that came into [the Kashmir Serai]43-the kashmir serai . [They]3788-they dipped across beds of light snow and snow - powdered shale , where [they]3788-they took refuge from a gale in a camp of Tibetans hurrying down tiny sheep , each laden with a bag of borax . [They]3788-they came out upon grassy shoulders still snow - speckled , and through forest , to grass anew . For all [their]3788-they marchings , [Kedarnath]288-kedarnath and [Badrinath]650-badrinath were not impressed ; and it was only after days of travel that [Kim]344-kim , uplifted upon [some insignificant ten - thousand - foot hummock]7429-some insignificant ten - thousand - foot hummock , could see that a shoulder - knot or horn of [the two great lords]7430-the two great lords had - ever so slightly - changed outline . At last [they]3788-they entered [a world within [a world]7432-a world]7431-a world within a world - [a valley of leagues where [the high hills]7356-the high hills were fashioned of a mere rubble and refuse from off the knees of [the mountains]1898-the mountains]7433-a valley of leagues where the high hills were fashioned of a mere rubble and refuse from off the knees of the mountains . Here one day 's march carried [them]3788-they no farther , it seemed , than [a dreamer]7436-a dreamer 's clogged pace bears [him]7436-a dreamer in a nightmare . [They]3788-they skirted a shoulder painfully for hours , and , behold , it was but an outlying boss in [an outlying buttress of [the main pile]7438-the main pile]7437-an outlying buttress of the main pile ! [A rounded meadow]7439-a rounded meadow revealed itself , when [they]3788-they had reached [it]7439-a rounded meadow , for [a vast tableland running far into [the valley]6349-the valley]7440-a vast tableland running far into the valley . Three days later , it was a dim fold in the earth to southward . '[3787-you] Surely [the Gods]1244-the gods live here ! ' said [Kim]344-kim , beaten down by the silence and the appalling sweep and dispersal of the cloud - shadows after rain . '[3787-you] This is no place for [men]752-men ! ' '[3787-you] Long and long ago , ' said [the lama]868-the lama , as to [himself]868-the lama , '[3787-you] it was asked of [the Lord]4482-the lord whether [the world]759-the world were everlasting . On this the Excellent One returned no answer ... When [I]0-i was in [Ceylon]193-ceylon , [a wise Seeker]3796-a wise seeker confirmed that from the gospel which is written in [Pali]561-pali . Certainly , since [we]3797-we know the way to Freedom , the question were unprofitable , but - look , and know illusion , [chela]5580-chela ! These - are the true Hills ! They are like [[my]0-i hills]3799-my hills by Suchzen . Never were [such hills]3800-such hills ! ' Above [them]3788-they , still enormously above [them]3788-they , earth towered away towards [the snow - line]7443-the snow - line , where from east to west across hundreds of miles , ruled as with [a ruler]7444-a ruler , the last of the bold birches stopped . Above that , in scarps and blocks upheaved , the rocks strove to fight their heads above the white smother . Above these again , changeless since [the world]759-the world 's beginning , but changing to every mood of sun and cloud , lay out the eternal snow . [They]3788-they could see blots and blurs on [its]7446-its face where storm and wandering wullie - wa got up to dance . Below [them]3788-they , as [they]3788-they stood , [the forest]7447-the forest slid away in a sheet of blue - green for mile upon mile ; below [the forest]7447-the forest was [a village]1733-a village in [its]1733-a village sprinkle of [terraced fields and steep grazing - grounds]7450-terraced fields and steep grazing - grounds . Below [the village]5076-the village [they]3788-they knew , though a thunderstorm worried and growled there for the moment , a pitch of twelve or fifteen hundred feet gave to [the moist valley where the streams gather that are the mothers of [young Sutluj]657-young sutluj]7452-the moist valley where the streams gather that are the mothers of young sutluj . As usual , [the lama]868-the lama had led [Kim]344-kim by cow - track and [by - road]7454-by - road , far from [the main route along which [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu]7455-the main route along which hurree babu , [that '[5580-chela] fearful man]7456-that ' fearful man ' , had bucketed three days before through a storm to which [nine Englishmen out of ten]7457-nine englishmen out of ten would have given full right of way . [Hurree]400-hurree babu was no game- shot - the snick of a trigger made [him]400-hurree babu change colour - but , as [he]400-hurree babu [himself]400-hurree babu would have said , [he]400-hurree babu was '[5580-chela] fairly effeecient stalker ' , and [he]400-hurree babu had raked [the huge valley]7458-the huge valley with a pair of cheap binoculars to some purpose . Moreover , the white of worn canvas tents against green carries far . [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu had seen all [he]400-hurree babu wanted to see when [he]400-hurree babu sat on the threshing - floor of [Ziglaur]291-ziglaur , twenty miles away as the eagle flies , and forty by [road]4564-road - that is to say , two small dots which one day were just below [the snow - line]7443-the snow - line , and the next had moved downward perhaps six inches on [the hillside]6396-the hillside . Once cleaned out and set to the work , [his]400-hurree babu fat bare legs could cover a surprising amount of ground , and this was the reason why , while [Kim]344-kim and [the lama]868-the lama lay in [a leaky hut at [Ziglaur]291-ziglaur]7463-a leaky hut at ziglaur till the storm should be over - past , [an oily , wet , but always smiling Bengali , talking the best of English with the vilest of phrases]7464-an oily , wet , but always smiling bengali , talking the best of english with the vilest of phrases , was ingratiating [himself]400-hurree babu with [two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners . [He]400-hurree babu had arrived , revolving many wild schemes , on the heels of a thunderstorm which had split a pine over against [[their]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners camp]5770-their camp , and so convinced [a dozen or two forcibly impressed baggage - coolies]7467-a dozen or two forcibly impressed baggage - coolies the day was inauspicious for farther travel that with one accord [they]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners had thrown down [their]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners loads and jibbed . [They]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners were [subjects of [a Hill Rajah who farmed out [their]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners services , as is the custom , for [his]7469-a hill rajah who farmed out their services , as is the custom , for his private gain private gain]7469-a hill rajah who farmed out their services , as is the custom , for his private gain]7468-subjects of a hill rajah who farmed out their services , as is the custom , for his private gain ; and , to add to [their]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners personal distresses , [the strange Sahibs]7470-the strange sahibs had already threatened [them]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners with rifles . [The most of [them]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners]7471-the most of them knew rifles and [Sahibs of old]7472-sahibs of old : [they]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners were trackers and [shikarris of [the Northern valleys]7474-the northern valleys]7473-shikarris of the northern valleys , keen after bear and wild goat ; but [they]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners had never been thus treated in [their]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners lives . So [the forest]7447-the forest took [them]7465-two sodden and rather rheumatic foreigners to [her]7447-the forest bosom , and , for all oaths and clamour , refused to restore . There was no need to feign madness or - [the Babu]400-hurree babu had thought of another means of securing a welcome . [He]400-hurree babu wrung out [his]400-hurree babu wet clothes , slipped on [his]400-hurree babu patent - leather shoes , opened the blue- and - white umbrella , and with mincing gait and a heart beating against [his]400-hurree babu tonsils appeared as '[5580-chela] [agent for [[His]3802-his Royal Highness]3803-his royal highness]3801-agent for his royal highness , [the Rajah of [Rampur]266-rampur]3804-the rajah of rampur , [gentlemen]3805-gentlemen . What can [I]0-i do for [you]3805-gentlemen , please ? ' [The gentlemen]7292-the gentlemen were delighted . [One]1164-one was visibly French , [the other Russian]7478-the other russian , but [they]7292-the gentlemen spoke English not much inferior to [the Babu]400-hurree babu 's . [They]7292-the gentlemen begged [his]400-hurree babu kind offices . [[Their]7292-the gentlemen native servants]7479-their native servants had gone sick at [Leh]263-leh . [They]7292-the gentlemen had hurried on because [they]7292-the gentlemen were anxious to bring the spoils of the chase to [Simla]159-simla ere the skins grew moth - eaten . [They]7292-the gentlemen bore a general letter of introduction [the Babu]400-hurree babu salaamed to it orientally to [all Government officials]7480-all government officials . No , [they]7292-the gentlemen had not met [any other shooting - parties en route]7481-any other shooting - parties en route . [They]7292-the gentlemen did for [themselves]7292-the gentlemen . [They]7292-the gentlemen had plenty of supplies . [They]7292-the gentlemen only wished to push on as soon as might be . [You]400-hurree babu have been shooting , eh ? That is fine performance ! '[400-hurree babu] [He]400-hurree babu skipped nimbly from one kilta to the next , making pretence to adjust each conical basket . [The Englishman]4653-the englishman is not , as a rule , familiar with [the Asiatic]3810-the asiatic , but [he]4653-the englishman would not strike across the wrist [a kindly Babu who had accidentally upset [a kilta with a red oilskin top]3812-a kilta with a red oilskin top]3811-a kindly babu who had accidentally upset a kilta with a red oilskin top . [The strangers]7272-the strangers did all these things , and asked many questions - about [women]4700-women mostly - to which [Hurree]400-hurree babu returned gay and unstudied answers . [They]7272-the strangers gave [him]400-hurree babu a glass of whitish fluid like to gin , and then more ; and in a little time [his]400-hurree babu gravity departed from [him]400-hurree babu . [He]400-hurree babu became thickly treasonous , and spoke in terms of sweeping indecency of [a Government which had forced upon [him]400-hurree babu [a white man]5508-a white man 's education]3816-a government which had forced upon him a white man 's education and neglected to supply [him]400-hurree babu with [a white man]5508-a white man 's salary . [He]400-hurree babu babbled tales of oppression and wrong till the tears ran down [his]400-hurree babu cheeks for the miseries of [[his]400-hurree babu land]3819-his land . Then [he]400-hurree babu staggered off , singing love - songs of [Lower Bengal]171-bengal , and collapsed upon a wet tree - trunk . Never was so unfortunate a product of English rule in [India]8-india more unhappily thrust upon [aliens]3820-aliens . '[400-hurree babu] When [he]400-hurree babu presented [himself]400-hurree babu again [he]400-hurree babu was racked with a headache - penitent , and volubly afraid that in [his]400-hurree babu drunkenness [he]400-hurree babu might have been indiscreet . [He]400-hurree babu loved [the British Government]294-the british government - it was the source of all prosperity and honour , and [[his]400-hurree babu master at [Rampur]266-rampur]3823-his master at rampur held the very same opinion . [These Sahibs]3834-these sahibs travelled without any retinue . Therefore [they]3834-these sahibs were [poor Sahibs]552-the sahibs , and ignorant ; for [no Sahib]6190-no sahib in [his]400-hurree babu senses would follow [a Bengali]3017-a bengali 's advice . But [the Bengali]3837-the bengali , appearing from somewhere , had given [them]3834-these sahibs money , and could make shift with [their]3834-these sahibs dialect . Used to comprehensive ill - treatment from [their]3834-these sahibs own colour , [they]3834-these sahibs suspected a trap somewhere , and stood by to run if occasion offered . Then through the new - washed air , steaming with delicious earth- smells , [the Babu]6478-the babu led the way down [the slopes]3839-the slopes - walking ahead of [the coolies in pride]3840-the coolies in pride ; walking behind [the foreigners]3841-the foreigners in humility . [His]6478-the babu thoughts were many and various . The least of [them]3842-them would have interested [[his]6478-the babu companions]4468-his companions beyond words . But [he]6478-the babu was an agreeable guide , ever keen to point out the beauties of [[[his]6478-the babu royal master]3844-his royal master 's domain]3845-his royal master 's domain .
