' The little fir - clump filled with clamouring coolies - panic- stricken , and in [their]7545-these folk terror capable of anything . [The man from [Ao]665-ao - chung - chung]7547-the man from ao - chung clicked the breech - bolt of [his]7547-the man from ao - chung gun impatiently , and made as to go downhill . '[385-holy one] Wait a little , [Holy One]385-holy one ; [they]3927-they can not go far . Wait till [I]0-i return , ' said [he]7547-the man from ao - chung . '[0-i] [It]3928-it is [this person who has suffered wrong]3929-this person who has suffered wrong , ' said [the lama]868-the lama , [his]868-the lama hand over [his]868-the lama brow . '[3929-this person who has suffered wrong] For that very reason , ' was the reply . '[3929-this person who has suffered wrong] If [this person]3930-this person overlooks it , [your]3929-this person who has suffered wrong hands are clean . Moreover , [ye]3929-this person who has suffered wrong acquire merit by obedience . ' '[3929-this person who has suffered wrong] Wait , and [we]3924-we will all go to [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh together , ' [the man]4471-the man insisted . For a moment , for just so long as it needs to stuff a cartridge into a breech - loader , [the lama]868-the lama hesitated . Then [he]868-the lama rose to [his]868-the lama feet , and laid a finger on [the man]4471-the man 's shoulder . '[3931-thou] Hast [thou]3931-thou heard ? [I]0-i say there shall be no killing - [I]0-i who was [Abbot of Such - zen]3932-abbot of such - zen . Is it any lust of thine to be re - born as a rat , or a snake under the eaves - a worm in the belly of the most mean beast ? Is it [thy]3931-thou wish to - ' [The man from Ao - chung]7547-the man from ao - chung fell to [his]7547-the man from ao - chung knees , for the voice boomed like a Tibetan devil - gong . '[3931-thou] Ai ! ai ! ' cried [the Spiti men]7553-the spiti men . '[3931-thou] Do not curse [us]3924-we - do not curse [him]3930-this person . It was but [his]3930-this person zeal , [Holy One]385-holy one ! ... Put down the rifle , [fool]3933-fool ! ' '[3933-fool] Anger on anger ! Evil on evil ! There will be no killing . Let [the priest - beaters]3934-the priest - beaters go in bondage to [their]3934-the priest - beaters own acts . Just and sure is [the Wheel]3935-the wheel , swerving not a hair ! [They]3934-the priest - beaters will be born many times - in torment . ' [His]0-i head drooped , and [he]0-i leaned heavily on [Kim]344-kim 's shoulder . '[3934-the priest - beaters] [I]0-i have come near to great evil , [chela]5580-chela , ' [he]0-i whispered in that dead hush under the pines . '[0-i] [I]0-i was tempted to loose the bullet ; and truly , in [Tibet]22-tibet there would have been a heavy and a slow death for [them]3934-the priest - beaters ... [He]3930-this person struck [me]0-i across the face ... upon the flesh ... ' [He]0-i slid to the ground , breathing heavily , and [Kim]344-kim could hear the over - driven heart bump and check . '[3930-this person] Have [they]3934-the priest - beaters hurt [him]3930-this person to the death ? ' said [the Ao - chung man]7554-the ao - chung man , while [the others]5143-the others stood mute . [Kim]344-kim knelt over the body in deadly fear . '[3930-this person] Nay , ' [he]344-kim cried passionately , '[3930-this person] this is only a weakness . ' Then [he]344-kim remembered that [he]0-i was [a white man]5508-a white man , with [a white man]5508-a white man 's camp - fittings at [his]0-i service . '[3930-this person] Open [the kiltas]3937-the kiltas ! [The Sahibs]5165-the sahibs may have a medicine . ' '[5165-the sahibs] Oho ! Then [I]0-i know it , ' said [the Ao - chung man]7554-the ao - chung man with a laugh . '[0-i] Not for five years was [I]0-i Yankling [Sahib 's shikarri]393-colonel creighton without knowing that medicine . [I]0-i too have tasted it . Behold ! ' [He]0-i drew from [his]0-i breast a bottle of cheap whisky - such as is sold to [explorers]7559-explorers at [Leh]263-leh - and cleverly forced a little between [the lama]868-the lama 's teeth . '[0-i] So [I]0-i did when [Yankling Sahib]666-yankling sahib twisted [his]666-yankling sahib foot beyond [Astor]283-astor . Aha ! [I]0-i have already looked into [their]5165-the sahibs baskets - but [we]3939-we will make fair division at [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh . Give [him]666-yankling sahib a little more . It is good medicine . Feel ! [His]666-yankling sahib heart goes better now . Lay [his]666-yankling sahib head down and rub a little on the chest . If [he]666-yankling sahib had waited quietly while [I]0-i accounted for [the Sahibs]552-the sahibs this would never have come . But perhaps [the Sahibs]5165-the sahibs may chase [us]3939-we here . Then it would not be wrong to shoot [them]5165-the sahibs with [their]5165-the sahibs own guns , [heh]3941-heh ? ' '[3941-heh] [One]1164-one is paid , [I]0-i think , already , ' said [Kim]344-kim between [his]344-kim teeth . '[0-i] [I]0-i kicked [him]666-yankling sahib in the groin as [we]3939-we went downhill . Would [I]0-i had killed [him]666-yankling sahib ! ' '[0-i] It is well to be brave when [one]1164-one does not live in [Rampur]266-rampur , ' said one whose hut lay within a few miles of [the Rajah 's rickety palace]7561-the rajah 's rickety palace . '[0-i] If [we]3939-we get a bad name among [the Sahibs]5165-the sahibs , [none]4586-none will employ [us]3939-we as [shikarris]298-shikarris any more . ' '[4586-none] Oh , but these are not [Angrezi Sahibs]552-the sahibs - [not merry - minded men like [Fostum Sahib]668-fostum sahib or [Yankling Sahib]666-yankling sahib]3946-not merry - minded men like fostum sahib or yankling sahib . [They]552-the sahibs are [foreigners]3947-foreigners - [they]552-the sahibs can not speak [Angrezi]552-the sahibs as do [Sahibs]552-the sahibs . ' Here [the lama]868-the lama coughed and sat up , groping for the rosary . '[552-the sahibs] There shall be no killing , ' [he]868-the lama murmured . '[552-the sahibs] Just is the Wheel ! Evil on evil - ' '[385-holy one] Nay , [Holy One]385-holy one . [We]3939-we are all here . ' [The Ao - chung man]7554-the ao - chung man timidly patted [his]7554-the ao - chung man feet . '[3939-we] Except by [thy]385-holy one order , [no one]786-no one shall be slain . Rest awhile . [We]3939-we will make [a little camp]3949-a little camp here , and later , as the moon rises , [we]3939-we go to [Shamlegh - under - the - Snow]299-shamlegh - under - the - snow . ' '[3939-we] After a blow , ' said [a Spiti man]7564-a spiti man sententiously , '[3939-we] it is best to sleep . ' '[385-holy one] There is , as it were , a dizziness at the back of [my]0-i neck , and a pinching in it . Let [me]0-i lay [my]0-i head on [thy]385-holy one lap , chela . [I]0-i am [an old man]831-an old man , but not free from passion ... [We]3939-we must think of the Cause of Things . ' '[3939-we] Give [him]0-i a blanket . [We]3939-we dare not light a fire lest [the Sahibs]5165-the sahibs see . ' '[5165-the sahibs] Better get away to [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh . [None]4586-none will follow [us]3939-we to [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh . ' This was [the nervous Rampur man]7565-the nervous rampur man . '[4586-none] [I]0-i have been [Fostum Sahib 's shikarri]668-fostum sahib , and [I]0-i am [[Yankling Sahib]666-yankling sahib 's shikarri]3953-yankling sahib 's shikarri . Let [two men]1385-two men watch below with the guns lest [the Sahibs]552-the sahibs do more foolishness . [I]0-i shall not leave [this Holy One]6899-this holy one . ' [They]3939-we sat down a little apart from [the lama]868-the lama , and , after listening awhile , passed round a water - pipe whose receiver was an old Day and [Martin]553-young martin blacking - bottle . The glow of the red charcoal as it went from hand to hand lit up the narrow , blinking eyes , the high Chinese cheek - bones , and the bull - throats that melted away into the dark duffle folds round the shoulders . [They]3939-we looked like kobolds from [some magic mine - gnomes of [the hills in conclave]7568-the hills in conclave]7567-some magic mine - gnomes of the hills in conclave . And while [they]3939-we talked , the voices of the snow - waters round [them]3939-we diminished one by one as the night - frost choked and clogged the runnels . '[6899-this holy one] How [he]666-yankling sahib stood up against [us]3956-we ! ' said [a Spiti man]7564-a spiti man admiring . '[0-i] [I]0-i remember an old ibex , out [Ladakh]280-ladakh - way , that [Dupont Sahib]669-dupont sahib missed on a shoulder- shot , seven seasons back , standing up just like [him]666-yankling sahib . ' [The Ao - chung man]7554-the ao - chung man took a pull at the whisky - bottle and passed it over . '[666-yankling sahib] Now hear [me]0-i - unless [any other man]3958-any other man thinks [he]3958-any other man knows more . ' The challenge was not taken up . '[666-yankling sahib] [We]3956-we go to [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh when the moon rises . There [we]3956-we will fairly divide the baggage between [us]3956-we . [I]0-i am content with this new little rifle and all its cartridges . ' '[0-i] Are the bears only bad on [thy]3959-thy holding ? said [a mate , sucking at the pipe]3960-a mate , sucking at the pipe . ' No ; but musk - pods are worth six rupees apiece now , and [[thy]3959-thy women]7571-thy women can have the canvas of [the tents]7572-the tents and some of the cooking - gear . '[3960-a mate , sucking at the pipe] ' That is well for [thee]3959-thy , but what will [[our]3956-we [Rajah]469-rajah]7574-our rajah say ? '[3964-the woman of shamlegh] But - but - ' '[0-i] [I]0-i have said [they]670-the sahibs are not [true Sahibs]3967-true sahibs . ' That was a shrewd argument , and [the Ao - chung man]7554-the ao - chung man knew [[his]7554-the ao - chung man fellows]7579-his fellows . [They]670-the sahibs frightened [us]3965-we . [We]3965-we fled ! Who knows where [we]3965-we dropped the baggage ? ' '[297-shamlegh] So be it , but [I]0-i carry the big kilta . The basket with the red top that [the Sahibs]5165-the sahibs pack [themselves]5165-the sahibs every morning . How can [they]3834-these sahibs make trouble ? What of [the kilta]7536-the kilta ? ' '[7536-the kilta] Nothing , but that [it]7536-the kilta is full of the Written Word - books and papers in which [they]5165-the sahibs wrote , and strange instruments , as of worship . [I]7536-the kilta do not like to handle the Written Word in that fashion . And [their]5165-the sahibs brass idols are beyond [my]7536-the kilta comprehension . '[7554-the ao - chung man] ' But [I]344-kim do , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim cautiously . [The lama]868-the lama drew breath in natural , easy sleep , and [Kim]344-kim had been thinking of [Hurree]400-hurree babu 's last words . ' It is a kilta with a red top full of very wonderful things , not to be handled by [fools]2559-fools . '[400-hurree babu] ' [I]3989-the bearer of that burden said it ; [I]3989-the bearer of that burden said it , '[3989-the bearer of that burden] cried [the bearer of that burden]3989-the bearer of that burden . '[673-whisky] [Whisky]673-whisky was demoralizing [the Ao- chung man]3990-the ao- chung man . ' It is no matter to [me]344-kim . [I]3992-they was only jesting . Give the order . There is more than enough for [us]3985-we all . [We]3985-we go [our]3985-we way from [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh in the dawn . '[3992-they] [They]3992-they arranged and re - arranged [their]3992-they artless little plans for another hour , while [Kim]344-kim shivered with cold and pride . The humour of the situation tickled [the Irish]374-irish and the Oriental in [his]344-kim soul . Here were [the emissaries of [the dread Power of [the North]1534-the north]3994-the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in [[their]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton own land]3996-their own land as [Mahbub]383-mahbub or [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton , suddenly smitten helpless . One of [them]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton , [he]344-kim privately knew , would be lame for a time . [They]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton had made promises to [Kings]870-kings . Tonight [they]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton lay out somewhere below [him]344-kim , chartless , foodless , tentless , gunless - except for [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu , guideless . And this collapse of [their]3992-they Great Game [Kim]344-kim wondered to whom [they]3992-they would report it , this panicky bolt into the night , had come about through no craft of [Hurree]400-hurree babu 's or contrivance of [Kim]344-kim 's , but simply , beautifully , and inevitably as the capture of [[Mahbub]383-mahbub 's fakir]3998-mahbub 's fakir - friends by [the zealous young policeman at [Umballa]52-umballa]3999-the zealous young policeman at umballa . ' [They]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton are there - with nothing ; and , by [Jove]638-jove , it is cold ! [I]344-kim am here with all [their]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton things . Oh , [they]3993-the emissaries of the dread power of the north , very possibly as great in their own land as mahbub or colonel creighton will be angry ! [I]344-kim am sorry for [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu . '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim might have saved [his]344-kim pity , for though at that moment [the Bengali]3837-the bengali suffered acutely in the flesh , [his]3837-the bengali soul was puffed and lofty . A mile down [the hill]2897-the hill , on the edge of [the pine - forest]4002-the pine - forest , [two half - frozen men]4003-two half - frozen men - [one powerfully sick at intervals]4004-one powerfully sick at intervals - were varying mutual recriminations with the most poignant abuse of [the Babu , who seemed distraught with terror]4005-the babu , who seemed distraught with terror . [They]4003-two half - frozen men demanded a plan of action . [He]3837-the bengali explained that [they]4003-two half - frozen men were very lucky to be alive ; that [their]4003-two half - frozen men coolies , if not then stalking [them]4003-two half - frozen men , had passed beyond recall ; that [the Rajah]4006-the rajah , [[his]3837-the bengali master]6109-his master , was ninety miles away , and , so far from lending [them]4003-two half - frozen men money and a retinue for the Simla journey , would surely cast [them]4003-two half - frozen men into prison if [he]3837-the bengali heard that [they]4003-two half - frozen men had hit [a priest]820-a priest . [He]3837-the bengali enlarged on this sin and its consequences till [they]4003-two half - frozen men bade [him]3837-the bengali change the subject . [Their]4003-two half - frozen men one hope , said [he]3837-the bengali , was unostentatious flight from [village]4009-village to [village]4009-village till [they]4003-two half - frozen men reached civilization ; and , for the hundredth time dissolved in tears , [he]3837-the bengali demanded of the high stars why [the Sahibs]670-the sahibs ' had beaten [holy man]7587-holy man '[3837-the bengali] . Ten steps would have taken [Hurree]400-hurree babu into the creaking gloom utterly beyond [their]4003-two half - frozen men reach - to [the shelter and food of [the nearest village]4012-the nearest village , where [glib - tongued doctors]4013-glib - tongued doctors were scarce . But [he]400-hurree babu preferred to endure cold , belly - pinch , bad words , and occasional blows in the company of [[his]400-hurree babu honoured employers]4014-his honoured employers]4011-the shelter and food of the nearest village , where glib - tongued doctors were scarce . but he preferred to endure cold , belly - pinch , bad words , and occasional blows in the company of his honoured employers . Crouched against a tree - trunk , [he]400-hurree babu sniffed dolefully . ' And have [you]4015-the uninjured man thought , '[4015-the uninjured man] said [the uninjured man]4015-the uninjured man hotly , ' what sort of spectacle [we]4003-two half - frozen men shall present wandering through [these hills]3764-these hills among [these aborigines]7589-these aborigines ? '[4015-the uninjured man] [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu had thought of little else for some hours , but the remark was not to [his]400-hurree babu address . ' [We]4003-two half - frozen men can not wander ! [I]344-kim can hardly walk , '[344-kim] groaned [[Kim]344-kim 's victim]4016-kim 's victim . ' Perhaps [the holy man]4622-the holy man will be merciful in loving - kindness , [sar]7525-sar , otherwise - '[344-kim] ' [I]4925-the speaker promise [myself]4925-the speaker a peculiar pleasure in emptying [my]4925-the speaker revolver into [that young bonze]7592-that young bonze when next [we]4003-two half - frozen men meet , '[4925-the speaker] was the unchristian answer . ' Revolvers ! Vengeance ! [Bonzes]674-bonzes ! '[400-hurree babu] [Hurree]400-hurree babu crouched lower . The war was breaking out afresh . ' Have [you]4018-you no consideration for [our]4003-two half - frozen men loss ? The baggage ! The baggage ! '[400-hurree babu] [He]400-hurree babu could hear [the speaker]4925-the speaker literally dancing on the grass . ' Everything [we]4003-two half - frozen men bore ! Everything [we]4003-two half - frozen men have secured ! [Our]4003-two half - frozen men gains ! Eight months '[4925-the speaker] work ! Do [you]4018-you know what that means ? " Decidedly it is [we]4019-we who can deal with [Orientals]7499-orientals ! " Oh , [you]4018-you have done well . ' [They]4003-two half - frozen men fell to it in several tongues , and [Hurree]400-hurree babu smiled . [Kim]344-kim was with [the kiltas]3937-the kiltas , and in [the kiltas]3937-the kiltas lay eight months of good diplomacy . There was no means of communicating with [the boy]986-the boy , but [he]986-the boy could be trusted . For the rest , [Hurree]400-hurree babu could so stage - manage the journey through [the hills]833-the hills that [Hilas]639-hilas , [Bunar]261-bunar , and four hundred miles of hill- roads should tell the tale for a generation . [Men who can not control [their]7597-men who can not control their own coolies own coolies]7597-men who can not control their own coolies are little respected in [the Hills]10-the hills , and [the hillman]1861-the hillman has a very keen sense of humour . '[4018-you] If [I]0-i had done it [myself]0-i , ' thought [Hurree]400-hurree babu , '[0-i] it would not have been better ; and , by [Jove]638-jove , now [I]0-i think of it , of course [I]0-i arranged it [myself]0-i . How quick [I]0-i have been ! Just when [I]0-i ran downhill [I]0-i thought it ! [Thee]4021-thee outrage was accidental , but onlee [me]0-i could have worked it - ah - for all it was dam'-well worth . Consider the moral effect upon [these ignorant peoples]4022-these ignorant peoples ! No treaties - no papers - no written documents at all - and [me]0-i to interpret for [them]4022-these ignorant peoples . How [I]0-i shall laugh with [the Colonel]757-the colonel ! [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had [their]4022-these ignorant peoples papers also : but [you]4024-you can not occupy two places in space simultaneously . Thatt is axiomatic . ' Chapter 14 [[My]4025-my brother]4548-my brother kneels so saith [Kabir]675-kabir To stone and brass in heathen wise , But in [[my]4025-my brother]4548-my brother 's voice [I]4025-my hear [My]4025-my own unanswered agonies . [[His]675-kabir God]7601-his god is as [his]675-kabir Fates assign - [His]675-kabir prayer is all [the world]759-the world 's - and mine . The Prayer . At moonrise [the cautious coolies]7603-the cautious coolies got under way . [The lama]868-the lama , refreshed by [his]868-the lama sleep and the spirit , needed no more than [Kim]344-kim 's shoulder to bear [him]868-the lama along - [a silent , swift - striding man]7605-a silent , swift - striding man . [They]4022-these ignorant peoples held the shale- sprinkled grass for an hour , swept round the shoulder of [an immortal cliff]7606-an immortal cliff , and climbed into [a new country]7607-a new country entirely blocked off from all sight of [Chini valley]267-chini . [A huge pasture - ground]7608-a huge pasture - ground ran up fan - shaped to the living snow . At [its]7608-a huge pasture - ground base was perhaps half an acre of flat land , on which stood [a few soil and timber huts]7609-a few soil and timber huts . Behind [them]4022-these ignorant peoples - for , hill- fashion , [they]4022-these ignorant peoples were perched on the edge of all things - the ground fell sheer two thousand feet to [Shamlegh - midden]297-shamlegh , where [never yet man]7610-never yet man has set foot . [The men]5050-the men made no motion to divide the plunder till [they]5050-the men had seen [the lama]868-the lama bedded down in [the best room of [the place]4561-the place]7613-the best room of the place , with [Kim]344-kim shampooing [his]868-the lama feet , Mohammedan - fashion . '[4025-my] [We]4025-my will send food , ' said [the Ao - chung man]7554-the ao - chung man , '[4025-my] and the red - topped kilta . By dawn there will be none to give evidence , one way or the other . If anything is not needed in [the kilta]7536-the kilta - see here ! ' [He]0-i pointed through the window - opening into space that was filled with moonlight reflected from the snow - and threw out an empty whisky - bottle . '[4025-my] No need to listen for the fall . This is [the world]759-the world 's end , ' [he]0-i said , and went out . [The lama]868-the lama looked forth , a hand on either sill , with eyes that shone like yellow opals . From the enormous pit before [him]868-the lama white peaks lifted themselves yearning to the moonlight . The rest was as the darkness of [interstellar space]7617-interstellar space . '[4025-my] These , ' [he]868-the lama said slowly , '[4025-my] are indeed [[my]0-i Hills]3799-my hills . Thus should [a man]750-a man abide , perched above [the world]759-the world , separated from delights , considering vast matters . ' '[750-a man] Yes ; if [he]750-a man has a chela to prepare tea for [him]750-a man , and to fold a blanket for [his]750-a man head , and to chase out calving cows . ' A smoky lamp burned in a niche , but the full moonlight beat it down ; and by the mixed light , stooping above the food - bag and cups , [Kim]344-kim moved like a tall ghost . '[676-ai] [Ai]676-ai ! But now [I]0-i have let the blood cool , [my]0-i head still beats and drums , and there is a cord round the back of [my]0-i neck . ' '[750-a man] No wonder . It was a strong blow . May [he]750-a man who dealt it - ' '[750-a man] But for [my]0-i own passions there would have been no evil . ' '[750-a man] What evil ? [Thou]4031-thou hast saved [the Sahibs]5165-the sahibs from the death [they]5165-the sahibs deserved a hundred times . ' '[4031-thou] The lesson is not well learnt , [chela]5580-chela . ' [The lama]868-the lama came to rest on a folded blanket , as [Kim]344-kim went forward with [his]344-kim evening routine . '[5580-chela] The blow was but a shadow upon a shadow . Evil in itself - [my]0-i legs weary apace these latter days ! - it met evil in [me]0-i : anger , rage , and a lust to return evil . These wrought in [my]0-i blood , woke tumult in [my]0-i stomach , and dazzled [my]0-i ears . ' Here [he]868-the lama drank scalding black - tea ceremonially , taking the hot cup from [Kim]344-kim 's hand . '[0-i] Had [I]0-i been passionless , the evil blow would have done only bodily evil - a scar , or a bruise - which is illusion . But [my]0-i mind was not abstracted , for rushed in straightway a lust to let [the Spiti men]7553-the spiti men kill . In fighting that lust , [my]0-i soul was torn and wrenched beyond a thousand blows . Not till [I]0-i had repeated the Blessings ' [he]868-the lama meant the Buddhist Beatitudes '[0-i] did [I]0-i achieve calm . But the evil planted in [me]0-i by that moment 's carelessness works out to its end . Just is the Wheel , swerving not a hair ! Learn the lesson , [chela]439-chela . ' '[439-chela] It is too high for [me]0-i , ' [Kim]344-kim muttered . '[0-i] [I]0-i am still all shaken . [I]0-i am glad [I]0-i hurt [the man]4471-the man . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i felt that , sleeping upon [thy]439-chela knees , in the wood below . [It]4036-it disquieted [me]0-i in [my]0-i dreams - the evil in [thy]439-chela soul working through to [mine]0-i . Yet on the other hand ' - [he]0-i loosed [his]0-i rosary - '[0-i] [I]0-i have acquired merit by saving two lives - the lives of those that wronged [me]0-i . Now [I]0-i must see into the Cause of [Things]677-things . The boat of [my]0-i soul staggers . ' '[0-i] Sleep , and be strong . That is wisest . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i meditate . There is a need greater than [thou]439-chela knowest . ' Till the dawn , hour after hour , as the moonlight paled on the high peaks , and that which had been belted blackness on [the sides of [the far hills]7620-the far hills]7619-the sides of the far hills showed as tender green forest , [the lama]868-the lama stared fixedly at the wall . From time to time [he]0-i groaned . Outside the barred door , where discomfited kine came to ask for [[their]4037-they old stable]7622-their old stable , [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh and [the coolies]7248-the coolies gave itself up to plunder and riotous living . [The Ao - chung man]7554-the ao - chung man was [[their]4037-they leader]7625-their leader , and once [they]4037-they had opened [the Sahibs]670-the sahibs '[0-i] tinned foods and found that [they]4037-they were very good [they]4037-they dared not turn back . [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh kitchen - midden took the dunnage . When [Kim]344-kim , after a night of bad dreams , stole forth to brush [his]344-kim teeth in the morning chill , [a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear]4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear drew [him]344-kim aside . ' [The others]5143-the others have gone . [They]5143-the others left [thee]344-kim this kilta as the promise was . [I]4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear do not love [Sahibs]670-the sahibs , but [thou]7627-thou wilt make [us]4037-they a charm in return for it . [We]4037-they do not wish little [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh to get a bad name on account of the - accident . [I]4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear am [the Woman of [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh]3964-the woman of shamlegh . '[4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear] [She]4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear looked [him]344-kim over with bold , bright eyes , unlike the usual furtive glance of [hillwomen]4039-hillwomen . ' Assuredly . But it must be done in secret . '[4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear] [She]4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear raised the heavy kilta like a toy and slung it into [[her]4038-a fair - coloured woman with turquoise- studded headgear own hut]4040-her own hut . ' Out and bar the door ! Let [none]4586-none come near till it is finished , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . ' But afterwards - [we]4037-they may talk ? '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim tilted the kilta on the floor - a cascade of Survey - instruments , books , diaries , letters , maps , and queerly scented native correspondence . At the very bottom was an embroidered bag covering a sealed , gilded , and illuminated document such as [one King]4041-one king sends to another . [Kim]344-kim caught [his]344-kim breath with delight , and reviewed the situation from a [Sahib]393-colonel creighton 's point of view . ' The books [I]344-kim do not want . Besides , they are logarithms - Survey , [I]344-kim suppose . '[344-kim] [He]344-kim laid them aside . ' The letters [I]344-kim do not understand , but [Colonel Creighton]393-colonel creighton will . [They]7630-they must all be kept . The maps - [they]7630-they draw better maps than [me]344-kim - of course . All the native letters - oho ! - and particularly the murasla . '[344-kim] [He]344-kim sniffed the embroidered bag . ' That must be from [Hilas]639-hilas or [Bunar]261-bunar , and [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu spoke truth . By [Jove]638-jove ! It is a fine haul . [I]344-kim wish [Hurree]400-hurree babu could know ... The rest must go out of the window . '[344-kim] [He]344-kim fingered a superb prismatic compass and the shiny top of a theodolite . But after all , [a Sahib]5596-a sahib can not very well steal , and the things might be inconvenient evidence later . [He]344-kim sorted out every scrap of manuscript , every map , and the native letters . They made one softish slab . The three locked ferril - backed books , with five worn pocket - books , [he]344-kim put aside . ' The letters and the murasla [I]344-kim must carry inside [my]344-kim coat and under [my]344-kim belt , and the hand - written books [I]344-kim must put into the food - bag . It will be very heavy . No . [I]344-kim do not think there is anything more . If there is , the coolies have thrown it down the khud , so thatt is all right . Now [you]7631-you go too . '[344-kim] [He]344-kim repacked the kilta with all [he]344-kim meant to lose , and hove it up on to the windowsill . A thousand feet below lay a long , lazy , round - shouldered bank of mist , as yet untouched by the morning sun . A thousand feet below that was a hundred - year - old pine- forest . [He]344-kim could see the green tops looking like a bed of moss when a wind - eddy thinned the cloud . ' No ! [I]344-kim do n't think [any one]7632-any one will go after [you]7631-you ! '[344-kim] The wheeling basket vomited its contents as it dropped . The theodolite hit [a jutting cliff - ledge]4043-a jutting cliff - ledge and exploded like a shell ; the books , inkstands , paint - boxes , compasses , and rulers showed for a few seconds like a swarm of bees . Then [they]4044-they vanished ; and , though [Kim]344-kim , hanging half out of the window , strained [his]344-kim young ears , never a sound came up from [the gulf]4045-the gulf . ' Five hundred - a thousand rupees could not buy them , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim thought sorrowfully . ' It was verree wasteful , but [I]344-kim have all [their]4044-they other stuff - everything [they]4044-they did - [I]344-kim hope . Now how the deuce am [I]344-kim to tell [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu , and whatt [the deuce]2454-the deuce am [I]344-kim to do ? And [[my]344-kim old man]2274-my old man is sick . [I]344-kim must tie up the letters in oilskin . That is something to do first - else [they]4044-they will get all sweated ... And [I]344-kim am all alone ! '[344-kim] [He]344-kim bound them into a neat packet , swedging down the stiff , sticky oilskin at the comers , for [his]344-kim roving life had made [him]344-kim as methodical as [an old hunter]7379-an old hunter in matters of [the road]4566-the road . Then with double care [he]344-kim packed away the books at the bottom of the food - bag . [The woman]766-the woman rapped at the door . ' But [thou]7635-thou hast made no charm , '[766-the woman] [she]766-the woman said , looking about . ' There is no need . '[766-the woman] [Kim]344-kim had completely overlooked the necessity for a little patter - talk . [The woman]766-the woman laughed at [his]344-kim confusion irreverently . ' None - for [thee]344-kim . [Thou]7635-thou canst cast a spell by the mere winking of an eye . But think of [[us]7636-us poor people]7637-us poor people when [thou]7635-thou art gone . [They]7637-us poor people were all too drunk last night to hear [a woman]1192-a woman . [Thou]7635-thou art not drunk ? '[766-the woman] ' [I]766-the woman am [a priest]820-a priest . '[766-the woman] [Kim]344-kim had recovered [himself]344-kim , and , [the woman]766-the woman being aught but unlovely , thought best to stand on [[his]344-kim office]5893-his office . ' [I]766-the woman warned [them]7637-us poor people that [the Sahibs]670-the sahibs will be angry and will make an inquisition and a report to [the Rajah]469-rajah . There is also [the Babu]670-the sahibs with [them]7637-us poor people . [Clerks]678-clerks have long tongues . '[766-the woman] ' Is that all [thy]7635-thou trouble ? '[766-the woman] The plan rose fully formed in [Kim]344-kim 's mind , and [he]344-kim smiled ravishingly . ' [I]344-kim can finish that in a breath , '[344-kim] [he]344-kim went on quickly . ' [The Babu]670-the sahibs is [the very hakim]7640-the very hakim [thou]7635-thou hast heard of [him]7640-the very hakim ? who was wandering among [the hills]833-the hills by [Ziglaur]291-ziglaur . ' '[4056-him] Indeed no . [They]4057-they are still in [the forest]7447-the forest across [the spur]4059-the spur . [I]0-i - [I]0-i am afraid . ' [Kim]344-kim laughed . '[0-i] [He]4065-the son of the charm is , [I]0-i have no doubt , very tired and very hungry . [The Hills]10-the hills make [cold bedfellows]4068-cold bedfellows . Hai , [my]0-i ' - it was on the tip of [his]0-i tongue to say [Mother]4505-mother , but [he]0-i turned it to [Sister]680-sister - '[0-i] [thou]4069-thou art [a wise and witty woman]4070-a wise and witty woman . News was at [Ziglaur]291-ziglaur by midnight , and by tomorrow should be at [Kotgarh]303-kotgarh . [The villages]2607-the villages are both afraid and angry . ' '[6478-the babu] No need . Tell [the villages]2607-the villages to feed [the Sahibs]670-the sahibs and pass [them]670-the sahibs on , in peace . [We]4074-we must get [them]670-the sahibs quietly away from [[our]4074-we valleys]4075-our valleys . To steal is one thing - to kill another . [The Babu]6478-the babu will understand , and there will be no after - complaints . Be swift . [I]0-i must tend [[my]0-i master]1715-my master when [he]1715-my master wakes . ' '[0-i] So be it . After service - [thou]4069-thou hast said ? - comes the reward . [I]0-i am [the Woman of [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh]3964-the woman of shamlegh , and [I]0-i hold from [the Rajah]469-rajah . ' [She]3964-the woman of shamlegh turned resolutely uphill , [her]3964-the woman of shamlegh silver necklaces clicking on [her]3964-the woman of shamlegh broad breast , to meet the morning sun fifteen hundred feet above [them]7655-them . This time [Kim]344-kim thought in the vernacular as [he]344-kim waxed down the oilskin edges of the packets . '[297-shamlegh] How can [a man]750-a man follow the Way or [the Great Game]235-the great game when [he]750-a man is so - always pestered by [women]4700-women ? There was [that girl at [Akrola]245-akrola of [the Ford]246-the ford]4083-that girl at akrola of the ford ; and there was [[the scullion]1336-the scullion 's wife]4085-the scullion 's wife behind the dovecot - not counting [the others]5143-the others - and now comes [this one]1289-this one ! When [I]0-i was [a child]4501-a child it was well enough , but now [I]0-i am [a man]750-a man and [they]4090-they will not regard [me]0-i as [a man]750-a man . [Walnuts]681-walnuts , indeed ! Ho ! ho ! It is almonds in [the Plains]175-the plains ! ' [He]0-i went out to levy on [the village]5076-the village - not with a begging - bowl , which might do for [down - country]7657-down - country , but in the manner of [a prince]4513-a prince . [[Shamlegh]297-shamlegh 's summer population]7659-shamlegh 's summer population is only [three families]7660-three families - [four women]7661-four women and [eight or nine men]7662-eight or nine men . [They]7660-three families were all full of tinned meats and mixed drinks , from ammoniated quinine to white vodka , for [they]7660-three families had taken [their]7660-three families full share in the overnight loot . [The neat Continental tents]7663-the neat continental tents had been cut up and shared long ago , and there were patent aluminium saucepans abroad . But [they]7660-three families considered [the lama]868-the lama 's presence a perfect safeguard against all consequences , and impenitently brought [Kim]344-kim of [their]7660-three families best - even to a drink of chang - the barley - beer that comes from [Ladakh]280-ladakh - way . Then [they]7660-three families thawed out in the sun , and sat with [their]7660-three families legs hanging over infinite abysses , chattering , laughing , and smoking . [They]7660-three families judged [India]8-india and [its Government]7665-its government solely from [their]7660-three families experience of [wandering Sahibs who had employed [them]7660-three families or [[their]7660-three families friends]7667-their friends as [shikarris]7668-shikarris]7666-wandering sahibs who had employed them or their friends as shikarris . [Kim]344-kim heard tales of shots missed upon ibex , serow , or markhor , by [Sahibs]2683-sahibs twenty years in [[their]2683-sahibs graves]1525-their graves - every detail lighted from behind like twigs on tree - tops seen against lightning . [They]7660-three families told [him]344-kim of [their]7660-three families little diseases , and , more important , the diseases of [their]7660-three families tiny , sure - footed cattle ; of trips as far as [Kotgarh]303-kotgarh , where [the strange missionaries]7671-the strange missionaries live , and beyond even to marvellous [Simla]159-simla , where [the streets]3459-the streets are paved with silver , and [anyone]1036-anyone , look [you]7674-you , can get service with [the Sahibs]670-the sahibs , who ride about in [two - wheeled carts]7675-two - wheeled carts and spend money with a spade . Presently , grave and aloof , walking very heavily , [the lama]868-the lama joined [himself]868-the lama to the chatter under the eaves , and [they]7660-three families gave [him]868-the lama great room . The thin air refreshed [him]868-the lama , and [he]868-the lama sat on the edge of precipices with the best of [them]7660-three families , and , when talk languished , flung pebbles into the void . Thirty miles away , as the eagle flies , lay the next range , seamed and channelled and pitted with [little patches of brush - forests]7677-little patches of brush - forests , each a day 's dark march . Behind [the village]5076-the village , [Shamlegh hill]7679-shamlegh hill [itself]7679-shamlegh hill cut off all view to southward . It was like sitting in a swallow 's nest under the eaves of [the roof of [the world]759-the world]7680-the roof of the world . From time to time [the lama]868-the lama stretched out [his]868-the lama hand , and with a little low - voiced prompting would point out [the road to [Spiti]648-spiti and north across [the Parungla]306-the parungla]7683-the road to spiti and north across the parungla . '[523-young de castro] Beyond , where [the hills]833-the hills lie thickest , lies [De - ch'en]523-young de castro ' [he]523-young de castro meant [Han - le]682-han - le '[523-young de castro] , ' [the great Monastery]7684-the great monastery . s'Tag - [stan - ras - ch'en]683-stan - ras - ch'en built [it]7684-the great monastery , and of [him]523-young de castro there runs this tale . '[523-young de castro] Whereupon [he]523-young de castro told it : a fantastic piled narrative of bewitchment and miracles that set [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh a - gasping . Turning west a little , [he]523-young de castro steered for [the green hills of [Kulu]19-kulu]4093-the green hills of kulu , and sought [Kailung]307-kailung under [the glaciers]4094-the glaciers . ' For thither came [I]523-young de castro in the old , old days . From Leh [I]523-young de castro came , over [the Baralachi]308-the baralachi . '[523-young de castro] ' Yes , yes ; [we]4095-the far - faring people of shamlegh know it , '[4095-the far - faring people of shamlegh] said [the far - faring people of [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh]4095-the far - faring people of shamlegh . ' And [I]4096-my slept two nights with [the priests of [Kailung]307-kailung]7685-the priests of kailung . These are [the Hills of [my]4096-my delight]7686-the hills of my delight ! Shadows blessed above all other shadows ! There [my]4096-my eyes opened on [this world]1066-this world ; there [my]4096-my eyes were opened to [this world]1066-this world ; there [I]4096-my found [Enlightenment]609-enlightenment ; and there [I]4096-my girt [my]4096-my loins for [my]4096-my Search . Out of [the Hills]10-the hills [I]4096-my came - the high Hills and the strong winds . Oh , just is the Wheel ! '[4096-my] [He]4096-my blessed them in detail - the great glaciers , the naked rocks , the piled moraines and tumbled shale ; dry upland , hidden salt - lake , age - old timber and fruitful water - shot valley one after the other , as [a dying man]4097-a dying man blesses [[his]4097-a dying man folk]4098-his folk ; and [Kim]344-kim marvelled at [his]4096-my passion . ' Yes - yes . There is no place like [[our]4099-the people of shamlegh [Hills]10-the hills]7689-our hills , '[4099-the people of shamlegh] said [the people of [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh]4099-the people of shamlegh . And [they]4099-the people of shamlegh fell to wondering how [a man]750-a man could live in [the hot terrible Plains]4101-the hot terrible plains where the cattle run as big as elephants , unfit to plough on [a hillside]4102-a hillside ; where [village]4009-village touches [village]4009-village , [they]4099-the people of shamlegh had heard , for a hundred miles ; where [folk]5943-folk went about stealing in [gangs]4106-gangs , and what [the robbers]4107-the robbers spared [the Police]1665-the police carried utterly away . So [the still forenoon]4109-the still forenoon wore through , and at the end of it [[Kim]344-kim 's messenger]4110-kim 's messenger dropped from [the steep pasture]4111-the steep pasture as unbreathed as when [she]4110-kim 's messenger had set out . ' [I]344-kim sent a word to [the hakim]7103-the hakim , '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim explained , while [she]4110-kim 's messenger made reverence . ' [He]7103-the hakim joined [himself]7103-the hakim to [the idolaters]7691-the idolaters ? Nay , [I]4110-kim 's messenger remember [he]7103-the hakim did a healing upon one of [them]7691-the idolaters . [He]7103-the hakim has acquired merit , though [the healed]7692-the healed employed [his]7103-the hakim strength for evil . Just is the Wheel ! What of [the hakim]7103-the hakim ? '[4110-kim 's messenger] ' [I]344-kim feared that [thou]7694-thou hadst been bruised and - and [I]344-kim knew [he]7103-the hakim was wise . ' [He]0-i says , [Holy One]385-holy one , that [he]0-i will escape from [the idolaters]7691-the idolaters , and will return to [us]7696-we . ' That may not be , [chela]5580-chela . From [my]868-the lama bones outward [I]868-the lama do desire it , but it is forbidden . [I]868-the lama have seen the Cause of Things . '[868-the lama] ' Why ? When [the Hills]10-the hills give [thee]7698-thee back [thy]7698-thee strength day by day ? ' Just and perfect is the Wheel , swerving not a hair . '[868-the lama] ' Quiet , be quiet ! '[297-shamlegh] said [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh , all arow . ' [He]868-the lama speaks of [Jam]685-jam [- lin - nin - k'or]309-- lin - nin - k'or , the Horse That Can Go Round [The World]14-the world In a Day . ' [I]868-the lama did not seek truth in those days , but the talk of doctrine . All illusion ! [I]868-the lama drank the beer and ate the bread of [Guru Ch'wan]686-guru ch'wan . " [I]868-the lama went , and [we]7705-we fought a day . '[868-the lama] ' But how , [Holy One]385-holy one ? '[297-shamlegh] ' With [our]7705-we long pencases as [I]4120-i could have shown ... [I]4120-i say , [we]7705-we fought under the poplars , both [Abbots]7709-abbots and [all the monks]7710-all the monks , and [one]1164-one laid open [my]4120-i forehead to the bone . See ! '[4120-i] [He]4120-i tilted back [his]4120-i cap and showed a puckered silvery scar . ' Just and perfect is the Wheel ! Yesterday the scar itched , and after fifty years [I]4120-i recalled how it was dealt and the face of [him]4120-i who dealt it ; dwelling a little in illusion . Followed that which [thou]7712-thou didst see - strife and stupidity . Just is the Wheel ! [The idolater]7713-the idolater 's blow fell upon the scar . Then [I]4120-i was shaken in [my]4120-i soul : [my]4120-i soul was darkened , and the boat of [my]4120-i soul rocked upon the waters of illusion . Not till [I]4120-i came to [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh could [I]4120-i meditate upon the Cause of Things , or trace the running grass - roots of Evil . [I]4120-i strove all the long night . '[4120-i] ' But , [Holy One]385-holy one , [thou]7712-thou art innocent of all evil . May [I]344-kim be [thy]7712-thou sacrifice ! '[344-kim] [Kim]344-kim was genuinely distressed at [the old man]861-the old man 's sorrow , and [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub 's phrase slipped out unawares . ' In the dawn , '[868-the lama] [the lama]868-the lama went on more gravely , ready rosary clicking between the slow sentences , ' came enlightenment . It is here ... [I]868-the lama am [an old man]831-an old man ... hill - bred , hill - fed , never to sit down among [[my]868-the lama Hills]3799-my hills . Three years [I]868-the lama travelled through [Hind]70-hind , but - can earth be stronger than [Mother Earth]711-mother earth ? There is no blame to [the hakim]7103-the hakim . [He]7103-the hakim - following Desire - foretold that [the Hills]10-the hills would make [me]868-the lama strong . '[868-the lama] ' More than once [I]4123-i remember '[4123-i] - [he]4123-i rested [his]4123-i cheek dolefully on [his]4123-i hand - ' [I]4123-i sought [thy]7720-thee praise and [the hakim]7103-the hakim 's for the mere strength of [my]4123-i legs . '[0-i] What is it to [thee]0-i , [woman of ill - omen]4176-woman of ill - omen , where [he]4163-my sahib goes ?
