' '[0-i] [I]0-i go to [the Plains]175-the plains . None must hinder [my]0-i return . [I]0-i have wrestled with [my]0-i soul till [I]0-i am strengthless . The stupid body is spent , and [we]4178-we are far from [the Plains]175-the plains . ' '[4179-thy great god] Behold ! ' [she]7765-she said simply , and drew aside to let [Kim]344-kim see [his]344-kim own utter helplessness . '[0-i] Curse [me]0-i . Maybe it will give [him]4163-my sahib strength . Make a charm ! Call on [[thy]0-i great God]4179-thy great god . [Thou]4180-thou art [a priest]820-a priest . ' [She]7765-she turned away . [The lama]868-the lama had squatted limply , still holding by the door - post . [One]1164-one can not strike down [an old man]831-an old man that [he]831-an old man recovers again like [a boy]4870-a boy in the night . [Weakness]693-weakness bowed [him]831-an old man to [the earth]1402-the earth , but [his]831-an old man eyes that hung on [Kim]344-kim were alive and imploring . '[820-a priest] It is all well , ' said [Kim]344-kim . '[4183-mine] It is the thin air that weakens [thee]0-i . In a little while [we]4182-we go ! It is the mountain - sickness . [I]0-i too am a little sick at stomach , ' - and [he]0-i knelt and comforted with such poor words as came first to [his]0-i lips . Then [the woman]766-the woman returned , more erect than ever . '[0-i] [Thy]0-i Gods useless , [heh]0-i ? Try [mine]4183-mine . [I]0-i am [the Woman of [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh]3964-the woman of shamlegh . ' [She]766-the woman hailed hoarsely , and there came out of a cow - pen [[her]766-the woman two husbands]7772-her two husbands and [three others]7773-three others with a dooli , [the rude native litter of [the Hills]833-the hills]7774-the rude native litter of the hills , that [they]7773-three others use for carrying [the sick]5721-the sick and for visits of state . '[3964-the woman of shamlegh] These cattle ' - [she]766-the woman did not condescend to look at [them]7773-three others - '[3964-the woman of shamlegh] are thine for so long as [thou]0-i shalt need . ' '[3964-the woman of shamlegh] But [we]4185-we will not go [Simla]159-simla - way . [We]4185-we will not go near [the Sahibs]670-the sahibs , ' cried [the first husband]7777-the first husband . '[4185-we] [They]670-the sahibs will not run away as [the others]5143-the others did , nor will [they]670-the sahibs steal baggage . Two [I]0-i know for [weaklings]4187-weaklings . Stand to the rear - pole , [Sonoo]694-sonoo and [Taree]314-taree . ' [They]670-the sahibs obeyed swiftly . '[694-sonoo] Lower now , and lift in [that holy man]1051-that holy man . [I]0-i will see to [the village]5076-the village and [[your]1051-that holy man virtuous wives]4190-your virtuous wives till [ye]1051-that holy man return . ' '[0-i] When will that be ? ' '[6870-the priests] Ask [the priests]6870-the priests . Do not pester [me]0-i . Lay the food - bag at the foot , it balances better so . ' '[385-holy one] Oh , [Holy One]385-holy one , [[thy]385-holy one Hills]4192-thy hills are kinder than [[our]4193-our Plains]4194-our plains ! ' cried [Kim]344-kim , relieved , as [the lama]868-the lama tottered to the litter . '[385-holy one] It is [[a very king]4195-a very king 's bed]4196-a very king 's bed - [a place of honour and ease]4197-a place of honour and ease . And [we]4193-our owe it to - ' '[4198-a woman of ill - omen] [A woman of ill - omen]4198-a woman of ill - omen . [I]0-i need [thy]385-holy one blessings as much as [I]0-i do [thy]385-holy one curses . It is [my]0-i order and none of thine . Lift and away ! Here ! Hast [thou]385-holy one money for [the road]4566-the road ? ' [She]4198-a woman of ill - omen beckoned [Kim]344-kim to [[her]4198-a woman of ill - omen hut]7779-her hut , and stooped above a battered English cash - box under [her]4198-a woman of ill - omen cot . '[0-i] [I]0-i do not need anything , ' said [Kim]344-kim , angered where [he]344-kim should have been grateful . '[0-i] [I]0-i am already rudely loaded with favours . ' [She]4198-a woman of ill - omen looked up with a curious smile and laid a hand on [his]344-kim shoulder . '[0-i] At least , thank [me]0-i . [I]0-i am foul - faced and [a hillwoman]4200-a hillwoman , but , as [thy]385-holy one talk goes , [I]0-i have acquired merit . Shall [I]0-i show [thee]385-holy one how [the Sahibs]670-the sahibs render thanks ? ' and [her]4198-a woman of ill - omen hard eyes softened . '[0-i] [I]0-i am but [a wandering priest]4201-a wandering priest , ' said [Kim]344-kim , [his]344-kim eyes lighting in answer . '[0-i] [Thou]385-holy one needest neither [my]0-i blessings nor [my]0-i curses . ' '[385-holy one] Nay . But for one little moment - [thou]385-holy one canst overtake [the dooli]7205-the dooli in ten strides - if [thou]385-holy one wast [a Sahib]5596-a sahib , shall [I]0-i show [thee]385-holy one what [thou]385-holy one wouldst do ? ' '[0-i] How if [I]0-i guess , though ? ' said [Kim]344-kim , and putting [his]0-i arm round [her]7213-my dear waist , [he]0-i kissed [her]7213-my dear on the cheek , adding in English : '[0-i] Thank [you]385-holy one verree much , [[my]0-i dear]7213-my dear . ' Kissing is practically unknown among [Asiatics]695-asiatics , which may have been the reason that [she]7213-my dear leaned back with wide - open eyes and a face of panic . '[385-holy one] Next time , ' [Kim]344-kim went on , '[385-holy one] [you]385-holy one must not be so sure of [[your]385-holy one heatthen priests]4205-your heatthen priests . Now [I]0-i say good - bye . ' [He]0-i held out [his]0-i hand English - fashion . [She]7213-my dear took it mechanically . '[0-i] Good - bye , [[my]0-i dear]7213-my dear . ' '[7213-my dear] Good - bye , and - and ' - [she]7213-my dear was remembering [her]7213-my dear English words one by one -'you will come back again ? Good - bye , and - [thee]7780-thee [God]360-god bless [you]7780-thee . '[868-the lama] Half an hour later , as the creaking litter jolted up [the hill path that leads south - easterly from [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh]4207-the hill path that leads south - easterly from shamlegh , [Kim]344-kim saw [a tiny figure at the hut door]4208-a tiny figure at the hut door waving a white rag . ' [She]7213-my dear has acquired merit beyond all others , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' For to set [a man]750-a man upon the way to [Freedom]315-freedom is half as great as though [she]7213-my dear had [herself]7213-my dear found it . '[868-the lama] ' Umm , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim thoughtfully , considering the past . ' It may be that [I]868-the lama have acquired merit also ... At least [she]7213-my dear did not treat [me]868-the lama like [a child]4501-a child . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama hitched the front of [his]868-the lama robe , where lay the slab of documents and maps , re - stowed the precious food - bag at [the lama]868-the lama 's feet , laid [his]868-the lama hand on the litter 's edge , and buckled down to the slow pace of [the grunting husbands]4211-the grunting husbands . ' These also acquire merit , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama after three miles . ' More than that , they shall be paid in silver , '[868-the lama] quoth [Kim]344-kim . [The Woman of [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh]3964-the woman of shamlegh had given it to [him]868-the lama ; and it was only fair , [he]868-the lama argued , that [[her]3964-the woman of shamlegh men]1962-her men should earn it back again . Chapter 15 [I]0-i 'd not give room for [an Emperor]4215-an emperor - [I]0-i 'd hold [[my]0-i road]6198-my road for [a King]4664-a king . To the Triple Crown [I]0-i 'd not bow down - But this is a different thing ! [I]0-i 'll not fight with [the Powers of Air - Sentry]4218-the powers of air - sentry , pass [him]4218-the powers of air - sentry through ! [Drawbridge]316-drawbridge let fall - [He]4218-the powers of air - sentry 's [the Lord of [us]4220-us all]4219-the lord of us all - [The Dreamer whose dream came true]4221-the dreamer whose dream came true ! The Siege of [the Fairies]696-the fairies . Two hundred miles north of [Chini]267-chini , on [the blue shale of [Ladakh]280-ladakh]4222-the blue shale of ladakh , lies [Yankling Sahib]666-yankling sahib , [the merry - minded man]4223-the merry - minded man , spy - glassing wrathfully across [the ridges]4224-the ridges for some sign of [[his]666-yankling sahib pet tracker]4225-his pet tracker - [a man from [Ao - chung]665-ao - chung]4226-a man from ao - chung . But [that renegade]4227-that renegade , with a new Mannlicher rifle and two hundred cartridges , is elsewhere , shooting musk - deer for the market , and [Yankling Sahib]666-yankling sahib will learn next season how very ill [he]666-yankling sahib has been . Up [the valleys of [Bushahr]287-bushahr]4228-the valleys of bushahr - [the far - beholding eagles of [the Himalayas]269-the himalayas]4229-the far - beholding eagles of the himalayas swerve at [his]666-yankling sahib new blue - and - white gored umbrella - hurries a Bengali , once fat and well - looking , now lean and weather - worn . [He]666-yankling sahib has received the thanks of [two foreigners of distinction]4230-two foreigners of distinction , piloted not unskilfully to [Mashobra tunnel]318-mashobra tunnel , which leads to [the great and gay capital of India]4231-the great and gay capital of india . It was not [his]666-yankling sahib fault that , blanketed by wet mists , [he]666-yankling sahib conveyed [them]4230-two foreigners of distinction past [the telegraph - station]4232-the telegraph - station and [European colony of [Kotgarh]303-kotgarh]4233-european colony of kotgarh . It was not [his]666-yankling sahib fault , but that of [the Gods]1244-the gods , of whom [he]666-yankling sahib discoursed so engagingly , that [he]666-yankling sahib led [them]4230-two foreigners of distinction into the borders of [Nahan]319-nahan , where [the Rahah of [that State]4236-that state]4235-the rahah of that state mistook [them]4230-two foreigners of distinction for [deserting British soldiery]4237-deserting british soldiery . [Hurree Babu]400-hurree babu explained the greatness and glory , in [[their]4238-their own country]5860-their own country , of [[his]400-hurree babu companions]4468-his companions , till [the drowsy kinglet]4241-the drowsy kinglet smiled . [He]400-hurree babu explained it to everyone who asked - many times - aloud - variously . [He]400-hurree babu begged food , arranged accommodation , proved [a skilful leech for an injury of the groin]4242-a skilful leech for an injury of the groin - such a blow as [one]1164-one may receive rolling down [a rock - covered hillside]4244-a rock - covered hillside in the dark - and in all things indispensable . The reason of [his]400-hurree babu friendliness did [him]400-hurree babu credit . With [millions of [fellow - serfs]4246-fellow - serfs]4245-millions of fellow - serfs , [he]400-hurree babu had learned to look upon [Russia]697-russia as [the great deliverer]4247-the great deliverer from [the North]48-the north . [He]400-hurree babu was [a fearful man]3229-a fearful man . [He]400-hurree babu had been afraid that [he]400-hurree babu could not save [[his]400-hurree babu illustrious employers]4249-his illustrious employers from the anger of [an excited peasantry]4250-an excited peasantry . [He]400-hurree babu [himself]400-hurree babu would just as [lief]4251-lief hit [a holy man]4605-a holy man as not , but ... [He]400-hurree babu was deeply grateful and sincerely rejoiced that [he]400-hurree babu had done [his]400-hurree babu ' little possible '[400-hurree babu] towards bringing [their]4253-they venture to - barring the lost baggage - a successful issue , [he]400-hurree babu had forgotten the blows ; denied that any blows had been dealt that unseemly first night under the pines . [He]400-hurree babu asked neither pension nor retaining fee , but , if [they]4253-they deemed [him]400-hurree babu worthy , would [they]4253-they write [him]400-hurree babu a testimonial ? It might be useful to [him]400-hurree babu later , if [others]1126-others , [[their]4253-they friends]7667-their friends , came over [the Passes]49-the passes . [He]400-hurree babu begged [them]4253-they to remember [him]400-hurree babu in [their]4253-they future greatnesses , for [he]400-hurree babu ' opined subtly '[400-hurree babu] that [he]400-hurree babu , even [he]400-hurree babu , [Mohendro Lal Dutt]698-mohendro lal dutt , [MA of [Calcutta]84-calcutta]4256-ma of calcutta , had ' done the State some service '[400-hurree babu] . [They]4253-they gave [him]400-hurree babu a certificate praising [his]400-hurree babu courtesy , helpfulness , and unerring skill as [a guide]4257-a guide . [He]400-hurree babu put it in [his]400-hurree babu waist - belt and sobbed with emotion ; [they]4253-they had endured so many dangers together . [He]400-hurree babu led [them]4253-they at high noon along [crowded Simla Mall]320-crowded simla mall to [the Alliance Bank of [Simla]159-simla , where [they]4253-they wished to establish [their]4253-they identity]4258-the alliance bank of simla , where they wished to establish their identity . Thence [he]400-hurree babu vanished like a dawn - cloud on [Jakko]181-jakko . Behold [him]400-hurree babu , too fine - drawn to sweat , too pressed to vaunt the drugs in [his]400-hurree babu little brass - bound box , ascending [Shamlegh slope]297-shamlegh , [a just man made perfect]4259-a just man made perfect . Watch [him]400-hurree babu , all [Babudom]699-babudom laid aside , smoking at noon on a cot , while [a woman with turquoise - studded headgear]4260-a woman with turquoise - studded headgear points south- easterly across the bare grass . [Litters]700-litters , [she]4260-a woman with turquoise - studded headgear says , do not travel as fast as [single men]4261-single men , but [his]400-hurree babu birds should now be in [the Plains]4138-the plains . [The holy man]4622-the holy man would not stay though [Lispeth]701-lispeth pressed [him]4622-the holy man . [The Babu]400-hurree babu groans heavily , girds up [his]400-hurree babu huge loins , and is off again . [He]400-hurree babu does not care to travel after dusk ; but [his]400-hurree babu days ' marches - there is none to enter [them]7783-them in a book - would astonish [folk who mock at [his]400-hurree babu race]7784-folk who mock at his race . [Kindly villagers]7785-kindly villagers , remembering the Dacca drug - vendor of two months ago , give [him]400-hurree babu shelter against [evil spirits of the wood]7786-evil spirits of the wood . [He]400-hurree babu dreams of [Bengali Gods]7787-bengali gods , University text - books of education , and the Royal Society , [London]204-london , [England]114-england . Next dawn the bobbing blue - and - white umbrella goes forward . On [the edge of [the Doon]251-the doon]7788-the edge of the doon , Mussoorie well behind [them]7785-kindly villagers and [the Plains]175-the plains spread out in golden dust before , rests a worn litter in which - all [the Hills]10-the hills know it - lies [a sick lama who seeks [a River]33-the river for [his]7789-a sick lama who seeks a river for his healing healing]7789-a sick lama who seeks a river for his healing . [Villages]7790-villages have almost come to blows over the honour of bearing it , for not only has [the lama]868-the lama given [them]7790-villages blessings , but [[his]868-the lama disciple]949-his disciple good money - full one - third [Sahibs]670-the sahibs '[400-hurree babu] prices . Twelve miles a day has [the dooli]7205-the dooli travelled , as the greasy , rubbed pole - ends show , and by roads that [few Sahibs]4265-few sahibs use . Over [the Nilang Pass]322-the nilang pass in storm when the driven snow - dust filled every fold of [the impassive lama]4266-the impassive lama 's drapery ; between the black horns of [Raieng]323-raieng where [they]4267-they heard the whistle of [the wild goats through the clouds]4268-the wild goats through the clouds ; pitching and strained on the shale below ; hard - held between shoulder and clenched jaw when [they]4267-they rounded the hideous curves of [the Cut Road under Bhagirati]4269-the cut road under bhagirati ; swinging and creaking to the steady jog - trot of the descent into [the Valley of the Waters]324-the valley of the waters ; pressed along the steamy levels of [that locked valley]4270-that locked valley ; up , up and out again , to meet the roaring gusts off [Kedarnath]288-kedarnath ; set down of mid - days in [the dun gloom of kindly oak- forests]4271-the dun gloom of kindly oak- forests ; passed from [village]4009-village to [village]4009-village in dawn - chill , when even [devotees]4274-devotees may be forgiven for swearing at [impatient holy men]4275-impatient holy men ; or by torchlight , when the least fearful think of ghosts - [the dooli]7205-the dooli has reached [her]7205-the dooli last stage . [The little hill - folk]4277-the little hill - folk sweat in the modified heat of [the lower Siwaliks]4278-the lower siwaliks , and gather round [the priests]6870-the priests for [their]6870-the priests blessing and [their]6870-the priests wage . ' [Ye]4281-the bearer have acquired merit , '[868-the lama] says [the lama]868-the lama . ' Merit greater than [your]4281-the bearer knowing . And [ye]4281-the bearer will return to [the Hills]10-the hills , '[868-the lama] [he]868-the lama sighs . ' Surely . [The high Hills]7356-the high hills as soon as may be . '[868-the lama] [The bearer]4281-the bearer rubs [his]4281-the bearer shoulder , drinks water , spits it out again , and readjusts [his]4281-the bearer grass sandal . [Kim]344-kim - [his]344-kim face is drawn and tired - pays very small silver from [his]344-kim belt , heaves out the food - bag , crams an oilskin packet - they are holy writings - into [his]344-kim bosom , and helps [the lama]868-the lama to [his]868-the lama feet . The peace has come again into [the old man]861-the old man 's eyes , and [he]861-the old man does not look for [the hills]833-the hills to fall down and crush [him]861-the old man as [he]861-the old man did that terrible night when [they]833-the hills were delayed by [the flooded river]4285-the flooded river . [The men]5050-the men pick up the dooli and swing out of sight between the scrub clumps . [The lama]868-the lama raises a hand toward [the rampart of [the Himalayas]269-the himalayas]4288-the rampart of the himalayas . ' Not with [you]861-the old man , O blessed among [all hills]7794-all hills , fell the Arrow of [[Our]7795-our Lord]4544-our lord ! And never shall [I]868-the lama breathe [your]861-the old man airs again ! '[868-the lama] ' But [thou]7797-thou art ten times [the stronger man in this good air]7798-the stronger man in this good air , '[344-kim] says [Kim]344-kim , for to [his]344-kim wearied soul appeal [the well - cropped , kindly Plains]4289-the well - cropped , kindly plains . ' Here , or hereabouts , fell the Arrow , yes . [We]7795-our will go very softly , perhaps , a koss a day , for the Search is sure . But the bag weighs heavy . '[344-kim] ' Ay , [our]7795-our Search is sure . [I]868-the lama have come out of great temptation . '[868-the lama] It was never more than a couple of miles a day now , and [Kim]344-kim 's shoulders bore all the weight of it - the burden of [an old man]831-an old man , the burden of the heavy food - bag with the locked books , the load of the writings on [his]831-an old man heart , and the details of the daily routine . [He]344-kim begged in the dawn , set blankets for [the lama]868-the lama 's meditation , held the weary head on [his]344-kim lap through the noonday heats , fanning away the flies till [his]344-kim wrists ached , begged again in the evenings , and rubbed [the lama]868-the lama 's feet , who rewarded [him]344-kim with promise of Freedom - today , tomorrow , or , at furthest , the next day . ' Never was such a chela . [I]868-the lama doubt at times whether [Ananda]363-ananda more faithfully nursed [[Our]7795-our Lord]4544-our lord . And [thou]7800-thou art [a Sahib]5596-a sahib ? When [I]868-the lama was [a man]750-a man - a long time ago - [I]868-the lama forgot that . Now [I]868-the lama look upon [thee]7800-thou often , and every time [I]868-the lama remember that [thou]7800-thou art [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . It is strange . '[868-the lama] ' [Thou]7800-thou hast said there is neither black nor white . Why plague [me]868-the lama with this talk , [Holy One]385-holy one ? Let [me]868-the lama rub the other foot . It vexes [me]868-the lama . [I]868-the lama am not [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . [I]868-the lama am [thy]7800-thou chela , and [my]868-the lama head is heavy on [my]868-the lama shoulders . '[868-the lama] ' Patience a little ! [We]4293-we reach Freedom together . Then [thou]7800-thou and [I]868-the lama , upon [the far bank of [the River]33-the river]7805-the far bank of the river , will look back upon [our]4293-we lives as in [the Hills]10-the hills [we]4293-we saw [our]4293-we days '[868-the lama] marches laid out behind [us]4293-we . Perhaps [I]0-i was once [a Sahib]5596-a sahib . ' " Was never a Sahib like [thee]868-the lama , [I]868-the lama swear it . '[868-the lama] ' [I]868-the lama am certain [the Keeper of the Images]4642-the keeper of the images in [the Wonder House]721-the wonder house was in past life [a very wise Abbot]7808-a very wise abbot . But even [his]7808-a very wise abbot spectacles do not make [my]868-the lama eyes see . There fall shadows when [I]868-the lama would look steadily . No matter - [we]4293-we know the tricks of the poor stupid carcass - shadow changing to another shadow . [I]868-the lama am bound by the illusion of Time and Space . How far came [we]4293-we today in the flesh ? '[868-the lama] ' Perhaps half a koss . '[868-the lama] Three quarters of a mile , and it was a weary march . ' Half a koss . Ha ! [I]0-i went ten thousand thousand in the spirit . How , [we]4293-we are all lapped and swathed and swaddled in these senseless things . '[0-i] [He]0-i looked at [his]0-i thin blue - veined hand that found the beads so heavy . ' [Chela]439-chela , hast [thou]7809-thou never a wish to leave [me]0-i ? '[0-i] [Kim]344-kim thought of the oilskin packet and the books in the food - bag . If [someone duly authorized]4295-someone duly authorized would only take delivery of them the Great Game might play itself for aught [he]344-kim then cared . [He]344-kim was tired and hot in [his]344-kim head , and a cough that came from the stomach worried [him]344-kim . ' No . '[344-kim] [he]344-kim said almost sternly . ' [I]344-kim am not a dog or a snake to bite when [I]344-kim have learned to love . '[344-kim] ' [Thou]7809-thou art too tender towards [me]344-kim . '[344-kim] ' Not that either . [I]344-kim have moved in one matter without consulting [thee]7809-thou . [I]344-kim have sent a message to [the Kulu woman]2181-the kulu woman by [that woman who gave [us]7812-we the goat 's milk this morn]7811-that woman who gave us the goat 's milk this morn , saying that [thou]7809-thou wast a little feeble and wouldst need a litter . [I]344-kim beat [myself]344-kim in [my]344-kim mind that [I]344-kim did not do it when [we]7812-we entered [the Doon]251-the doon . [We]7812-we stay in [this place]2919-this place till the litter returns . '[344-kim] ' [I]344-kim am content . [She]2181-the kulu woman is [a woman with a heart of gold]1301-a woman with a heart of gold , as [thou]7809-thou sayest , but [a talker - something of a talker]7815-a talker - something of a talker . '[344-kim] ' [She]2181-the kulu woman will not weary [thee]7809-thou . [I]344-kim have looked to that also . [Holy One]385-holy one , [my]344-kim heart is very heavy for [my]344-kim many carelessnesses towards [thee]2181-the kulu woman . '[344-kim] An hysterical catch rose in [his]4296-his throat . ' [I]344-kim have walked [thee]2181-the kulu woman too far : [I]344-kim have not picked good food always for [thee]2181-the kulu woman ; [I]344-kim have not considered the heat ; [I]344-kim have talked to [people]4650-people on [the road]4566-the road and left [thee]2181-the kulu woman alone ... [I]344-kim have - [I]344-kim have ... [Hai mai]444-hai ! But [I]344-kim love [thee]2181-the kulu woman ... and it is all too late ... [I]344-kim was [a child]4501-a child ... Oh , why was [I]344-kim not [a man]750-a man ? ... '[344-kim] Overborne by strain , fatigue , and the weight beyond [his]4296-his years , [Kim]344-kim broke down and sobbed at [the lama]868-the lama 's feet . ' What a to - do is here ! '[861-the old man] said [the old man]861-the old man gently . ' [Thou]7820-thou hast never stepped a hair 's breadth from the Way of Obedience . Neglect [me]861-the old man ? [Child]835-child , [I]861-the old man have lived on [thy]2181-the kulu woman strength as an old tree lives on the lime of a new wall . Day by day , since [Shamlegh]297-shamlegh down , [I]861-the old man have stolen strength from [thee]2181-the kulu woman . Therefore , not through any sin of thine , art [thou]2181-the kulu woman weakened . It is [the Body]7822-the body - [the silly , stupid Body]7823-the silly , stupid body - that speaks now . Not the assured Soul . Be comforted ! Know at least the devils that [thou]2181-the kulu woman fightest . [They]7824-they are earth - born - [children of illusion]7825-children of illusion . [We]7826-we will go to [the woman from [Kulu]19-kulu]6884-the woman from kulu . [She]6884-the woman from kulu shall acquire merit in housing [us]7826-we , and specially in tending [me]861-the old man . [Thou]2181-the kulu woman shalt run free till strength returns . [I]861-the old man had forgotten [the stupid Body]702-the stupid body . If there be any blame , [I]861-the old man bear it . But [we]7826-we are too close to [the Gates of [Deliverance]325-deliverance]7828-the gates of deliverance to weigh blame . [I]861-the old man could praise [thee]6884-the woman from kulu , but what need ? In a little - in a very little - [we]7826-we shall sit beyond all needs . '[861-the old man] And so [he]4299-he petted and comforted [Kim]344-kim with wise saws and grave texts on that little - understood beast , [our]4300-our Body , who , being but a delusion , insists on posing as [the Soul , to the darkening of the Way , and the immense multiplication of unnecessary devils]4301-the soul , to the darkening of the way , and the immense multiplication of unnecessary devils . ' Hai ! hai ! Let [us]7826-we talk of [the woman from [Kulu]19-kulu]6884-the woman from kulu . Think [you]6884-the woman from kulu [she]6884-the woman from kulu will ask another charm for [[her]6884-the woman from kulu grandsons]7830-her grandsons ? When [I]4302-i was [a young man]3859-a young man , a very long time ago , [I]4302-i was plagued with these vapours - and some others - and [I]4302-i went to [an Abbot]7832-an abbot - [a very holy man]4878-a very holy man and [a seeker after truth]7834-a seeker after truth , though then [I]4302-i knew it not . Sit up and listen , child of [my]4302-i soul ! [My]4302-i tale was told . Said [he]7832-an abbot to [me]4302-i , " [Chela]439-chela , know this . There are many lies in [the world]759-the world , and [not a few liars]7836-not a few liars , but there are [no liars]7837-no liars like [our]7838-our bodies , except it be the sensations of [our]7838-our bodies . " Considering this [I]4302-i was comforted , and of [his]7832-an abbot great favour [he]7832-an abbot suffered [me]4302-i to drink tea In [his]7832-an abbot presence . Suffer [me]4302-i now to drink tea , for [I]4302-i am thirsty . '[4302-i] With a laugh across [his]4302-i tears , [Kim]344-kim kissed [the lama]868-the lama 's feet , and set about the tea - making . ' [Thou]7839-thou leanest on [me]344-kim in the body , [Holy One]385-holy one , but [I]344-kim lean on [thee]868-the lama for some other things . Dost know it ? '[344-kim] ' [I]868-the lama have guessed maybe , '[868-the lama] and [the lama]868-the lama 's eyes twinkled . ' [We]4308-we must change that . '[868-the lama] So , when with scufflings and scrapings and a hot air of importance , paddled up nothing less than [[the Sahiba]7180-the sahiba 's pet palanquin]4306-the sahiba 's pet palanquin sent twenty miles , with [that same grizzled old Oorya servant]4307-that same grizzled old oorya servant in charge , and when [they]4308-we reached the disorderly order of [the long white rambling house behind [Saharunpore]100-saharunpore]4309-the long white rambling house behind saharunpore , [the lama]868-the lama took [his]868-the lama own measures . Said [the Sahiba]7180-the sahiba cheerily from an upper window , after compliments : ' What is the good of [an old woman]5332-an old woman 's advice to [an old man]831-an old man ? [I]7180-the sahiba told [thee]868-the lama - [I]7180-the sahiba told [thee]868-the lama , [Holy One]385-holy one , to keep an eye upon [the chela]3570-the chela . How didst [thou]868-the lama do it ? Never answer [me]7180-the sahiba ! [I]7180-the sahiba know . [He]831-an old man has been running among [the women]781-the women . Look at [his]831-an old man eyes - hollow and sunk - and the Betraying Line from the nose down ! [He]831-an old man has been sifted out ! Fie ! Fie ! And [a priest]820-a priest , too ! '[7180-the sahiba] [Kim]344-kim looked up , over - weary to smile , shaking [his]344-kim head in denial . ' Do not jest , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' That time is done . [We]7845-we are here upon great matters . A sickness of soul took [me]868-the lama in [the Hills]10-the hills , and [him]831-an old man a sickness of the body . Since then [I]868-the lama have lived upon [his]831-an old man strength - eating [him]831-an old man . '[868-the lama] ' [Children]848-children together - young and old , '[4313-i] [she]4313-i sniffed , but forbore to make any new jokes . ' May this present hospitality restore [ye]848-children ! Hold awhile and [I]4313-i will come to gossip of [the high good Hills]7847-the high good hills . '[4313-i] At evening time - [[her]4313-i son - in - law]4314-her son - in - law was returned , so [she]4313-i did not need to go on inspection round [the farm]4315-the farm - [she]4313-i won to the meat of the matter , explained low - voicedly by [the lama]868-the lama . [The two old heads]4317-the two old heads nodded wisely together . [Kim]344-kim had reeled to [a room with a cot in [it]4318-a room with a cot in it]4318-a room with a cot in it , and was dozing soddenly . [The lama]868-the lama had forbidden [him]344-kim to set blankets or get food . ' [I]4313-i know - [I]4313-i know . Who but [I]4313-i ? '[4313-i] [she]4313-i cackled . ' [We]7848-we who go down to the burning - ghats clutch at the hands of those coming up from [the River of Life]326-the river of life with full water - jars - yes , brimming water - jars . [I]4313-i did [the boy]986-the boy wrong . [He]986-the boy lent [thee]7850-thee [his]986-the boy strength ? It is true that [the old]7851-the old eat [the young]3692-the young daily . Stands now [we]7848-we must restore [him]986-the boy . '[4313-i] ' [Thou]7853-thou hast many times acquired merit - '[868-the lama] ' [My]868-the lama merit . What is it ? Old bag of bones making curries for [men who do not ask " Who cooked this ? " Now if it were stored up for [[my]868-the lama grandson]7855-my grandson]7854-men who do not ask " who cooked this ? " now if it were stored up for my grandson - '[868-the lama] ' [He]986-the boy that had the belly - pain ? '[4313-i] ' To think [the Holy One]385-holy one remembers that ! [I]868-the lama must tell [[his]986-the boy mother]727-his mother . It is most singular honour ! " [He]986-the boy that had the belly - pain " - straightway [the Holy One]4553-the holy one remembered . [She]727-his mother will be proud . '[868-the lama] ' [[My]868-the lama chela]4863-my chela is to [me]868-the lama as is [a son to the unenlightened]7859-a son to the unenlightened . '[868-the lama] ' Say [grandson]7860-grandson , rather . [Mothers]7109-mothers have not the wisdom of [our]7862-our years . If [a child]4501-a child cries [they]7109-mothers say the heavens are falling . Now [a grandmother]7106-a grandmother is far enough separated from the pain of bearing and the pleasure of giving the breast to consider whether a cry is wickedness pure or the wind . And since [thou]7865-thou speakest once again of wind , when last [the Holy One]4553-the holy one was [here]4484-here , maybe [I]4313-i offended in pressing for charms . '[4313-i] ' [Sister]680-sister , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama , using that form of address [a Buddhist monk]4321-a buddhist monk may sometimes employ towards [a nun]1239-a nun , ' if charms comfort [thee]680-sister - '[868-the lama] ' They are better than [ten thousand doctors]7868-ten thousand doctors . '[4313-i] ' [I]4313-i say , if [they]7109-mothers comfort [thee]680-sister , [I]4313-i who was [Abbot of Such - zen]3932-abbot of such - zen , will make as many as [thou]7865-thou mayest desire . [I]4313-i have never seen [thy]7865-thou face - '[4313-i] ' That even [the monkeys who steal [our]7871-our loquats]7870-the monkeys who steal our loquats count for again . Hee ! hee ! '[868-the lama] ' But as [he]7872-he who sleeps [there]4784-there said , '[868-the lama] - [he]868-the lama nodded at the shut door of [the guest - chamber across the forecourt]4323-the guest - chamber across the forecourt - ' [thou]7865-thou hast a heart of gold ... And [he]7872-he is in the spirit [[my]868-the lama very " grandson]7874-my very " grandson " to [me]868-the lama '[868-the lama] ' Good ! [I]868-the lama am [the Holy One]4553-the holy one 's cow . '[868-the lama] This was pure [Hinduism]703-hinduism , but [the lama]868-the lama never heeded . ' [I]868-the lama am old . [I]868-the lama have borne [sons]5366-sons in the body . Oh , once [I]868-the lama could please [men]752-men ! Now [I]868-the lama can cure [them]752-men . '[868-the lama] [He]868-the lama heard [her]868-the lama armlets tinkle as though [she]868-the lama bared arms for action . ' [I]868-the lama will take over [the boy]986-the boy and dose [him]986-the boy , and stuff [him]986-the boy , and make [him]986-the boy all whole . Hai ! hai ! [We]7879-we [old people]7880-old people know something yet . '[868-the lama] Wherefore when [Kim]344-kim , aching in every bone , opened [his]344-kim eyes , and would go to [the cook - house]4325-the cook - house to get [[his]344-kim master]6109-his master 's food , [he]344-kim found strong coercion about [him]344-kim , and [a veiled old figure at the door]4327-a veiled old figure at the door , flanked by [the grizzled manservant , who told [him]344-kim very precisely the things that [he]344-kim was on no account to do]4328-the grizzled manservant , who told him very precisely the things that he was on no account to do . ' [Thou]7881-thou must have ? [Thou]7881-thou shalt have nothing . What ? A locked box in which to keep holy books ? Oh , that is another matter . Heavens forbid [I]4329-they should come between [a priest]820-a priest and [his]820-a priest prayers ! It shall be brought , and [thou]7881-thou shalt keep the key . '[4329-they] [They]4329-they pushed the coffer under [his]344-kim cot , and [Kim]344-kim shut away [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's pistol , the oilskin packet of letters , and the locked books and diaries , with a groan of relief . For some absurd reason [their]4329-they weight on [his]344-kim shoulders was nothing to [their]4329-they weight on [his]344-kim poor mind . [His]344-kim neck ached under it of nights . ' Thine is a sickness uncommon in youth these days : since [young folk]7883-young folk have given up tending [their]7883-young folk betters . The remedy is sleep , and certain drugs , '[7180-the sahiba] said [the Sahiba]7180-the sahiba ; and [he]344-kim was glad to give [himself]344-kim up to the blankness that half menaced and half soothed [him]344-kim . [She]7180-the sahiba brewed drinks , in some mysterious Asiatic equivalent to the still - room - drenches that smelt pestilently and tasted worse . [She]7180-the sahiba stood over [Kim]344-kim till [they]4329-they went down , and inquired exhaustively after [they]4329-they had come up . [She]7180-the sahiba laid a taboo upon [the forecourt]4331-the forecourt , and enforced it by means of [an armed man]4332-an armed man . It is true [he]4332-an armed man was seventy odd , that [his]4332-an armed man scabbarded sword ceased at the hilt ; but [he]4332-an armed man represented the authority of [the Sahiba]7180-the sahiba , and [loaded wains]4334-loaded wains , [chattering servants]4335-chattering servants , [calves]4336-calves , dogs , hens , and [the like]4337-the like , fetched a wide compass by those parts . Best of all , when the body was cleared , [she]7180-the sahiba cut out from the mass of poor relations that crowded the back of [the buildings]4338-the buildings - [house]4339-house - hold dogs , [we]4340-we name [them]4341-them - [[a cousin]4342-a cousin 's widow]4343-a cousin 's widow , skilled in what [Europeans]540-europeans , who know nothing about it , call massage . And the two of [them]4329-they , laying [him]4332-an armed man east and west , that the mysterious earth - currents which thrill the clay of [our]4340-we bodies might help and not hinder , took [him]4332-an armed man to pieces all one long afternoon - bone by bone , muscle by muscle , ligament by ligament , and lastly , nerve by nerve . Kneaded to irresponsible pulp , half hypnotized by the perpetual flick and readjustment of the uneasy chudders that veiled [their]4329-they eyes , [Kim]344-kim slid ten thousand miles into slumber - thirty - six hours of it - sleep that soaked like rain after drought . Then [she]7180-the sahiba fed [him]4332-an armed man , and [the house]797-the house spun to [her]7180-the sahiba clamour . [She]7180-the sahiba caused fowls to be slain ; [she]7180-the sahiba sent for vegetables , and [the sober , slow- thinking gardener]4345-the sober , slow- thinking gardener , nigh as old as [she]7180-the sahiba , sweated for it ; [she]7180-the sahiba took spices , and milk , and onion , with little fish from the brooks - anon limes for sherbets , fat quails from the pits , then chicken - livers upon a skewer , with sliced ginger between . ' [I]7180-the sahiba have seen something of [this world]1066-this world , '[7180-the sahiba] [she]7180-the sahiba said over the crowded trays , ' and there are but [two sorts of women in it]7885-two sorts of women in it -those who take the strength out of [a man]750-a man and [those who put it back]7887-those who put it back . Once [I]7180-the sahiba was [that one]5323-that one , and now [I]7180-the sahiba am this . Nay - do not play [the priestling]7889-the priestling with [me]7180-the sahiba . [Mine]7180-the sahiba was but a jest . If it does not hold good now , it will when [thou]7890-thou takest [the road]4566-the road again . [Cousin]704-cousin , '[7180-the sahiba] - this to [the poor relation]4346-the poor relation , never wearied of extolling [[her]7180-the sahiba patroness]4347-her patroness 's charity - ' [he]344-kim is getting a bloom on the skin of a new - curried horse . [Our]7892-our work is like polishing jewels to be thrown to [a dance - girl]7893-a dance - girl - eh ? '[7180-the sahiba] [Kim]344-kim sat up and smiled . The terrible weakness had dropped from [him]344-kim like an old shoe . [His]344-kim tongue itched for free speech again , and but a week back the lightest word clogged it like ashes . The pain in [his]344-kim neck [he]344-kim must have caught it from the lama had gone with the heavy dengue - aches and the evil taste in the mouth . [The two old women]4348-the two old women , a little , but not much , more careful about [their]4348-the two old women veils now , clucked as merrily as the hens that had entered pecking through the open door . ' Where is [my]344-kim Holy One ? '[344-kim] [he]344-kim demanded . ' Hear [him]344-kim ! [Thy]7894-thy Holy One is well , '[7180-the sahiba] [she]7180-the sahiba snapped viciously . ' Though that is none of [his]344-kim merit . , Knew [I]7180-the sahiba a charm to make [him]344-kim wise , [I]7180-the sahiba 'd sell [my]7180-the sahiba jewels and buy it . To refuse good food that [I]7180-the sahiba cooked [myself]7180-the sahiba - and go roving into [the fields]4992-the fields for two nights on an empty belly - and to tumble into [a brook]7896-a brook at the end of it - call [you]344-kim that holiness ? Then , when [he]344-kim has nearly broken what [thou]7897-thou hast left of [my]7180-the sahiba heart with anxiety , [he]344-kim tells [me]7180-the sahiba that [he]344-kim has acquired merit . Oh , how like are [all men]4849-all men ! No , that was not it - [he]344-kim tells [me]7180-the sahiba that [he]344-kim is freed from all sin . [I]7180-the sahiba could have told [him]344-kim that before [he]344-kim wetted [himself]344-kim all over . [He]344-kim is well now - this happened a week ago - but burn [me]7180-the sahiba such holiness ! [A babe of three]7899-a babe of three would do better . Do not fret [thyself]7900-thyself for the Holy One . [He]344-kim keeps both eyes on [thee]7900-thyself when [he]344-kim is not wading [our]7901-our brooks . '[7180-the sahiba] ' [I]629-maharanee do not remember to have seen [him]344-kim . [I]629-maharanee remember that the days and nights passed like bars of white and black , opening and shutting . [I]629-maharanee was not sick : [I]629-maharanee was but tired . " '[629-maharanee] A lethargy that comes by right some few score years later . But it is done now . ' '[629-maharanee] [Maharanee]629-maharanee , ' [Kim]344-kim began , but led by the look in [her]629-maharanee eye , changed it to the title of plain love - '[4505-mother] [Mother]4505-mother , [I]0-i owe [my]0-i life to [thee]4505-mother . How shall [I]0-i make thanks ? Ten thousand blessings upon [[thy]4505-mother house]1713-thy house and - ' '[4505-mother] [The house]797-the house be unblessed ! ' It is impossible to give exactly [the old lady]1825-the old lady 's word . Have [I]0-i shifted [thee]4505-mother and lifted [thee]4505-mother and slapped and twisted [thy]4505-mother ten toes to find texts flung at [my]0-i head ? ' '[4505-mother] [I]0-i had [no mother]4357-no mother , [[my]0-i mother]4610-my mother , ' said [Kim]344-kim . '[0-i] [She]4355-a mother died , [they]4359-they tell [me]0-i , when [I]0-i was young . ' '[4359-they] [Hai mai]444-hai ! Then none can say [I]0-i have robbed [her]4355-a mother of any right if - when [thou]4505-mother takest [the road]4566-the road again and [this house]4618-this house is but one of a thousand used for shelter and forgotten , after an easy - flung blessing . '[0-i] Take up the trays to [the house]797-the house . What is the good of stale food in [the room]2908-the room , [O woman of ill - omen]4364-o woman of ill - omen ? ' '[0-i] It is [I]0-i that am [the woman of ill - omen]4366-the woman of ill - omen , ' cried [the old lady]1825-the old lady penitently . '[4367-we] [We]4367-we that go down to [the chattris]4368-the chattris the big umbrellas above the burning - ghats where [the priests]6870-the priests take [their]6870-the priests last dues clutch hard at [the bearers of the chattis water - jars]4370-the bearers of the chattis water - jars - [young folk full of the pride of life]4371-young folk full of the pride of life , [she]4366-the woman of ill - omen meant ; but the pun is clumsy . When one can not dance in the festival one must e'en look out of the window , and [grandmothering]4372-grandmothering takes [all a woman]4373-all a woman 's time . [[Thy]4374-thy master]2991-thy master gives [me]0-i all the charms [I]0-i now desire for [[[my]0-i daughter]4623-my daughter 's eldest]7086-my daughter 's eldest , by reason - is it ? - that [he]7086-my daughter 's eldest is wholly free from sin . [The hakim]7103-the hakim is brought very low these days . [He]7103-the hakim goes about poisoning [[my]0-i servants]5871-my servants for lack of [their]5871-my servants betters . ' '[7103-the hakim] What hakim , [mother]4505-mother ? ' '[4505-mother] [That very Dacca man who gave [me]0-i the pill which rent [me]0-i in three pieces]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces . [He]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces cast up like a strayed camel a week ago , vowing that [he]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces and [thou]4382-thy had been blood - brothers together up [Kulu]19-kulu - way , and feigning great anxiety for [thy]4382-thy health . [He]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces was very thin and hungry , so [I]0-i gave orders to have [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces stuffed too - [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces and [his]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces anxiety ! ' '[0-i] [I]0-i would see [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces if [he]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces is here . ' '[4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces] [He]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces eats five times a day , and lances boils for [my]0-i hinds to save [himself]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces from an apoplexy . [He]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces is so full of anxiety for [thy]4382-thy health that [he]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces sticks to the cook - house door and stays [himself]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces with scraps . [He]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces will keep . [We]4383-we shall never get rid of [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces . ' '[4505-mother] Send [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces here , [mother]4505-mother ' - the twinkle returned to [Kim]344-kim 's eye for a flash - '[4505-mother] and [I]0-i will try . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i 'll send [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces , but to chase [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces off is an ill turn . At least [he]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces had the sense to fish the Holy One out of [the brook]4385-the brook ; thus , as [the Holy One]4553-the holy one did not say , acquiring merit . ' '[4553-the holy one] [He]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces is [a very wise hakim]4387-a very wise hakim . Send [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces , [mother]4505-mother . ' '[4505-mother] Priest praising [priest]4580-priest ? A miracle ! If [he]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces is [any friend of [thine]4391-thine [ye]4391-thine squabbled at [your]4391-thine last meeting]4390-any friend of thine ye squabbled at your last meeting [I]0-i 'll hale [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces here with horse - ropes and - and give [him]4381-that very dacca man who gave me the pill which rent me in three pieces a caste - dinner afterwards , [[my]0-i son]4602-my son ... Get up and see [the world]759-the world ! [This lying abed]4394-this lying abed is [the mother of seventy devils]4395-the mother of seventy devils ... [[my]0-i son]4602-my son ! [[my]0-i son]4602-my son ! ' [She]4394-this lying abed trotted forth to raise a typhoon off [the cook - house]4325-the cook - house , and almost on [her]4394-this lying abed shadow rolled in [the Babu]6478-the babu , robed as to the shoulders like [a Roman emperor]7908-a roman emperor , jowled like [Titus]705-titus , bare - headed , with new patent- leather shoes , in highest condition of fat , exuding joy and salutations . '[4395-the mother of seventy devils] By [Jove]638-jove , [Mister O'Hara]636-mister o'hara , but [I]0-i are jolly - glad to see [you]636-mister o'hara . [I]0-i will kindly shut the door . It is a pity [you]636-mister o'hara are sick . Are [you]636-mister o'hara very sick ? ' '[636-mister o'hara] The papers - the papers from [the kilta]7536-the kilta . The maps and the murasla ! ' [He]636-mister o'hara held out the key impatiently ; for the present need on [his]636-mister o'hara soul was to get rid of the loot . '[636-mister o'hara] [You]636-mister o'hara are quite right . That is correct [Departmental]706-departmental view to take . [You]636-mister o'hara have got everything ? ' '[636-mister o'hara] All that was handwritten in [the kilta]7536-the kilta [I]0-i took . The rest [I]0-i threw down [the hill]2897-the hill . ' [He]636-mister o'hara could hear the key 's grate in the lock , the sticky pull of the slow - rending oilskin , and a quick shuffling of papers . [He]636-mister o'hara had been annoyed out of all reason by the knowledge that they lay below [him]636-mister o'hara through the sick idle days - a burden incommunicable . For that reason the blood tingled through [his]636-mister o'hara body , when [Hurree]400-hurree babu , skipping elephantinely , shook hands again . '[0-i] This is fine ! This is finest ! [Mister O'Hara]636-mister o'hara ! [you]636-mister o'hara have - ha ! ha ! swiped the whole bag of tricks - locks , stocks , and barrels . [They]4401-they told [me]0-i it was eight months ' work gone up the spouts ! By [Jove]638-jove , how [they]4401-they beat [me]0-i ! ... Look , here is the letter from [Hilas]639-hilas ! '[0-i] [He]0-i intoned a line or two of Court Persian , which is the language of authorized and unauthorized diplomacy . ' [Mister Rajah Sahib]707-mister rajah sahib has just about put [his]707-mister rajah sahib foot in the holes . [He]707-mister rajah sahib will have to explain offeecially how [the deuce]2454-the deuce - an'-all [he]707-mister rajah sahib is writing love - letters to [the Czar]7910-the czar . And they are very clever maps ... and there is three or four Prime Ministers of these parts implicated by the correspondence . By [Gad]708-gad , [sar]7525-sar ! [The British Government]294-the british government will change the succession in [Hilas]639-hilas and [Bunar]261-bunar , and nominate [new heirs to the throne]7912-new heirs to the throne . " Trea - son most base " ... but [you]7525-sar do not understand ? Eh ? '[0-i] ' Are they in [thy]344-kim hands ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim . It was all [he]344-kim cared for . ' Just [you]7525-sar jolly - well bet [yourself]7525-sar [they]7913-they are . '[0-i] [He]0-i stowed the entire trove about [his]0-i body , as [only Orientals]4402-only orientals can . ' [They]7913-they are going up to [the office]881-the office , too . [The old lady]1825-the old lady thinks [I]0-i am permanent fixture [here]4484-here , but [I]0-i shall go away with these straight off - immediately . [Mr Lurgan]544-mr lurgan will be [proud man]7917-proud man . [You]7525-sar are offeecially subordinate to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i shall embody [your]7525-sar name in [my]0-i verbal report . It is a pity [we]7918-we are not allowed written reports . [[We]7918-we Bengalis]7919-we bengalis excel in [thee]7525-sar exact science . '[0-i] [He]0-i tossed back the key and showed the box empty . ' Good . That is good . [I]0-i was very tired . [[My]0-i Holy One]7920-my holy one was sick , too . And did [he]7920-my holy one fall into - '[0-i] ' Oah yess . [I]0-i am [[his]7920-my holy one good friend]7921-his good friend , [I]0-i tell [you]7525-sar . [He]7920-my holy one was behaving very strange when [I]0-i came down after [you]7525-sar , and [I]0-i thought perhaps [he]7920-my holy one might have the papers . [I]0-i followed [him]7920-my holy one on [his]7920-my holy one meditations , and to discuss ethnological points also . [You]7525-sar see , [I]0-i am [verree small person here nowadays , in comparison with all [his]7920-my holy one charms]7922-verree small person here nowadays , in comparison with all his charms . [By Jove]638-jove , [O'Hara]636-mister o'hara , do [you]7525-sar know , [he]7920-my holy one is afflicted with infirmity of fits . Yess , [I]0-i tell [you]7525-sar . Cataleptic , too , if not also epileptic . [I]0-i found [him]7920-my holy one in such a state under a tree in articulo mortem , and [he]7920-my holy one jumped up and walked into [a brook]7896-a brook and [he]7920-my holy one was nearly drowned but for [me]0-i . '[344-kim] ' Yes , [he]7920-my holy one might have died , but [he]7920-my holy one is dry now , and asserts [he]7920-my holy one has undergone transfiguration . '[400-hurree babu] [The Babu]400-hurree babu tapped [his]400-hurree babu forehead knowingly . ' [I]400-hurree babu took notes of [his]7920-my holy one statements for [Royal Society]327-royal society - in posse . [You]7925-you must make haste and be quite well and come back to [Simla]159-simla , and [I]400-hurree babu will tell [you]7925-you all [my]400-hurree babu tale at [Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib 's . It was splendid . The bottoms of [their]7926-their trousers were quite torn , and [old Nahan Rajah]709-old nahan rajah , [he]7920-my holy one thought [they]7926-their were [European soldiers]7927-european soldiers deserting . '[400-hurree babu] ' Oh , [the Russians]7928-the russians ? How long were [they]7928-the russians with [thee]7925-you ? '[0-i] ' [One]385-holy one was [a Frenchman]7297-a frenchman . Oh , days and days and days ! Now [all the hill- people]7930-all the hill- people believe [all Russians]7931-all russians are [all beggars]7932-all beggars . By [Jove]638-jove ! [they]7928-the russians had not one dam'-thing that [I]344-kim did not get [them]7928-the russians . And [I]344-kim told [the common people]7211-the common people - oah , such tales and anecdotes ! - [I]344-kim will tell [you]7211-the common people at [old Lurgan]539-lurgan sahib 's when [you]7211-the common people come up . [We]7934-we will have - ah - a night out ! It is feather in both [our]7934-we caps ! Yess , and [they]7928-the russians gave [me]344-kim a certificate . That is creaming joke . When do [you]7211-the common people come along ? [We]7934-we are very proud of [you]7211-the common people though [you]7211-the common people gave [us]7934-we great frights . And especially [Mahbub]383-mahbub . '[344-kim] ' Ay , [Mahbub]383-mahbub . And where is [he]383-mahbub ? '[400-hurree babu] ' Selling horses in this vi - cinity , of course . '[0-i] ' Here ! Why ?
