' Well , [you]7211-the common people see , [I]400-hurree babu am [fearful man]7937-fearful man , and [I]400-hurree babu do not like responsibility . [You]7211-the common people were sick , [you]7211-the common people see , and [I]400-hurree babu did not know where [deuce - an'-all]710-deuce - an'-all the papers were , and if so , how many . So when [I]400-hurree babu had come down here [I]400-hurree babu slipped in private wire to [Mahbub]383-mahbub - [he]383-mahbub was at [Meerut]329-meerut for races - and [I]400-hurree babu tell [him]383-mahbub how case stands . [He]383-mahbub comes up with [[his]383-mahbub men]1138-his men and [he]383-mahbub consorts with [the lama]868-the lama , and then [he]383-mahbub calls [me]400-hurree babu [a fool]5333-a fool , and is very rude - '[400-hurree babu] ' But wherefore - wherefore ? '[0-i] ' That is what [I]0-i ask . [I]0-i only suggest that if [anyone]1036-anyone steals the papers [I]0-i should like [some good strong , brave men]7942-some good strong , brave men to rob [them]7942-some good strong , brave men back again . [You]7943-you see , they are vitally important , and [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub [he]383-mahbub did not know where [you]0-i were . '[0-i] ' [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub to rob [[the Sahiba]633-the sahiba 's house]7944-the sahiba 's house ? [Thou]7945-thou art mad , [Babu]400-hurree babu , '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim with indignation . ' [I]344-kim wanted the papers . Suppose [she]7946-she had stole them ? It was only practical suggestion , [I]344-kim think . [You]0-i are not pleased , eh ? '[344-kim] A native proverb - unquotable - showed the blackness of [Kim]344-kim 's disapproval . ' Well , '[400-hurree babu] - [Hurree]400-hurree babu shrugged [his]400-hurree babu shoulders - ' there is no accounting for [thee]7943-you taste . [Mahbub]383-mahbub was angry too . [He]383-mahbub has sold horses all about here , and [he]383-mahbub says [old lady]7947-old lady is pukka [thorough old lady]7948-thorough old lady and would not condescend to such ungentlemanly things . [I]400-hurree babu do not care . [I]400-hurree babu have got the papers , and [I]400-hurree babu was very glad of moral support from [Mahbub]383-mahbub . [I]400-hurree babu tell [you]7943-you , [I]400-hurree babu am [fearful man]7937-fearful man , but , somehow or other , the more fearful [I]400-hurree babu am the more dam'-tight places [I]400-hurree babu get into . So [I]400-hurree babu was glad [you]7943-you came with [me]400-hurree babu to [Chini]267-chini , and [I]400-hurree babu am glad [Mahbub]383-mahbub was close by . [The old lady]1825-the old lady [she]1825-the old lady is sometimes very rude to [me]400-hurree babu and [my]400-hurree babu beautiful pills . '[400-hurree babu] ' [Allah]382-allah be merciful ! '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim on [his]344-kim elbow , rejoicing . ' What [a beast of wonder]7951-a beast of wonder is [a Babu]3813-a babu ! And [that man]4846-that man walked alone - if [he]4846-that man did walk - with robbed and [angry foreigners]7954-angry foreigners ! '[344-kim] ' Oah , thatt was nothing , after [they]7954-angry foreigners had done beating [me]4403-he ; but if [I]4403-he lost the papers it was pretty - jolly serious . [Mahbub]383-mahbub [he]4846-that man nearly beat [me]4403-he too , and [he]4846-that man went and consorted with [the lama]868-the lama no end . [I]4403-he shall stick to ethnological investigations henceforwards . Now good - bye , [Mister O'Hara]636-mister o'hara . [I]4403-he can catch 4.25 p.m. to [Umballa]52-umballa if [I]4403-he am quick . It will be good times when [we]7956-we all tell [thee]7957-thee tale up at [Mr Lurgan]544-mr lurgan 's . [I]4403-he shall report [you]7957-thee offeecially better . Good - bye , [[my]4403-he dear fallow]7958-my dear fallow , and when next [you]7957-thee are under [thee]7957-thee emotions please do not use the Mohammedan terms with the Tibetan dress . '[4403-he] [He]4403-he shook hands twice - a Babu to [his]4403-he boot - heels - and opened the door . With the fall of the sunlight upon [his]4403-he still triumphant face [he]4403-he returned to the humble Dacca quack . ' [He]4403-he robbed [them]7959-them , '[344-kim] thought [Kim]344-kim , forgetting [his]344-kim own share in the game . ' [He]4403-he tricked [them]7959-them . [He]4403-he lied to [them]7959-them like [a Bengali]3017-a bengali . [They]7959-them give [him]4403-he a chit a testimonial . [He]4403-he makes [them]7959-them a mock at the risk of [his]4403-he life - [I]344-kim never would have gone down to [them]7959-them after the pistol - shots - and then [he]4403-he says [he]4403-he is [a fearful man]3229-a fearful man ... And [he]4403-he is [a fearful man]3229-a fearful man . [I]344-kim must get into [the world]759-the world again . '[344-kim] At first [his]344-kim legs bent like bad pipe - stems , and the flood and rush of the sunlit air dazzled [him]344-kim . [He]344-kim squatted by the white wall , the mind rummaging among the incidents of the long dooli journey , [the lama]868-the lama 's weaknesses , and , now that the stimulus of talk was removed , [his]344-kim own self - pity , of which , like [the sick]5721-the sick , [he]344-kim had great store . The unnerved brain edged away from all the outside , as a raw horse , once rowelled , sidles from the spur . It was enough , amply enough , that the spoil of the kilta was away - off [his]344-kim hands - out of [his]344-kim possession . [He]344-kim tried to think of [the lama]868-the lama - to wonder why [he]344-kim had tumbled into [a brook]7896-a brook - but the bigness of [the world]759-the world , seen between the forecourt gates , swept linked thought aside . Then [he]344-kim looked upon the trees and [the broad fields]4409-the broad fields , with the thatched huts hidden among crops - looked with strange eyes unable to take up the size and proportion and use of things - stared for a still half - hour . All that while [he]344-kim felt , though [he]344-kim could not put it into words , that [his]344-kim soul was out of gear with its surroundings - a cog - wheel unconnected with any machinery , just like the idle cog - wheel of [a cheap Beheea sugar - crusher laid by]4410-a cheap beheea sugar - crusher laid by in a corner . The breezes fanned over [him]344-kim , the parrots shrieked at [him]344-kim , the noises of [the populated house]4411-the populated house behind - squabbles , orders , and reproofs - hit on dead ears . ' [I]344-kim am [Kim]344-kim . [I]344-kim am [Kim]344-kim . And what is [Kim]344-kim ? '[344-kim] [His]344-kim soul repeated it again and again . [He]344-kim did not want to cry - had never felt less like crying in [his]344-kim life - but of a sudden easy , stupid tears trickled down [his]344-kim nose , and with an almost audible click [he]344-kim felt the wheels of [his]344-kim being lock up anew on [the world]759-the world without . Things that rode meaningless on the eyeball an instant before slid into proper proportion . [Roads]2593-roads were meant to be walked upon , [houses]4414-houses to be lived in , cattle to be driven , [fields]4415-fields to be tilled , and [men]752-men and [women]4700-women to be talked to . [They]4418-they were all real and true - solidly planted upon the feet - perfectly comprehensible - clay of [his]344-kim clay , neither more nor less . [He]344-kim shook [himself]344-kim like a dog with a flea in [his]344-kim ear , and rambled out of the gate . Said [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba , to whom watchful eyes reported this move : ' Let [him]344-kim go . [I]633-the sahiba have done [my]633-the sahiba share . [Mother Earth]711-mother earth must do the rest . When [the Holy One]4553-the holy one comes back from meditation , tell [him]344-kim . '[633-the sahiba] There stood an empty bullock - cart on [a little knoll half a mile away]4419-a little knoll half a mile away , with a young banyan tree behind - a look - out , as [it]4420-it were , above some new - ploughed levels ; and [his]344-kim eyelids , bathed in soft air , grew heavy as [he]344-kim neared it . [The ground]1001-the ground was good clean dust - no new herbage that , living , is half - way to death already , but the hopeful dust that holds the seeds of all life . [He]344-kim felt it between [his]344-kim toes , patted it with [his]344-kim palms , and joint by joint , sighing luxuriously , laid [him]344-kim down full length along in the shadow of [the wooden - pinned cart]4422-the wooden - pinned cart . And [Mother Earth]711-mother earth was as faithful as [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba . [She]633-the sahiba breathed through [him]344-kim to restore the poise [he]344-kim had lost lying so long on a cot cut off from [her]633-the sahiba good currents . [His]344-kim head lay powerless upon [her]633-the sahiba breast , and [his]344-kim opened hands surrendered to [her]633-the sahiba strength . The many- rooted tree above [him]344-kim , and [even the dead manhandled wood beside]4423-even the dead manhandled wood beside , knew what [he]344-kim sought , as [he]344-kim [himself]344-kim did not know . Hour upon hour [he]344-kim lay deeper than sleep . Towards evening , when the dust of [returning kine]4424-returning kine made all the horizons smoke , came [the lama]868-the lama and [Mahbub Ali]383-mahbub , both afoot , walking cautiously , for [the house]797-the house had told [them]4427-them where [he]344-kim had gone . ' [Allah]382-allah ! What [a fool]5333-a fool 's trick to play in [open country]7966-open country ! '[2470-the horse - dealer] muttered [the horse - dealer]2470-the horse - dealer . ' [He]344-kim could be shot a hundred times - but this is not [the Border]59-the border . '[2470-the horse - dealer] ' And , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama , repeating a many - times - told tale , ' never was such a chela . [Temperate]712-temperate , kindly , wise , of ungrudging disposition , a merry heart upon [the road]4566-the road , never forgetting , learned , truthful , courteous . Great is [his]344-kim reward ! '[868-the lama] ' [I]2470-the horse - dealer know [the boy]986-the boy - as [I]2470-the horse - dealer have said . '[2470-the horse - dealer] ' And [he]986-the boy was all those things ? '[2470-the horse - dealer] ' Some of them - but [I]2470-the horse - dealer have not yet found a [Red Hat]580-red hat 's charm for making [him]986-the boy overly truthful . [He]986-the boy has certainly been well nursed . '[2470-the horse - dealer] ' [The Sahiba]633-the sahiba is a heart of gold , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama earnestly . ' [She]633-the sahiba looks upon [him]986-the boy as [[her]633-the sahiba son]3622-her son . '[868-the lama] ' Hmph ! [Half Hind]713-half hind seems that way disposed . [I]2470-the horse - dealer only wished to see that [the boy]986-the boy had come to no harm and was [a free agent]7971-a free agent . As [thou]7972-thou knowest , [he]986-the boy and [I]2470-the horse - dealer were [old friends]7973-old friends in the first days of [your]2470-the horse - dealer pilgrimage together . '[2470-the horse - dealer] ' That is a bond between [us]7974-we . '[868-the lama] [The lama]868-the lama sat down . ' [We]7974-we are at the end of the pilgrimage . '[868-the lama] ' No thanks to [thee]2470-the horse - dealer thine was not cut off for good and all a week back . [I]383-mahbub heard what [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba said to [thee]2470-the horse - dealer when [we]7974-we bore [thee]2470-the horse - dealer up on the cot . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub laughed , and tugged [his]383-mahbub newly dyed beard . ' [I]383-mahbub was meditating upon other matters that tide . It was [the hakim from [Dacca]254-dacca]7975-the hakim from dacca broke [my]383-mahbub meditations . '[383-mahbub] ' Otherwise '[868-the lama] - this was in [Pushtu]330-pushtu for decency 's sake - ' [thou]2470-the horse - dealer wouldst have ended [thy]2470-the horse - dealer meditations upon [the sultry side of [Hell]234-hell]7976-the sultry side of hell - being an unbeliever and an idolater for [all [thy]2470-the horse - dealer child]7977-all thy child 's simplicity . But now , [Red Hat]580-red hat , what is to be done ? '[868-the lama] ' This very night , '[868-the lama] - the words came slowly , vibrating with triumph - ' this very night [he]383-mahbub will be as free as [I]383-mahbub am from all taint of sin - assured as [I]383-mahbub am , when [he]383-mahbub quits this body , of Freedom from the Wheel of Things . [I]383-mahbub have a sign '[383-mahbub] - [he]383-mahbub laid [his]383-mahbub hand above the torn chart in [his]383-mahbub bosom - ' that [my]383-mahbub time is short ; but [I]383-mahbub shall have safeguarded [him]383-mahbub throughout the years . Remember , [I]383-mahbub have reached Knowledge , as [I]383-mahbub told [thee]2470-the horse - dealer only three nights back . '[383-mahbub] ' It must be true , as [the Tirah priest]7978-the tirah priest said when [I]383-mahbub stole [[[his]7978-the tirah priest cousin]7979-his cousin 's wife]7980-his cousin 's wife , that [I]383-mahbub am a Sufi [a free - thinker]7981-a free - thinker ; for here [I]383-mahbub sit , '[383-mahbub] said [Mahbub]383-mahbub to [himself]383-mahbub , ' drinking in blasphemy unthinkable ... [I]383-mahbub remember the tale . On that , then , [he]383-mahbub goes to [Fannatu]332-fannatu l'Adn [the Gardens of [Eden]334-eden]333-the gardens of eden . But how ? Wilt [thou]2470-the horse - dealer slay [him]383-mahbub or drown [him]383-mahbub in [that wonderful river from which [the Babu]6478-the babu dragged [thee]2470-the horse - dealer]7982-that wonderful river from which the babu dragged thee ? '[383-mahbub] ' [I]868-the lama was dragged from [no river]1450-no river , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama simply . ' [Thou]2470-the horse - dealer hast forgotten what befell . [I]868-the lama found it by Knowledge . '[868-the lama] ' Oh , ay . True , '[383-mahbub] stammered [Mahbub]383-mahbub , divided between high indignation and enormous mirth . ' [I]383-mahbub had forgotten the exact run of what happened . [Thou]2470-the horse - dealer didst find it knowingly . '[383-mahbub] ' And to say that [I]383-mahbub would take life is - not a sin , but a madness simple . [[My]383-mahbub chela]4863-my chela aided [me]383-mahbub to [the River]33-the river . It is [his]383-mahbub right to be cleansed from sin - with [me]383-mahbub . '[383-mahbub] ' Ay , [he]383-mahbub needs cleansing . But afterwards , [old man]1240-old man - afterwards ? '[383-mahbub] ' What matter under all the Heavens ? [He]383-mahbub is sure of [Nibban]714-nibban - enlightened - as [I]383-mahbub am . '[383-mahbub] ' Well said . [I]383-mahbub had a fear [he]383-mahbub might mount [Mohammed]715-mohammed 's Horse and fly away . '[383-mahbub] ' Nay - [he]383-mahbub must go forth as [a teacher]7326-a teacher . '[383-mahbub] ' Aha ! Now [I]383-mahbub see ! That is the right gait for [the colt]5882-the colt . Certainly [he]383-mahbub must go forth as [a teacher]7326-a teacher . [He]383-mahbub is somewhat urgently needed as [a scribe by the State]7990-a scribe by the state , for instance . '[383-mahbub] ' To that end [he]383-mahbub was prepared . [I]383-mahbub acquired merit in that [I]383-mahbub gave alms for [his]383-mahbub sake . A good deed does not die . [He]383-mahbub aided [me]383-mahbub in [my]383-mahbub Search . [I]383-mahbub aided [him]383-mahbub in [his]383-mahbub . Just is the Wheel , [O horse - seller from [the North]48-the north]7991-o horse - seller from the north . Let [him]383-mahbub be [a teacher]7326-a teacher ; let [him]383-mahbub be [a scribe]4577-a scribe - what matter ? [He]383-mahbub will have attained Freedom at the end . The rest is illusion . '[383-mahbub] ' What matter ? When [I]383-mahbub must have [him]383-mahbub with [me]383-mahbub beyond [Balkh]165-balkh in six months ! [I]383-mahbub come up with ten lame horses and [three strong - backed men]7994-three strong - backed men - thanks to [that chicken of [a Babu]3813-a babu]7995-that chicken of a babu - to break [a sick boy]7997-a sick boy by force out of [[an old trot]7998-an old trot 's house]7999-an old trot 's house . It seems that [I]383-mahbub stand by while [a young Sahib]8000-a young sahib is hoisted into [Allah]382-allah knows what of [an idolater]851-an idolater 's Heaven by means of old Red Hat . And [I]383-mahbub am reckoned something of [a player of the Game]8002-a player of the game [myself]383-mahbub ! But [the madman]8003-the madman is fond of [the boy]986-the boy ; and [I]383-mahbub must be very reasonably mad too . '[383-mahbub] ' What is the prayer ? '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama , as the rough Pushtu rumbled into the red beard . ' No matter at all ; but now [I]868-the lama understand that [the boy]986-the boy , sure of [Paradise]101-paradise , can yet enter [Government service]8006-government service , [my]868-the lama mind is easier . [I]868-the lama must get to [my]868-the lama horses . It grows dark . Do not wake [him]986-the boy . [I]868-the lama have no wish to hear [him]986-the boy call [[thee]383-mahbub [master]8008-master]8007-thee master . '[868-the lama] ' But [he]986-the boy is [[my]383-mahbub disciple]1064-my disciple . What else ? '[383-mahbub] ' [He]986-the boy has told [me]383-mahbub . '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub choked down [his]383-mahbub touch of spleen and rose laughing . ' [I]868-the lama am not altogether of [thy]383-mahbub faith , [Red Hat]580-red hat - if so small a matter concern [thee]383-mahbub . '[868-the lama] ' It is nothing , '[868-the lama] said [the lama]868-the lama . ' [I]868-the lama thought not . Therefore it will not move [thee]383-mahbub , sinless , new- washed and three parts drowned to boot , when [I]868-the lama call [thee]383-mahbub [a good man]5663-a good man - [a very good man]8011-a very good man . [We]8012-we have talked together some four or five evenings now , and for all [I]868-the lama am a horse - coper [I]868-the lama can still , as the saying is , see holiness beyond the legs of a horse . [Yea]8013-yea , can see , too , how [[our]8012-we Friend of all [the World]14-the world]8014-our friend of all the world put [his]8014-our friend of all the world hand in thine at the first . Use [him]8014-our friend of all the world well , and suffer [him]8014-our friend of all the world to return to [the world]759-the world as [a teacher]7326-a teacher , when [thou]8014-our friend of all the world hast - bathed [his]8014-our friend of all the world legs , if that be the proper medicine for [the colt]5882-the colt . '[868-the lama] ' Why not follow the Way [thyself]8018-thyself , and so accompany [the boy]986-the boy ? '[383-mahbub] [Mahbub]383-mahbub stared stupefied at the magnificent insolence of the demand , which across [the Border]1463-the border [he]383-mahbub would have paid with more than a blow . Then the humour of it touched [his]383-mahbub worldly soul . ' Softly - softly - one foot at a time , as the lame gelding went over [the Umballa]52-umballa jumps . [I]868-the lama may come to [Paradise]101-paradise later - [I]868-the lama have workings that way - great motions - and [I]868-the lama owe [them]8020-them to [thy]8014-our friend of all the world simplicity . [Thou]8014-our friend of all the world hast never lied ? '[868-the lama] ' What need ? '[868-the lama] ' [O Allah]382-allah , hear [him]986-the boy ! " What need " in [this [Thy]8014-our friend of all the world world]8021-this thy world ! Nor ever harmed [a man]750-a man ? '[868-the lama] ' Once - with a pencase - before [I]868-the lama was wise . '[868-the lama] ' So ? [I]4436-i think the better of [thee]8014-our friend of all the world . [Thy]8014-our friend of all the world teachings are good . [Thou]8014-our friend of all the world hast turned [one man that [I]4436-i know from the path of strife]8023-one man that i know from the path of strife . '[4436-i] [He]4436-i laughed immensely . ' [He]8023-one man that i know from the path of strife came here open - minded to commit a dacoity a house - robbery with violence . Yes , to cut , rob , kill , and carry off what [he]8023-one man that i know from the path of strife desired . '[4436-i] ' A great foolishness ! '[868-the lama] ' Oh ! black shame too . So [he]8023-one man that i know from the path of strife thought after [he]8023-one man that i know from the path of strife had seen [thee]8014-our friend of all the world - and [a few others , male and female]8024-a few others , male and female . So [he]8023-one man that i know from the path of strife abandoned it ; and now [he]8023-one man that i know from the path of strife goes to beat [a big fat Babu man]8025-a big fat babu man . '[868-the lama] ' [I]4436-i do not understand . '[4436-i] ' [Allah]382-allah forbid it ! [Some men]8026-some men are strong in knowledge , [Red Hat]580-red hat . [Thy]8026-some men strength is stronger still . Keep it - [I]4436-i think [thou]8026-some men wilt . If [the boy]986-the boy be not [a good servant]8028-a good servant , pull [his]986-the boy ears off . '[4436-i] With a hitch of [his]4436-i broad Bokhariot belt [the Pathan]533-the pathan swaggered off into the gloaming , and [the lama]868-the lama came down from [his]4436-i clouds so far as to look at the broad back . ' [That person]8029-that person lacks courtesy , and is deceived by the shadow of appearances . But [he]8029-that person spoke well of [[my]868-the lama chela]4863-my chela , who now enters upon [his]4863-my chela reward . Let [me]868-the lama make the prayer ! ... Wake , [O fortunate above all born of [women]4700-women]8031-o fortunate above all born of women . Wake ! It is found ! '[868-the lama] [Kim]344-kim came up from [those deep wells]4438-those deep wells , and [the lama]868-the lama attended [his]344-kim yawning pleasure ; duly snapping fingers to head off evil spirits . ' [I]868-the lama have slept a hundred years . Where - ? Holy One , hast [thou]8033-thee been here long ? [I]868-the lama went out to look for [thee]8033-thee , but '[868-the lama] - [he]868-the lama laughed drowsily - ' [I]868-the lama slept by the way . [I]868-the lama am all well now . Hast [thou]8033-thee eaten ? Let [us]8034-us go to [the house]797-the house . It is many days since [I]868-the lama tended [thee]8033-thee . And [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba fed [thee]8033-thee well ? Who shampooed [thy]8033-thee legs ? What of the weaknesses - the belly and the neck , and the beating in the ears ? '[868-the lama] ' Gone - all gone . Dost [thou]8033-thee not know ? '[868-the lama] ' [I]868-the lama know nothing , but that [I]868-the lama have not seen [thee]8033-thee in a monkey 's age . Know what ? '[868-the lama] ' Strange the knowledge did not reach out to [thee]8033-thee , when all [my]868-the lama thoughts were theeward . '[868-the lama] ' [I]4440-i can not see the face , but the voice is like a gong . Has [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba made [a young man of]8036-a young man of [thee]8033-thee by [her]633-the sahiba cookery ? '[4440-i] [He]4440-i peered at the cross - legged figure , outlined jet - black against the lemon - coloured drift of light . So does the stone Bodhisat sit who looks down upon the patent self - registering turnstiles of [the Lahore Museum]723-the lahore museum . [The lama]868-the lama held [his]868-the lama peace . Except for the click of the rosary and a faint clop - clop of [Mahbub]383-mahbub 's retreating feet , the soft , smoky silence of evening in [India]8-india wrapped them close . ' Hear [me]344-kim ! [I]344-kim bring news . '[344-kim] ' But let [us]8037-we - '[344-kim] Out shot the long yellow hand compelling silence . [Kim]344-kim tucked [his]344-kim feet under [his]344-kim robe - edge obediently . ' Hear [me]344-kim ! [I]344-kim bring news ! The Search is finished . Comes now the Reward ... Thus . When [we]8037-we were among [the Hills]10-the hills , [I]344-kim lived on [thy]10-the hills strength till the young branch bowed and nigh broke . When [we]8037-we came out of [the Hills]10-the hills , [I]344-kim was troubled for [thee]10-the hills and for other matters which [I]344-kim held in [my]344-kim heart . The boat of [my]344-kim soul lacked direction ; [I]344-kim could not see into [the Cause of Things]336-the cause of things . So [I]344-kim gave [thee]10-the hills over to [the virtuous woman]7312-the virtuous woman altogether . [I]344-kim took no food . [I]344-kim drank no water . Still [I]344-kim saw not the Way . [They]8039-they pressed food upon [me]344-kim and cried at [my]344-kim shut door . So [I]344-kim removed [myself]344-kim to a hollow under a tree . [I]344-kim took no food . [I]344-kim took no water . [I]344-kim sat in meditation two days and two nights , abstracting [my]344-kim mind ; inbreathing and outbreathing in the required manner ... Upon the second night - so great was [my]344-kim reward - [the wise Soul]8040-the wise soul loosed itself from the silly Body and went free . This [I]344-kim have never before attained , though [I]344-kim have stood on the threshold of it . Consider , for it is a marvel ! '[344-kim] ' A marvel indeed . Two days and two nights without food ! Where was [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba ? '[344-kim] said [Kim]344-kim under [his]344-kim breath . ' Yea , [[my]344-kim Soul]8041-my soul went free , and , wheeling like an eagle , saw indeed that there was no [Teshoo Lama]497-teshoo lama nor any other soul . As a drop draws to water , so [[my]344-kim Soul]8041-my soul drew near to the Great Soul which is beyond all things . At that point , exalted in contemplation , [I]344-kim saw [all Hind]8043-all hind , from [Ceylon]193-ceylon in [the sea]1554-the sea to [the Hills]10-the hills , and [my]344-kim own Painted Rocks at Such - zen ; [I]344-kim saw [every camp]8045-every camp and [village]4009-village , to the least , where [we]8047-we have ever rested . [I]344-kim saw them at one time and in one place ; for [they]8043-all hind were within [the Soul]339-the great soul . By this [I]344-kim knew [the Soul]339-the great soul had passed beyond the illusion of Time and Space and of Things . By this [I]344-kim knew that [I]344-kim was free . [I]344-kim saw [thee]8048-thee lying in [thy]8048-thee cot , and [I]344-kim saw [thee]8048-thee falling downhill under [the idolater]7713-the idolater - at one time , in one place , in [my]344-kim Soul , which , as [I]344-kim say , had touched [the Great Soul]339-the great soul . Also [I]344-kim saw the stupid body of [Teshoo Lama]497-teshoo lama lying down , and [the hakim from [Dacca]254-dacca]7975-the hakim from dacca kneeled beside , shouting in its ear . Then [my]344-kim Soul was all alone , and [I]344-kim saw nothing , for [I]344-kim was all things , having reached [the Great Soul]339-the great soul . And [I]344-kim meditated a thousand thousand years , passionless , well aware of the Causes of all Things . Then a voice cried : " What shall come to [the boy]986-the boy if [thou]8048-thee art dead ? " and [I]344-kim was shaken back and forth in [myself]344-kim with pity for [thee]8048-thee ; and [I]344-kim said : " [I]344-kim will return to [[my]344-kim chela]4863-my chela , lest [he]986-the boy miss the Way . " Upon this [my]344-kim Soul , which is [the Soul of [Teshoo Lama]497-teshoo lama]340-the soul of teshoo lama , withdrew itself from [the Great Soul]339-the great soul with strivings and yearnings and retchings and agonies not to be told . As the egg from the fish , as the fish from the water , as the water from the cloud , as the cloud from the thick air , so put forth , so leaped out , so drew away , so fumed up the Soul of [Teshoo Lama]497-teshoo lama from [the Great Soul]339-the great soul . Then [a voice]8053-a voice cried : " [The River]33-the river ! Take heed to [the River]33-the river ! " and [I]344-kim looked down upon all [the world]759-the world , which was as [I]344-kim had seen [it]759-the world before - one in time , one in place - and [I]344-kim saw plainly [the River of [the Arrow]34-the arrow at [my]344-kim feet]8055-the river of the arrow at my feet . At that hour [my]344-kim Soul was hampered by some evil or other whereof [I]344-kim was not wholly cleansed , and it lay upon [my]344-kim arms and coiled round [my]344-kim waist ; but [I]344-kim put it aside , and [I]344-kim cast forth as an eagle in [my]344-kim flight for [the very place of [the River]33-the river]8056-the very place of the river . [I]344-kim pushed aside world upon world for [thy]8057-thy sake . [I]344-kim saw [the River]5005-the river below [me]344-kim - [the River of the Arrow]4652-the river of the arrow - and , descending , the waters of [it]5005-the river closed over [me]344-kim ; and behold [I]344-kim was again in the body of [Teshoo Lama]497-teshoo lama , but free from sin , and [the hakim]7103-the hakim from [Decca]341-decca bore up [my]344-kim head in [the waters of [the River]33-the river]8061-the waters of the river . It is here ! It is behind the mango- tope here - even here ! '[344-kim] ' Allah kerim ! Oh , well that [the Babu]6478-the babu was by ! Wast [thou]8057-thy very wet ? '[344-kim] ' Why should [I]344-kim regard ? [I]344-kim remember [the hakim]7103-the hakim was concerned for the body of [Teshoo Lama]497-teshoo lama . [He]7103-the hakim haled it out of the holy water in [his]7103-the hakim hands , and there came afterwards [[thy]344-kim horse - seller]8064-thy horse - seller from [the North]48-the north with a cot and [men]752-men , and [they]8064-thy horse - seller put the body on the cot and bore [it]8066-it up to [[the Sahiba]633-the sahiba 's house]7944-the sahiba 's house . '[344-kim] ' What said [the Sahiba]633-the sahiba ? '[344-kim] ' [I]4443-i was meditating in that body , and did not hear . So thus the Search is ended . For the merit that [I]4443-i have acquired , [the River of [the Arrow]34-the arrow]4652-the river of the arrow is here . It broke forth at [our]8069-our feet , as [I]4443-i have said . [I]4443-i have found it . Son of [[my]4443-i Soul]8041-my soul , [I]4443-i have wrenched [my]4443-i Soul back from [the Threshold of Freedom]8071-the threshold of freedom to free [thee]8072-thee from all sin - as [I]4443-i am free , and sinless ! Just is [the Wheel]273-the wheel ! Certain is [our]8069-our deliverance ! Come ! '[4443-i] [He]4443-i crossed [his]4443-i hands on [his]4443-i lap and smiled , as [a man]750-a man may who has won salvation for [himself]750-a man and [[his]750-a man beloved]4445-his beloved .
